Summary: This is a typical Embassy Suites, except for the fact that the bathroom door is located inside of the master bedroom. If you have any children, there will be no privacy.  For us, the main purpose of having a door between the rooms is being able to have your own privacy without worrying about having any minors barge in when they need to take a shower or make a golden one.  Also, keep in mind that you will pay extra for parking.    The breakfast is always the best at Embassy Suites, and as an added bonus, you get a complementary snack or drink every night.    Now, to the ES staff, variety is the spice of life.  Only having those dry pancakes to choose from for 5 days straight as opposed to French Toast or Eggo waffles was a total drag.  Also, those irons are the worst!  I loved

We booked this hotel to stay in LA for the week and enjoyed our stay.  The room was great. The beds were extremely comfortable. The staff were friendly and accommodating when we needed extra towels. The breakfast bar has so many options we ate something different every day.  The guest happy hour was outstanding. The hotel was busy and lively.  We enjoyed relaxing in the atrium, swimming pool and hot tub.  We will stay here every time we visit LA!

Summary Heading: Not hygienic at all for families with babies
Summary: This hotel asks for guests to request house cleaning at reception. Did not know this until 2nd day stay. So we requested house keeping as we have 2 toddlers not toilet trained. You can imagine how full our trash can got full with nappies… they promised house keeping and clean towels… it’s now 3pm and reception are now saying we were not on the agenda for house keeping! They told us they cannot make promises and will “try” to give us towels. Mate… all I want is a clean floor, trash collected and some Bloody towels!   Not happy Australian,  Ariana

Summary Heading: Not worth the cost. It might be a good hotel if you're desperate enough for a hotel in SoCal.
Summary: My family and I went to Anaheim to visit my sister for her engagement party, and a day at Disneyland. It was good for what it was for a couple of days in the Anaheim area. The breakfast was mediocre at best, the coffee would also run out pretty quick, and there was a pregnant woman (she should've been on prenatal leave) cooking omelets for a long line every morning I was there. Also, there was a large crowd of Asian and Indian kids on a SoCal/Disneyland Tour. Probably on a field trip. The only issue I had with that was, there was too many people at once going up on the elevators. And there isn't a convenient staircase anywhere. That's not a good thing. Especially if there's a fire. Also, some people staying there were somewhat inconsiderate of others trying to sleep. I've heard

Room was dirty with spots on the bed cover and couch.  There were food crumbs on the. Ouch. No paper towels in the room. Toilet water tank wasn't working.  Bar/Dinning only had one person working with long lines to get service. Digital key didn’t work.  The place seemed “cheap”.  Got the impression that they are more i to saving money that building their reputation for returned customers.  Not sure if new management, but the place has definitely degraded since my last stay 10 months ago!

We always try to stay at Embassy suites when we travel because we love the managers reception, the breakfast, and the spacious rooms. As a family of 5, it gives us room to spread out. We stayed here for 4 nights on our recent Disneyland and Universal Studios Trip. We were incredibly disappointed and would never recommend this hotel to anyone. Our room was dirty and our bathroom door handle was literately held together by a dirty old tissue. At $200 a night, this is absolute unacceptable. The temperature in our room was miserable and we were promised fans on 2 different occasions that never appeared. The hot tub had so many chemicals it bleached by brother and sister in laws swim suit and melted the hair off of my brothers legs. This was brought to the attention of the front desk

The staff is nice, parking is easy, the hotel itself is dated. stained carpet everywhere, transition in room from carpet to tile is tearing, stains on walls, furniture not completely clean- corners not dusted, hair in bathroom, bath tub has warn out slip stickers on bottom of tub, the breakfast area was always a mess  and food quality was ok actually I've had better coffee and breakfasts at Hampton Inn chains, it's an old hotel need renovating- not the worst Embassy Suites but def close- the beds were comfortable

The Cleaniness of the hotel really needs to be addressed. The bathroom in our room were full of mold as well as mold around the slider door.  The carpets had red stains on them and the bathroom molding had brow stains on them.

Although the staff is friendly and helpful, this hotel is run down and shows its age. An overall renovation is definitely needed! Our room had a strange odor that never went away. After opening the closet doors the smell was even stronger. Your shoes stick to the tile and wood flooring and even to the carpet in places. Walls are patched/painted, curtains had tears and were falling down. The beds were AWFUL! The mattress made you roll to the middle and it was a constant fight all night. Outside garbages were constantly overflowing with trash on the ground and littered around the parking lot. The breakfast was nice, housekeeping came daily, and the location is in a safer area. Overall this hotel IS NOT up to Hilton standards and I would say run, don't walk to another hotel if

Summary Heading: Great family stay, lots to do, stay for breakfast.
Summary: There is so much to like about this hotel! Truly wish I could give it 5 stars because it has a lot to offer. It still earns 4, and here’s why: 1.) It is super family friendly. With a beautiful indoor pool, hot tub, pool table and arcade room. The kids won’t get bored here. Plus, there is a golf land Camelot within sight to fill any downtime. 2.) The common areas are beautiful! The main dining courtyard area is really picturesque. With the giant water feature/fountains and indoor bridge it begs for pictures. The balcony type hallways above are beautiful from below and give great views from above. 3.) The breakfast!!! Wow, so impressive and so much more than I’d expect from a free continental breakfast. It has a made to order omelet / egg bar, and about a dozen other buffet
Room tip: Some road noise near highway, if you are a light sleeper stay on the other side of hotel by...

Summary: We were told housekeeping cleans your room on the 4th day, although would do it daily if requested. Housekeeping never came but everything else was amazing. The General Manager, Maurice, was outstanding. He was always present and made sure his guests were treated like family.  How is he not in a higher position? Even saw him present  on Saturday! He doesn't just hide in his office, something I've seen other managers do. Front desk was quick and friendly.  Parking was safe and plentiful.  Can't wait for my next trip.

Decent bed and breakfast but that's it! Rooms are horribly run down. Changed rooms and still wasn't much better. Patched/painted over walls, tattered/torn carpet, smoke detector ripped off wall, stained  bathtubs, dirt in corners, cracked/pealing paint in bathroom vanity, rust spots and bubling ceiling paint, rooms & hotel smell. This is a budget hotel that is NOT a Hilton Honors hotel! Private hotel that should loose its Hilton brand.

Price versus value lacking. Nice spa.Breakfast more like a Hampton Inn; expected better. Two holes in the carpet next to bed and carpet looked dirty. Room clean and functional, but when booked offered upgrade/higher floor for $60…would have put us in same 7th floor suite. Room amenities OK. Taken aback by the $20 up charge for parking. I’m long time Hilton Honors; didn’t like the $75 damage deposit on the room. No kids/dog; we weren’t there for Disney. Ridiculous!

Summary Heading: Great hotel, great location but needs some small improvements.
Summary: This was a nice, clean hotel for myself and family for a Disneyland trip.  The staff were very nice and the King Suite was spacious enough for the 3 of us.  It was also nice and relaxing to hear and see the water fountain display in the center of the hotel, plus the heated pool and jacuzzi being indoors was great.  But the spa jets had very little pressure whatsoever was the only downside.   The only comments otherwise I could make was the food for the breakfasts was usually luke-warm at best.  Especially the bacon.  It looked like they had no sterno keeping it warm while it sat in the serving tray.    Secondly, the evening reception was pretty disappointing.  Although the drinks and snacks were complimentary, I had to laugh at and refrain from the snacks.  It consisted of

My wife and I decided to go to Embassy Suites Anaheim North on our anniversary because we were there previously for another one of our Anniversaries and we enjoyed ourselves so much that we wanted to to that again. Unfortunately this trip we didn't get that same feel. The carpets were not vacuumed and were starting to rip, the curtains in our bedroom area wouldn't open and the room smelled like mildew. Seems like this Embassy Suites has fallen below the standards we expected.

Summary Heading: I wouldn’t stay here again even if they paid me!
Summary: I should have read the other reviews on Tripadvisor and Yelp before booking.  I wouldn’t stay here again even if they paid me. The hotel does not look like it was recently remodeled like their website says.   The biggest disappointment was the bathroom. It was in desperate need of a clean. It had mildew/mold on the sink and bathtub walls, the bathtub floor had yellow stains. Even my kids pointed out how gross the bathtub was. Everyone was instructed to shower with flip flops on.   I was never told at check in that we had to request to have our rooms cleaned. I found out from a sticker on the bathroom mirror. The next day I went to the front desk to request a room clean and was told they didn’t have availability. I don’t understand why they tell you to request a room clean and

I normally do not write reviews, but we did stay here about 3 weeks ago, and I felt I needed to given an honest review on this hotel, as there were a lot of negative reviews.   Listen, if you want a great value while staying in Anaheim, stay here.   Great breakfast buffet with good choices, with a made-to-order omelet station.   The eggs we ate every day were not runny.  We are not drinkers, but they do have a free happy hour each day from 5-7 with snacks.   Yes, it is an older hotel, and the carpet does need to be replaced, and also the pool does need to be cleaned.   I did use the fitness center all 5 days, and the equipment was operating properly and  the center was clean.   The traffic is very congested around Disneyland, and with staying at this hotel, you are away from all

Very good location for access to a variety of locations in the Anaheim area. Many families for Disney but not in a bad way. Husband had to work but had some downtime. Easy access to freeways. Big room like all Embassy Suites.  Staff was good. Many choices of restaurants nearby.

Summary Heading: old out dated hotel with poor servive
Summary: The hotel is old and seems not been maintained for a while.  The front desk is rude and not helpful. and you service end there. There is no service anywhere, you may check in a motel to receive the same.    definitely not wealth the money.

Summary Heading: Excellent Customer Service and Delcious Breakfast
Summary: Hello all!  I normally don't have time to write review because like most of us, our lives are so busy .  However,  I was compelled to write  about Supervisor Mr. Muhammed Alkodmani.  When I approached this gentleman with my issue his attitude and professionalism was so wonderful that others should emulate.  He resolved my problem quickly with a pleasant smile and with grace.  This is the main reason I Love Embassy Suites and the Hilton brand.  I travel at least 12 roundtrps a year and I always stayat Embassy Suites unless they are booked.  You madd my day Mohammed and thanks again,  you are much appreciated!  Warmest regards, Fred

My wife and I visited this Hotel on June 15-20, I can say this is the first Embassy Suites that we were truly disappointed with, the Women at the counter charged my credit card for a room that was already paid for the sad thing I confronted her about the charge and she was in denial. My guess is that we booked this hotel through Hotwire and were given a room with holes in the carpet and the bathroom was filthy put it this way it was just a room that was disgusting, to say the least, we were given paper plates food breakfast and the parking lot always had people hanging around drinking and smoking. I do know believe me because of Covid you are understaffed I do but this was a truly sad place to stay haven't been on vacation in over three years. The only good thing is that the

This is a nice hotel with great bfast and complimentary reception in the evening. With that being said, if you want to swim, don’t bother! The pool and hot tub have mold and dirt build up on the walls!

As always very satisfied! Greeted when we walked in, great customer services and didn’t take long to check in. The lady at the front was very welcoming, she asked how many keys we needed and if we were there for a special occasion! With her help she provided all the information for local restaurants and gas stations as well as information for the shuttle to the Disney Park. We were nervous to take the shuddle as we had a one year old HOWEVER, it is so worth it.. $23 dollars for 5 of us! Download the app and it’s so easy! The shuddle picked us up within 15 minutes of requesting a ride and dropped us off at the very front! at he end of the night we again requested a shuddle and though because it was late and everyone would be leaving at the same time we would wait a long time but

Avoid this hotel until it is remodeled. No air conditioning control (it was hot), it smells in the elevator and rooms, staff does not really care & parts of it are under construction (just taped off) like one of the elevators.

The place is desperately in need Of renovating and serious upkeep.  The room smells of poop and mildew while there is no window or door you can open to even try to get fresh air.  A/C is broken and the room is somehow humid and swampy hot despite it being a dry heat outside.    Who could tell if the place was dirty or clean with how miserable everything looked.  Elevators were broken and definitely not the hotel of the photos.    We left after one night of a 2 night stay.

Summary Heading: Ain't What It Used To Be
Summary: We used to come to this hotel  30 years ago on an annual basis for family vacations to Disneyland.  We were always very happy with our stay.  When planning a trip for my niece's Disneyland graduation party, I recommended we stay at this hotel as it has never failed us.  Disclosure:  It's been about 15 years since my last stay.    I don't know what it is with elevators at Embassy Suites, but it seems to be a running pattern that one of them is always out of order.  The lobby did have refreshing water upon entry, so that was a nice touch to make up for the lack of elevator service.  The room itself was disappointing.  Furniture is dirty.  My bed had a hole in the sheets.   The bathtub/shower looked like a parade of thousands of dirty feet trampled through leaving a lingering,

To start, I am a diamond honors member of Hilton.  So I've stayed in quite a few places.   1. The Breakfast was good on paper but the actual food was subpar.   The liquid eggs were still liquid and hardly anyone touched them.  It's pretty disgusting.  Drinks were running out left and right while breakfast was still running (orange juice, apple juice & coffee).  Definitely needs a visit from corporate quality control or someone.  I realize you get a ton of people because of location and being summer time but that's no excuse.  2.  We never ask for our room to be cleaned, but the one time I asked for towels it took 3 hours and a second phone call.  3.   Room TV is from 10 years ago and very very very very slow.  Basically stuck watching whatever channel the last person left it on.

This was our first stay  at Embassy Suites while we were visiting Disneyland with family,  and was a terriblr experience. No housekeeping done on multiple days even though made request. Bath tub was old and worn out, shower fixture broken and dropped while taking shower creating safety hazard. Towels were also worn out and not great quality. Morning  breakfast was served in disposable foam plates which was not very pleasing experience. Apart from that broken elevator in front lobby made huge waiting times. Swimming pool water was not very clean and kids refused to go in. Even though front desk agents were cordial and receptive, but didn’t get to talk to manager though requested multiple times when observed poor service. Overall I think this place needs overhaul as the only good

Elevators don’t work. Room was not serviced once in 4 days. A/c didn’t work. Pool is dirty. Trash was overflowing at entrance and near the elevators to each floor. We were charged for parking, when clearly there were truckers parked and camped out overnight.  While staying I read up on reviews and the negatives are spot on. A few lucky ones got rooms where the a/c was functional.  I would not recommend a stay for more than $100-140 a night. Better options elsewhere.  I paid $185 a night for a hotel that should be fully functional. There are approx 35 rooms on each floor, with 5-6 floors and only 2 working elevators with a capacity for 6-8 people in an elevator??? No excuses except for lazy owners not getting items serviced in the peak of the season- summer time Disney vacations.

The lobby  is very pretty when you come in.  The room was clean but not as remodeled or updated as other embassy suites. I do want to say this is probably one of the least fave embassy suites I’ve stayed at mostly because of breakfast. I’m used to them having lots of options, not sure if it’s because of covid but I still think the quality of the food could be improved. We didn’t get to use the pool but looked nice from afar. The bar/restaurante is expensive so prepare for that and they don’t have a kids menu. I did find that the room doors close rather loudly and one night the people next door kept going in and out and it was very noisy.

Summary Heading: Great service by Marissa Vigil at Embassy Suites by Hilton Anaheim North.
Summary: I would like to express my thanks and gratitude for the service and care I received at Embassy Suites by Hilton Anaheim North on June 24th through June 27th 2022. Guest service manager Marissa Vigil helped resolve my problem and came through for me and my family.  Marissa is one of a kind and much appreciated. We have already decided to Return to Embassy Suites by Hilton Anaheim North for our next vacation. Thank you again Marissa and staff for such outstanding service.

Don’t be fooled by pictures on this location. Room was extremely filthy with moldy ceilings and bathroom. Furniture is very rundown cracked & torn. Parking charge is a scam! Parking lot is shared with a nightclub so hotel guests pay for parking while nightclub guests park for free. Parking lot security was never seen.

Shower was disgusting, ceiling was filthy from the ac vent. AC did not work. It felt like a swamp cooler - very muggy and not cold air- even the Kleenexes were damp.  Only one of the elevators on our side of the hotel worked. We ditched it and kissed the money good bye. Pull out bed was not comfortable either.

I checked in late in the evening and was greeted by some very friendly front desk staff. Trevor, the young man manning the desk, really stood out to me as accommodating and extremely polite. They were happy to answer my questions and provided me with some of the toiletries and other items I forgot to pack. The lobby is quite beautiful and has a great water feature with plenty of room to sit and relax or have a conversation.  The room itself was very clean and came with a very comfortable bed with plenty of pillows. I always check some of the corners to see how well the rooms were cleaned, and was pleased to see that the housekeeping staff did a great job. I couldn't hear any noises from neighbors or the lobby, which was also great.  I was surprised to find a complimentary hot

I stayed with my friend over the weekend at your hotel everyone was really nice but the one young lady Kim really stood out to me she embedded what hospitality guest services is. She took her time to help us with the Art shuttle service we requested a crib and extra towels the day before never got it but when we got back from dinner it was in our room she told us it’s in the room because she delivered it. Even when she had a line checking in the phones ringing she was very nice, polite and was always smiling  Kim and James both have  great service really stands out keep doing a great job.

i am a HHonor member. the quality of that hotel is so bad i wanted to leave the next day and i called the hilton and front desk to let them know i am leaving. they stated there is no penalty for leaving early. they lied. they charged me for the second day. the pool was so dirty that i didn't let my children go in. the room was smeled bad and the cabinet was broken. the shower had mildew. no business center. what else do you want?.....Motel six is bettter that that place.

Tub was dirty, used to phone there was food stuck to the phone, smell. Rooms are not sanitized was not informed, you have to request it!  Requested towels since rooms were not sanitized or restocked took forever had to the cleaning room if the hotel to try to find some. After an hour the towels were delivered. And there was a smell to the room. Would definitely not come back to this hotel avoid it if you can.

Beware that adjacent to this hotel, sharing the parking lot is a large Night Club. You will hear music and bass through out the night until 2 am. Doesn't stop there as the club closes some will feel the need to rev their cars as they leave effecting all the front facing rooms. To avoid don't pick a room facing the front!

I was so pleasantly surprised with our stay. Hotel had a great location right off the 91fwy. Parking was so easy and the glass elevators were quick and actually smelled really good ( I get claustrophobic so being able to see out was great ) The lobby is nice and the rooms were really clean with a comfortable bed. The separation between the bedroom and living room was a huge plus. Bathrooms were really nice with a big shower. We will definitely be staying here again!

Beautiful hotel. 7th floor is where it’s at!! The beds were soo comfy (big deal to me) couch was super big and comfortable as well! Staff was super friendly! Parking was easy. Clean. What more do you need?

I left a cup there and the amazing staff kept it for me and even though it was longer than I intended they kept it safe! The room was clean. The breakfast was good. There was something for our whole family. Thank you!

Location is a little worn down I think, but overall a nice place in a good location near tourist attractions in Orange County.  Spacious rooms, comp breakfast and evening bar reception.  Nice indoor pool, small arcade for kids and close to lots of lacal businesses.

Very dated hotel. Desperately needs updating. Rooms are dingy. Bathroom has very little light. Bathtub was really dirty. Entry doors have a couple inches of open space at the threshold so you hear all the noise throughout the hotel. AC doesn’t cool very well. Looks like it hasn’t been renovated since the 90s. Our room faced out to the freeway and the traffic noise was awful.

My Wife and I missed the boat. Being rather disappointed about our situation we decided last minute to go with an unplanned "B" vacation. We called the hotel last minute and they were able to accommodate our 4 day stay. The room was very comfortable and roomy. The bed was amazing. The morning Breakfast was exceptional. The staff from the front desk to the maintenance techs were friendly and helpful with any accommodations we needed. My wife enjoyed the pool and hot tub, and I the happy hour and bar. In missing the boat? it turned out that the overall experience was a great and relaxing one. Thank You.

Summary Heading: This hotel needs a good cleaning and better customer service
Summary: Extremely unhappy to stay at this hotel. It just keeps getting worst, might as well change it to motel 6. Dirty restroom and shower, old uncomfortable beds and couch. Noise AC that didn’t cool down the room.

Parking lot is not secure. The catalytic converter was stolen from my rented Mitsubishi as well as another hotel guest’s rental on the same night while staying here. Per management, there aren’t security cameras. There’s also not a security gate to the lot. There was very little concern when I reported the incident to the front desk. I had more dialogue with the other hotel guest with the same experience than the hotel management. I’ve stayed here a few times but I won’t be back.

Beat place I’ve ever stayed at. Everything was amazing from the service to the checkin to the rooms. It was probably the best hotel I’ve stayed in by far and I travel a lot for work. The bartender was amazing and was extremely friendly and was not bothered by my daughters asking for change for the arcade. Amazing.

It has been a few years since I have stayed at this BEAUTIFUL Hotel… but refurbished Embassy Suites AMAZING!  The entire staff is so helpful🙏🏻🙏🏻😍!  Happy Hour / 5:00pm to 7:30pm is TERRIFIC!  🥤🍷I enjoyed a “Knock your Socks Off” Rum Punch made fresh by my Friendly Bartender.  You may order food from the menu.  My Club Sandwich was the BEST EVER!  My husband’s burger was cooked rare like he asked for.  The Suites are spacious!  Complementary Breakfast in the morning features Embassy Suites Famous Omelettes.

Summary Heading: They put the Horror in horrible
Summary: They are going to ruin the Hilton name! They don't clean the rooms, they do provide clean towels or empty the trash even when requested multiple times. My sons room was not what he requested and it smelled like fish, they knew it smelled horrible because they had the windows open. Then we had to go back multiple times to get a different room. Do yourself a favor and don't stay here.

Summary Heading: Horrible Don't stay at this hotel ever!!!
Summary: The pool was filthy with multiple particles swimming with you. My family and I all got sick from staying in this hotel. The rooms were disgusting they only partially cleaned the room I had to bring my own Clorox wipes and lysol.When asked for a cleaning they gave me the brush off till the fourth day. If I could of found another hotel I would of ran from this place. The a/c was broken, toilet clogged, the pool was yellow. Please save your self some stress and avoid this hotel.

Other reviews complained of poor condition/poor housekeeping. We found the room and the hotel to be in good condition. This is not a new hotel.  Don't expect that. It is a  typical Embassy with a large interior atrium. Beds comfortable. Breakfast good. Atrium  too cold due to open doors of lobby letting in cold winter air. Had to wear jackets to breakfast or happy hour. Overall, a B+, and a good value. Close to Disney, short drive.

I haven’t even checked out and this has been a disaster.  I didn’t get any of my usual rewards on checking in.  It’s a completely open parking lot and still costs $17.  The evening social was tortilla chips (ran out of salsa) and basically celery sticks.  There is no business center (my own fault for not checking that).  The air conditioner can’t be turned on if the temp is 70° outside and the ambient room temp is 74° which is nearly impossible to sleep.  I didn’t come to hotel like this to haul a fan in so I can sleep.  Never ever again.

Summary Heading: Great Value alternative for your Disneyland Vacation
Summary: Stayed for a full week in late December for Disney and SoCal family vacation.  Most all other hotels around the area were either full or cost 50-100% more per night - this was a great deal!  Booked 2 rooms for our family of 6 and it was great to have all the added room of a suite along with included daily breakfast.  Staff was always very cheerful and helpful.  Location is convenient for driving but you won't be walking anywhere from here - but it's SoCal so who walks anywhere?  You can be at Disney or Garden Mall or other Anaheim locations within 15 minutes.  You can hop on the freeways and be at Knox Berry or Orange County in about the same.  Parking is much less than other area hotels too - and even free with some room packages.  We didn't use it but the Anaheim Shuttle Bus

This is a convenient location for me to get to north Orange County, South Orange County, and Los Angeles.  Clean, and the staff is accommodating and friendly. And the Embassy has the best free breakfast selection.  This is my go to choice when I need to stay in this area.

Stayed here for my son’s basketball tournament but will definitely stay here next time we are in town for Disneyland. The hotel has a complimentary breakfast (made to order omelettes and lots more that changed daily) and free happy hour daily!!! Can’t beat it!

I stayed for a week at this hotel. The lobby staff were really nice and helpful. The hotel is beautiful  and my room was clean.   I particularly enjoyed the happy hour by the bar. The bartenders are fun to talk to and you get to meet other people doing business in the area which is helpful. The food is outstanding, so is the breakfast. I will definitely be back.

Just what I was looking for. A hotel close to Disney where I do not need to pay extra resort fees. Annnnd a FULL cook to order breakfast too! I stayed at other local hotels in the area and those are still not providing the full breakfast. did I mention free drinks in the evening too? don't sleep on this place. had a great stay.

Dirty and understaffed. This place needs to be updated and cleaned. Our room was disgusting and the staff were not friendly or helpful at all. I wouldn’t waste your money here for the stay. Only good thing is the complimentary breakfast but even that isn’t worth it. They served boxes eggs oily sausages the whole time.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience about your recent stay at our hotel.  We strive to provide gracious, engaging and caring service and sincerely appreciate your feedback and we're very sorry you were unhappy. We will take your comments under consideration as we continually work to improve our guest experience.  If you have some time to give me a call I would love to discuss your stay with you in more detail.  We hope you will consider staying with us in the future.  Sincerely,  Maurice Casaus General Manager Embassy Suites by Hilton Anaheim North  657-439-0060

Summary: Rooms smelled bad Needs updating Price too high for the quality  Bathroom fixtures old and not working right  Not as clean in the bathroom as I would have liked  Never been deep cleaned Only good thing was the feather bed and pillows

I would really say that it it a true suite for an embassy suite if it was clean and relaxing for me and my family. I would probably love it if the menus for breakfast is different everyday and not the same food over and over again for the whole week of our stay in the hotel.

Rooms are old and in desperate need of updating. I had 8 charges on a prepaid reservation and am still fighting to get back the extra $400 they charged. Manager never returned messages and front desk was a joke. Marriott has my business for life. I will never stay at embassy / Hilton again. Oh and don’t mind the strip club in front of hotel. Sketchy area.

The hotel is soooo old. My daughter wanted to use the pool and there were no indoor pools in the area but this one. Big mistake booking here. I went off reviews and thought no big deal we won’t be there long

Summary Heading: Leaves a lot to be desired
Summary: Stayed there around new years 2022.  The good - close to Disneyland and there's a shuttle for $6/PP (roundtrip); buffet breakfast is better than nothing, but not great.  A lot of reconstituted food that you'd get at a Hampton Inn (waffles, scrambled eggs, oatmeal).  They make omelettes to order but, if you are a vegetarian or don't eat pork, kinda gross to have bacon fried on the same griddle.  Rooms are a good size and parking is free.  Kitchen and janitorial staff were super nice and friendly - they only bright side of this hotel.  Dude at the front desk couldn't be bothered for a pretend smile - not a good look to have him greet your guests.  The bad - far outweighs the good.  Rooms unbearably hot if the outside temperature is between 50 and 70 degrees - the AC/Heat can't be

Unfortunately embassy suites was not what we thought it would be. We were expecting nice clean rooms for $300 a night but the room was gross. Found left over hair in the bathroom. Asked for towels several times. Took an hour to get a clean one. No one answered the phones at front desk. Very very disappointed

We stayed for 5 nights. The Front Desk agent did advise that we would have to request to get our room cleaned and to let them know the night before we wanted it cleaned. We requested our room to be cleaned 3 times. It finally got cleaned the night before we checked out. We also requested extra towels and wash rags, as we have 3 kids and it took 3 days to receive them. My Husband was at the Front Desk every day making these requests. We were constantly told the hotel was short staffed. I will say the Front Desk agent who checked us in was lovely and the complimentary breakfast was great.

Summary Heading: Disappointing hotel experience, never coming back.
Summary: We had a lot of problems during our stay. We called ahead to confirm crib availability, and requested a crib at check in. We had to call the front desk 5 times over 4 hours to get a crib. Once arrived, the crib had dark stains, appeared to be some sort of body fluid - likely fecal, possibly blood. Very gross. Blood stains on curtains as well.  Couch was pulled out with numerous beer cans behind it. Hair in the sink, toilet and shower.  No shower soap or shower gel. No washcloths. Whole floor smelled like weed. Gross.  No climate control, it was tough getting the toddlers to sleep with them sweating so profusely. Had a 7th floor balcony with a sliding screen door that did not lock - it couldn’t be closed all the way. Curtains were off the upper rail so they wouldn’t slide open or

When we travel for tournaments the families like to get together in the lobbies/bar area to have some drinks and eats while discussing how our girls did in the games and the fun we are having. It gives the parents and girls a relaxing way to bond.  The whole group enjoyed playing pool also!

Summary Heading: No A/C in heat wave, poor housekeeping
Summary: There was a heat wave when we stayed here for 2 nights.  A/C didn't work on 6th floor.  Hotel had turned off the AC for the season.  Really uncomfortable.  Room was also not that clean, hair dryer was covered in sticky hair product from previous users.  Stain on bathroom floor looked like the floor hadn't been cleaned.  With COVID so easily spread, I didn't feel this hotel was taking appropriate precautions and the majority of guests were not wearing masks.

Walking into the hotel, my granddaughter & I were very pleased. Unfortunately, we didn’t feel that in our room. Room was outdated and didn’t feel very clean. Found items from a previous guest in a top drawer. Balcony sliding door was cracked open which was a safety issue. We were only on the 2nd floor and area wasn’t the greatest. Turned out bottom sliding track was bent. Took all my strength to close it. Bathroom lighting was so bad, we had to leave bathroom door open for light. We never sat on the couch, because it feeling it was clean. We only stayed 1 night. The best part of our stay was breakfast. They had many options to choose from. The downside was you had to clean your own table prior to sitting down to eat.

Very dissatisfied I’ll never stay at this hotel very bad service very dirty rooms and bathroom ass well the floors I really expected better service and cleanliness shower tub was clogged up very disappointed

Everything about the hotel was great but the club severity and parking management kinda killed it. We came down for a Japanese classic car show and it was close enough to the hotel and for the price it was great the breakfast was the best and indoor pool and hottub

Great except for minor problems at Saturday buffet. Helpful people in bar / restaurant. Would return when we return to visit Disneyland.Rooms are good, indoor pool was good after a day at an amusement park

65 yr old grandma …Arriving so exhausted from 4 days at the parks  with kids  the front desk staff took great care of me and found a room early I was so grateful my family went shopping and a beach day I told them I was done just leave me at hotel the front desk staff took really good care of me  As soon as my head hit the pillow I was asleep 😴 thank you

Summary Heading: Price per night was definitely not worth it
Summary: Amount we paid per night was not worth it.. made Guest limited to the parking due to shared with a night club and still made us pay for parking per night. Room seemed very outdated and shower dripped and leaked all night long.

Summary Heading: Good family place with nice breakfast options
Summary: We enjoyed our stay and the breakfast was a bonus to start the day! Rooms were spacious for a family of four. Could have been cleaner in the bathroom. Next time we return I expect all the elevators to work the entire time instead of being marked “out of service”. Thank you!

Summary Heading: Always a pleasure to stay at
Summary: We always stay here during our trips to Disney and basketball tournaments. Lobby and room was clean. Breakfast was great. Only concern was the internet being slow or cutting off and parking space because of the event being held across the street at night.

The main reason not to return is the fact that the air conditioning in their rooms does not work. For what you pay, this should be a basic function that works!  Breakfast was ok, staff did not mask which made me feel uneasy.

We have stayed at Embassy Suites before so were very disappointed in the lack of cleanliness in the room. Even though there were stickers all over the place stating that the room had been “sanitized”, the bathroom floor was visibly soiled and there was hair everywhere. The couch in the front room was hard and uncomfortable and the furnishings were outdated. The pillows and extra blanket were very sub standard although the bed seemed comfortable. The hotel also did not give us the Booking.com discount we booked under plus we were charged overnight parking which was also not expected. Overall very disappointed.

Love staying here whenever we spend the day at Disneyland which seems like so long ago :( . The rooms are very comfortable and the breakfast buffet serves delicious food. Hopefully, we can visit again soon.

Embassy suites typically a great place to stay .  A couple of things were a little strange. Like for instance they put all the guests on the freeway side instead of the quiet side. Note this was during the corona virus scare along with Disneyland being closed . So there was not many people here. We also left for the day and waited for maid service when came back and only the towels were replaced. The rooms heating systems is really bad. Felt cold the entire time u couldn’t turn heat up over 69. But the bartender and chef from breakfast were awesome warm and friendly.
Manager Response: In light of recent local and global events, we thank you for your review. We greatly appreciate your feedback and we sincerely apologize for the disappointment with your stay. We will be sure to take your comments about our property under consideration as we re-evaluate guest needs and continually work to improve our guest experience. Please stay safe during these trying times and when these unfortunate events subside, we hope you will consider staying with us again the next time your travels bring you to our area.

Summary: Stayed just one night while in the OC. Great hotel for families with the 2 rooms - and breakfast. Staff was very helpful. Indoor pool was great, because the weather was not. :) Would definitely recommend if you are travelling as a family.
Manager Response: Our Hotel Team could not be happier to hear that you and your family had such a great experience while staying with us. Thank you for your delightful feedback and for your valued business! We look forward to your return in the not too distant future.

Summary: The stay was disappointing, rooms were not what I expected at all! Digital key did not work and we found mold in the room. Outside of the room in the courtyard was nice but, the inside was outdated! Was charged $10 for parking per night and was advised that the $10 was for security patrolling the parking lot. I never saw any security just cones that blocked off most of the parking lot for a night club next door. I almost canceled my night there and was going to another hotel. I would never stay at that hotel again!
Manager Response: We are terribly sorry to hear that there were so many challenges with your recent stay and that we did not meet your expectations.  We always strive to provide excellent service and a great clean hotel for our guests. On a side note, our parking fee is not to cover our security cost, parking is charged at most hotels across the nation, and considering that our Security continually patrols our lot, I'm surprised to hear that you never saw them.  Regardless, our reputation with you is now tarnished, but nevertheless, I assure you that we will take all of your feedback seriously and will use this as a training opportunity for improvement in the future.  Thank you again for your feedback, and we truly hope you will return to allow us the opportunity to "Make it Right" for you in the near future.

Summary Heading: Friendly, helpful staff, but the hotel was not good
Summary: We arrived from our late flight tired and ready to rest. The staff was friendly and checked us in right away. We went up to our room, only to discover it smelled badly. A musty/mildew smell. We grabbed our things and headed back to the desk, where they gave us a key to a second room, but it had the same issue. We tried one more time, and the third room also had a problem. Perhaps it was a temporary problem with a water issue or something,  but it was disappointing. We were unable to stay at the hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We greatly appreciate your feedback and we sincerely apologize for the disappointment with your attempted stay. We will be sure to take your comments about our property under consideration as we re-evaluate guest needs and continually work to improve our guest experience. We hope you will consider staying with us again the next time your travels bring you to our area.

Summary: Though this hotel has nice accommodations; the location is left to be desired.  Sitting adjacent to a night club 1: the parking for the hotel is not separate for guests - thus if you are there nights where the club is packed; you are advised that you may have to park outside of the parking lot (i.e. on the street) but you are charged for daily parking.  So one night we couldn't leave for dinner for concern of not being able to park near the hotel and safety.  The included breakfast is good - made to order omelets or ala cart - The evening reception is nice for drinks, don't expect fancy snacks - Chex mix, popcorn, tortilla chips, veggie dip.  there is a shuttle to Disneyland but Uber is cheaper, especially non-surge hours.
Manager Response: Hello Christina, Thank you for staying with and providing feedback. I apologize for the inconvenience you experienced with parking. If you would be so kind as to let me know where you received the information regarding parking (lot, security, etc.) I would like to follow up on the issue. We look forward to seeing you on your next visit to Anaheim. Thanks, Kevin kevin.werner@hilton.com

Summary: Stay away from this hotel if at all possible. Dirty room, evening reception service subpar. Nightclub open Saturday night sharing the parking lot with the hotel and apparently night club patrons get preferred parking over hotel guests
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear that we did not meet your expectations and that your perception of our hotel has been tarnished partially due to the Club adjacent to the Hotel which caused somewhat of a parking challenge for you during your stay. We hope that this will not stop you from staying with us again in the future.. This is certainly not our goal and for this we do apologize as all of our guest always have top priority throughout our hotel. Rest assured that we take feedback seriously as we continually look for opportunities to improve our customers experiences. Thank you for your feedback!

Summary: I have been staying at this location since mid-2015.  I have been with them through their remodel and they continually deliver.   The location is perfect, easy freeway access, but no road noise in the rooms.   Hotel is clean, staff friendly, fantastic breakfast and easy parking.   I stay her 10 - 14 nights per year.
Manager Response: Hello, Thank you for your kind words. We also thank you for your loyalty. Thanks, Kevin

Summary Heading: Nice property but rooms need a refresh
Summary: Overall the property is nice with plenty of parking. The rooms feel a bit outdated and had a funky smell as if the carpet and couch were dirty. I would have asked for a different room however my check in was very late (after midnight). The digital key worked great on all doors. The breakfast was great, I just wish it started earlier on the weekend (instead of 7a). The staff was friendly and helpful. I checked in via the app and never interacted with the front desk staff but did with other staff during breakfast and in the common areas.

This was our first stay at this hotel and we loved it! Check in was easy (after a long flight from Cleveland). The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. The breakfast was wonderful, the made to order omlettes were a big hit. Loved sitting in the beautiful atrium eating breakfast and the tables are spread out so you are not hearing other conversations.  The indoor pool and spa were very relaxing, love all of the plants around the pool, they really help clean the air so you don't have the overwhelming chlorine smell.  The early evening Manager's Reception was great, drinks and snacks while relaxing in the atrium. We will definitely stay at this Embassy Suites again.  The staff was amazing.  Everyone was so friendly. Thanks Andy for the recommendations on where to eat!

Went to visit family in Orange County CA.  Selected this hotel because of location and indoor pool/spa.  The breakfast was amazing-the breakfast staff so nice and helpful.  Front desk very helpful.  Andy at the front desk was very friendly and helpful giving us directions and help.  Hotel is a little worn but clean.  The best thing about this hotel other than location was the amazing employees.

Just horrible!!!  They had the reservation wrong and the lady in the lobby was rude. I had a reservation for a two bedroom suite with two bathrooms. They don't have that type of room. I will not stay there again.
Manager Response: We are sorry you experienced challenges regarding your reservation, and felt that we were not able to provide you with the quality of services you deserve. This is not typical of our hotel and staff, as we are always looking for ways to improve our customer experience. Perhaps there was some confusion regarding the descriptions of our rooms, but all of our room types only have 1 bathroom. I also do apologize if you felt that our staff members attitude was rude and unbecoming. Your satisfaction is very important to us and we strive to provide gracious, engaging and caring service and try hard to make sure all of our guests have a rewarding stay. Thank you again for your feedback and we hope you will consider staying with us again.

Summary: Very nice and professional.  I would suggest this hotel to all of my friends and co-workers.  We always stay at this hotel for vacation and Disneyland.  My children enjoy the pool and other activities that we do, during our stay.
Manager Response: Our Hotel Team could not be happier to hear that you and your family had such a great experience while staying at the Embassy Suites Anaheim North. Thank you for your delightful feedback! We look forward to seeing you and your family again in the not too distant future.

Summary: We were a little concerned that this hotel was a little too far from Disneyland however, being just over 4 miles away was worth it, after experiencing one of the best stays at any Embassy we've ever been to.

I was in town for the Hilton convention and PJ made my stay excellent!!  My stay was lacking a few things as far as housekeeping standards. But it didn't even matter after meeting him. He made my stay 100% satisfied. It seems many guests feel the same way and only come in when he is working. He deserves a huge thank you from the management company.  My head turned from a negative experience to a positive after engaging with him on my first night.  The front desk staff did handle my issue but didn't even say sorry for food left from the previous guest. Hairs in my bed and coffee all over the floor in front of the fridge.  My co worker also experienced housekeeping issues. Including hairs in her room and a toothbrush on the desk chair. My five  star rating is due to his lack of

Excellent location in regards to Nixon Library.  Also, I was told only 15 minutes from Disneyland.  Spacious rooms/suites.  Staff at desk very friendly.  Very quite.  Husband loved being able to have a fried egg instead of scrambled eggs that you usually get at hotel provided breakfasts.

Summary Heading: Great Price for a Great Experience
Summary: Complimentary breakfast and a 5:30-7:30pm snack/drink time was an awesome bang for your buck. The appearance of the lobby was beautiful. The room itself was a little plain for my taste, definitely the TVs need to be upgraded next but for its value and location was a plus!

We stayed at this hotel due to the proximity to CSU, Fullerton. The room we had was facing the freeway and it was a little difficult to sleep due to the freeway noise.  If you stay here and are a light sleeper, choose the other side of the hotel.

The good definitely outweighed the not-good and I would certainly stay here again. There were a few drawbacks though -  Positive: affordable rates, friendly staff, clean room, warm indoor pool, shuttle to Disneyland, full complimentary breakfast.  Bear in mind, though: Disneyland is 20-30 minutes away, the shuttle doesn’t run for three hours midday, I forgot the tap water in CA tastes bad, and the hotel is in a very isolated location: freeway on two sides, scrap metal yard on another, and a club on the other (then more freeway).  We had not rented a car and if I did it over, I would want a car just to feel less isolated (and pick up a handle or two of drinking water).

Older Embassy Suites, the decor is somewhat dated, close to interstate but noise was not too bad. Staff very helpful and friendly. Rooms clean and comfortable, nice to have a walkin shower. Evening reception, quality of dinner food and breakfast experience were all positive. Complimentary internet a little iffy, but i was on 7th floor. Reccomend a higher floor if you like quiet time in early evening. Fitness room sub par, but overall good quality hotel for the money.

If you're looking to stay in the North Anaheim area, it's my recommendation that you skip this Embassy Suites. We were completely dissatisfied with our stay. The suite was not clean, and we were not told that it faced a metal recycling plant, that runs 24/7. All we could hear was the plant running, and for someone like me who is a light sleeper, it was impossible to sleep !!  We asked for housekeeping in our room the following morning, as we were gone all day, but when we returned, no one had showed up. At 4:40 a housekeeper finally showed up, but we were getting ready to leave for a family dinner, so we asked she come back in an hour. We were told "nope, I'm off in 20 minutes", and that was that. We had to call down to the front desk to get clean towels, coffee, etc., and our

There were clumps of hair on the floor, the end tables/lamps around the bed were dirty. The windows were dirty. The bed was made poorly. I checked in then when to the front desk, then left for another hotel.

While we have stayed here in the past and enjoyed it this time we did not.the service was slow and the breakfast staff were extremely rude the food was just average as well.and while the room was nice there was an overwhelming sewer smell all night long at first only my wife smelled it but upon entering the room after breakfast I could absolutely smell it and it was strong.needless to say with so many other choices in hotels out there we will not be back and that disappoints me because I really use to like staying here
Manager Response: We are terribly sorry to hear that you had challenges regarding an unpleasant odor in your room during your recent stay and that we did not meet your expectations.  We always strive to provide excellent service and a great clean hotel for our guests.  Regardless, I assure you that we will take all of your feedback seriously and will use this as a training opportunity for improvement in the future.  Thank you again for your feedback!

Summary Heading: Nice intentions but room for improvements...
Summary: From a location POV this hotel worked out great for my needs.  Over a three day weekend, I had the NAMM show (Anaheim Convention Center) and a two-day volleyball tournament at American Sports Center (next to Disney).  This property was about 5 miles away from both venues so it met my needs and got my booking.  The format of the hotel is nice (atrium in middle) but also one of the major flaws.  When you have a hotel with hundreds of rooms there are bound to be a couple of clueless guests in regards to how they should act in public areas.  Every night past 10p had a few guests shouting to their mates from the atrium and the flaw is that it works like a huge PA system and everyone hears it.  Similar in the mornings are parents that let their kids run through the atrium at 5a who
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We greatly appreciate your feedback and are happy to hear that you feel your stay was a good value and met your needs for the volleyball tournament and the NAMM convention. We apologize however that you had some challenges during your stay regarding noise from outside, and within the atrium. We are always striving to provide engaging and caring service and we look for opportunities to capitalize and improve our service offerings so we thank you for making us aware. We do hope you will consider staying with us again the next time your travels bring you to our area. All the best!

Summary: This Embassy Suites is a little beat up and worn down but they have it priced right considering it’s location to nearby attractions like Disneyland. The rooms are spacious and there was a mini refrigerator in my room (no freezer section). The four stars is due to the price I paid in comparison to its location. If this place would get a little TLC, it would really be a first class hotel.

We stayed here for our Disney trip and it was wonderful, easy to get to the park and Yummy breakfast every morning! When we got done at the parks we went back to a clean, and quiet Hotel! Our room was large and easy to entertain a few family members wanting to talk, you had chairs, a couch and a TV in the front room! No one had to sit on a bed! Love it!

Our stay at the hotel was great. Hotel staff was friendly, breakfast was fabulous. The only thing that I didn't enjoy was how far hotel was from Disneyland, I was expecting it to be a 5 minute drive when it reality its more of a 10-15 min drive to Disney. Otherwise great.

If you don't mind the hotel having control of your room temperature, then you'll be fine. But if you like it cooler than what they have set the temperature, be ready to ask for a fan and sleep with sliding glass door open (if cool outside).
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write your review and share your experience. I am sorry that you did not enjoy your time with us. Our building is set up with a two-pipe system, so our entire building is either in cooling, neutral, or heating. We do our best to select the mode that will satisfy the most people, and I am sorry that we were not able to satisfy you. Thank you for staying with us and we hope to see you back again.  Best,   Andrew F.

Summary: My family of 5 spent 3 nights here in room 631. It faced the river, and was nice and quiet. Room itself was spacious, though not the bathroom. Easy to get to Disney in about 10-15 minutes though the hotel itself is isolated. Evening reception was busy but it worked out fine. Cons: breakfast gets crowded, pool kept running out of towels, atrium noise, and there was a significant draft through the door jam into the sitting room where I had 2 kids sleeping. Also, bathroom was quite small.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We greatly appreciate your feedback and are happy to hear that you feel your stay was a good for you and your family. We apologize however that you had some minor issues during your stay. We are always striving to provide caring and engaging service and we thank you for making us aware of your room concerns and our pool area servicing the towels a little quicker. We do look forward to you staying with us again the next time your travels bring you to our area. All the best!

Summary: We normally stay at a hotel across from Disneyland.  This hotel came with our Costco package.  I read mixed reviews and was a little concerned before getting there.  We arrived at 10pm and it was quick to check in and get to our room.  Our room was decent.  We didn't have blankets for the pull-out bed and enough towels, made a call to housekeeping but no one was answering.   The shuttle to Disneyland leaves on the hour and it takes about 30 minutes.   Breakfast buffet was awesome and we enjoyed the evening drinks and snacks, but also ordered full meals.   Overall, it was a good place to stay and everyone there were very friendly.
Manager Response: Our Hotel Team could not be happier to hear that you and your family had a great experience while staying at the Embassy Suites Anaheim North. Thank you for your delightful feedback! We look forward to seeing you and your family again in the not too distant future.

Summary Heading: Room feels like a cheap hotel not Embassy Suites
Summary: Room feels like a cheap hotel not Embassy Suites. Vents were dirty, beds were not comfortable, pillows were lumpy, sofa bed blanket was old. Cannot control room temperature. Room was hot! There's a nightclub next to it and parking was terrible.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are very sorry to hear that you did not enjoy your stay. Your comments will be shared with our staff as we are always looking to improve. We sincerely hope that you will give us another chance the next time you are in the Anaheim area.  Kindest Regards,  Andrew F.

Summary Heading: Good hotel for families visiting Disneyland
Summary: We have an overall good experience, there was one con but I’ll get to that and it’s large enough to give 3 instead of 4 rating.  We enjoyed the checkin experience, very easy they had a room ready when we arrived at 1pm so we could put our luggage away. We took advantage of the indoor pool and hot tub as it was cold and raining, huge plus if you go in the winter as the kids can go swimming and it was plenty warm inside the pool area. Towels were provided in the pool area so you don’t need to get any from your room. We enjoyed the evening reception only one night but it was nice with light snacks on a table and drinks were generous with very kind bartenders.   Our room was clean and overall very comfortable, one of our queen beds was a little lumpy but the other was fine. The sofa

I would have given 4+ for the hotel,but for my bad experience with the housekeeping staff. During my stay they never properly cleaned the room. Proximity to Disney and the shuttle service is a plus. Good for families
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. I am sorry to hear that we were not able to provide you with the quality of housekeeping service that you deserve during your stay with us; my apologies. Please do think of us the next time you are in the area as we would be grateful for another opportunity to earn your business.  Best Wishes,  Andrew F.

Summary: This is a great option if you don’t mind staying a few miles away from Disneyland. The rooms are spacious for a family of 4 and the indoor pool is a plus during the winter. I was very satisfied by the quality of the morning breakfast buffet.

stay was not bad except for the day that it rained the nice day notice that the bedroom carpet was completely soaked up to about I don't know quarter of the bed underneath, higher than that just a was okay just wish they would have told me that if it rained anything on the floor near the false balcony was gonna get wet.
Manager Response: We're sorry you had challenges in your room due to a leak. Please know that this is not normal for our hotel and staff, as we work hard to maintain functionality and exceed the quality of service provided to all of our guest. Unfortunately, mitigating circumstances do occur which can sometimes cause momentary setbacks; My apologies. Nevertheless we are continually making the necessary adjustments to ensure that we uphold our brand motto, which is to "Make it Right" and we strive to provide engaging and caring service for all of our guests. Thank you for bringing your issues and concerns to our attention, and we look forward to seeing you again in the not too distant future.

Summary: We decided to stay here because of the Hilton Hotel name.  Upon arrival, the Front Desk did greet us, but was not friendly, not even a smile.  Not a great first impression of the hotel.  The lobby area was clean. We were not advised of the afternoon reception or breakfast. While we were in the elevator, a guest told us about breakfast and Happy Hour. The room clearly needs to be updated. The ceiling appears to have had some water damage as it appears that there were bubbles on the ceiling.  The sheets did not smell clean, there was a musty/mildew smell.  The bathroom ventilation was poor, the toilet handle had to be held down when flushing.  The bathroom door entrance floor frame needed to be repaired as paint was chipping from the frame.  The sliding door was not insulated
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience. We always appreciate those that take the time to leave feedback; good, bad, or otherwise. I am sorry to hear that you had such a poor stay with us, and on behalf of all of us here at Embassy Suites Anaheim North I apologize. I am happy to hear that the bar staff provided you with great service. We hope that you will give us another chance the next time you are in the area.  Best Wishes,  Andrew F.

Summary: This is a great place for families rain or heat. The inside allows for a great experience even if it is raining outside because of the atrium. They also have an indoor pool and free full breakfast. Our family had a great time.

We stayed here for 5 nights with 2 adults and 3 kids. There were only two towels in the restroom, so we asked for more. The next day, same thing again. We asked again. Happened all 5 nights. Had to ask for more pillows/sheets/blankets all 5 nights too. Some of the staff acted very annoyed when asked for more towels/pillows, etc. Other than that, it was a great place to stay. Friendly folks for the most part. Great breakfast. It's a Disneyland good neighbor hotel, but it's nowhere near the park.

We were so fortunate to have found this location. The staff were wonderful, accommodating an went beyond the call of ordinary duty - one male housekeeper even opened one of those impossible plastic clamshells well held a new laptop charger. The front desk was helpful even after we were back in AZ, retrieving jewelry left by chance and helping me get it shipped.  The hosted manager’s happy hour is pleasant and generous.  The breakfast is fit for royalty. Their menu for lunch and dinner is more limited than the previous version (the changeover took place during our stay).  Nothing wrong with the food, but limited choices especially for anyone wishing to be gluten free.  And did I mention that you may purchase your Disney tickets there. The shuttle stops right at the door (20”

Summary Heading: Embassy Suites looks beautiful and nice stay on side away from interstate
Summary: I love the brand but must STaybridge Suites is doing a better job. This place looked beautiful but I waited 15 minutes to check-in at around 7pm - no staff. The room was loud due to traffic all night -hard to sleep. Breakfast was okay and the evening reception continues to go down hill- cheap well drinks and hardly anythign to snack on protein wise (no cheese, salami, etc.) My hopes were up becuase it looked so beautiful.
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear that you did not enjoy your experience at our hotel. We will take your comments into consideration as we are always looking to improve. We do hope to see you again in the future for another chance to impress you.  Kindest Regards,  Andrew F.

Summary: Air conditioner didn't work. Hard to sleep in hot room. Old facilities in bathroom. Not very nice tub or toilet. Very cheap furniture with parts broken or simply not very nice. Near freeway. If your room is facing freeway, it will be loud.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I am sorry to hear that you had a negative experience. I do hope you will come back as we are always looking to improve.  Kindest Regards,  Andrew F.

Summary: Overall great hotel would recommend this to everyone. Space of the rooms is what I was looking for so much room in there especially for big families. Room was cleaned everyday which is important to us.

We were upset about the smell on the last two days. It smelled like sewer. We told the staff , all they did was take 75 dollars of a 600 dollar stay. And the restaurant orders kept getting messed up and wasn't very good and way over priced.

Summary Heading: Worst Embassy Suites I could imagine
Summary: Upon arrival, the overwhelming smell of mold hit me as soon as we entered our room (602). I knew it was in the ventilation system, so I tried to put the fans on high without changing the room temp, but the way the thermostats work in this hotel, you cannot manually set a fan speed unless the system is also trying to change the air temp. They also only run heat when the ambient (outside) temperature falls below a certain value, and only A/C above another temp, but there’s a gap in the middle where it runs neither, which is apparently where it was set at. I reported the problem and asked for another room, but no others were available with the desired bedding arrangement. My wife decided the smell wasn’t enough reason to move, but when she went to take a shower, the valve that
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear that you had such a poor experience at our property. Please know that your comments will be shared with all management.  We do hope that you will give us another chance the next time you are in the area for another shot at giving you a comfortable stay.  Kindest Regards,  Andrew F.

Summary Heading: Not an ES I'd pick again.
Summary: First the good: the cooks that this ES are outstanding. The breakfast is fantastic, the dinner servings are right sized and tasty (try tacos asada!), the bar staff is friendly and quick, the front desk staff and management is excellent. The one ellipical and one working treadmill combined with a mutifunction weight machine and free weights up to 50 lbs was GREAT (get the other treadmill fixed!). That said, this ES needs a complete overhaul. The carpet is atrocious, seriously the ugliest carpet I've ever seen. It looked like glue on concrete. My bath faucet leaked and changed temperature from warm/just right to scalding hot all by itself and was so worn out that nothing Maintenance did helped it. The bath itself looked rode hard and put away wet. The view of the metal recycling
Manager Response: Dear gentrysm,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your stay with us. We truly appreciate your feedback and while we’re so happy you received friendly service from our entire staff, we are very sorry for the conditions you endured during your visit. We will address your comments with our team as we work to improve our guest experience. Your input is genuinely helpful, and we hope you will come visit us in the future.

Summary Heading: Hotel smelled, front desk staff wasn't meh
Summary: Breakfast and bar staff was excellent.  Room wasn't as nice as I thought it would be.  Our ice machine was broken on our floor.  The ART shuttle only runs every hour and it's about 30 minutes away during higher traffic times.  There is a block out time from 11 to 3 in which you can't use the shuttle.  Decent hotel but I would like to be closer to Disney next time.
Manager Response: Dear kathrynburgunder,  Thank you for your review. While we’re happy you received friendly service from our dining staff, we’re sorry we didn’t provide the quality of amenities you expected during your recent stay at our hotel. We apologize for the issues encountered, and we are working with our team to correct the problems and avoid recurrence going forward. Your feedback is genuinely helpful, as it is the first step in identifying areas where we can better our guest services. If you return to our area, we hope you’ll stay with us again.

Summary: First the good. The staff was great, they were friendly and helpful. We had both breakfast and dinner there, the food here did not disappoint it was good!! So many options at breakfast!! We loved it! there was a shuttle to take us to and from the parks so we did not have to drive in LA traffic. Now the bad. We had encountered an issue with our toilet they called housekeeping right away to come fix the issue but the issue was not going to be fixable within the time that we were staying. They should have moved us to a different room right away to a room that had a working tolit, instead my husband fixed it every time someone flushed the toilet which he shouldn't have had to do on vacation. That was the only bad I would say. All else was good.

Love this hotel! Had a slight issue on check in but the Guest Services Manager Marissa was so helpful and accommodating. Will definitely come back because of the great service received and the beautiful, well kept rooms.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sharing information regarding your recent stay with us, at the Embassy Suites Hotel Anaheim North. We strive to provide caring and engaging service to all of our guests, and I'm glad our guest service manager Marissa, made you feel right at home. We look forward to you returning to our property in the not to distant future.  Respectfully,

Summary: I've stayed in many Hilton brand hotels and this one was by far the worst. Rooms were dirty (bathroom floors, air-conditioning vents were dirty/dusty) . Housekeeping didn't restock room items (toilet paper, coffee cups). This hotel should not qualify as a Disney Good Neighbor hotel.

We typically stay at the south embassy suites but wanted to try this one. We were disappointed with the room. Paint was peeling on the bathtub and there was rust in the sprinkle head. It looks like they just repainted things in the room. Not what I’m used to seeing at embassy suites. We were cold the first night and couldn’t tell whether the thermostat was working Mx the next day we asked the front desk about this and they mentioned that they don’t have heat in the hotel and gave us a heat lamp. We couldn’t believe it. This hotel is about a 20-30 minute shuttle ride.  Too far from Disneyland for us. Almost forgot to mention how close this hotel room is to the freeway and could hear the traffic. Husband couldn’t sleep in the room because of the noise. Had to sleep on the sofa
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your comments. We are sorry to hear that you were disappointed with your stay. The condition of your room will be relayed to our maintenance team.  Regarding the heat in your room, we do have heat in our hotel. It runs through one central system and, due to the outside temperature during your stay, the building was set to air conditioning. We do apologize that you were unable to switch your room to heat, but am happy to hear that our staff was able to offer you a heater.  Thank you again for your feedback and we do hope you'll give us another chance the next time you are in the Anaheim area.

Summary: As we stayed for 2 nights,we are satisfied.Our only concern is that they should have a firm and soft pillows.Expect for vehicles noises at midnight because it is close to freeway.All the staff are friendly and helpful.Fitness room is small but when I worked out I was only myself inside the gym.Over all it was a great first experience at this hotel and definitely we'll come back.
Manager Response: Hello!  Thank you so much for your feedback! We are so happy to hear about your positive experience with your stay. We do hope to see you back soon.

Summary: Fantastic all around, mabey some minor updates needed, strange style choice for hallway carpets, will definitely still stay here again. Staff were always happy to help. Pool and hot tub were perfect temps.

If you want a good place for your family to stay at while visiting Disneyland, this place is good.  The rooms and beds are good and offer a lot of options if you have children.  The staff is friendly and helpful and the morning breakfast session is well run.  Having the indoor atrium adds a level of security for children and the pool and hot tub can provide a good distraction.    One reason why we chose this location is that they have a very reasonable Disneyland shuttle that runs every 30 minutes.  If memory serves me correctly, the shuttle was $3 adults and $2 children for unlimited rides from morning till 1 hour past closing.  That saved us from renting a car and / or paying $20 to park it at Disneyland.
Manager Response: Our Hotel Team could not be happier to hear that you and your family had such a great experience while staying at the Embassy Suites Anaheim North. Thank you for your delightful feedback! We look forward to seeing you and your family again in the not too distant future.

Summary: Stayed here on a recent trip to Disneyland. This hotel is very old and tired. The bathroom is very dingy with a lot of mildew. It’s also not in the best location, without any restaurants nearby.  The staff we did interact with were all very nice, the only plus to this establishment. We would not choose to stay at this hotel again. We love staying at Embassy Suites, but this one is just not up to par. Also, the coffee in the morning is just plain terrible.

Summary Heading: It does have a good breakfast
Summary: Claims renovated rooms.  Slopping paint over mold and rust should not be called renovations.   Toilet kept running all night and shower wouldn't stop dripping.  Those really needed renovated.  Breakfast is always the best though!!  And the breakfast staff was super friendly and very aware!!

Pretty loyal to Embassy Suites and this was a typical clean, friendly staffed and convenient location property.  My room overlooked a recycling center, not a major concern but if I were to be in vacation that would be less then ideal, being that side of the building.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking a moment to share your experience. We're sorry you didn't like the placement of your room. Per our brand motto, we strive to "Make It Right" and I'm sure we could have resolved this issue immediately for you had we been made aware of the circumstances, my apologies. Otherwise, I am happy to hear you found the Embassy Suites Hotel Anaheim North to your liking. We strive to provide gracious, engaging and caring service and appreciate you bringing your challenges and concerns to our attention. We look forward to welcoming you back to our hotel in the not too distant future.

Summary: The room was worn- rusted, dripping faucets and shower head, peeling leather/vinyl furniture, torn shower curtain, worn/peeling wood vanity, jammed curtains in bedroom. It was exceptionally noisy due to its location on a busy freeway and loud parking lot next to a club. The fitness room was tiny with broken equipment and no mats for stretching or yoga. I was very disappointed in the condition of the property.
Manager Response: Dear phcoop, 					 Thank you for sharing this invaluable insight into your recent visit. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and we’re very sorry you were unhappy with our hotel. We will take your comments under consideration as we continually work to improve our guest experience. We hope you will consider staying with us in the future.

Summary: Told staff 3 times my room wouldn't cool off and I was ignored. Veggies and dip every night for evening reception. Tacked on a $20 resort fee per day at end of stay. The rooms are spacious, the beds and couch was soft but too hot to sleep. Wouldn't stay again.
Manager Response: Dear roxego2, 					 Thank you for sharing this invaluable insight into your recent visit. We are very sorry you had a poor experience with our staff and that you were unhappy with our guestroom due to the faulty air conditioner. We will work with our team to ensure this is not a recurring problem. Your input is genuinely helpful, as it is the first step in identifying areas where we can better our guest services. We hope you will come visit us in the future for a much better experience.

Summary: Great first experience view,food and staff was wonderful. My room was perfect and I can't wait to return again  I will recommend others to stay at your hotel as well. It was perfect location to the location I had to be in. Parking was great not too far away from hotel  Overall great experience

Summary Heading: Rooms pretty nice, freeway NOISE is terrible, and the carpets need some cleaning, but not overly so
Summary: The title mostly covers it. Rooms are good, carpets could be cleaner, but were fine. The FREEWAY NOISE is CRAZY loud.  Even WITH earplugs, I struggled to sleep well.  They need some sort of better curtains, or windows, to block the sound from the freeway...

We are paying xxx amount and they control the tv??? Brought my ROKU, NO HDMI in any room? WTF? I’m very upset!!! They have no right to put in tvs and disable all the HDMI ... If rooms available at other hotels I would check out tomorrow morning but all hotels are full near Disneyland the days we are staying. I’m a Diamond Member Hilton so this is horrible and extreme disservice to guests!
