Summary Heading: Usually love this brand but they let us down this time
Summary: Room type wasn't available, had to budge to get them to offer us another room type, we had a wedding to get ready for in an hour. When we got up to the room there were no towels for us, dried with hand towels
Manager Response: Dear megsmc1291,  Thank you for sharing your experience with us.  The night before your arrival our hotel was sold out. We understand that you had a wedding to prepare for, and we did our best to get you a room as soon as possible, as you arrived well before our check-in time of 4pm. We always do our best to accommodate all requests. We also, noticing your time constraints, were more than happy to move you to an alternate room type to get you in quicker.  Kindest Regards,  A. Favorito

Summary: We had such a nice and FUN family trip! We loved the complimentary breakfast and having the shuffle non stop route to Disneyland and back to the hotel! We will for sure be staying here again! It was plenty of room for all four of us! It was a WONDERFUL family trip!
Manager Response: Hello 660jayleneh!  Thank you so much for telling us about your stay! We hope you enjoyed your vacation and hope to see you again the next time you are in the Anaheim area.  Best,  A. Favorito

Summary: Nice hotel in a good location. Can’t beat their outstanding breakfast and evening reception. Room was clean and well kept. Fitness room was small but had everything you needed for a decent workout. Pool and hot tub were great.
Manager Response: Hello randolphc551,  We are happy to hear about your experience at our hotel. We hope to see you again the next time your travels bring you in our direction.  Kindest Regards,  A. Favorito

Summary: Overall I was not happy with this Hilton Property. I was super disappointed in not receiving bath towels, clean wash clothes, and a room that didn’t have a strong bad odor. I will not be staying at this Hilton property again.
Manager Response: Dear cucberni,  Thank you for your feedback. We appreciate those who take time to tell us their experience as we are always looking to improve. We hope to see you back so that we may do better next time.  Kindest Regards,  A. Favorito

Summary: We planned a vacation for my grandchildren for the first time. The LA fires re-routed us and it literally took 10 hours to get from Bakersfield to Anaheim. Anna in customer service stayed on the phone and googled and re-directed us like a champ… She’s the best! When arriving to the hotel with continued directional services from general manager, Kevin, we were greeted with complementary drinks and free Wi-Fi… And a relaxing dip in the pool and hot tub. Our room was spacious comfortable and amazing. When departing... we were assisted by Jean, who despite my misunderstanding still made our stay amazing!
Manager Response: Hello Grandmanurse5,  Thank you for sharing you experience with our hotel. We are so happy that you made it despite all the fire situation and road closures. We hope to welcome you back again in the future.  Kindest Regards,  A. Favorito

Summary: This is a well-run and well-maintained hotel that does well even when crowded.    The hotel itself isn't the newest, but it's very conveniently located on the north edge of Anaheim along the Riverside Freeway.  The eastern-facing rooms have a view of an auto-recycling facility which is fascinating and closes down around dinner time, so noise isn't an issue. The freeway side is a little noisy, but the comfy be and lots of pillows helped with that.  Steve and Juan at the bar made for a pleasant dinner while I watched the ballgame and had a nice shrimp scampi. The shrimp was a little tough, but my presumption is that it's frozen somewhere with a bunch of other Hilton shrimp.  The servers were friendly and took care of everything well.  Breakfast was likewise good. I had an omelet
Manager Response: Dear lungfish2k,  Thank you so much for telling us about your stay! We do our best to make sure everyone, whether here for business or pleasure, has a positive experience and we are thrilled to hear that we made the possible for you.  Kindest Regards,  A. Favorito

Summary: We arrived for 2 nights (2 adults + 2 kids) and had a pleasant stay. Room was impressive and comfortable, nice staff. Breakfast was a disappointment but in over all we will be glad to recommend and be back.
Manager Response: Hello Yaniv P,  Thank you for your comments. We are sorry to hear that your breakfast was unimpressive, but are pleased that the rest of your stay was pleasant.   We look forward to seeing you again.  Best,  A. Favorito

Summary Heading: Do not stay at this hotel!
Summary: Worst experience ever. Rooms are dirty, staff is rude, bed is as hard as a rock and food is horrible. Our fridge was leaking and the maintenance man cleaned the mess with our bathroom towels and then never replaced them. Stay at this hotel if you want to leave feeling like you just got punched in the stomach after flushing $400 down the toilet.
Manager Response: I am so sorry you found your guest room and bathroom unsatisfactory, and felt that our staff was rude and our food was undesirable. I can assure you that is not the standard in our hotel. We work hard to make sure our staff conducts themselves to the highest standards of hospitable professionalism, and that our housekeepers and engineers keep each and every guest room and bathroom clean and fully operational; my apologies. Obviously, we missed the mark and now our reputation is tarnished with you. Nevertheless, I hope you consider staying with us again. We strive to provide gracious, engaging and caring service and we’d love to have you as our guest to ensure you have the best travel experience ever.

Summary: Dirty pool water, broken bed mattress, air conditioning problems, bent refrigerator door, would not cool drinks or food,Parking lot full, no parking for my mom who is handicapped, broken chase lounge and sofa,loud noise all night long both from adjoining rooms and from freeway traffic outside. Guest Beware.
Manager Response: Dear Z1708VBpeter,  Thank you for your review. We’re sorry we didn’t provide the quality of amenities and service you and your mother deserved during your recent stay at our hotel. We apologize for the many issues encountered, and we are working with our team to correct the problems and avoid recurrence going forward. Your feedback is genuinely helpful, as it is the first step in identifying areas where we can better our guest services. If you return to our area, we hope you’ll stay with us again.

Summary: I went for my anniversary with my husband. Service was great. The waffles were amazing. Strawberry preserves would have been a plus, along with bigger Bagels. I would of loved a room with a working heater, but otherwise it was a nice place to stay.

Summary Heading: Old property not close to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here this past weekend. It’s an older property without restaurants in walking distance.    It’s an old property but it’s clean and our room was nice.   We took the shuttle to Disneyland and it runs once per hour on the hour.    Everything was going pretty well and expected to write a positive review until breakfast this morning.   The staff was caught completely by surprise. They ran out of clean plates, silverware and coffee. It was a nightmare with 40-50 people standing around waiting.  You would think they could plan better but it didn’t happen.   We most definitely won’t stay here again with so many better choices closer to the park.

My family stayed here recently to catch a couple of the Angels last games of the season.  Stayed on the 7th floor, and had a quiet stay.  The ceilings are higher on the upper floor, which I like.  The breakfast was stocked well, and there were tables available, even though it was busy.  If you want a good place to stay with reasonable prices, this place works!

Summary Heading: This was my go to hotel, unfortunately not any longer...
Summary: Stay at this location twice a year for business, unfortunately the rooms were updated a few years ago but have not been kept up.  I ended up moving rooms because the first one had dirt all over the walls, a hole in one of the doors, a shredded shade and overall just not cleaned properly.  Looks like their housekeeping staff is overwhelmed or just not doing everything that should be done.  They were happy to change my room but he second was not much better.  I stay at many Hilton properties (Hampton Inn's, Embassy Suites, Homewood Suites etc.) at all price points for business.  This which was once my go to hotel in Anaheim won't be any longer.

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel, but our issues were not resolved
Summary: This hotel is beautiful, but none of our issues we ended up having were resolved. The staff brushed them off and would just try to calm us and let us know it was not their fault and everything will be fine soon.

As Hilton Honors members we regularly stay at Embassy Suites hotels. We love the two room suites, happy hour and omelet bar b'fast. However this time we were very upset as we paid extra to get a room with a view of the Disneyland fireworks, only to find out that the fireworks were only on at the weekend and we were staying there during the week. This is a complete ripoff and Embassy Suites should be held accountable. When we complained, the front desk said that they were not aware of the ever changing firework schedule. That's bullcrap! They know that in the off season the fireworks are only in at the weekend and they should not be upselling "rooms with a view of the fireworks" when they know that the fireworks are not on!

Love the indoor pool and full breakfast buffet in the morning.  We always stay at this hotel when we go to Disney. Beds are comfortable and rooms are clean. Rooms are a great size as well. The staff is amazing!

Summary Heading: Would stay again, great hotel and friendly staff.
Summary: Lights were blown in our room upon check in and had to call for towels to be stocked up in pool room. Complimentary evening reception could use better snacks, the snacks were horrible compared to other hotels.

The hotel chain is way better than this particular hotel, rooms are just too old and dirty, would stay at another location. The complimentary breakfast and beverage time was great and staff at each was attentive, a real plus
Manager Response: We are sorry we were unable to provide you with the quality of amenities and service you deserved during your recent stay. We apologize for the issues in your room and will work with our maintenance team to ensure this does not happen again. If you return to our area, we hope you will consider staying with us again.

Summary: Great staff, nice location, very happy with the breakfast options,  glad for the evening reception, clean but the rooms need some work and updates. The baseboard was falling off, the bathtub was a little iffy and dingy. But I was glad it was clean, they cleaned good while we were there too. My kids enjoyed the pool. And again the staff was great all of them.

Embassy Suites was a fantastic value considering the amenities and location! It was centrally located, the rooms were very spacious, the pool area wasn’t crowded and the breakfast was amazing (delicious and so many choices)! We would definitely stay here again! I also liked that they accept Hilton Honors rewards.

This was an easy choice for location, and amenities. Great pool my granddaughter loved, the evening reception was great as there were plenty of spaces to hang out and enjoy family. The breakfast was great. The only downside is if you sleep hot, bring a fan. Temperature is automatic and it got rather warm. All in all one of our favorite places to all join up and meet!

Terrible experience. AC broken, tub doesn't drain, and hairdryer is so sticky you’ll need to hold it with a plastic bag. Customer service is horrendous. Ruined our Disney experience. Don’t stay here if you want to relax!

This was a stop over to drive around orange county and LA county.  Very nice hotel, great location off the highway, about 15 minutes from Disneyland.  Shopping nearby.  Breakfast was fantastic as usual, staff was helpful and nice.  Mgrs evening reception, never fails, always a nice way to wind down the day.

We had several problems with our room. The staff was quick to come investigate but did NOT resolve any of the issues. Our room was always warm and the molding in the living room fell off the wall and hit my wife in the head. The curtains were full of dust and the bathroom light fixtures were not bright enough to see in the shower. There was mold in the shower and rust on floor from the rotted out door frame.  There was mold on the patio door.
Manager Response: I am so sorry you found your room and bathroom unsatisfactory. I can assure you that is not the standard in our hotel. We work hard to make sure our housekeepers and engineers keep each and every guest room and bathroom clean and operational; my apologies. I hope you consider staying with us again. We strive to provide gracious, engaging and caring service and we’d love to have you as our guest to ensure you have the best travel experience ever By then, I'm certain that we'll have rectified your issues and concerns and regained your trust in the high standards and quality of service we provide.

Summary Heading: Building's Age, Engineering and Mechanical Upkeep Causes Stale, Damp Air within Guest Suites
Summary: I stayed at the Embassy Suites by Hilton Anaheim North 3 times now--always in August, 3 of the past 4 years, for 4 or 5-day stays. My first visit was prior to the atrium upgrades, and my last two trips were after the atrium upgrades, which were well executed. The issues I encounter at this specific Embassy Suites location have to do with the age and engineering of the building. Other reviewers mentioned the limitations of the HVAC system inside the hotel suites, but that's not my issue--the A/C in the room did manage to keep the suite cool in August. My problem has to do with ventilation. The bathroom vent fan is very old and very weak. As a result, the bathroom stays pretty damp, even if the fan is running 24/7. There is no separate switch for the bathroom's ventilation fan and

Summary Heading: bathrooms in the suite poorly maintained
Summary: no hot water in the bathroom faucet and the drain in the tub / shower was clogged. The food is average for an evening reception and the fitness facility had a broken machine and the TV monitors were not working

Summary Heading: Love this location because of the people that work there
Summary: You will not find a finer group of people than the folks that work at this location - they are all "Top Notch!" I always go back because they truly care about your comfort and happiness! The food is also wonderful!

Stayed here with my family for 2 night weekend of August 2, 2019. We were disappointed. The rooms were clean enough,  outdated but clean. The carpet in the lobby was old and dirty and the feel of the hotel it self was less then what I would have expected for an Embassy. We stayed at an Embassy in April in Seattle and the happy hour was amazing, their breakfast was amazing and staff were very professional. With that said, this hotel was like a cheaper imitation of my last experience at an embassy. The staff was okay, one person in particular was some what rude and when we checked out I mentioned it to the girl who helped me and she told me the girl i described as rude was the manager. Breakfast was over very early and food seemed sparse. It you were there even half an hour before
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experiences from your most recent stay. I appreciate you taking time out of your day to offer constructive feedback. I am sorry that we did not meet your expectations. Please give me a call at the phone number below so that we can discuss this further and come up with a resolution to make it right. Thank you  Marissa Vigil Guest Services Manager Marissa.Vigil@Hilton.com Embassy suites by Hilton Anaheim North  (714)618-9010 3100 E Frontera St  Anaheim, Ca 92806

Summary: When the elevator doors opened, I thought the hotel was under renovation, that is how bad the carpeting is. Next, change the ight bulbs, fluorescent is not complimenting the hotel at all. When I arrived at my room there was a dust bunny on the wall right beside the bed and I needed to wipe out the cola syrup from the mini fridge. I bumped into a manager and he seemed concerned, like he was going to send someone to the room, but it was late and I asked if it could be cleaned in the morning. This is our third morning and it’s still there. Food in and under the couch as well.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experiences from your most recent stay. I appreciate you taking time out of your day to offer constructive feedback. I apologize there were a few issues with the room you checked into. It is very disappointing to hear especially that housekeeping was not able to take care of the issue in a timely manner. Please give me a call at the phone number below so that we can discuss this further and come up with a resolution to make it right. Thank you again! Sincerely,  Marissa Vigil Guest Services Manager Marissa.Vigil@Hilton.com Embassy suites by Hilton Anaheim North  (714)618-9010 3100 E Frontera St  Anaheim, Ca 92806

Summary: This hotel is like most Embassy brand hotels. The hotel is much older and a bit of update to the facility could be better, such as the AC. room struggles to get cool. A common issue since there is only one AC unit for all rooms.

Patio covered in bird droppings and tons of spider webs. Some lights didn't work and a couple of them didn't match their light quality. House keeping never restocked the items. And the pool is smaller than what the picture shows. The only thing that was awesome was the breakfast. They even had a grill cook for fresh omelets, but the potatoes are the best.

Summary Heading: Good value; a little far from Disney
Summary: Shuttles need to run more than once an hour. We ended up using Uber a couple times. Manager’s reception was nice. Hotel was redone on the public portions but the rooms still need a bit of an update. Very good price for a Disney trip. Wish they had an outdoor pool. But we really only utilized the hotel as a place to sleep, recharge our phones, and drop off memorabilia from the park.  The walls are thin and you can hear children screaming in the morning.

Nice hotel!  Just uncomfortable beds and pillows.  Breakfast needs to extend to at least 9:30am for family vacations.  Not everyone will be up that early when on vacation.  I see guests were only able to get coffee while they clean up at 9:00am.  Everything else was gone.
Manager Response: We are terribly sorry to hear that there were challenges with your breakfast during your recent stay and that we did not meet your expectations.  We always strive to provide excellent caring and engaging service for all our guests. I assure you that we will take all of your feedback seriously and will use this as a training opportunity for improvement in the future. Thank you again for your feedback!

Summary: Sketchy pool, bad food, no parking due to nightclub taking it all.  I reported all of our concerns to the hotel staff and they did not care at all. I would never stay here again and we recommend you do not either

We stated  at the location for about 6 days. Our room had spider web on the ceiling and killed about 5 spiders. When the window was open to get fresh air due to the room being Musty then it was very dirty and spider webs all over. I don;t think the outside have ever been cleaned. The side of the window was all dirty and black. For being a hilton honor member I am very suprise this location is actually a hilton related.  The staff are great but the building it self need help. I called to report and someone was going to call me back but I did not get a report. My son and kids  have bites . The bed sheet smile like someone pee on them.  The worst hilton honor experience.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience about your recent stay at our hotel regarding your challenges with cleanliness and unpleasant room odors. Please know that this is not typical for our hotel and staff, and also know that as a Hilton Honors member, you are among our most valued guests. We strive to provide gracious, engaging and caring service and sincerely appreciate your feedback and we're very sorry you were unhappy. We will take your comments under consideration as we continually work to improve our guest experience. We hope you will consider staying with us in the future. Perhaps then, you'll catch us at our best and we'll possibly overwhelm you with our "Make It Right" quality of overall service you deserve.

Summary: They over charged my credit card and it didn’t get resolved and my credit card was maxed out I could not use it on my trip because of the hotel. There customer service was horrible especially marrisa and craig the general manger
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experiences from your most recent stay. I appreciate you taking time out of your day to offer constructive feedback. I sincerely want to apologize that you had an issue with your credit card being over authorized. As much as we all rely on technology, sometimes it malfunctions. I have escalated the matter to corporate management team to hopefully find a fix so that no one has to go through that again. If there is anything that I may assist with regarding your previous stay and/or any future stays, please contact me at your convenience.  Marissa Vigil Guest Services Manager Marissa.Vigil@Hilton.com Embassy suites by Hilton Anaheim North  (714)618-9010 3100 E Frontera St  Anaheim, Ca 92806

Summary: This was an overall average hotel. I've definitely stayed at better Embassy Suites before though. The rooms were clean and has a comfortable bed. The breakfast was below average compared to the other Embassy Suites that I've stayed in. Nice pool and spa.
Manager Response: We are sorry you had challenges with breakfast and felt that we were not able to provide you with the quality of services you deserve. This is not typical of our hotel and staff, as we are always looking for ways to improve our customer experience. Your satisfaction is very important to us and we strive to provide gracious, engaging and caring service and try hard to make sure all of our guests have a rewarding stay. Thank you again for your feedback and we hope you will consider staying with us again.

Summary Heading: Not up to standards you typically expect from Embassy Suites
Summary: I love Embassy Suites but this one did not meet my expectations. Breakfast was ridiculous - they were out of multiple things every single day including 2% milk, bacon, eggs, Coke, forks, etc. The bacon they did have was laying in a bowl of bacon grease. The Coke in the fountain had an "out of order" sign on it all week. The A/C system is set up weird where you don't have control of it so the room was very warm. There were people outside smoking weed at the side door where my small children had to enter (because the parking lot was full of people at the adjacent club). Check-out via the app didn't work. Minor things but annoying and not what I've come to expect from this brand and for this price.
Manager Response: We appreciate you staying with us and taking a moment to share some feedback. We apologize that there were multiple items missing from breakfast every single day. I will notify our food and beverage director regarding the missing items. Thank you for sharing your thoughts and bringing this to our attention. Our team strives to deliver friendly service at all times, and we sincerely apologize for any inconvenience you experienced.

Summary: The room smelled Moldy. There was mildew in the bathroom on the shower and tiles around. The picture in the bathroom had clear signs of mold. For a Hilton hotel it’s poorly kept. We spent almost 800.00 for 3 days. Paid Hilton price for 2star hotel.
Manager Response: I am so sorry you found an unpleasant smell in your guest room and felt that our room was not up to your standards of cleanliness. This is unsatisfactory, and I can assure you that is not the standard in our hotel. We work hard to make sure our housekeepers keep each and every guest room and bathroom clean; my apologies. I hope you consider staying with us again. We strive to provide gracious, engaging and caring service and we’d love to have you as our guest to ensure you have the best travel experience ever.

Summary: We usually love staying at Embassy Suites, but the housekeeping at this one was poor.  The room very average compared to other Embassy Suites that we have stayed at in the past. The breakfast however was amazing as usual.
Manager Response: I am so sorry you found the decor of your guest room worn down and unsatisfactory. I can assure you that is not the standard in our hotel. We work hard to make sure our housekeepers and engineers keep each and every guest room and bathroom clean and functional; my apologies. I hope you consider staying with us again. We strive to provide gracious, engaging and caring service and we’d love to have you as our guest to ensure you have the best travel experience ever.

Summary: I have one issue with this hotel. Unfortunately it is the only one close to the office I visit and within the company budget. You are at the mercy of the hotel when it comes to the temp in your room. There system won't allow some guest to run the heat and others to run the air. It's either all heat or all air conditioning and sometimes neither. They have a system for when they will turn one of the two on.  It really stinks.  They have comfortable beds and pillows but I never sleep well because of the room temp.

Summary Heading: Always a good stay for business trip
Summary: I stay here for proximity to my business office, but also a good hotel for Disney travelers. Lots of families and kids but not too noisey. Close to highway and businesses. Previous stays are why I come back.
Manager Response: We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your recent stay at the Embassy Suites Anaheim North while traveling on business. It sounds like you have had frequent successful trips since you mentioned that your company is within close proximity to our hotel, and this makes us so happy to hear. Thank you for your kind feedback and for your valued business! Looking forward to seeing you again on your next trip!

Summary: Good place to relax after a long trip... beds were comfy especially after walking all day at Disneyland. My husband and I love happy hour, fyi--order the Punch Rum if you like sweet alcohol drinks! Breakfast is good in the mornings, one of many reasons we enjoy this hotel. I think Disneyland is 15 mins away from this hotel when using the freeway.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking a moment to share your experience. Based on your comments, I am happy to hear you found the Embassy Suites Hotel Anaheim North to your liking, and I'm glad you found some the specialty drinks offered at our evening reception to be quite appealing. We strive to provide gracious, engaging and caring service and look forward to welcoming you back to our hotel in the not too distant future.

Summary Heading: Sewer and sweat smell in the room
Summary: I use this location quite a bit for the convenience but even after the remodel it’s falling apart. Big chunks of stuff missing under the sink- the room smelled like sewer and sweat. I got there too late and I wasn’t about to go down to exchange it. But I’m definitely hesitant to stay there again. I’m very disappointed- the check in was slow and one receptionist was on the phone and avoided making eye contact to acknowledge the fact I was waiting- luckily I had an electronic key. Bathroom needs revamping big time- luckily I’m short but anyone over 5’8” would have a problem with the shower head so low.

Summary Heading: An old property and it shows
Summary: Stayed here for business for three nights.  As I stated in the title the property is old about 25 to 30 years.  You can tell that this is a favorite location for visitors to Disneyland. The rooms are well worn and the carpeting needs to be replaced. The fixtures in the bathroom all leaked and the toilet ran all night long.  Not quite sure what the extra hole was above the bathtub. This was one of the first times I ever was charged for parking in a non-downtown area.  Although the fee is only $11 per night, I think it is very opportunistic of them, and takes advantage of the guests.

Summary Heading: Staff was excellent. The service and amenities we excellent. I would highly recommend this site to anyone!
Summary: The staff and team were excellent. I would highly recommend this location to anyone! The restaurant and front desk staff were excellent. The place was quiet and clean. Keep up the great work staff. Great group!

Took the shower 15 mins to get warm and no water pressure. Shower doors squealed when you opened and closed them. The whole hotel was humid including my room thankfully I had a small fan with me to help. I looked forward to the pool but the chemical smell was so bad we lasted 2 mins. The hotel atrium was beautiful if you can get past the green coloring in the water displays.

There were a lot of families staying here for Disney.  Close to both Disney and Knotts.  Best value for my family of 7.  Breakfast was excellent, especially the made to order omelet.  Kids loved going into the pool and the hot tub was just right after long days at Disney and Knotts.

This is an above average hotel.  I would stay here again. The room was clean. The staff was pleasant even though they were busy. Location was good for the meetings I had. Breakfast was okay. Being a vegan I am sensitive to food offerings. Their buffet had things I could eat.

Very friendly staff and beautiful hotel.  Will stay here with my family the next time I am in Anaheim and not on business.  It is about 15 minutes from the Disneyland Resort and an easy drive to the park.

Many family members came from Montana California New York and New Jersey to celebrate and nephews wedding. The front desk accommodated me in securing rooms for my son and his wife who arrived later! We were all able to connect in the breakfast room and enjoy a delicious breakfast!

Summary Heading: Average Embassy Suites, other locations were better
Summary: I pick this hotel for the location. It was a family vacation. I have stayed at a few other Embassy Suites, this location is ranked at the bottom. The breakfast buffet is very good and made up somewhat for the location quality

Summary Heading: Terrible Experience. Front Desk Manager Marissa was very rude.
Summary: Marissa, the Front Desk Manager was extremely rude ad unprofessional. She was not able to resolve any of my concerns. I decided to check out a day early and she refused to give me any credit. Bad Stay

We chose this hotel for two main reasons: 1) the pool and 2) the proximity to Disney.  We are a family of four and stayed in a suite.  There was a noticeable humidity and musty smell to the unit.  The room's patio was not useable (dead bugs all over) and the doors don't open enough to get outside.    The beds were clean and neatly made however there were not enough linens or towels.  The first evening was a terrible night's sleep as many guests were in and out of their rooms, slamming doors, running up and down the hallways until well after midnight.  The open concept of the hotel is like an amphitheater.  Our showers on both mornings were cold.    The pool was closed the second day of our stay, due to maintenance needs.  The third day the pool was open but there were large

Horrible breakfast and evening reception.  Not enough staff.  Quality of food was awful.  Don’t count on a “made to order breakfast”.  There was 1 omelette guy with hundreds of people eating at a time.  The line was 45 minutes!  Had to buss our own table and food didn’t get refilled!

Nice property EXCEPT if you're a light sleeper and is bothered by freeway noise be sure to request a room on the OTHER side of the hotel.   Their windows need sound proofing which caused me to have to sleep on the pull out sofa bed in the other room. I also had to complain to the front desk about screaming kids in the lobby area below at 10:30pm

This property is constantly good, they have been remodeled recently, so the environment is pleasing, the rooms have been updated as well.  The location is a little off the path, but still close to most attractions.  My recent trip was for business and I was quite pleased.

I stayed here last week for 6 nights, and was it was not a good experience. When we got there we noticed a night club sharing the parking lot, which was something I didn’t see in any reviews. Check in was good, but when we got up to our room (720) we noticed there was a car recycling facility behind the hotel. This facility seems to run 24/7 crushing cars very loudly. In addition our shower was dripping from the ceiling. We called the front desk and they sent someone up to fix it. It ended up coming back the next day. We did end up moving rooms, but the hotel itself left a sour taste in my mouth. I would not recommend staying here, but if you do, try to stay on one of the rooms on the left or right sides and not in the front and definitely not the back.

This was a very great stay. I appreciated the clean, spacious rooms, fresh towels and room maintence daily, and wide variety of tv channels. The front desk clerks were friendly. I do wish I would have been informed/offered WiFi, told about amenities and the open bar. I discovered the open bar on my own. I would like to mention the friendliness of the gentlemen working at the bar/restaurant. One man in particular (with a bald head I believe) was above and beyond awesome. He was friendly, had a sense of urgency, and was just very on top of things. I wish I would have gotten his name but to him a HUGE thank you.

Bartender barely spoke English. Didn’t know how to make basic drinks like an old fashioned or a mai tai...Refused to give lemon w/our water and then lied about not having any. Even though you could see them across the bar in the garnish container directly behind him.  He was rude and seemed irritated for having to serve my wife, my son and myself water, even though there was no one else at the bar to look after.  He Tried to swindle and scam money from us. He quoted an Cadillac margarita w/crappy Cuervo at 11$ (already overpriced). I asked about adding better tequila like 3 generations. He said 15$ (absurdly overpriced) I said, ok let me get that. He then said it’ll be 15$  Plus 3$ more for the upcharge of 3 generation instead of Cuervo... I said you just told me 15$ even, for

BJ and Diane are the best managers ever. They truly went above and beyond to help us in every way possible. I truly recommend this property to anyone staying in the Anaheim area. It’s more up to date than some others we’ve frequented in the past. There are 3 ways to get to Disneyland from the hotel. So no matter what traffic is like you always have an out. Awesome spot guys. Check em out.

Having stayed at Embassy Suites multiple times I have come to appreciate the amenities that the hotel offers. Between the managers reception in the evening and the breakfast in the morning you basically save yourself $20-$40 per person. For the most part this hotel met our standards. There were minor issues with paint chips in the bathroom and there was a slightly musty smell when we first entered but that it went away shortly after we started the A/C. One recommendation I would strongly make is to BRING YOUR OWN PILLOWS if you can. It is a recommendation I make for most hotels but these pillows especially were not very good quality and did not lead to a comfortable nights sleep.

We were on the 4th floor.  Only 3 out of the 4 elevators worked.  The staff use the elevators to transport their carts, so we had to wait awhile to use the elevators.  They should have inner stairs, because the wait was so long.  This is an inexpensive hotel for families, so there can be lots of noise in the inner court that permeates into your room.  The beds are mushy.  They need new faucets for the tub/shower and sink.  They need a new toilet too.  This is a very busy place, so our room was not serviced.  They apologized and I was okay with it, since we did not mess up our beds too much.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel and great buffet but Bring Ear Plugs!
Summary: Nice hotel and great buffet, very comfy bed, but make sure to bring earplugs if you want to get any sleep. The hotel is off a major freeway and trucks travel it at night and honk at each other. We also heard busses backing up in the parking lot at night. Kids ran around the hotel at night too quite late. Very loud for a light sleeper! There is a shuttle to Disneyland that runs every hour, so if you miss it, you have to catch an Uber if you don't want to wait. It's at least a 20 minute shuttle ride, longer in traffic.  Otherwise, nice place,  nice indoor pool, nice lobby!

There were several problems and apparently maintenance is not always there. They were called by multiple people in our party more than once. The main reason I would say not to stay, is the doors stick. One of our party was actually locked into the room. If there were a fire or other emergency people would probably die. Electricity went out in multiple suites bathrooms. There was an out of service elevator and the other at that end of the hotel was used by housekeeping. So you get an extremely long wait and to ride the elevator with dirty laundry. The lack of sleep and delays were not worth the beautiful lobby and the nice staff at the bar. Seriously, I am worried, due to the complete lack of maintenance workers doing anything to fix problems, that someone could end up dead.

We enjoyed our stay here. The room was spacious and pretty, the hotel was clean and impressive. Breakfast in the morning was really good with plenty of seating in a pretty courtyard. The beds were comfortable and the pillows were weirdly square but good to sleep on. The whole experience was great.

I LOVE Embassy Suites, this place doesn't even compare to some of the properties I've stayed with. The staff in the morning is poorly trained, they didn't give a damn that I fell on a puddle of water CLEARLY in front of the night front desk staff.....just over it!

I had a business meeting in Anaheim in a Saturday morning so instead of driving 50 miles from my home I stayed at this hotel.  Embassy suites are always wonderful and this one did not disappoint.  The only glitch was a technology breakdown upon arrival.  The system went down and could not process credit cards.  The cards were being denied.  It was the hotel system.  It took a bit but eventually I got checked in.  The room was right adjacent to the elevator. was nice and comfortable.  It seemed nice however when in the bathroom, I could hear the elevator going up and down OMG I am so glad that this wasn’t a bedroom.  Other than this, I thoroughly enjoyed this room and the buffet breakfast was awesome.  My omelette was just what I needed before my meeting.  I must come back.  It

Rooms have no individual heat control, very cold, and staff "may" bring you a working space heater that heats a one foot radius. Front desk staff is rude, at best, Great waffles but no syrup, "only honey"!!

Stayed here for 4 nights to go to Disney for 3 days.  Easy check in, waited a half hour for room to be ready, receptionist friendly.  Room clean and plenty of space for family of 5.  2 queen beds and a sofa sleeper, 2 TVs! Stayed here 6 years ago to go to Disney and everything has been modernized since.  Beds comfortable, never slept so good.  (Could be because we walked 9 miles at Disney).  I could hear the freeway from our room but not other guests in other rooms nor walking in the halls.  Freeway noise didn’t wake me.   Breakfast wonderful.  Made to order omelettes with veggies and/or meat, potatoes, muffins, pastries, oatmeal, bacon, sausage, waffles, juices, etc..   Returned from Disney, room cleaned and tidy.   Free Evening reception from 5:30 to 7:30.  Veggies and dip,

I’m a Hilton team member, and I stayed at this property while visiting Disneyland for the weekend. It was a beautiful location and felt very high-end. We spent most of our time at the parks, but this hotel was a great, comfortable place to rest our heads in between. The shuttle to Disney was very convenient— the earliest ride was 7am and the latest return time was 12:30am. Thank you to the staff for a wonderful stay!

Summary Heading: Don’t stay here unless you like LOUD.
Summary: Staff do nothing to control noise level. They let school kids and teens run everywhere and act obnoxious. And yes, expect school kids as I was told they book them frequently. The free evening reception and breakfast is for everyone so don’t expect yourself to get nice treatment. Go to doubletree for a more luxury service, feel, and quiet.   The pool will be packed. Everyone and their kids are in it. So don’t expect to use it frequently. :) We stayed here for 10 days. Not exactly what I had in mind for what I paid.

Summary Heading: This hotel feels old and outdated.
Summary: It felt dirty and made me not want to touch anything.  Everything seemed old and had a motel vibe. I stayed for business and my colleges agreed that this was not up to standards. The worst part, the room smelled like mold.

Overall our experience went without a hitch.  Our questions were answered, staff was friendly.  The shuttle service to and from Disneyland was as smooth as it can be.  The breakfast options were excellent and plenty of seating to enjoy your meal. Rooms were great plenty of space.

Summary Heading: Rooms desperately need renovation, management needs to improve communication
Summary: I booked our room months in advance, but noticed when it was time to check in (via the app) that we were now in an "accessible room". What this meant was the shower was handheld (i.e. you cannot stand under it, you need to actually hold the shower head in one hand while you attempt to wash yourself) and the sink is in the bedroom, which takes up a lot of space and is weirdly placed behind the door. But the real problem was with the room itself: there were marks/scuffs all over the furniture and cupboards, the carpet was worn, and the table in the front room was broken. We reported this to the manager on duty our first night and asked if we could switch rooms, but was told the hotel was completely booked by a school. He was very apologetic and said he'd do everything he could to
Manager Response: Thank you very much for the very in depth review. We very much appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with us, as we are always looking to improve our guest experience. I would like to personally apologize for the mishaps that occurred with your stay, In the room, and with our staff. I can promise you that it is not characteristic of our property at all and I'm sorry that we fell short of your expectations. I hope you consider returning in the future. Best wishes!

Summary: I enjoyed a wonderful stay at the Embassy Suites North in Anaheim, Ca. The room was clean, the evening happy hour was really nice. I enjoyed the hot tub. The breakfast was really nice as I am a vegetarian).

Summary Heading: Not worth the price. Not worthy of being associated with Hilton.
Summary: We are loyal to Hilton chains but this is the second consecutive experience with Embassy Suites that has fallen short of expectations. Let me count the ways.  In both cases there were housekeeping staff using the guest elevators alongside guests (including a cart filled with garbage). And in both cases one of the elevators was out of service while the hotel was nearly full causing frequent traffic jams at the elevators. And the stairs are not an option to the elevators as all stairs only go outdoors and are not available from the lobby or ground floor.  The so-called free drinks are of such low quality that they are pushing their "Raise The Bar" campaign to have you purchase better quality upgrade drinks (like wine I can get at Costco for $8 a bottle) or even well-drink quality

Room was showing signs of wear. Carpet was damaged by the bathroom door and the night stand was chipped.  During my  5 day stay they ran out of favored cream. The breakfast is great .. fresh made waffles and omelettes. Selection of fruit  also available. People were friendly and helpful. Indoor pool is also available. In the evening there’s snacks available at the bar. Employees were friendly and helpful

Very comfortable place. Complementary breakfast was excellent and the kitchen staff are very helpful and at helpful. Nice ambiance and the place promotes relaxation and rest after a stressful and tiring day! Very good accommodation!

very dark deprssing property, customer service was lousy, they did not even acknowledge Diamond members. Room was marginally clean, Bathroom was not very clean either. Overall between lack of service and the unclean clean room, I will not recommend this hotel to anone else nor ever stay there again.

After driving from Sacramento, and needing a place to stay, we checked in here ( be sure to ask for AAA rates)...room is dated....however, breakfast is OK...parking is "only" 10.00 ( other places were more )....  Safe and secure...I would not recommend staying more than 1 night
Manager Response: We are sorry you felt that our decor was outdated, and that our breakfast was marginal. Please know that our hotel and staff, are always looking for ways to improve our customer experience. Your satisfaction is very important to us as we strive to provide gracious, engaging and caring service and try hard to make sure all of our guests have a rewarding stay. Thank you again for your feedback and we hope you will consider staying with us again since at least you felt safe and secure. Perhaps next time, you'll catch us at our best and possibly change your opinion of us overall.

Summary: I was very unhappy with what I had to experience. Especially for the price I was being charged for. We enter into the 1st room and there was hair in our bed, dust everywhere, a patio door broken,  and the room did not have a fresh clean smell. The clerk offered  us a 2nd room. The bed had yellow stains in the sheet, carpet ripped up, and my husband sat on the couch dust popped up. Afterwards, talking to the Manger was even more disappointing. She was nice and polite, but her customer service knowledge need more training. As a Manager you never let your guest/customers leave unhappy, not satisfied, or irritated. We have stayed at  several of your hotels in the past and this one needs help and a lot of deep cleaning.

Overall was a great experience. Amenities were great, service great, room was almost great. There were some maintenance issues in our specific room. For example, our shower took way too long to drain, so much so I had to keep checking back once I was done to make sure it was draining at all, and the water took decently long to heat up. The air vent was dripping from the ceiling occasionally, making for some unexpected jump scares. I do also wish there was an option to use stairs to reach your floor as I really don't like elevators.   Don't let this take away from staying here, it is great. It just lacks the "wow" I usually experience from other embassy suites I have stayed at with family and as my first solo stay was a bit underwhelming but I more than likely have Rose colored
Manager Response: We are sorry you had challenges with your stay, and the condition of your suite. This is not typical of our hotel and staff, as we are always looking for ways to improve our customer experience. Your satisfaction is very important to us as we strive to provide gracious, engaging and caring service and try hard to make sure all of our guests have a rewarding stay. Thank you again for your feedback and we hope you will consider staying with us again. Perhaps then, you'll catch us at our best and you can carry that new image of us in your memory until you return.

Summary: The bartender was rude.  Front desk staff was very nice.  Wait staff except for one chef just seemed miserable to be there and not friendly at all.    The rooms need upgraded and workmanship needs to be inspected.    Location close to Disneyland was great and shuttle was a nice amenity even though you had to pay.  Would've been nice if they had shared that you need cash and exact amount.
Manager Response: We are sorry you had challenges with customer service regarding our food and beverage staff, and felt that the condition of your suite was marginal and overall left you feeling that we were not able to provide you with the quality of services you deserve. Our reputation is now tarnished with you, but please know, this is not typical of our hotel and staff, as we are always looking for ways to improve our customer experience. Your satisfaction is very important to us and we strive to provide gracious, engaging and caring service and try hard to make sure all of our guests have a rewarding stay. Thank you again for your feedback and we hope you will consider staying with us again. Perhaps then, you'll catch us at our best, and we'll possibly change your opinion of us overall.

Summary: I had a pretty good experience with my stay at this hotel. The breakfast provided was very yummy, my only real complaint was with the noise. At night someone on my floor had a screaming baby and I could hear. So if you are okay with the possibility of hearing your neighbors, everything is great. Otherwise you might want to stay elsewhere.

We stayed two nights while on our California road trip and very much enjoyed our stay.  The service was friendly, our room was clean, and breakfast was very yummy with an array of options.   Our only complaints would be that one of the elevators was broken (making the time to get to and from our room rather lengthy), our tub faucet leaked unless turned just so, and the bathroom door was so close to one of the beds that you could not open it fully.  We would definitely recommend this hotel to others and we would definitely stay again.

Embassy Suites was a great brand in the early 1990’s.  They invented the all suite sub-luxury property and did it very well.  The problem is it’s now 2019, the competition has upped its game and Hilton/Embassy Suites has stayed static.   This property is an excellent example. Marginal in room electrical outlets, dated bathroom, nice living area, but no different than it was 25 years ago.  The breakfast seems a bit less fancy than brand standard.  Typical crappy Hilton internet (they really do need to terminate their contract with AT&T or perhaps install a lot more base stations).   Otherwise, however, this is a fine hotel. Nice staff, clean rooms, quite predictable.  Hilton (and their individual franchisees) needs to up their game, however.  This property is due for an upgrade,

I just want to thank Embassy's wonderful staff. There was air conditioning problems, front desk sent up an electrician right away who had a fan to us within 15 minutes. I also left my wallet behind and Edith was able to help me locate it over the phone and arrange shipment back to me. Housekeeping turned it in and in this world we live in, it is nice to know they employ people that have integrity. I have stayed here several times and will continue to give them my business!

Summary Heading: Worst stay ever at an Embassy Suites
Summary: There were quite a few things that were wrong, the toilet was not functional, the bedding was unsatisfactory, the noise was terrible, the staff was not accomadating, by far my worst expierence at an Embassy Suites!

Leaky bath faucet and although a non-smoking room it smelled musty and faintly of cigarette smoke. I would stay there again but would be more selective of my room if staying for more than 1 night. The standard internet speed was decent. Approximately 1.5-1.7 Mbs down / up per speedtest.net

Summary Heading: Disappointed in this stay because of customer service and dirty carpet
Summary: We needed a hotel unexpectedly and I wasn't able to book online because we were in transit, so I called the toll free number to book this hotel.  I specifically asked the operator if parking was free and she told me it was.  So, we check in around an hour later and there are no problems with that.   The room itself is fine although it's rather small for an embassy suites hotel.   The breakfast was also fine. Note this is next to a large recycling plant so it can be smelly and loud.  Here are the problems I had with this stay:  Cleanliness - There was a spot in the living room where the carpet was wet.  I didn't want to inspect that further but I was wearing socks so my socks got wet. Also, the carpet next to the nightstand was very sticky.  So now my feet are sticky and wet.

The shuttle service to the Disney parks was great! The breakfast was good, and the lobby is very nice. The room was spacious and comfortable. We had a hard time adjusting the thermostat, house keeping services were not great and the room had a strange smell to it.

Summary Heading: Front Desk Incompetence & Plumbing Needs Help
Summary: Front Desk staff we interacted with lacked basic knowledge of how to use the ART bus pass system for the shuttle to Disneyland that is associated with this property. They were less than helpful with a few issues we had during our stay.  Plumbing issues in both our suites.  Slow drains and worn toilets. Shower diverter broke in one of our rooms the last morning-When front desk was called no one responded before we checked out.

One of the best stay`s ever, from the check-in time I was immediately greated. Everyone here was very helpful and pleasent. Despite the hotel been sold out with a group of students the breakfast was very organized with designating a special room for the group for breakfast and restaurant still having many seats available for leisure travelers good gesture. Everything was very organized didn't even seem a big group was in house. Great customer service will recommend for families business travelers . Plus disney shuttle stops at hotel and takes you downtown disney helps with the hassle of driving your car instead take the Disney shuttle. Thank you best stay ever.

A great hotel close to freeway access, but within a short distance of Disneyland. Service here is top notch, and the cleaning the staff do to take care of the hotel is amazing. Great quality breakfast with plenty of staff on hand to help. For the price, the size of the rooms can't beat. Nearby are grocery and dining options.

First time staying at this property. The location is convenient to the Anaheim attractions and the suites were perfect for relaxing in the comforts of “away from home”.  Breakfast is good and for free it has a nice selection. Had two minor issues with my room upon check in and both were promptly addressed.  My only complaint is about the parking. The main lot is very small and if you don’t valet it’s difficult to find a parking spot later in the evening. Had to park almost a block away two nights and if you have anything heavy to carry it’s inconvenient. Not enough to sway me from staying here again. I would stay here again.

I book this property for a work trip. It was close to my business meeting location. Easy to get to off highway and plenty bn of parking.  I was initally concerned with noise as my room was located by the elevator, but it was ok.  Only occasionally would I hear other guests in the atrium and hallway.  Staff was friendly and courteous. Made to order omelets with free hot breakfast was a winner.

To anyone looking to stay here please consider this as one of your main choices. Only problem I experienced was with the breakfast cook on my last day he was rude to both me and my wife. However I would not let that one interaction taint my overall experience  This is a fantastic place and the staff is great.

Summary Heading: Disappointed in quality of rooms and service
Summary: The room was not clean... mold/mildew in bathroom and dirty surfaces throughout. They do a great job with the lobby and specifically in the pictures posted online, but very disappointed in the quality of the room. With that being said, I did sleep well because the bed was comfortable and I wore ear plugs to keep out the loud noise of the freeway right outside our window. I also highly recommend checking our rate. At check-in I noticed they were charging me well over the rate I booked it at. At check-out I specifically asked for a printed receipt (they were just going to email it to me) to confirm they did fix my rate and they did not. I had to ask them to fix it again and was met with attitude and a lame excused about their system instead of an apology.

I travel for work a couple times a year.  Typically loyal to another chain but decided to try this one.  The room is spacious with a living room and bedroom. The bed was comfortable.  Nice atmosphere with the covered atrium.  Made to order omelets or upscale buffet breakfast.  Nightly social offering snacks (hummus, veggies, bread, popcorn) and drinks.  The a/c comments are accurate, there was a thermostat but it would not activate the system or turn on the fan to circulate air.  Overall it was nice.

Summary Heading: Everything was good but the rooms.
Summary: Breakfast was great. Hotel was clean (except rooms) Pool was decent. Food at bar was great. Rooms were outdated and poorly maintained. Carpets and couches had not been properly cleaned. Vents were covered in clumps of dust. Room was not cleaned daily. AC did not work adequately. Bath faucet was leaky. Staff seemed indifferent of concerns.
Manager Response: Adam: I am so glad that you were happy with the accommodations that our hotel had to offer. I am very sorry, however, that we fell sort of your expectations when it came to the cleanliness of the room. We will be taking the notes you have given here, and passing it on to our housekeeping director so that we may improve our guests' experience. Thank you again for sharing your experience with us, and I hope you will consider staying with is in the future.

Summary: Need to update rooms and fix a/c issues. Room was stuffy and the restroom was next to one of the beds door would get in the way when opened. Not enough plugs to charge phones or any other devices, TV channels were just terrible.

We were there with a group. For that purpose, the hotel, for the price, was fine. We wouldn't stay here again if it were just my family. 3 out of the 4 elevators were working. The first room we had had a terrible chemical smell like they were trying to cover something up. We had to request another room. They were accommodating and we were able to move to another room. The second room was much better. There were 2 adults and 2 kids in the room. It tended to get stuffy. We wanted to turn the air on, but we learned that since it wasn't hot enough outside, we weren't able to do so. It was terrible. We could request a fan, but it wasn't the same. They had a small balcony (really a step out), but with 2 kids I didn't feel it was safe to keep the door open. Once everyone had taken

Lets start by looking at the room .It was somewhat nice but the ceiling had all kinds of big pockets of rust from the rain water leaking into the room. And the A/C well i was told that more people would have to complain in order to get them to turn it over to the A/C. So keep in mid you have no control over the heat or A/C at all. bad if you like your room kept cool.
Manager Response: I would like to start off by thanking you for sharing your experience with us at our property. Although I should clarify that the setting of our HVAC system is not based on the amount of complaints that we get, it is actually based on the temperature outside. When it gets below 55 degrees we are required to turn the heat on for the guests. Any guests that prefer to stay cooler in these situations are given the option to stop the heat circulation in the room, as well as offered fans if that is not enough. We take your comments very seriously, and will be taking them into consideration as we work to improve our guest experience.

Summary: Extremely hot, we were not the only ones to complain about this. The temperature from the room to the lobby/atrium was at least 20 degrees different. We left the door open to get air into our room. I don't recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: I would like to begin by thanking you for taking the time to share your experience with our hotel. We are always looking to improve our guest experience, and I am sorry that we fell short of your expectations this time. With our particular property, if the temperature outside is below 50 degrees outside, our system has to be put onto its "heat setting". By law this is how our system had to be operated. Thank you again for your comments.

Summary: I was suppose to attend a convention today, and because of babysitting issues I was unable too. I bought my tickets and so did my boss ahead of time and were bummed we weren't able to make it. I called the operator, and Anna answered the phone. Let me tell you, I've worked and been in management in customer service for over 6 years now and she is EXACTLY who I would hire. She went above and beyond to see if I could still pick up my training things I would miss. Not only did she do that, she took my name and number down and called me once she got the answer, way faster than I thought. It's really hard to find genuine people in this world, especially in customer service. Anna thank you again. Seriously. Because of you, I got the last few things I need for my next training class,

Rooms were dated. Our room didn’t have a working tub. Also, none of the rooms have individual air conditioning or heat... the whole system is on the same sensor. So if you sleep too hot or too cold you won’t have control over the temperature.    Breakfast was decent and the evening reception wasn’t bad.  This did not feel like a Hilton property. It felt like a motel 6 with a nice reception a warm breakfast.

This place was amazing for our weekend trip to Disney. The kids loved the indoor pool, and we loved the evening reception with adult beverages and snacks.The buffet was great and the staff was wonderful. The parking can be tough Friday and Saturday because they share the parking lot with a nightclub. It's about a six mile drive to Disney, but if you want to avoid the parking fiasco at Disney, just take the ART Bus. It is right outside the doors and easy to access.

Wonderful stay!  Thrilled we had a room with heat.  Great breakfast and friendly staff. I would love to stay her again on another family vacation it really works for families with several children. It was very clean.

Cold spell in Southern California, and room had no heat (it was freezing). Sign in room says they can only turn on heat or a/c at one time in the whole building. Breakfast might have been ok if the buffet was fresh and stocked. Why do some hotels (like this one) believe that if you eat in the last half hour of the breakfast time you only get what is left. Offerings at the last minute should mirror those at the first minute of the breakfast period. $10 for parking is also aggravating. The guy at the desk said they do it because they can.
Manager Response: I appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with us, and I am very sorry that you had a bad experience this time around. We our always trying to improve our guests' experiences by providing gracious, engaging, and caring service. If you would like to speak to one of us directly about the problems that you encountered during your stay, you may reach us at 714-632-1221 (ask for Lorenzo, B.J., or Marissa) and we would love to make it right for you.

Summary Heading: Great value for a nice hotel!
Summary: This is my second time staying here with my fiance and we will come back again. It’s close to everything and has a shuttle to Disney that runs all day. Two room suites and a nice complimentary breakfast in the morning!

We were attendingn a funeral in a nearby locale, and this Embassy Suites was perfectly located off the freeway. While not much on views, the amenities more than make up the difference. You can't go wrong with an onsite omellete chef, and excellent choices for other breakfast tastes. Rooms are clean, spacious. There's also an indoor pool and Jacuzzi with a small work out area.

We stayed at this hotel because it was close to friends we were visiting. Did not realize it was close to a nightclub and appeared to share a parking lot with that night club. Both Friday and Saturday nights were loud with I assume people visiting the night club. As was mentioned in some other reviews you did not have control of heat or A/C as it was dependent on outside temperatures. Cold outside you could have heat, hot outside you could have A/C and if it was neutral outside you could have neither. We were visiting during a neutral time so in order to have fresh air of any sort had to open patio door a bit which since we were on the highway side it made for a lot of traffic noise. Both days we needed the room cleaned we needed ask it to be done as it wasn't done by 4pm. I

The staff worked hard to accommodate our large group. Everyone was friendly and helpful. One of our participants became ill on the trip and the staff made sure the room was sterilized and linens were changed. Everyone went above and beyond for our large group!

I wish I could give this hotel 10 stars! To start off with, they let me check in 3 hours early. The hotel rooms were surprisingly quite large! It had a separate living room with pull out couch, work desk, television, and mini kitchenette, as well as a full sized bedroom. We ended up sleeping in the living room more than we did in the bedroom!  Secondly, the breakfast buffet is a winner! (Not to mention, free!) And so kid friendly - Elsa came walking around, greeting all the children. She was so sweet, even watched my two girls for me as I stood in the buffet line. Also gave out some fruit snack treats!  Third, there was an INDOOR pool and jacuzzi. The entire lobby is indoor as well. Travelling in January when it’s freezing outside, this sure comes in handy.  Finally, the hotel

Summary Heading: Top notch! Will stay again and again!
Summary: I am not sure why there are so many negative reviews... We absolutely LOVED this property! From check-in to check-out, all the employees were doing whatever they could to make our stay as pleasant as possible. It was quiet, peaceful, clean, and a beautiful property! Our suite was amazing for our family of four, and we honestly never had an issue. There is also a happy hour type of thing where there are free drinks and snacks for your family from 5:30-7:30. Pretty neat!  The breakfast is FANTASTIC and the workers there were so kind and helpful.  The ART schedule from here is only once every hour, so know that before you book, but it picks you up right outside the lobby.  We have already decided that, with it being such a great value and property, it will be our go-to hotel for

We enjoyed staying here, the staff was professional and efficient and helped us with anything we needed. We left a blankie and the kind front desk staff mailed it back with a sweet note to my kiddo. It was a nice stay!

Summary Heading: Be Prepared for uncomfortable room tempature, bad smells and loud noises
Summary: If you do stay, expect to be woken by the Recycling plant that is on one side of building, not be able to use your AC/Heat depending on year if they determine the temperature is Neutral and if you are able to open your door, prepare for the bad smells and noises of either the night club inn the parking lot, or early AM commercial facility next door.

Summary Heading: Great hotel to stay at with Family
Summary: The hotel is clean and rooms are spacious when staying with family of four. The breakfast is good with cooked to order omelets and a waffle station.The only thing was the $10 per night parking at this specific location. It shares a parking lot with a club which can make finding parking a little difficult on the weekends.

This Embassy Suites shares a parking lot with a nightclub. A lot of it’s occupants are the loud clubbers who file in for after parties afterwards. I watched 11 people enter the room next to the one my son, mother and myself where sleeping in. With it being 2:30 in the morning I felt it appropriate to let security know. Nothing, not even a knock on their door was done. Not until the second time we complain did they come up at 3:00a. We are talking - music blasting, screaming the the hall “send help” because people are laying in the hall, shouting so loud that they cant hear security knocking on the door - loud. Security then identifies us as the people who made the noise complaint. After security leaves the guests proceed to slap our hotel room door and jiggle the handle. Right

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel!  Quick acess to Disneyland!
Summary: Close to Disneylad.  Excellent breakfast!  Rooms are older.  Excellent staff.  Disney caracters during breakfast.  20 mins from Santa Ana airport.  Close to lots of shopping centers.  Breakfast close at 9am during weekdays...

This property was one of my favourites before they renovated.  Heat/AC didn't work in room and it was basically an icebox.  Quiet and away from the crowds on Harbor, this used to be a preferred destination.  There used to be turtle habitat in interior that made this hotel unique.  Now, it's just like the others.  Restaurant is understaffed and you have to check with bar to see if it's even open.  Breakfast in morning is terrible with cook splattering butter on grill for every grill order.  Beverages awful too.  Needs to be completely overhauled.
Manager Response: I would like to personally thank you for providing us with your feedback on your recent stay. We strive to provide caring and gracious service to each and every guest that stays with us, and I'm very sorry that you had a bad experience this time around. We take your comments very seriously, and we will be taking them into consideration going forward. I hope that you will consider staying with us in the future.   - Lorenzo Fletcher   Front Office Supervisor    714-632-1221

Summary: The entire hotel was dirty the staff for mangers reception was covered in tattoos gang tattoos and she was rude and stared at me when I came to order a drink I ask for a luggage cart in and out of my stay no one came the sink shower was clogged

Summary Heading: Great place for a family vacation
Summary: We went to Disneyland and enjoyed coming back with a room clean and needed bedding.  We have always had good experiences with Embassy Suites.  This one was very close to Disneyland and provided transport to the location.

Lots of noise from highway outside and too hot in the room at night with no AC option. Most staff friendly was friendly and breakfast was great for on the go guests. Loved the omelettes! Traveled with large group apparently give you no perks as a Hilton honors customer at this hotel. Bottles of water would have made things much better.

Like every Embassy Suite, rooms are large and well appointed  Breakfast is included and it’s much better than most hotel breakfasts The evening reception with free snacks and beer/wine means that your money goes a Ling, long way here.

Summary Heading: Construction on house Embassy Suites here we come
Summary: Stayed here back in August  work being done on my house front desk was very helpful hotel is nice great indoor swimming pool the bar area is very nice rooms are also nice for an embassy suite Lobby just was remodeled the only con I can find is they charge you for parking which in my opinion did not make much sense especially especially due to the fact I'm a lifetime diamond with Hilton I do want to give mention that the front desk was awesome they were very nice to my nanny they were very nice to my children and made sure our stay was good I'd like to give a shout out to Edith also Diana do Tess they were very sweet helpful recognize me as a lifetime diamond and were therefore any problems also indoor pool was very clean and hot looking forward to another stay at this hotel in

The rooms are dated, there was trash in the room from prior guests (used tissues and beer bottle caps), the shower leaked everywhere, none of pre-checkin requests were filled (asked for 4 towels and they gave us 2 for a family of 4), and staff at free breakfast were rude. We will not stay here again for future trips to Disneyland.

Had, a wonderful stay and the staff were very professional, kind and considerate. Will recommend this location to anyone traveling to this area of the country. Breakfast was great and enjoyed my stay.

The wife and I were here Thanksgiving week in '16 and '17. This year's stay was sub-par. Thermostat didn't work. Overall comfort in a room is most important. Water leak in room and had to change rooms. Best breakfast around but doesn't make up for the rooms, which need a complete makeover.
Manager Response: We are terribly sorry to hear that there were so many challenges with your recent stay and that we did not meet your expectations.  We always strive to provide excellent service and a great clean hotel for our guests.  Considering that our guestrooms were recently completely remodeled we were surprised to hear this that you were unhappy with your guestroom. Also, unfortunately mitigating circumstances beyond our control do occur at times, however we try our best to rectify the issues immediately.  Regardless, I assure you that we will take all of your feedback seriously and will use this as a training opportunity for improvement in the future. Thank you again for your feedback, and we look forward to you staying with us in the near future.

Summary: Good value, lots of extras. Close to freeway and central to our multuliple locations.  Rooms were clean and spacious. Bed was very comfortable. We were there for a wedding so we didn’t get to enjoy all the extras.

Beds were comfortable, that's crucial. Linens and towels were crisp and clean. Rooms were very celan, when we asked for extra linens and towels we received them promptly. The only issue was the shower faucet was not working correctly and it was impossible to completely close off the water drip. The rooms and bathrooms are a bit outdated and could use some freshening up. Overall, we enjoyed our stay here for 3 nights. Location was very convenient right off the freeway, centrally located. Parking was adequate,  no safety concerns. Any staff we encountered were all friendly.

Stay at another location this one the rooms are worn out and have old carpet. Ceiling repairs from water leaks not repaired well. Although the breakfast was good the employees are overwhelmed and it shows in their attitude. This location is too far out of the way from core attractions so spend a little extra and stay at another Embassy and you will be happier!

Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights while visiting Disney. The lobby is extremely nice (I do believe it was recently renovated), and the rooms are nice as well. The view from our room wasn't anything to rave about though, it was of some sort of recycle center so all we saw were piles of trash.  This location is a very short drive to Disney, only about 10 minutes without any major traffic. We were able to have our luggage held before checking in, and even after checking out, so we didn't have to take it with us while at Disney or worry about our car being broken in with all our luggage in the back. It was a great stay.

Summary Heading: noise, loud noise, all night long!
Summary: do not take a room on back wall of hotel, very loud noise from recycle center they the whole night. I was very disappointed that having reserved the room  a month in advance, for the all night noise.  Very disappointed for no recompense of the situation.  Also had a puddle from a defrosted fridge upon arrival.

This hotel is awful. Rooms need to be overhauled, the corners are gross and the buffet is tasteless.  My #1 issue is that the toilet in my room was broken, I asked them to fix it while I was at dinner and they said they did but when I returned they didn't, so we changed rooms(again, dirty). When I checked out nobody asked how my stay was, when I explained, they shrugged their shoulders like they heard it before. This is my second Embassy stay this year where I had issues. I've lost confidence in this chain.

I arrived at hotel around 10pm and used digital key. When I went upstairs and looked out window there were giant cranes picking up blocks of material and dumping them into a hole next to it. 10pm?? Really? After noticing the loud and unpleasant view I was starting to pick up on a strong mildew smell. I went downstairs and the GSA Maggie was SUPER nice in switching my room. Second room had quiet area but still smelled of a wet sponge (mold smell) . I went downstairs again and I frankly didn't want to even stay here at this point. Maggie and MOD PJ were kind enough to switch my room again and cancel my 2nd night WITHOUT charge. They both were apologetic about the situations. I was later informed by PJ that both rooms that I checked into before my 3rd room had "cleaned carpets" I

I love this newer Embassy Suite location. It's really close to Anaheim Stadium and surrounding shopping centers. I have stayed at Anaheim South which is closer to Placentia (SR-91 freeway), but it's older and I like the new design at Anaheim North. If you plan your trip right, Anaheim North is also cheaper. So give it a try next time your in the area.

I was warmly greeted as a Diamond member when I checked in. The hotel is older and the furniture in the rooms looks worn out.  The bed was comfortable but the foam pillows were just ok. I had plenty of hot water in the morning with no water pressure fluctuations but it did take a bit to get warmed up.  The Embassy has a dorm size fridge which is awesome!  I stay at Embassy frequently and many have not transitioned to the dorm size and are still using the very small fridge that you can hardly fit in your diet cokes and ice tea bottles.  Housekeeping wasn't so hot. My biggest issue is the HVAC system. They have a sign up saying it is a two pipe system meaning both air and heat can't run at the same time. The biggest issue was the sign also said if the temp is between # and #

We were happy with our week stay! Two room suite met our needs. Restaurant served great wings! Only disappointment was no outdoor pool. A cheap hourly shuttle to Disneyland was a short 15 min ride away. I’d stay here vs the hustle and bustle we’ve experienced at hotels closer to Disney.

The hotel was not as close to Disneyland as was advertised.  Our room had horrible views of a disgusting recycling center, and a broken door from the front window.  We also had a a loud electrical unit right outside the room window

Rooms are outdated with rusted fixtures, had to hold the flusher on toilet every time. TV is the smallest cheapest thing I have ever seen including play pillows that must have been designed for a baby to sleep on.

This was one of the loudest hotels I have stayed at due to interstate traffic. The suites were spacious but very worn. The whole place felt a bit dingy, especially the bathrooms.
