The air was very hard to regulate as well (too hot).  However, the staff was great and the breakfast was amazing! Probably wouldn’t say there again unless it had been renovated.
Manager Response: We are terribly sorry to hear that you were disturbed by the freeway traffic during your recent stay and that we did not meet your expectations.  We always strive to provide excellent service and a great clean hotel for our guests.  Considering that our guestrooms were recently completely remodeled we were surprised to hear this that you were unhappy with the décor of the hotel and your guestroom.  Regardless, I assure you that we will take all of your feedback seriously and will use this as an opportunity to build upon  for improvement in the future. We hope that you will reconsider and stay with us again should your future travels bring you near. Thank you again for your feedback!

Summary Heading: Itchy Sheets / Moldy Smell / Air Quality Poor / Service Bad
Summary: You'll want to stay at a different Embassy Suites. I've stayed at more than 15 different ones and by far the worst. It's located next to a nightclub so the parking lot is packed. The sheets were itchy. The front room was freezing while the bed room was warm. No one answered the phone later on in the night. Requested a fan and after 2 hours had to cancel because it never showed up. Pull out couch bed is extremely uncomfortable. All in all, stay at the other Embassy Suites closer to Disneyland and pay the extra for the quality. This property needs attention.
Manager Response: We're sorry you had challenges regarding your room, the parking lot, and the surrounding businesses of our hotel, and unfortunately it affected your stay with us. Your opinion matters to use, and now our reputation has been tarnished. Please know that we attempt to rectify problems within our control immediately, as we continually strive daily to improve our standards amongst our employees, our property operations, and the overall functionality towards providing the utmost customer satisfaction across the board. Once again, thank you for your feedback, and we hope you'll consider staying with us again in the not too distant future.

Summary: Unbearably loud street noise from the Riverside Freeway.  Make sure your room is on the south side of the building.  Breakfast is good, with excellent service. Very crowded but the staff tried to stay on top of things to get tables cleared.
Manager Response: Were sorry you had challenges regarding noise from the freeway, and your stay was not as pleasant as it should have been. Unfortunately, mitigating circumstances do occur out of our control sometimes, however we do our best to try and rectify the circumstance immediately. We will take your comments into consideration as we continually strive to improve all of our guests experience while they stay with us. Thank you once again for your comments and we look forward to you staying with us again in the near future.

Summary: Though we booked last minute, the price was right, but little did we know about the night club right next door and the parking lot being re-done, causing an issue with locating a parking spot. After the hassle of trying to park two cars (my husbands and mine), later I received my bill that charged $12 for parking. Surprising!

Very clean & easy to get to. Beautiful  lobby and very spacious. Plenty of parking and rooms are nicely spaced out with 2 TVs and a regular sized bathroom. Service was great. We needed more towels at 1:30am and we got them in 6 minutes. That was the true test!!!

Summary Heading: DISGUSTING (poop show) in accommodations, service and appearance!
Summary: I will start with the very few things thst are positive.  The staff is nice and trying hard to deal with what seems like many complaints.  Where could you.possjbly move guests when everything is a poop show?  The pool is clean and the breakfast is more than continental but none of that matters whwn you are so grossed out that you are afraid to swim or eat!  We booked this hotel through Disney and I feel deceived!  I think whatever Disney executive approves this hotel should be forced to stay here with his family for a week and then immediately removed from his position!  The management at this hotel should also.    It is beyond gross and I was told that it was renovated 3 years ago.  A hotel doesn't get like this in 3 yrs.  Poor training, bad housekeeping, lackluster management,
Manager Response: We are terribly sorry to hear that there were so many challenges with your recent stay and that we did not meet your expectations and that your perception of our hotel has been tarnished. This is certainly not our goal and for this we do apologize. Rest assured that we have looked into each and every item that you mentioned and have made adjustments where applicable. We always strive to provide excellent service and a great clean hotel for our guests, and trust me, your opinion matters. Regardless, I assure you that we will take all of your feedback seriously and will use this as a training opportunity for improvement in the future. Hopefully then, perhaps you'll give us the opportunity to catch us at our best and we'll possibly exceed all of your expectations regarding cleanliness, décor, and overall hospitality.   Thank you once again for your feedback.

Summary: The room contained two queen-size beds plus a separate living area with a full size sofa sleeper. It easily accommodated a party of four comfortably. Added bonus was the free evening reception every day from 5:30 to 7:30 that includes free alcoholic beverages and snacks. We enjoyed the free full buffet breakfast every day. It was nice to enjoy eggs, omelets, waffles, and other hot food instead of a continental breakfast.

Staff was nice but the room was not clean upon arrival, the room smelled horrible, I had to buy cleaners and air fresheners for our stay but that still didn't do much to help. An I'm not a very picky person but it was very hard to try an put up with the smell. We tried our hardest as a family to stay out until dark so we didn't have to be there even though we would have liked to go and rest before we continued our other plans.

Excellent suite with plenty of room (AC fan somewhat loud).  Excellent complimentary breakfast with plenty of seating room.  Staff very cordial, efficient, and accommodating.  Not giving a better rating because of bed - WAY TOO SOFT, with no support.  Always try to stay at Embassy Suites, but would not return to this one because of bed.  Absolutely not the place for anyone with arthritis.
Manager Response: We are sorry we were unable to provide you with the quality of amenities and service you deserved during your recent stay. We apologize for the issues in your room and will work with our maintenance team to ensure this does not happen again. If you return to our area, we hope you will consider staying with us again.

Summary Heading: Amenities & Complimentary Items Made The Trip
Summary: Overall, my stay here was good. I stayed for a business meeting being held in one of their meeting halls. The experience during the meeting was good. The staff and the facility were good. During the hours after the meeting, my experience was good as well. The complimentary snacks and adult beverages made up for the fact that my room was on the freeway side of the hotel which you could hear the freeway very clearly. The restaurant in the hotel had great service and the food was good. I would stay here again if I had another meeting in this hotel.

Overall service excellent.  Very pleased with our stay. Check in staff very nice. Breakfast was great.  Room was clean and very comfortable.  We will visit your hotel again. Thanks for a great stay. Thanks

I have had many good experiences at Embassy Suites but this was not one of them.  The staff was welcoming but the hotel was not pristine.  It was impossible to cool our room down.  The ice machine located at the far extreme from where we were was out of order.  The hallway carpets were in poor condition.  The little market near the check in counter to buy juice, etc, was poorly stocked.
Manager Response: We are terribly sorry to hear that there were so many challenges regarding the AC, the ice machine, during your recent stay and that we did not meet your expectations.  We always strive to provide excellent service and a great clean hotel for our guests.  Considering that our guestrooms were recently completely remodeled we were surprised to hear that you were unhappy with our carpet selection..  Regardless, I assure you that we will take all of your feedback seriously and will use this as a training opportunity for improvement in the future. Thank you again for your feedback!

Summary: I checked into this hotel and was immediately disappointed with our room.    Our room was very outdated and warm.     I left for dinner and when I came back I was surprised how warm the room still was.   I adjusted the thermostat again and took a shower.   I found mosquitoes and spiders in the very small and outdated bathroom.    I got out of the shower and called downstairs about the room temperature.  We were informed that the ac is out.   I asked for a fan and they said they would bring it up.   45 minutes later I went downstairs and told them we wanted to leave and expected not to pay.  The receptionist was very understanding and gladly obliged.    Upon leaving, I also noticed cobwebs in the corner of the room.  I would not stay here again.
Manager Response: We are terribly sorry to hear that there were so many challenges with your recent stay and that we did not meet your expectations.  We always strive to provide excellent service and a great clean hotel for our guests.  Considering that our guestrooms were recently completely remodeled we were surprised to hear this that you were unhappy with your guestroom.  Regardless, I assure you that we will take all of your feedback seriously and will use this as a training opportunity for improvement in the future. Thank you again for your feedback!

Summary: The hotel is very nice.  The evening reception was good as was the breakfast.  My room was clean and comfortable except that it faced the main highway.  The traffic noise woke me up throughout the night.  My tub also did not drain well.  If I had been staying more than one night I would have checked on changing rooms.  I will choose the property again if I can be assured on having a room that was away from the highway.  If you can avoid these rooms you will have a nice stay served by friendly staff.  One other thing I was not aware of though is that they do charge $10/day for parking in an open/expansive lot.

The hotel itself is beautiful and has a large bar. The breakfast area is large and had a good selection. My room is on the sixth floor and was in need of a revamp. The air conditioning was so loud it drove me nuts. My patio overlooked a scrap heap where they were processing old cars into scrap. That was loud too. My room was also hot. It never got below 74° despite having it set at 65 the whole time.  I have definitely stayed at nicer Embassy suites. That said, the staff was incredibly friendly and amazing. If I returned I would stay on the lower floor, and ask not to be near the scrapheap.
Manager Response: We are sorry you had challenges with our AC, and you didn't get the service you deserve. Unfortunately, mitigating circumstances arise out of our control, however we try our best to rectify the circumstance to the best of our ability. Regardless, your satisfaction is important to us as we continually strive to improve our guests experience while staying with us. We will take your comments into consideration and make the immediate adjustments within our control. Once again, thank you for staying with us, and we hope to see you again in the near future.

Summary: As soon as I walked in to the hotel lobby it looked like the carpet was being ripped up... when in all reality it was just how the carpet looked, it appeared so trashy.   Their indoor pool was a joke and their evening reception consisted of popcorn and goldfish.

There is not much to look at around this property. From the parking lot you could see screen falling off the sliding doors. Evening reception was ok. They didn't restock and clean up the area. Breakfast was great and the areas were kept clean. The bathroom in our suite needed attention with a hook about ready to fall off.

Summary Heading: Great stay with small sport group!
Summary: We booked 6 rooms at Embassy Suites Anaheim North in July for a nearby basketball tournament. Lexa and Gladis from the sales department were wonderful with all of our changes and requests. The rooms were spacious, clean, and well functioning. Breakfast was ideal for the group.  The pool, laundry, gym, wi fi and parking were perfect. We can not fault this hotel and highly recommend it to all.

We were only here for one night as it was close to a wedding we attended. Upon check in (in a very hot lobby), we were given a room on the 6th floor. The room was spacious & lovely, but smelled musty & like cigarettes. We asked if we could have another room as the windows do not open. They gave us room 206. Again, a strong musty smell, but at this point we had to start getting ready for the wedding so turned on the air in hopes of it clearing.   Soon after, my son began wheezing. We left for the wedding, came back and turned up the air as the room was hot, again, more wheezing, trouble breathing. It was a miserable night of him having difficulty breathing- needing his inhaler constantly. My daughter also began to cough.   This hotel is really nice. It’s clean, comfortable and
Manager Response: We are terribly sorry to hear that there were so many challenges with your recent stay regarding your AC, and that we did not meet your expectations.  We always strive to provide excellent service and a great clean hotel for our guests.  Regardless, I assure you that we will take all of your feedback seriously and will use this as a training opportunity for improvement in the future. Thank you again for your feedback!

Summary: We stayed in a one bedroom suite on the 5th floor and were impressed with the size of the rooms - they were very spacious. Everything seemed relatively recently renovated with the exception of the bathroom - the bathtub looked a bit old and the faucet kept leaking. We heard from some other guests at happy hour that the hotel was having trouble with the AC, but our room was fine - plenty cool for us. Our room overlooked the freeway and there was some traffic noise which might bother you if you're looking for total peace and quiet (for us it was not a big deal at all). The breakfast was great - they have a huge dining area which felt very spacious, not crowded at all. Overall, it was comfortable, modern, clean and convenient for our trip. We'd definitely stay there again.

The A/C didn’t work I would have switched hotels prior too my stay had I read the reviews ! Also the 3rd floor was ridiculously noisy from the lobby to the pool all noise drifted upwards to our room. The breakfast was outstanding and the dining was great. However probably will skip this hotel next time.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, and we are truly sorry we didn't give you the quality service you deserve.. We greatly appreciate your feedback and we sincerely apologize for the disappointment and challenges you experienced with your AC. We will be sure to take your comments about our property under consideration as we re-evaluate guest needs and continually work to improve our guest experience. We hope you will consider staying with us again the next time your travels bring you to our area.

Summary: This was our second trip to this particular hotel and it was very good.  The rooms are nice size, clean and comfortable.  As before the staff was excellent and took very good care of us.  The breakfast and pool recieved our attention the most and were very nice.

Summary Heading: Not what we expected from a Hilton hotel
Summary: the room was a good size,  no restaurants close by, the floors do not seemed to be vacuumed regularly, staff was difficult,  AC is controlled so we had to request a fan,  there is no access to balcony, food and wait staff were great
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We greatly appreciate your feedback and are happy to hear that you feel your stay was a good. We apologize however that you had some service inconsistencies during your stay. We are always striving to improve our service offerings so we thank you for making us aware. We do hope you will consider staying with us again the next time your travels bring you to our area. All the best!

Summary: The hotel needs a facelift, the rooms are worn and I agree with the prior review, the carpet in the hallway looks like ripped up old carpet, but it really is just the weird coloring of the carpet.  The bathroom is really small and worn.  The temperature in the room said 64 degrees but was more like 80 degrees.  The atrium gets really hot in the afternoon... so hot I couldn’t stand to even sit there.  Kinda ruins the free happy hour when you are sweating like a pig.  The restaurant food is pretty good, but you have to sit in the sauna like atrium to enjoy your food.  We got a group rate for this hotel but I would not stay here again and choose a nicer place with working ac.
Manager Response: We are terribly sorry to hear that there were so many challenges with your AC during your recent stay and that we did not meet your expectations.  We always strive to provide excellent service and a great clean hotel for our guests.  Considering that our guestrooms were recently completely remodeled we were surprised to hear this that you were unhappy with your guestroom.  Regardless, I assure you that we will take all of your feedback seriously and will use this as a training opportunity for growth and  improvement in the future. Thank you again for your feedback!

Summary: I came to the Embassy Anaheim North for two days for business. The property is starting to show it is a little dated and tired, but overall, this is a good hotel for the area.   As a business hotel, it is OK, but the hotel seemed to definitely cater more to the vacationing families of the local parks and attractions. It is close to the freeway, but there are not many dining options within walking distance, and the club in the adjacent parking lot is a little suspect. However, the area felt safe and secure, easy to access, and had plenty of space in the rooms I expect from Embassy Suites.   The drawback is the upkeep. At first, I thought the hotel was under renovation when I got off the elevator. When I looked down, it looked like the carpet had been partially torn up. Nope! It

HOIt was the worst experience we had. NEVER BOOK THIS HOTEL   AND MAKE SURE THEY DO NOT PUT YOU IN THE ROOM FACING THE BACK OF THE HOTEL AS THERE IS A RECYCLING FACTORY ADJOINING THE HOTEL When I checked in with my family, the reception desk Mr. Fernado, put me in a room which was right above the kitchen whereas I have changed the room online to floor 6 when I told him about the room change, he told me no rooms are available and I should come talk to the reception in the morning. But, while bringing my stuff from my car, I decided to stop and talk to another receptionist who gladly offered to move us to our originally booked room on Floor 6. This caused me lots of inconvenience as we were 5 in the family planning to stay almost a week with our stuff. The ordeal did not end
Manager Response: We are terribly sorry to hear that there were so many challenges with our HVAC system during your recent stay, and that we did not meet your expectations.  We always strive to provide excellent service and a great clean functional hotel for our guests, and now your perception of our hotel has been tarnished. Unfortunately, sometimes mitigating circumstances arise out of our control, and please know, that we do our best to rectify and resolve those unforeseen obstacles. Regardless, I assure you that we will take all of your feedback seriously and will use this as an additional opportunity for improvement in the future. Thank you for your review. We greatly appreciate your feedback and once again, we sincerely apologize for the disappointment with your stay. We hope you will consider staying with us again the next time your travels bring you to our area.

Summary: Embassy is liked by my family, both my 11 year old grandson and 22 year old son like this chain best  of all three we stayed at during trip to LA. I would like to see the breakfast be served later for those kids that get up a little later. We stayed at a Marriott in Sacramento  yesterday and they served breakfast until 11 a.m. and that made sense since not everybody is up and dressed by 9.

Room had sewer-like smell from the bathroom. Housekeeping did not clean our room 3 out of 5 days of our stay. We notified front desk each time but they told us to be out of our room by 10am if we want it to be cleaned!
Manager Response: We are terribly sorry to hear that there were so many challenges with your recent stay regarding housekeeping service and that we did not meet your expectations, nor did we give you the service that you deserve.  We always strive to provide excellent service and a great clean hotel for our guests. Your challenges should have been rectified sooner, and because they weren't, this led you to being unhappy with your guestroom and our staff.  Regardless, I assure you that we will take all of your feedback seriously and will use this as a training opportunity for improvement in the future.  Thank you again for your feedback!

Summary: Our room smells of dampness and mold it was explained to us that the carpet and couch I had just been cleaned so it wasn’t quite dry yet. The room was so dirty that was so much mold in the shower so much dirt buildup everywhere I have over 40 pictures just disgusting and we were told by the manager BJ smash that basic We could leave he did t care

Summary Heading: wish it had been better-expect more from an embassy
Summary: We stayed at the Embassy Suites Anaheim North for 2 days to go to Disneyland. We are Hilton fans usually. Unfortunately,  this stay was a disappointment. The website says recently renovated but I question how recently. The carpet was worn and the bathroom tub/shower dirty and faucet leaked no matter how tightly we closed it. Upon arrival we had to call the front desk 3 times -and we never call the front desk. The first time was bc the floor was so dirty and littered with small pieces of trash we didnt believe it had been cleaned so we asked for a vacuum - which has never happened before. Then we found the noise of a group of women so loud it overtook even the noise of a fan and tv after 10pm. We had to call twice to get someone to do something about it. It was not a good start

Horrible guest experience from front desk staff!  Room ac units barely or don’t work. Excuse was given that units work, but don’t get cold, because everyone else has their ac on. My family was then made feel they were wrong, because we wanted another room. Was eventually able to move, but was told it was a courtesy from the night supervisor. Being a Diamond status member, my expectations were definitely not met!  Never again!
Manager Response: We are terribly sorry to hear that there were so many challenges regarding your AC with your recent stay, and that we did not meet your expectations.  We always strive to provide excellent service and a great clean hotel for our guests. Regardless, I assure you that we will take all of your feedback seriously and will use this as a training opportunity for improvement in the future.  Thank you again for your feedback!

Summary: Pleasant staff, great two room suite, complimentary breakfast was great, shuttle to my training on time and pleasant shuttle driver (Diana), open bar with munchies from 1630-1930. Called for extra blankets, which were delivered quickly even when less staff was available.

Summary Heading: Standard Embassy Suites, rooms a little musky
Summary: This was pretty standard as Embassy Suites go. The room was refurbished but still had a musky odor to it. The staff were very helpful and kind. The bar closes a bit early though. There is a strip club that shares the same parking lot which was a little weird but they kept the two areas separated on the weekends.

Room was unbearably hot. Thermostat did not work and TVs either. Called multiple times but no one ever came to room to help! Never come to this hotel! Hotel appeared to be an outdated, old poor quality hotel!
Manager Response: We are terribly sorry to hear that there were so many challenges with your recent stay and that we did not meet your expectations.  We always strive to provide excellent service and a great clean and functional hotel for our guests.  Unfortunately, our AC System went down over the past few days due to the Heat Wave, and we are actively working to resolve the issue. Considering that our guestrooms were recently completely remodeled we were surprised to hear this that you were unhappy with your guestroom.  Regardless, I assure you that we will take all of your feedback seriously and will use this as a training opportunity for improvement in the future.  Thank you again for your feedback!

Summary Heading: Hotel is tired, badly in need of renovation
Summary: Hotel is tired and in need of major renovations. Bathroom was not as clean as I would expect from a Hilton property; there were hairs left by a previous guest that were not cleaned. AC could not keep up with the heat outside, although it was a record heat wave. Rooms are noisy. Hall carpets are old and worn.TV in front of suite would not copnnect to cable. Free breakfast was OK but lacks healthy choices (only 3 types of cereal, no bananas or berries,). Location of hotel less than ideal and is next to a busy nightclub.
Manager Response: We are sorry to hear that we did not meet your expectations and that your perception of our hotel has been tarnished. This is certainly not our goal and for this we do apologize. Rest assured that we have looked into each and every item that you mentioned and have made adjustments where applicable. We take your feedback seriously and will use this as a training opportunity for improvement.

Summary: I have expressed concerns with BJ after I checked out when he called in regards to my review. I would like to add although my experience was NOT the best at this hotel, BJ (Director) at the hotel reached out to me and he was superb.  He apologize for my stay and tried to make is right. I will stay at this hotel again purely based off his due diligence, he's awesome in his leadership role.  He really made difference in returning to this hotel again. :)
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to recognize the efforts of one of our team members "BJ" and also for providing the Hotel with your feedback. We are unhappy to hear that you did not enjoy your stay, and for that we are truly sorry. We strive to provide all of our guests with top notch service and we work hard to insure that happens. We appreciate you as a valued member, and we truly feel that "feedback is a gift" that allows us opportunities to best take care of our guests so we will certainly consider your suggestions. Thank you for your valued business!

Summary: Great front desk staff! Everyone was very helpful, especially the manager! Manager did a great job listening to the reservation issue I had and immediately rectified to ensure I was a happy customer! The only disappointment I had was that housekeeping did not meet Embassy Suites standards. I had to ask for toilet paper, toiletries were not replenished and one day our bed was not remade even though I could see housekeeping had been there. Every other aspect was wonderful so I would give them another chance if I stay in that area.

Summary Heading: Comfortable hotel but out of the way
Summary: We stayed here for two nights.  The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful.  Our room was very comfortable and the sofa bed was brand new.  The breakfast was well done with a large variety of hot food.  We choose this hotel because we got a good deal.  They do have Disney transportation of some kind, but this hotel isn't near much at all.

Very nice place to stay, but you have to pay for parking on top of an already expensive room. Parking lot is not very secure and have signs stating they are not responsible for your vehicle. Why am I paying for parking then?

The views are not the greatest.  The freeway is on one side and a scrap yard is on the other.  We were only there for the night.  The breakfast is good.  Lots of options.  The atrium setting is very nice. Room is spacious but the walls were a little marked up and the bathroom floor still had some hair in the corners.  I forgot my Clorox wipies!  Not deal breakers.  I would stay here again.  The staff was very nice.

Summary Heading: Place is run down, smells bad and way over priced
Summary: Staff is not friendly, rooms smell bad and are run down, they charge $10 a day to park in the hotel parking lot. horrible value for the run down place that it is. I would definitely not recommend this place
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear that we did not meet your expectations and that your perception of our hotel has been tarnished. This is certainly not our goal as we are always in the process of developing new improved ways to better service our guests. Considering our guestrooms were just recently completely remodeled we were surprised to hear this feedback. I assure you that we will take all of your feedback seriously and will use this as a training opportunity for improvement in the future. We hope that you will change your mind and consider staying with us again so we can show you what our Hotel and Team are truly made of. Thank you for your feedback!

Summary: We stayed at this embassy for a total of 5 nights. We got in late the first night. Discovered there was no Kleenex in the room. We left the Kleenex holder out on the counter the next morning as we were leaving so housekeeping could see that it was empty. I purchased some Kleenex at the front desk on our way out.  When we returned to the room, the Kleenex holder was back where it belonged - still empty. We contacted Housekeeping. On the 3rd day, we had no wash cloths in the bathroom. Also on the 3rd day, we asked for passes for the two of us for the shuttle to Disney. This was at 8:45 in the morning. We were told there were no passes available all day. That was disappointing. We asked if we could get passes, then, for the next day. He said we could, but we had to come to the
Manager Response: We are terribly sorry to hear that there were so many challenges with your recent stay and that we did not meet your expectations.  We always strive to provide excellent service and a great clean hotel for our guests. I assure you that we will take all of your feedback seriously and will use this as a training opportunity for improvement in the future. Thank you again for your feedback!

Summary: We stayed here one night this week and we got a room on the freeway side.  Unless you are used to sleeping on the shoulder of a freeway, you will think it is noisy.  I would suggest getting a room on the other side of the hotel where I would imagine it has to be better.  The room, breakfast, hotel grounds were fine.  Too bad for the location.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We greatly appreciate your feedback and we sincerely apologize for the disappointment with your stay regarding the freeway noise. We will be sure to take your comments about our property under consideration as we re-evaluate guest needs and continually work to improve our guest experience. Perhaps, should you stay with us again and any challenges arise, please contact our hotel staff immediately and we will do our best to "Make It Right" which is our brand motto. We hope you will consider staying with us again the next time your travels bring you to our area.

Summary: This is a great location, relatively safe, and minutes from Disneyland.  The front desk upon arrival was superb.  Since we arrived late she directed us to the bar/restaurant that offered late night dining which was very convenient.  The rest of the time the staff was so-so.  Very nice but not as helpful.  We had to beg for extra towels and wait for a blanket for the sofa bed that took hours.  (We had 4 people in our suite and only 3 towels).  It was very expensive but it was because of the proximity to Disney.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We greatly appreciate your feedback and we sincerely apologize for the disappointment with your stay. We will be sure to take your comments about our property under consideration as we re-evaluate guest needs and continually work to improve our guest experience. We hope you will consider staying with us again the next time your travels bring you to our area.

Summary: The renovation is complete and the hotel is open with no construction. I enjoyed the evening reception and the breakfast the next day.  I use the gym which is adjacent to the pool area. I had no problems working out and using the equipment.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. I’m glad to hear you received excellent service during your recent stay! We are also happy to hear that you were comfortable in our newly renovated suites. More importantly - we truly appreciate you utilizing our fitness area and enjoying our hotel overall. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: My family of 5 just checked out of the hotel. Our stay there was great! We reserved a corner suite which was the perfect fit for us. We did have to get a rollaway because the sofa bed was beyond uncomfortable. However Azavier did remove the rollaway charge from my bill which was greatly appreciated. The restaurant was great just some easy clean eating. They put on a great breakfast which comes with your stay. Cook to order omelettes is my favorite! They also had a pool with jacuzzi and fitness center.  The suite had a neutral color scheme with a comfortable atmosphere. It was pleasant to come back to after long days at the amusement parks. It also came with a fridge, coffee maker and microwave.
Manager Response: Thank you  for your kind response!  I'm glad one of our sister properties was able to accommodate your needs. The reason I say this is because we do not have rollaway beds at our property. I hope the next time your travels bring you into the area, perhaps you'll stay with us here at the Embassy Suites Anaheim North. We look forward to seeing you in the not too distant future.

Summary: The rooms really need a deep cleaning.  The room felt stuffy/humid so the sheets and carpet felt moist.  You cannot control the thermostat between 50 and 70 degrees outside.  You can request a fan.  Bedding quality felt cheap but it was probably exaggerated by the moist feeling.   Given the price of the room, seems like you're not getting much for room quality.  If you like quiet do not get a highway facing room although the staff was able to quickly change my room upon request.  Complimentary breakfast and front desk staff were great.
Manager Response: We are terribly sorry to hear that there were so many challenges with your recent stay and that we did not meet your expectations.  We always strive to provide excellent service and a great clean hotel for our guests.  Considering that our guestrooms were recently completely remodeled we were surprised to hear this that you were unhappy with your guestroom.  Regardless, I assure you that we will take all of your feedback seriously and will use this as a training opportunity for improvement in the future. Thank you again for your feedback!

Summary: Mold/mildew smell in room. Mildew in bathroom. Dirty tub & faucets. Dripping faucet. Out of order elevator. Water leak In atrium. Parking lot   shared with a nightclub so no parking after 10 pm.  Basic WiFi rarely works.   Breakfast/cocktail good
Manager Response: We are terribly sorry to hear that there were so many challenges with your recent stay and that we did not meet your expectations. We are also saddened that your perception of our hotel has been tarnished. This is certainly not our goal and for this we do apologize. Rest assured that we have looked into each and every item that you mentioned and have made adjustments where applicable. We take your feedback seriously and will use this as a training opportunity for improvement as we re-evaluate guest needs and continually work to improve our guest experience.  We hope you will consider staying with us again the next time your travels bring you to our area.

Summary Heading: Hello Big Brother and view off the 7th Floor to the bridge made for cool shots!
Summary: Given the location (safety concerns) there are cameras on all floors so if incognito is your thing, this is NOT the place to hang out. Nice features are the cooked to order breakfast and electronic key check in (which worked well). Views of the Santa Ana River Trail brought back cherished memories of Engineering friends.    Thanks for the invite (met a family with a relative at Kaiser Hospital in Anaheim) and meeting everyone from Mom, to Sister and Brother was nice.  Drinks (alcoholic and otherwise) are provided during the nightly cocktail reception on the main floor (north). Anaheim PD patrols here so safety was insured.    Notice the rod iron custom work on the railings, clean windows and delightful pool---south side---and outdoor patio. There is a special children's area at
Manager Response: Thank you so much for commenting and sharing some of your thoughts regarding your recent stay with us, at the Embassy Suites Anaheim North. Please know that your feedback, is of the utmost importance to us, as it helps us to fine tune our ability to provide better overall service.  We hope in the near future, that you return to our hotel, and give us the opportunity to serve you once again, and hopefully we'll exceed all your expectations to the point where we rate a "10" on your scale of satisfaction.

Summary Heading: Can’t beat a suite and full breakfast
Summary: If you have a family this is a must stay place.  The separate bedroom is great to separate from the kids for awhile and the breakfast is better than most restaraunts.  I don’t know why you would go anywhere else.
Manager Response: Our Hotel Team could not be happier to hear that you and your family had such a great experience while staying at the Embassy Suites Anaheim North. Thank you for your delightful feedback! We look forward to seeing you and your family again in the not too distant future.

Summary: We chose this hotel because of the size of the room and it is at the mid-point where we were visiting. The room was large. However, it was not clean. The floor was dirty with dust, the bathroom had dust on corners, and the sliding door to the balcony was very dusty. We told the hotel manager who gave no apology. If we overlook the dust, the beds were comfy and roomy. Breakfast was average and crowded. They do not refill the snacks at the evening reception, which is not normal. Felt like being nickel and dimed. They charge $10 for parking. The pool was was the color green. Didn't use it. The hotel tax at this location was particularly higher than other parts of the LA, a hefty 15% or more.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We greatly appreciate your feedback and we sincerely apologize for the disappointment with your stay. We will be sure to take your comments about our property under consideration as we re-evaluate guest needs and continually work to improve our guest experience. We hope you will consider staying with us again the next time your travels bring you to our area.

Summary: Overall the place looks like it’s in dire need of remodeling  furniture in the suite appear to be very old, they did appear to be some mold in the bathroom, hallways carpets look like there should’ve been replaced years ago
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide the Hotel with your feedback. We are saddened to hear that your recent stay did not meet your expectations. We truly feel that "feedback is a gift" that allows us opportunities to best take care of our guests. We will sincerely consider all of your feedback. Thank you for your valued business!

Summary: Great location close to Disneyland. Hotel is close to restaurants and shopping areas. Rooms where clean.Good breakfast and manager hour. Enjoyed the shuttle to Disneyland. The front desk was very helpful with purchasing Disney tickets.
Manager Response: Our Hotel Team could not be happier to hear that you and your family had such a great experience while staying at the Embassy Suites Anaheim North. Thank you for your delightful feedback! We look forward to seeing you and your family again in the not too distant future.

Summary: it was very terrible in every way. the front desk workers were very rude. our room had hair in the sink. the bed wasn't made properly. the overall quality was just awfully for the price we paid. and there was a lot of noise..
Manager Response: We are so sorry to hear that we did not meet your expectations and that your perception of our hotel has been tarnished. This is certainly not our goal and for this we do apologize. We hope to have the opportunity to serve you again so we can show you a positive experience similar to what so many other guests are sharing while staying with us.

Summary: Best hotel ever!! Comfy clean beds. Big room. Great free breakfast every morning. You name it, they had it. Staff was friendly, and incredibly helpful when we needed them to be. Indoor Pool was warm and much needed relief after all the walking we had done. All my kids came to help me celebrate my 50th birthday and I’m so glad we all stayed here.
Manager Response: Our Hotel Team could not be happier to hear that you and your family had such a great experience while staying at the Embassy Suites Anaheim North. Thank you for your delightful feedback! We look forward to seeing you and your family again in the not too distant future.

Summary: The hotel and our suite By far was the cleanest hotel we have stayed in near the Anaheim area! Our Suite was imaculently clean.  The hotel is always nice and clean no matter the time of day.  Breakfast was also great.  We  will be back!

We spent our spring break at this hotel and were very happy. It was clean and the staff was friendly. We enjoyed the bar area and the proximity to anything we needed. We were able to access tickets to the area attractions right in the lobby. The only thing the kids were disappointed in as there was not an outdoor pool so we beached it most days.

Great stay!  Bed was very comfortable. Room was quiet. Food was delicious. Pillows were plentiful and comfortable. Staff was very friendly. The facilities were well maintained and pleasing to the eye. I will stay here again.

I arrived on Friday May 11, 2018. We were early, and the room I pre-picked was not ready, but they were able to set me up in a “comparable” room.   When I arrived at the room, I didn’t even go in because it was directly across from the elevator. There’s only one thing on my profile preference, and that’s request for rooms away from elevator.   I got another room, it was two doors down. Okay?   Our next room assignment was Room 421. It was a little grubby. There was a kiddie sticker on the bathroom switch plate, and  it didn’t look or feel clean. But I was tried and I needed food and a rest, so I went down to the restaurant.   After a bite, I returned to my room for a nap. Thank goodness I slept on top of the bed! After an hour, my traveling companion woke me up to get ready for

Houskeeping is severely lacking. Arrived to a dirty room, requested extra attention during cleaning next-day, only beds were made- trash bins full, no new towels. contacted front desk again to have them service for next day, this time they never showed. So the entire stay, overspilling trash bins and towels were never refreshed. Contacted manager Chris on several occasions and left messages with staff- he has yet to contact me back.
Manager Response: Dear Adije N,  We are very sorry we were not able to provide you with the quality of services you deserved during your recent stay with us. Please know that this is not typical of our hotel and staff, and we are sorry we didn’t meet your expectations throughout your visit. We are always looking for ways to improve our guest experience as your satisfaction is very important to us. Thank you again for your feedback. We hope you will consider staying with us again soon so we may have the opportunity to make it right.

Summary Heading: We wouldn't go back to this location
Summary: While being located in sunny California, the swimming pool is  inside the hotel instead of outside where the sun is!!!  Also, there is a $10.00 parking fee even though you're paying to stay at the hotel and there isn't valet service.  Why?
Manager Response: Dear Kimberleeinoc,  We appreciate your feedback. Although our heated pool is inside the hotel, our guests still have access to the sun deck located outside of the pool area. As far as the amenities included with your stay, registered guests of the hotel can enjoy free made-to-order breakfast, complimentary drinks during the Managers Reception and two-room suites. Unfortunately parking is not included.  We hope this does not discourage you from returning for a future visit. Should your travels bring you back to Orange County, please do not hesitate to contact me directly so I may assist with your booking.  Best Regards,  Chris Jimerson Guest Service Manager Embassy Suites Anaheim North Chris.Jimerson@Hilton.com  714-618-9010

Summary: After a long day flying from Texas into LAX (red-eye), and a long, fun day running around Disney, it was nice to have a restful place to stay with a good breakfast the next morning.  This ES is older but clean and quiet.

I wanted to surprise my wife for her birthday and I wanted to take her to Disneyland. Embassy suites has always been a great place for us to relax so I chose this one for it's proximity to Disneyland. The complimentary breakfast and cocktail hour we're great.

This hotel is located on the side of 91 Freeway and it is very noisy.  But be aware that the other side of this hotel is a scrap yard which the trucks start their day at 4:30 am!  Very noisy ....At least you know now!
Manager Response: Dear Ron R,  I was very sorry to hear about your recent experience. Please note we have mostly relaxing weekdays for our business guests and I really do apologize for any noise disturbance that took away from your visit. If you have any questions please contact me at the hotel any time and we do greatly appreciate your Hilton Honors loyalty.  Best Regards,  Chris Jimerson Guest Service Manager Embassy Suites Anaheim North Chris.Jimerson@Hilton.com  714-618-9010

Summary: Our 4 night stay at embassy suites was wonderful. All of the staff were great especially the breakfast staff. Chris Jimerson was the most helpful throughout our entire stay as well as after we left. We discovered we had left behind some items and if it wasn't for all his time and help, I don't think we would have been able to get our items back.

We stayed here for my daughter's cheer competition. Parking was great even though it seemed to be full upon arrival but the staff put us right near an elevator and parking was near the door....Great! Although I did not remember when making reservation that I would have to pay for parking but only $10 with unlimited re-entry during your stay. The private bedroom was great and the complementary breakfast was superb!!

Summary Heading: We were happy, but I'll look around for other options next time.
Summary: Average Embassy Suites with a top notch breakfast service.  The in room HVAC controls are a joke which seem to be controlled by CA politics.  If you want to make the room comfortable for your liking, you better hope your comfort level is in line with what the CA government approves of.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing feedback on your recent experience at our hotel. We apologize again for our missteps in guestroom appointment and appreciate you bringing this opportunity to our attention and allowing us to make it right so you may enjoy your stay. We value your input and hope you will return to stay with us again soon.

Summary: Stayed here one night to attend a wedding nearby. Hilton Honors price made this stay an excellent choice.  Room was vey clean and quiet, although the freeway noise was above normal. It was very convienent to both the 55 and 91 freeways.  The best part was the breakfast, plenty of food choices and lots of good coffee.  Would hav e given a score of 5 if it weren’t for the freeway noise. Would stay here again.

So good i was very happy with breakfast  the service was amazing everyone was helpful and friendly the pool was clean and nice the hotel was very clean and it was great to have complimentary drinks and snacks

We stayed in Embassy Suites in the past and this hotel matched our expectations. Hotel is clean, excellent breakfast/in-suite dining and great service. Front desk staff was patient and accommodated special request for our party with multiple families. Lounge area is relaxing. Breakfast has good spread and food in general was higher quality.  Only downside is that digital key is not provided, even though I am hilton honors member, since our reservation is made from a third party website. I wish Hilton changes this policy to make it more convenient for customers and save on room card printing :)

Love Embassy best customer service rooms are the best we had a ocean view. Made to order breakfast every one friendly. We were on the 20th floor I would of like to be on a lower floor that was the only down fall of the hotel and we were next to elevator. I always try to stay at Embassy because my husband looks forward to their breakfast.

This is an awesome hotel!  Clean rooms,  cimfy beds and really yummy free breakfast and evening reception.  My children LOVED this hotel and the indoor pool.    Would definitely stay again and again!!  Highly recommend!!!

Damaged room, staff inattentiveness,  food quality up and down, unexpected charges.  This was the hotel stay from your nightmares.  Why have checking requests such as extra towels and non-down pillows (allergic) when staff doesn't act on them? Why cant we have scrambled eggs that one day aren't liquid and the next day hard as a rock (both days mind you we ate right when breakfast opened).  Why cant we have a room without broken cabinet doors falling on our toes and broken toilet seats? And most important, why cant staff resolve the issues in a timely manner (had to request again for pillows and towels 3 more times).
Manager Response: Dear boltfan74,  We are very sorry we were not able to provide you with the quality of services you deserved during your recent stay with us. Please know that this is not typical of our hotel and staff, and we are sorry we didn’t meet your expectations throughout your visit. We are always looking for ways to improve our guest experience as your satisfaction is very important to us. Thank you again for your feedback. We hope you will consider staying with us again soon so we may have the opportunity to make it right.

Summary: Will up date, but the the cleanliness of this place need some consistency. I also believe that the staff needs to stop playing the blame game and take more responsibility. Linens and towels should not be waited for more than 20 minutes when you have full staff. We waited well over 2 hours, I personally retrieved them myself. The room 228 smelled of mold and mildew especially in the sleeping area of the suite.
Manager Response: Dear Belai M,  We appreciate your comments and certainly understand your frustrations. Please know that hospitality and prompt service is the culture of our team and we regret that we did not demonstrate that during your recent stay. Your comments have been shared with our department heads to bring back for training opportunities. Thank you.  Best Regards,  Chris Jimerson Guest Service Manager Embassy Suites Anaheim North Chris.Jimerson@Hilton.com  714-618-9010

Summary: We recently stayed here again for the first time since they remodeled the Atrarium which is now much nicer. The last time we stayed here they were not charging $10 for parking. Charging for parking does seem to be happening at more Embassys. I could understand the charge if parking was at a premium but the lot was empty. We learned our lesson about staying there on Saturday nights on our last stay having witnessed 4 police cars at the very loud night club next door.  This stay we did get a room over looking the junk yard but we were not staying here for the view. The reception is no better than many other Embassy's but not as good as some. There are others in the area which offer a much better selection of snacks if that is a consideration.  The breakfast  is nicer now because
Manager Response: Dear Mark951,  Thank you for taking the time to share your comments and we are sorry that you experienced these problems during your stay. Guest satisfaction is our #1 priority and please know your feedback has since been shared with our staff as a training tool. We hope to regain your trust for a future visit.  Best Regards,  Chris Jimerson Guest Service Manager Embassy Suites Anaheim North Chris.Jimerson@Hilton.com  714-618-9010

Summary: This hotel had a layout that is peculiar. Though it is very pretty and the little fountains in the middle makes the place feel fancy: I loved the buffet breakfast, especially how you can request what you want in the omelettes, that food options were really good, and lots of drink options. It's a 12min drive from Disneyland also which was helpful for us.

First thing first the staff is very rude and not helpful at all. My step-son accidentally dropped his phone down the elevator shaft and I found maintenance worker and was like what are our options. He looked at me and told me I would have to talk  to the front desk and did not speak English very well. He got mad that I was asking questions. So I went to the front desk and told them what happened and the manager told me give her a few minutes and she would find out. She sat there and joked around with her fellow co-workers and 40 minutes later I was then approached and told I would have to pay $750 to have it retrieved. I then asked if that was the only option as I would not pay it because that was ridiculous.She then walked away from me and I heard nothing else. I then went to

Summary Heading: Clean, family friendly, Great location & breakfast
Summary: We have stayed here twice as a family. The kids always enjoy the pool & the jacuzzi. We love the breakfast with omelets made to order! Waffles are hot, many choices for breakfast then off to the parks :)

The staff is great and welcoming! Our Complimentary cocktails were a plus. Breakfast was delicious and there were a variety of foods to choose from that were still fresh at 8:30 AM. The room had a musty smell and that was my only complaint.

We stayed at this embassy suite location late February. Please be aware this is a far different guest experience than the Embassy suites Anaheim South. This location could be so much better staff wise. While checking in other staff member was talking over us about cashing out even though staff member has begun to serve us. Managers hour food (ex veg tray)  was mostly gone one hour before event was to end. Compare this to the south location where they make sure there is ample food, staff great you entering and exiting the facility etc. The positive is very nicely decorated public and room areas (make sure to ask for room on quiet side to abode freeway nojse).

This was a good location as a base for college visits.   Having the suite also gave me and my teen extra room and allowed her to sleep in while I worked.  The happy hour was a nice treat after a long day of tours.

Summary Heading: Terribly noisy room and no respect for a Diamond member
Summary: I have been staying at this hotel for many years as it is close to my company. I always request a room away from the scrapyard on the back and the freeway. This time they gave me a very noisy room just next to the freeway and completely ignored my repeated request to change room. They gave me a surreal reason that 'all the other guest on the quiet side were Diamond' that I am pretty sure it is a lie. When I filled their online survey I received the response below: 'We appreciate your brand loyalty. Delivering the best customer experience is our #1 priority and we apologize for falling short regarding your room assignment. We hope you will continue your travels with our hotel and your comments will be thoroughly reviewed for service training so this doesn't happen again. Thank
Manager Response: Dear Acireale,  Thank you for the feedback. As mentioned before, we are sorry for the challenges you experienced regarding noise during your recent stay. Please know that our hotel runs a high occupancy of Diamond Hilton Honors members, and our team does their best to accommodate preferences and special requests associated with Diamond member profiles.   We wish you well on your future travels and thank you for your continued loyalty to Hilton.  Best Regards,  Chris Jimerson Guest Service Manager 714-618-9010

Summary: It’s been a few years since I have stayed @ this Embassy Suite by Hilton.  Warm full breakfast in the morning & Happy Hour in the evening is GREAT!!  I did not give an Excellent because the Hotel is in the midst of refurbishing- carpet pretty bad.  Diane @ the Front Desk gave this Honors Member the quiet side-away from the freeway.

Current Diamond Member and HGV Club member. Cashed a few hundred thousand  hard earned Honors points to stay here with my wife kids while visiting Disneyland. I haven’t ever witnessed the level of after hours noise in a Hilton Property before in all my years of patronage. Kids running in the halls, screaming and yelling pushing every floor button in the elevator. I wouldn’t ever consider recommending this hotel until management reeled in this nuisance.   On a positive note, Carlos (maintenance) was very friendly. He said hello to us every day after He was unable to fix my broken safe or get me another room with a working safe (as they were oversold) and I have yet to receive the “customer satisfaction” points he claimed he would talk to ‘Chris’ about.
Manager Response: Dear Charclar,  I was so sorry to hear about your recent experience which does not represent our guest service promise. Your stay has been reviewed by our department managers to ensure we are delivering excellent hospitality. On the bright side, we are pleased to hear about the friendly encounters you had with Carlos. Thank you for taking the time to share and please contact my office directly if I can offer any re-assurance for future stays at the hotel.   Best Regards,  Chris Jimerson 714-632-1221 Guest Service Manager

Summary: As a Hilton Honor member, we were treated terribly.  We are not used to that at all.   Proximity of hotel is good and breakfast is very good but that is about all that I would say is positive.  The shuttle service is nice to have available and was a surprise for Disneyland goers.
Manager Response: Dear C N,  You're experience is definitely not our level of service. We will review your comments at our February team meeting to emphasis what we expect form all associates and to deliver only great guest service experience. Thank you for sharing.  Best Regards,  Chris Jimerson Guest Service Manager Embassy Suites Anaheim North Chris.Jimerson@Hilton.com  714-618-9010

Summary Heading: Traffic Noise Insane, Bad Breakfast Handling
Summary: If you go, be sure to NOT get a room facing the freeway. It's as if the window is open the whole night, and the traffic never dies down. Beware that at breakfast, they turn everything off right at 10. If you run out of juice or coffee at 10:01, you have to finish the rest of your meal dry, and staff will just tell you "tough luck."  Set an alarm on your watch, and fill up a bunch of their little cups before then.

The Embassy Suites in Anaheim North is a very nice place to stay.  The staff is very professional and helpful.  The continental breakfast is EXCELLENT.  This Embassy does show its age.  The beds are very comfortable!

Summary Heading: Jewelry stolen from bathroom, no contact after multiple attempts to resolve
Summary: Jewelry stolen from bathroom, no contact from the hotel cleaning staff or front desk after multiple attempts to resolve. I called and left a message with the cleaning staff as directed by the hotel operator, and was told that I would receive a call in 24 hours or less. I called back three times over the course of the next four days, and was told that there was nothing they could do. I've been Gold or Platinum for business travel for years, and this is terrible service.
Manager Response: Dear D6565XXseanh,  At our hotel, we strive to provide a high standard of customer service, and we apologize for any inconveniences you had with receiving a call back from our housekeeping department in a timely manner. The Director of Housekeeping confirmed that he reached out to the call back number and left a voicemail. For immediate resolution, please contact the hotel directly and ask to speak with the Director of Housekeeping, thank you.  Chris Jimerson Guest Service Manager Embassy Suites Anaheim North Chris.Jimerson@Hilton.com  714-618-9010

Summary: Nice hotel. Clean suite. Good hotel rate when you factor in breakfast buffet including made to order omelet station and evening reception. Staff was friendly and helpful. Only regret... Couldn't find a happy medium with the room temperature .

The renovation here is really nice, and the rooms are big .  There are five people in our family and we felt comfortable hanging out in the room.  The breakfast bar was convenient and we love that the pool is inside for cold days or nights.  Friendly staff and good room service.  We will definitely make this our annual hotel to stay at .

This place is great! Nice, clean rooms, free parking, happy hour, free delicious breakfast, nice indoor pool, weight room, and super nice staff. We especially loved the two ladies that clean up at breakfast. So sweet and eager to help.

Summary Heading: Noisy and hole behind bathroom mirror
Summary: Nightclub across the parking lot is super noisy during the weekend. Made it hard to sleep with the bass thumping until 2AM. Also parking was hard to find because of nightclub patrons. They charge $10 for parking and it was hard to find a space Saturday night. We also had a hole behind out our bathroom mirror due to poor remodeling practices. We could hear our next door neighbors as if they were in the bathroom with us.

Summary Heading: Great hotel if you can handle sour water smell in suites.
Summary: I love Embassy and would normally always give 5 stars. This time we entered our suite to a foul sour smell; which I surmised was caused by moistness. We requested a different room and encountered the same smell but a little less prevalent. The slider was locked and were not able to open it but a few inches which was entirely inadequate to air out the room as the curtains covered that area. I kept all the wet towels in the front of the suite and kept to fan running as much as possible in the bathroom. Everything was great about the hotel; just that musty stinky sour smell. One more thing, the highway side of the hotel is quite noisy at night.

This is a nice embassy suites with a nice breakfast. A nice business,pool and fitness center. They have friendly staff and a hudge parking lot . Hotel is located close to Disney. They have nice spacious suites.

Summary Heading: An enjoyable stay at a good hotel
Summary: The hotel offers a pool with a hot tub, free hot breakfast, a bar and restaurant. The full hot breakfast was excellent - eggs made to order, home fries, breakfast meats, pastries, cereals, both hot & cold, fruit, granola and yogurt. The restaurant was good - we had a Cobb salad and a burger and both were very good. A daily manager's cocktail hour with a free drinks offering a signature cocktail, wine & beer. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The daily shuttle ($5.50/person) to Disneyland was convenient and useful.  The hotel could use some work; some areas in our room needed some upkeep, especially in the bathroom. The choice of rug in the common areas on the floors with the guest rooms was interesting - it looked just like the floor was being renovated, even though it's

I decided to spend a little more money then I normally do to make our family experience just a little nicer. Yes the rooms were a little bigger and the beds were comfortable, but the breakfast was not great quality, and there were other fees not disclosed when I booked the reservation. And I am a Hilton Loyalty member so not my best experience.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay! Very airy and bright.
Summary: Rooms are a good size. Very comfortable and very clean. Nice indoor pool with jacuzzi hot tub. Complimentary breakfast. Superb omelette. Close to Disneyland. Which was great after a long day of fun with the family. Shopping and restaurants are not far too.

Love the hotel.  Will definitely stay again. Breakfast and evening reception were wonderful.  Staff was on it at all times.  Great job all around.  Keep up the good work.  If you want a clean hotel close to Disneyland this is the one.

This was an excellent hotel with a unique layout that made it really memorable and special for my family!  The pool and hot tub were great, and the Disneyland shuttle service was really handy for us. Would stay again, and would reccommend.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel but pick your room
Summary: This hotel was chosen because we wanted to stay where a group was booked through a travel agent.  We booked our own room.  At check in, I asked if there were any complimentary upgrades and was told no, all the rooms are the same.  While this is true, we were in room 606 which is in a corner looking out onto the hallway as are 4 rooms per floor.  Almost all the other rooms look out over the atrium and have a much better view.  Ours of course may have been quieter because no one would be walking there. Enjoyed the breakfast, especially the made to order omelets. The front desk staff was very pleasant and helpful. The bar staff was also pleasant and we enjoyed the 2 hours nightly of free drinks and munchies.  The pizza we ordered there was hohum.  I did notice Domino's being

Good-Open bar for a couple of hours at night. Great breakfast. Nice people.  Bad-you can't adjust the thermometer and the room was hot. I've never seen anything like that and it happens in all rooms, it wasn't like ours was broken.  They have a sign that explains it and to call for a fan if you are hot, which I did after a couple of sleepless nights.I won't stay at an Embassy Suite again if it's like this in all their hotels.

Summary Heading: Are they even trying?  Two stars at best.
Summary: Stayed for four nights on a recent business trip. The hotel was chosen for me, but I have had good experience with the Embassy Suites brand in the past and expected the Embassy Suites Anaheim North to be at the same level.   It was not.  Let's count the failures:  - Front desk staff was mostly useless. I asked them a few basic questions, like where the nearest drugstore or big box department store was (I needed toothpaste).  They acted as if I asked them how to get to Mars.   - Room was in poor condition. One of the sink faucets was sitting on the counter next to the sink when I checked in. There was a hole about the size of a golf ball completely through the front door, letting in light, sound and smells from the rest of the hotel. This was made worse because the hotel is of

Nice place nice staff, i love the breakfast but only stayed one day so i didnt get to take advantage of everyhingthey had to offer, i would definitely stay there again, the room was nice and the food was good

The hotel was very good and spacious. The breakfast was ok. I wish there was more pastries options. Also, I wish they provided chocolate milk and hot cocoa for the kids. Overall, it was a good experience.

Bad customer service. Attitude and no respect. Bad housekeeping service...good luck, even after requesting numerous time, housekeeping will not come clean your room. Bad Maintenance service. If your heater is broken in your room, no one will come and fix it at all, even after 4 request...so family will get sick and it will ruin your vacation.

Summary Heading: Bad service can't overcome terrible facilities
Summary: After great experiences in other Embassy Suites hotels, I was looking forward to our stay. It was a sign of things to come that upon checking in, I was told that the room I had reserved (two queens) was replaced with a single king.  Needless to say, my son was disappointed that he now had to sleep on the pull-out couch.  Sure, they comped my $10/day parking fee (what is up with that, anyway?) but it set things off on the wrong foot.  The room was hot and stuffy. But the thermostat is basically non-functional -- take a look at the attached picture, this sign is actually posted in the room.  With this setup, when it's 50 degrees outside but 80 in the room, lowering the thermostat has absolutely no effect. Wonderful.  So I opened the sliding door, disobeying the sign posted on it,

Front desk staff are not friendly at all. They need to be retrained for customer service! If they continue to display their behavior, they might as well work as prison guards....and not in a nice hotel!

I have stayed in plenty of Embassy Suites and this one by far is the most disappointing! It was so dirty I couldn’t even think of giving my kids a bath after a day of Disneyland. My husband killed s cockroach in our bathroom! Speaking of Disneyland it’s very far from the hotel compared to others.

This Embassy Suites was a bit different from the others.  Overall the appearance of the hotel was nice. However our room was not.  The bathroom tile looked awful and needed a deep clean. The toilet was installed crooked and was slanted.  The long mirror on the wall in the sleeping room, was also installed crooked and was literally falling out of it's frame.  All the cosmetic stuff was not eye pleasing but not a big deal.  The fact that the hotel took away the guests ability to control the temperature in their room was frustrating. The hotel locked our thermostat at 72 and wouldn't unlock it.  They proceeded to give us a box fan to regulate the temperature in our room and also suggested we cracked our loced slider to let in air.  I'm not opposed to fresh air.  However the whole

This hotel is very well organized and the lobby is new.  The staff are very well trained and they are ready to help.  The hotel has very warm indoor swimming pool and nice Spa.  Gym is great. I used all these facilities.  The hot breakfast is unbeatable.  Hot breakfast can be cooked as you need. Plenty of room to sit during breakfast. Happy hours is very good.  I went with my family and we all enjoyed our stay at this hotel.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, stayed for Disneyland trip
Summary: The hotel has wonderful suites, excellent cook to order breakfast, wonderful INDOOR pool and hot tub that we used every night to refresh after spending all day on our feet, walking all over Disneyland.  Shuttle for a small fee, only drawback is that it only comes once an hour, and there is a time period from 11-3, that it does not run.  We like to break up the day with a few hours at Disneyland, break, then come back for evening festivities.  Can't do that here unless you drive over to Disneyland and pay for parking there.

We brought our friend and her 93-year-old mother to see the World of Color show at CA Adnentures. She couldn’t make it that long so we booked a room to share. We had a great experience, they were so happy with the hotel! We have stayed there several times and knew it would be great, and it was!

Summary Heading: Loud, hotel needs updating, poor air quality
Summary: Stayed one night and was put in a room facing the expressway.  Was beyond loud, so loud I couldn't hear the TV, which was not functioning properly.  The tub was dirty and the faucet dripped the entire time. Room furnishings are old and mismatched.  There were notices posted regarding the HVAC system indicating it could very hot or very cold and there was nothing that could be done. When I checked out I mentioned the noise and the front desk clerk shrugged and said I should have been told about that when I checked in and given ear plugs.  Nothing else was done to make up for a sleepless night.

Summary Heading: Stay at the other Anaheim Embassy instead!
Summary: Has a nightclub in the parking lot clogging up things on the weekends. We found dirty plates several times at breakfast, and it was generally sub par to other Embassy's we have stayed at. If you're going to Disney its a 30 minute shuttle trip each way.

Stayed for two nights. I’m gold with Hilton and I was given a room facing the highway: it literally feels you’re sleeping in the highway: no soundproof whatsoever. The air con inside sounds like a air jet engine. Sleeping in the room was a challenge.  Starting at 6 the smell of eggs enters in the  room. Breakfast is really basic.

Found the chef could not cook over easy eggs, had to tell him on the third time to remove it from the grill.  Overnight parking fee is not acceptable.  Room was clean and bed was comfortable.  Coffee in room not good and the coffee at breakfast is a instant type used and taste like it.

This dump is advertised as recently remodeled.  The room ceilings are crumbling, the bathroom doors are splitting due to excessive moisture, and the the shower/tub was so dirty I had to buy my cleaning supplies.  There is a night club at the end of the parking lot that is so loud, you will not sleep on Friday or Saturday nights.  Avoid this place at all costs!

Checking in, front desk staff was great, no issues there at all. Checked my husband and I in, and issued two keys.. You'll see where this circles back around.   Went to our room, it was really warm. Turned the air all the way down, and after hours of running at full blast it was still warm. Went to our friends room, they were having the same issue. We went into the hallway to try to get some fresh air and was enjoying a beer, wont lie there, and security immediately came over and said we couldn't do that in the hallway, we were respectful and went back into said hot rooms.  Upon checking in the guy told us about the Manager's reception, so we wait in a long line, about 30 mins. And the ONE bartender (at a hotel hosting 2 huge Christmas parties that night it appeared) told us
Manager Response: Dear Meghan f,  Thank you very much for your recent visit and vital feedback given. We are extremely disappointed and sorry you experienced an unpleasant encounter with one of our bartenders. Since your visit we have addressed the issue and assure you this will not happen in the future.  We hope to have another opportunity to host your next holiday party. Please let me know if you have any questions or would like to book a future stay.  Best Regards,  Chris Jimerson Guest Service Manager 714-632-1221

Summary: I usually stay at the Embassy Suites in Brea, but it was sold out so I ended up at this location.  The hotel is fine - clean, good service, etc.  The only negatives are the fact that there isn’t much close to the hotel, and the night club next door that takes up most of the parking lot and a lot of the rooms in the hotel.  The stay was fine, but I’d stick with Brea or the Marriott Fullerton if needing to be in this area.
Manager Response: Dear Grant W,  We appreciate you taking the time to share your review. While we are happy that you were pleased with the cleanliness and customer service, we are sorry to hear that you were dissatisfied with the location of our hotel. We hope you reconsider staying with us again. Our front desk staff would be more than happy to provide you with any local eateries, entertainment or convenience stores that you may be looking for.  Best Regards,  Chris Jimerson Guest Service Manager Embassy Suites Anaheim North Chris.Jimerson@Hilton.com  714-618-9010

Summary: We  decided to do Disneyland this year instead of doing gifts.  We've stayed at the Embassy Suites South and loved it! We decided to try Embassy Suites North this time,  we loved it as Well! Staff were very nice,  always with a smile and greeting us. Breakfast was delicious and a good variety and it being free, it's definitely a plus!! They did a beautiful job on their renovation in the lobby/common areas with water fountains. Beds are super comfortable,  I didn't want to get out of bed every morning.  I highly recommend you to stay here when planning to visit Disneyland.

The hotel in itself was very clean, room was nice as well.  The cooked to order omelette/egg breakfast with all of the other options was excellent, and we rarely encountered a line.  Though we only were able to take advantage of the happy hour (which is actually 2 hours) twice while we were there, the drinks were plenty and the service excellent there as well.  The appetizers aren't really appetizers, more like goldfish crackers and a bar mix, plus some pita bread with hummus.  However, we did eat at the bar/restaurant 3 times and everything that we had was great which included pizza, burgers/fries and the cobb salad.  Our room was at the back of the hotel which was good, as we did hear a few people that shared the nightclub across the parking lot prevented them from getting a

I would give a 5 stars for the hotel cleanliness and great staff but be aware of the night club next door. You may ended up hearing them next to your room having loud party. Sleepless night! Not worth it!

I enjoy Embassy Suits, usually neat and clean.  Howeve, this trip my bathroom was not swept or mopped the 4 days I was staying there.  I did enjoy the morning breakfast, good selection and service.  Also I enjoyed the lobby area when I was doing some work.  Very nice.

We like Embassy especially when on family vacay. This time it was only the two of us. We had a nice large suite. The hotel caters to families w/children mainly as it's close to Disney. It is a typical Embassy w/its ready to make breakfast items, and evening cocktail reception. You can also purchase food like pizza while at the free guest reception. The breakfast area is large and spread out and it never got congested-I guess schools are in session, but holidays are coming so that might change.

Definitely the place to stay for visit to Disneyland. Very warm and inviting with beautiful lobby. Rooms with comfy beds and very nice linens including the towels. Nice complimentary items for personal use. The reception is nice and the bar tender is so accommodating! So quiet, yet with a great pool and spa. Made  to order omelettes with all the fixings. Shuttle at front door every hour for ride to Disneyland!

Summary Heading: The Hotel is Beautiful and their staff is very welcoming.
