Summary: I was very impressed with how open and inviting the hotel was when I first entered the lobby. The front desk agent who checked me in was very welcoming and looked like a GQ model. Another staff member that stood out was Rafa from the bar he made us laugh and had drinks ready for us. I'm not sure if the security guard David was part of the hotel but he was great as well. Overall a great night stay and very welcoming staff I cant wait to stay here again.

Summary Heading: Old hotel, noisy, terrible customer service
Summary: We had a bad experience with this hotel.  We arrived to this hotel late on Nov 18th after a long drive, we tried to get some rest but couldn’t because there were a group of party people were laughing, talking, dancing with so loud music that we could hear it from inside the room.  We tried to contact the front desks few times to let them know the situation, but they ignored us, the music continued loudly on and on .... My family had to suffer all night long and couldn’t sleep at all. The hotel is very old, the sofa bed was terrible, the room insulation were not good, that’s why we could hear everything from outside, the bed sheets were dirty, the TV were very old and blurry! I have stayed in many Embassy Suites before and this is the worst, I won’t come back!
Manager Response: Dear Andrea N,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience about your recent stay at our hotel. I am sorry to hear about the difficulties you faced in regards to noise. This is not typical of our hotel and our staff does try to do their best job of controlling any noise coming from in-house events.   If your travels bring you back to Orange County, we hope you consider staying with us again.  Best Regards,  Chris Jimerson Guest Service Manager Embassy Suites Anaheim North Chris.Jimerson@Hilton.com  714-618-9010

Summary: This Embassy Suites was very conveniently located.  We were there to visit the Disney Resort.  Nice rooms, enjoyed the free breakfast and the grand children loved the pool and having their own room in the suite.  They also highly enjoyed the room service and the desserts!

Summary Heading: There are better hotels closer to Disney
Summary: This hotel was the location of a conference for me in October. Normally I choose to stay in a different hotel than my conference, as I prefer to stay at boutique luxury hotels but the area wasn't able to accommodate that. This hotel is sort of an island, off on its own in the middle of nowhere surrounded by freeways. There is nothing you can walk to and you wouldn't talk in this area anyway. Let's get to it.  The good. The breakfast was staffed by incredibly friendly people. The front desk staff was amazing, kind and accommodating. The centre court made it feel like I was in Melrose Place, a bit fun. The conference rooms were adequate size for what we needed them for. The bedrooms are large, like an old 70s key party hotel room.  The bad. The breakfast is basic. The word for
Manager Response: Dear Tarbow,  Thank you for taking the time to provide feedback about your recent stay. I am sorry to hear that the condition of your room and location of the hotel did not meet your satisfaction. Although we are located 6 miles from Disneyland, Southern California traffic can cause commute times to take up to 15-25 minutes.  We wish you well on your future travels and if they bring you back to Orange County, we would be happy to host you once again.  Best Regards,  Chris Jimerson Guest Service Manager Embassy Suites Anaheim North Chris.Jimerson@Hilton.com  714-618-9010

Summary: I had a great one night stay for business. I had no problems with my room or shower. The remodel was very nice. There did not seem to be lots of places nearby to eat but the hotel has a restaurant. I got a cobb salad for about  $15 at the bar. It cost about $20 for an Uber to the convention center area. The breakfast was ok, the made to order omelette was a nice touch.

Great Breakfast and friendly staff.  Transport to Disneyland was direct but did have a nominal cost.  Parking was also charged at the hotel of $10 per day.  A little disappointed about the parking fee.  Rooms were clean and quiet and comfortable beds.

Everything was great, service, the room was clean the continental breakfast was good too. The location was great. we had zero problem with anything I️ will totally Book again.  Thankyou we had a great time

Summary Heading: Should’ve stayed at the other Embassy Suites Hotel.
Summary: What did they do with the money to refurbish hotel? Hotel shower leaked, tepid water arrives eventually. Close to Disneyland means take the freeway.  Club across the parking lot provides in room music.
Manager Response: Dear O6813TEbrianc,  Thank you for selecting to stay at the Embassy Suites Anaheim North during your recent travels. I sincerely apologize that you were inconvenienced with a shower leak, and that the water temperature was not to your satisfaction. Thanks to your valued feedback, I am happy to report our maintenance department repaired the leak and water temperature discrepancy.  We hope to welcome you back to our newly renovated hotel in the not too distant future.  Best Regards,  Chris Jimerson Guest Service Manager Embassy Suites Anaheim North Chris.Jimerson@Hilton.com  714-618-9010

Summary: Average customer service. Average quality of bathroom. Bathroom tub leaking the 6 nights 7 days of our stay. Breakfast menu was the same every day (no change at all). Staff needs training. Noisy rooms on the freeway side. Some staff had excellent customer service.
Manager Response: Dear herbertd288,  Thank you very much for the recent visit and vital feedback provided. I am sorry to hear that you experienced some challenges with our hotel staff, as well as bathroom discrepancies. The concerns mentioned have since been addressed and corrected.  We hope you reconsider giving us another opportunity to host your travels next time you are in the area. Please feel free to contact me personally so that I may assist with any requests prior to your next arrival.  Best Regards,  Chris Jimerson Guest Service Manager Embassy Suites Anaheim North Chris.Jimerson@Hilton.com  714-618-9010

Summary: excellent, we thought the breakfast and treatnment from the entire staff made us feel welcome, safe and respectied. we found that on the way home we couldnt stomach staying at anything other than an embassy suite

From front desk reception to the complimentary breakfast, I couldn't be happier. The front desk lady deserves a pat on the back. She made my day with her cheerfulness and acknowledged my hhonors status. Very delightful presence and attitude.  The room is a bit dated but the suite I was in was spacious and had one of the most amazing beds and pillows. I have a bad back and I slept like a baby in that bed!  Breakfast was to my liking and coffee was great.  Very happy with my stay!!!

Lovely ambiance, warm and inviting, clean and modern.  Great breakfast with an array of dishes to choose from.  Lobby and eating areas comparable  to high price hotels.  Excellent value for your money.  We would stay there again!

When we came in we were exhausted from flying overnight with three young children, the front desk did everything they could to make it as easy as possible on us. Every single staff member there was incredibly helpful and thoughtful. I have never stayed anywhere as welcoming as this hotel was. Housekeeping went above and beyond what we expected and my husband looked forward to their breakfast more than any other meal of the day. When we make it back there is not a doubt in my mind that we will be staying here again.

We enjoyed our two night stay immensely! The front desk staff was extremely welcoming and friendly. The suite we had was comfortable and spacious, not to mention beautifully decorated and modern. Also, we really, really appreciate that our room had a fridge as well as a microwave! We will definitely be staying in Embassy Suite again, and this location when we're in the area.

Embassy Suites is one of the Premier Suite Hotels.  I enjoyed the complimentary Manager's Cocktail hour, the open airy Atrium felt like we were outdoors, yet indoors. Pool, Jacuzzi and Exercise room were conveniently located. The Ballroom and Staff were exquisite!  They worked with our decorations committee in setting up the Banquet Room to accommodate 160 for our Class Reunion, plus dance floor, plus Green Screen photo booth, and plenty of room left for mingling.  Exceptional Service!

Not clean, closet smelled like wet moldy carpet..dirty dishes and utinsils..sad that I wasted my money and vacation...I hold Hilton Hotels to higher standard..I hope it improves because this is a hotel I would live to stay in but not in these conditions.

Summary Heading: Very nice improvements at the Embassy
Summary: They recently completed a remodel of the lobby, gym and breakfast areas. They results were excellent. I have stayed at this facility on 9 different occasions and the service is always excellent. The staff is very helpful and courteous.

Typical outstanding Embassy Suites service. Shuttle service from hotel to Disneyland - five dollars covers you all day no matter how many trips. Free parking and easy freeway access.  Staff was friendly. One can buy tickets to Disney land here too without the need to wait in line at the park.

Disappointed on how my situation and experience was handled at this location. Housekeeping walked into my room while I had no clothes on and I professionally addressed the issue with the manager. Being a diamond member, I expected more than just an apology and a recover points not even equal to one night of stay. Will never stay at this property again.

My wife and I and our 3 children enjoyed our stay at the Embassy Suites in Anaheim. It was a good value for our family when you consider the evening manager's reception and made-to-order breakfast. The indoor pool and hot tub provided a great opportunity to play and relax.

Do not stay in Room 719. The water turns off around 9 pm. My husband stood there all soapy and unable to rinse off until it came back on. Exhaust fan was loud and kept us awake. Internet was bad and we couldn't get email on regular or premium (HH member) service until we left the premises and used our cell data. Breakfast and reception were excellent.  If going to Disneyland with the shuttle and you are a senior, ask for senior tickets to save you some money; we weren't told one of two days and had to pay full rate.

Great hotel would recommend to anyone looking for a place to stay on a trip to Disneyland. The ART shuttle to Disneyland was perfect way to get to the park. Side note if you are traveling from LAX to this hotel book a Super Shuttle. The shared ride service was one of the best I have ever used. (Download their APP)

Thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Embassy Suites. The rooms are a great size for two people, and we particularly liked the separate living room/study, plus kitchenette with coffee and tea making facilities. The complimentary breakfast buffet was excellent. Our only let down was no porter to help unload our luggage when we arrived, and we subsequently struggled to maneuver the heavy luggage trolley up to our room. Otherwise, an extremely satisfying experience and I'd definitely recommend this hotel and its friendly, helpful staff.

This hotel is nice and it's the second time I have stay there for an event. I was not satisfied with the housekeeping or the service in the bar. The breakfast was by far amazing and they exceeded what they did the year prior.

Summary Heading: A very nice property with friendly, professional staff
Summary: I was just in town for a quick overnight stay and was very impressed with this property.  You can tell there have been a number of renovations and upgrades and everything was very nice.  I didn't take part in the managers reception or breakfast, but the dining and lounge area looked very nice.  My room was very nice and the furnishings/decorations are modern and trendy.  It met every one of my expectations.  I would definitely stay here again over some of the higher priced hotels I've visited in that area!

The evening staff (Edith and Chris) are amazing! The best employees! The day time front desk staff seemed annoyed every time we had a question or complaint. The breakfast was great! The staff in the breakfast area were very friendly. The room was gross! We had big yellow stains on the carpet. It looked like old vomit stains. The a/c overflow leaked in the shower the whole visit. When we would shower we would have to dodge the water coming from the ceiling. The sound of dripping water when you sleep, was horrible. The hotel was ok. The room was awful! We couldn't wait to leave.

Very nice hotel in good location.  Nice suites, more then enough space and good service, hotel has guest happy hour, nice pool and very nice free breakfast.  Was here for business, but noticed that the Disney bus picks up here. I would definitely stay here again.

Tired of cramped airline seats and postage stamp boutique hotel rooms? Come back to vintage sized rooms and wonderful service.  Other than a cranky sofa and the bar closing at 11 on a Friday night, I had no complaints.  The drinks were great which is why I wish the bar had stayed open longer.  The bartender was great.  We were there for a party and had the best time.  Nice room, nice bed, lots of pillows, a decent breakfast with enough seats for everyone. I didn’t go to Disneyland but they have a shuttle that goes there. $15 gets you to the hotel from SNA on Lyft. All in all, a great visit.

The staff at this location is so helpful.  We had an issue with the first night there with noise on the back side of the property.  They  moved our luggage and items to another room for us while we were at the Park. They offer a great shuttle service for just $ 5.00 per person both ways to Disneyland.  This hotel has just been remolded and is very comfortable.

best of the best and the clerk who checked me in and out was awesome... professional--everything was clean and the entire staff went above and beyond to make sure my stay was great.  Would recommend this hotel to anyone needing a great place to stay

The room (King Suite) was clean and comfortable with updated furnishings. After only a few minutes in our room, the front desk called to see if everything was to our liking. Since the purpose for our two night stay was to attend a conference, we were not in our room much. Even so, it was nice to come back to a good place to rest.   The best part about this hotel is the atrium style lobby where you’ll find a fountain, a lounge, and plenty of seating. It was a relaxing place to wait for the rest of our group and enjoy the generous (and delicious) breakfast! The hotel makes the most of the space by offering a mangers happy hour reception in the evenings in addition to breakfast.  Overall it was a great place to stay!

We came here a year ago and had a great stay.  We were a little disappointed with the changes in the atrium that were made.  No more trees, fish or frogs.  My kids were pretty bummed.  Our room was clean and we like having all of the extra room.  We really enjoy the shuttle that takes you right to Disneyland and brings you right back to the hotel when you are done at the park.    We like this hotel because it seems to not be as busy as other hotels closer to Disneyland.  Our room was on the side of the freeway but we hardly noticed the noise.  Our group enjoyed the breakfast each morning and even the picky eaters found something to eat.  The only thing we wish is that the bathroom door was more in the hall and not in the bedroom.   All in all a great stay!  We hope to return

Nicely remodeled public areas, in addition, to updates in the suites including the bathrooms.  The breakfast staff is always very cheerful preparing omelettes for the guests.   The atrium is much more inviting than before the remodel.

The Embassy Suites Anaheim North is located on the south east corner of Highway 91 and Frontera Street in Anaheim, California.  It is also located just north of the Santa Ana River.  Unfortunately it is also located next to a noisy recycling center on the east side.  The Embassy Suites chain is owned by Hilton and there are over 220 locations in 6 countries.  I stayed here for 2 nights in mid-September and generally liked my room and thought it was a decent place to stay.  The front desk people were very friendly and helpful but they told me they did not have any King Size beds but then gave one to the guy right after me. They had a pretty good buffet breakfast with an omelet bar and regular cold and hot buffet lines.  My room was large (of course it was a suite) and the

Summary Heading: A simple answer to a simple problem
Summary: On September 6th I booked 6 nights for an employee who was traveling from Rhode Island.  After using the Mobile app to book the room I found that it went through 6 times so I called into customer service who corrected the booking and confirmed it was just the 1 confirmation above. At this point I verified with the customer service rep and was assured that when my employee arrived onsite he would not have an issue checking in because the room was paid for and his name was listed.  On September 14th my employee flew out only to find out he was not able to check in, the reason provided was the room was not paid for. At 11:30 PM I contacted Hilton Customer Service and after explaining the situation was told that there was nothing that could be done unless the employee onsite pays

Great hotel.  Great location.  Great rooms.  Great employees.  Great breakfast.  Great happy hour.  I would say stay was relaxing and great.  I always enjoy staying in this hotel when I am in this area.  The staff go out of their way to help you.  Cost is reasonable.  I love their breakfast as they have everything you would expect at a resturant.  You won't be sorry to stay there.  Just tell them Bill sent you

Summary Heading: Like being in the comfort of home
Summary: Not having to go look for a place to have breakfast, is so convenient. We were able to enjoy our breakfast in comfort, before heading out for the day. Just like being at home. Meeting people from other places and sharing stories.

I would recommend book this hotel. Hotel just finish renovated and look really nice & modern. Breakfast & evening reception is great. I like cook order omelet and the evening adult cocktail or wine, for the kids snack drinks. We able sit & talk with our family. The staff are nice and courtesy.

This Embassy Suite location has destroyed the comfortable and relaxing atrium and replaced it with a cold harsh environment that is far from enjoyable.  Other than that the suites, food, drinks and staff are excellent.

We chose this hotel because we went Disneyland. The hotel is really nice and clean. The front desk answered any and all questions we had for our stay. A plus for the hotel was having a shuttle take the guests to Disneyland for a low price. It helped us save money on parking at Disney. The only downfall of the hotel was the temperature of the shower not cooperating correctly. Overall, I would stay here again.

With traditional Spanish design, this is one of the friendliest Embassy Suites I have stayed at over the years.  Close to the freeway, Santa Ana, and Disneyland, this is a nice change of pace from the Disney area hotels.  Everyone - from the front desk to the breakfast staff is genuinely happy to be there and help your stay be great!  Have stayed at least 6 times in the past three years, and was equally happy with each visit. With a free breakfast buffet, it is the perfect place for families on vacation.  And the layout is typical, with quiet areas for those of us staying for business.

Customer service was horrible. This is the second time we have been to this hotel and the first time was just as horrible. Had I known that my family booked this specific hotel, I would have told them not to. The ONLY good thing that came out of this hotel was the manager Chris who managed to help us just at the arrival. Front desk was rude, bartender was rude, we had to switch rooms the first night because it smelled horribly and seemed to have still been going through renovation. We WERE NOT greeted as Hilton Honors members and I am a Silver member, almost Gold. I had to ASK for my bag and waters, front desk took two other groups before us and we were standing right were it says Hilton Honors Line. In the last two days, I have been asked what are the best hotels to stay at and
Manager Response: Dear james_thename,  Thank you very much for your recent visit and vital feedback given. We are extremely disappointed and sorry you did not receive the welcoming customer service that you deserve. Since your visit we have addressed the issue with our team members and assure you this will not happen in the future.  We hope to have another opportunity to host you. Please let me know if you have any questions or would like to book a future stay.  Best Regards,  Chris Jimerson Guest Service Manager (714) 618-9010

Summary: We have stayed at this hotel several times and will certainly be back. It's close to all that Anaheim has to offer and easy to find. The Manager's Reception and breakfast are great! The rooms are huge and well appointed. The indoor pool and spa are open early and late so you can enjoy them longer.

Embassy Suites is our preferred hotel brand.  We had stayed here before but thought it was a bit shabby so we have been staying at another property a bit further away.  Major improvements have been made that will bring us back here again.

good to have the suite, good to have the breakfast, fans too loud in the bathroom, can't turn off the fan.  Also, badroom door is inside the bedroom so the person staying outside in the sofa bed has to go into the bedroom at night.  That was not good for me since i'm a light sleeper and woke up everytime my mom came in to use the restroom.  Beds are comfortable though.

Nice place to stay, even though under some construction, breakfast is very good and the manager's reception is nice.  When the new breakfast area is compete this will be a really nice place.  I would stay there again if in the area. Convenient ride to Disney Land and shuttle tickets are reasonable.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay in Anaheim
Summary: Stayed 2 nights. Big rooms can accommodate max of 4 per king suite room, full breakfast buffet, happy hour 5 pm to 7 pm, swimmlng pool, disney ticket assistance, ART public bus 21 to disneyland for $3 one way for adults cheaper for senior and children.  Staffs were very courteous and helpful.

Summary Heading: Can't go wrong with Hilton's brand
Summary: Embassy Suites are our favorite Hilton brand.  Roomy, good breakfast, and quiet.  This particular one in Anaheim is no exception.  The location is very conveniently located at Highway 91 and 57 while traffic was acceptable in the LA area.

Summary Heading: My new favorite place to stay
Summary: Chris, who checked me in, treated me very professionally, welcomed me as a valued Hilton HHonors member, asked if this was my first time staying with Embassy Suites and since it was, he proceeded to give me a quick overview of some of the benefits of staying with Embassy including the nightly Manager's Reception from 5:30 - 7:30 pm that provides light snacks and drinks. He encouraged me to jump right on in with the Manager's Reception which was currently going on when we arrived. I asked him his name and gave him a handshake because I appreciated how professionally he treated me whereas in the past at other Hilton properties, I have been treated as someone there to serve the hotel instead of someone there who is giving the hotel business. I treat the hotel staff professionally

I was very pleased how I was treated as a valued customer.   I stayed at another Hilton property in June in Southern California. There my room was not ready when I arrived at 5 pm, and rude comments were made to me when I expressed dissatisfaction.   My experience with Embassy Suites was completely different.   First of all my room was ready when I arrived in the same manner with the digital check-in. At the front desk where I checked in, the service was speedy, Chris, who checked me in, treated me very professionally as he welcomed me as a valued customer and Hilton HHonors member. He also encouraged to feel at home and take advantage of the Manager's Reception that was going on when we arrived.  The made-to-order breakfast was excellent with made-to-cook omelettes, eggs,

I've been a diamond member for 2yrs now and must say this visit was disappointing. At check in the front desk didn't go over anything. Had to look up breakfast, happy hour and pool times on our own. Had to ask where the laundry areas and ice machines locations. The pool area had a very strong chlorine smell as you walked in. The hot tub was not working correctly. We waited an hour just get get maintenance to come and fix it before we just headed back to our room. Long wait times for fresh towels and an extra blanket. Ice machine on our floor didn't work the entire time of our stay. Not all washers had been working. The 7 days we stayed and no one seem to care about the problems until the last day. Lack of communication on the staff at this hotel. During breakfast service at most

We choose Embassy Suites to house our family when we are away from home. We love going down to sit in the atrium to relax. The hotel and rooms are very clean. Beds are amazingly comfortable. Breakfast is super yummy!

This property was not at all comparable to the one in the South. I felt more like I was at Motel 6. The room was not clean, the equipment didn't work properly, the view was of the river channel and the walls were way too thin. Don't waste your time coming here, if you've ever been to a nice hotel because they are just perpetrating under the name of Embassy Suites but it's  really Econolodge. The price is much too high 4 the poor quality. Don't be fooled.
Manager Response: Dear yolandamM6018EL,  We thank you for your recent stay and vital feedback provided. We are extremely sorry to hear we fell short of your expectations of the hotel property. We hope you reconsider staying with us once our complete hotel upgrade is finished September 2017.  Best Regards,  Chris Jimerson Guest Service Manager Embassy Suites Anaheim North Chris.Jimerson@Hilton.com  714-618-9010

Summary: After staying at this hotel for more than 9 years, I doubt I will ever return due to the poor maintenance and management control or the A/C system. During my recent stay the A/C system failed in our room and after only one attempt to fix the system we had to move at midnight, with NO help from staff.
Manager Response: Dear johnaC2298SO  I am sorry to hear about the A/C challenges you experienced during your recent stay. Your comfort and satisfaction is very important to us, our apologies for not providing a rewarding stay. We hope to have another opportunity to welcome back your continued loyalty.  Best Regards,  Chris Jimerson Guest Service Manager Embassy Suites Anaheim North Chris.Jimerson@Hilton.com  714-618-9010

Summary: Suite was roomy, plenty of room for four people to stay comfortably. Breakfast and reception were a plus. I also like that they have a shuttles to and from Disneyland at a very reasonable price. The staff was great amd attentive

We spent 3 nights here and this hotel looks like old style hotel and breakfast is very nice and the only concern is wifi speed is very slow apart from that decent stay in LA. omelette in breakfast is so good. Weather in LA is good and traffic is the worst part, so if you plan to catch the flight please start at-least 3 hrs before else you will miss the flight.

Summary Heading: The good, the bad, and the ugly
Summary: Good: excellent free breakfast. The made to order omelettes were very tasty. Coffee was also good. In addition the location was very convenient and close to everything.   The Bad: the hotel could use some deep cleaning. Towels were an issue. One day we didn't get any - the cleaning lady said they had run out - until we went to the reception and got them. Twice the "clean" towels had dirt or hair in them. So check your towels before you use them.   The ugly: the hotel was HOT! Like uncomfortable, muggy, sweating while seating hot. The main area was uncomfortably hot. The room was so hot it was hard to sleep. When asked to have it checked the maintenance guy indicated it was what it was. Offered a fan, which was never delivered any day of our 7 day stay. When we gave feedback to

Upon entering our room, we noticed the latch lock on the door was coming off.  In our bathroom, we also noticed that the vent was coming off of the wall.  We took pictures and reported both to the front desk immediately, but it wasn't fixed throughout our entire stay.   Also, we found wrappers from the previous family who stayed in the room between the bed and night stand and it was obvious our room had not been vacuumed.  With two children it was an inconvenience to have to tell them to constantly not be on the floor because it hadn't been cleaned.   We've stayed here previously and always stay at Embassy Suites during our trips, but we will no longer be staying at your location.  As a diamond member, I expected to have a different experience.
Manager Response: Dear Carringtons_2011,  We are sorry to hear that our housekeeping services did not meet your expectations. Your satisfaction is very important to us and if you reconsider staying with us again, please feel free to contact me at anytime so that I can ensure you have a great stay.  Best Regards,  Chris Jimerson D: 714-618-9010 E: Chris.Jimerson@Hilton.com

Summary: As a family of 4 we spent 5 nights in a 2 bed suite. The beds were so comfortable, the bedroom was spacious and had adequate storage space for our clothes. Having the separate lounge/dining area and fridge was great as it meant the kids could chill and watch a bit of tv or play a game without being cooped up in the bedroom. The rooms were clean and the cleaners came daily. Breakfast was the same each morning, bacon, scrambled eggs, sausage, pastries, fruit, potatoes, cereal and alternated days of pancakes or waffles. They also had a fresh station where you could get an omelette or fresh eggs made to order. There was also Apple juice, orange juice, tea and coffee.  We stayed here whilst we were doing Disney. The shuttle bus (daily charge) was really handy and cheaper than paying

Summary Heading: Close but not too close to Disneyland
Summary: My family and I stayed here in July 2017 for our Disney/LA family vacay. The location is good.  Not too far away from Disneyland. I didn't want to pay the daily parking fees at the other hotels closer to Disney. This one doesn't charge for parking. We opted to drive (10 mins) and park at Disneyland for $20 instead of taking the shuttle.  And we drove for almost an hour and a half to get to Universal Studios. Although this hotel shares a parking lot with a nightclub, we didn't find this a problem.  We came back one Friday night and there was hotel security there watching, making sure only hotel guests were parking on their side of the parking lot. Security even blocked off some very close parking spaces for their late incoming guests (us). Never had a problem finding parking on

Summary Heading: Only stay here if you have to
Summary: It was a business trip so we had no choice. HVAC is inadequate. Room rate was excessive. Housekeeping inconsistent. Location is terrible!  I grew up in California so I know what this hotel used to be. They did a badly needed renovation but skipped important details. We paid $225 per night because they market this as the Disney hotel. In the process the gouge the other customers who have to stay there.
Manager Response: Dear 992lauriej,  Thank you for your recent visit to our property. We are so very sorry to hear of the challenging experience you had during your visit. The vital feedback provided is taken as a gift, and shall be passed along to our management staff as we strive to become better everyday. We hope you reconsider staying with us once again.  Best Regards,  Chris Jimerson D: 714-632-1221 E: Chris.Jimerson@Hilton.com

Summary: I thoroughly enjoy staying at this hotel.  The staff is nice, helpful, and really pay attention to detail and try to make your experience a great one!  Thanks for all that you do here to make our stay a great one!

This hotel is close to the park but does not offer free shuttle service.  If anyone decides to stay at this location, be aware that it may be cheaper to drive and park at the Disney parking lot verses taking a shuttle where you are charged per person.  This hotel is clean and provides good service.

Don't recommend. Room not clean. Stairwells not clean. Elevators in the morning overcrowded. Location right by freeway. Guard in the parking lot. Not the Hilton experience I am use to. Construction going on.

I have stayed at this hotel for 30 days with the family and in general it very good with the exception of the remodeling/renovation noise level. Maybe by the time you read this post it'll be done and you'll be on every chic and new remodeled Embassy Suites.  The food was very good, and they had shuttles that goes back and forth from Disney Land. The staff were very friendly.

Summary Heading: Hotel under construction; a bit of an odor
Summary: This older property is undergoing a facelift so best not to go unless you need two rooms or get a deeeeeeep discount.  New furnishings have been installed in the rooms but they have an odd odor-probably because they are out of the box.  TIP: DO NOT BOOK A ROOM ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE PROPERTY-IT IS RIGHT NEXT TO A MAJOR METAL RECYCLING COMPANY AND THE TRUCK NOISE STARTS AT 7:00 AM.  On a picky note-the acoustic ceilings are dated and falling apart, water damage has destroyed bathroom painted ceilings, the bathroom is right off of the bedroom (why?) breakfast ends at 9:00 AM, and our tub fixture dripped all night.  The staff is good

I made this reservation on-line. There was a disclaimer stating "Pardon our Dust". It should have read "Warning this hotel looks like a war zone ". My wife and I have stayed in Embassy Suites since 1991. Our experience has usually been over the top. Last year we stayed at Embassy Suites Temecula. The air conditioning was out and it was 105 degrees outside. We had to have maintenance visit the room twice before we we able to stay in it. We left there and went to Embassy Suites Santa Ana. We had an accessible room, but it wasn't accessible. I said I would never stay in Embassy Suites again. I had forgotten about the experience and scheduled this room. I can now say I'm finished with Embassy Suites.

This hotel is in a state of disarray, construction, noise, dust, basically you can stay in your room or leave the hotel. We were told when checking in (not prior, when we would have been able to make the decision to cancel or find a room elsewhere) that the electricity was being shut down for hours in the middle of the day...not internet, no tv, no use of fitness center, etc no restaurant. Were they offering discounted rooms for this inconvenience...? NO, they offered some wrapped deli sandwiches. Wow....that's really great customer service. This hotel is also in the middle of nowhere.

Summary Heading: Why isnt half a star an option?
Summary: Hotel construction was very disruptive and not reflected in the cost of the room. Internet costs almost 12 dollars a day which is absurd. Hotel staff rude on many occassions. Room left dirty by room service 3 out of 6 day which leads me to think they were understaffed. Does not live up to the Hilton brand. Go to a best western or motel 6 for this kind of service.

The hotel is under construction however the rooms are very clean staff is friendly and courteous.  The hotel restaurant has a good selection the food was very good.  The rooms are very spacious and the bed is very comfortable.

The hotel is clean and being updated and for the most part fits the expectations of staying in an Embassy Suites. However, this hotel shares a parking lot with a strip club. The impact of this is that the strip club makes parking in the lot very difficult and the music is so loud that it kept us up (and we were on the sixth floor). It was not restful. Also, the bacon was burned every morning. Every morning.

Summary Heading: Just don't use the On-Line check-in, otherwise Under Construction
Summary: Ok, to be upfront, I must say there was nothing wrong with the room or breakfast. Both were just what you would expect from Embassy Suites.  That being said, just don't do the on-line check in & cell phone as your room key options, neither worked.  We were going to Disney with some friends & I thought the on-line thing would be nice to ensure we got rooms by each other.  So I selected my room, but when I got there, there was no record of my on-line check in (& I had called to confirm & spoke to an employee that verified it).  So didn't get our room even on the same floor and the employee didn't apologize for the inconvenience and even went as far to insinuate it was my fault.  I also requested extra pillows on-line, which they did acknowledge, but had to call 2 times to get. The

The Embassy suite was under construction, the elevator windows where covered with dust, the hall ways and room smelled very bad, the rooms smelled like someone used a whole container of fresh-up in the room to cover up the bad smell but you could still smell the bad order.  My granddaughter has allergies and the hotel’s bad smell and dust did not help.  Sitting in the room (door open due to smell) after a long drive from Elk Grove, CA (6 hr drive) we had to listen to the banging of the construction crew doing the work.  Two years ago we were visiting our daughter and we went to an Embassy suite, not sure which one it was, but they were booked so they sent us to this one.  The hotel was not under construction at the time, but it smelled badly and had a bad order throughout the
Manager Response: Dear 132alfredb,  We appreciate you taking the time to write your feedback, as it is critical to our success as we strive to improve our services and facilities. We are very sorry we fell short of your expectations, and also for any frustration you may have experienced for a second time.  If you find yourself in the area and are willing to give us another opportunity to provide you with a quality stay, please feel free to contact me personally so that I may assist with your reservations.  Best Regards,  Chris Jimerson Guest Service Manager D: (714) 618-9010 E: Chris.Jimerson@Hilton.com

Summary Heading: Not the best experience for the money
Summary: Caution advised. Hotel atrium under construction. Major noise during the day. Room not super clean. Hair in bathroom and on towels. Hot Tub needs cleaning. Nice workout room but the music can't be turned down or channel changed. Face south to avoid the noisy highway.

I wish the hotel agent would have informed me of two things when I booked this hotel:  1.  There is construction going on in the atrium.  2.  There is a metal crushing business in the back of the hotel.    In regard to the construction - the noise in the morning started before 9am on a Sunday.  I'm sure there were some folks who wanted to sleep in on the weekend, but the noise that resonated to the 6th floor probably kept many people from doing so.    In regard to the metal crushing business - it was outside our window and we had a great view of the bright lights that shown all night long from this business.  We had to clamp the curtains closed to make the room dark at night.  I'm not sure where the noise was coming from, but there was some kind of grinding noise that started

Summary Heading: A few bumps along the way
Summary: I really enjoy staying at this hotel especially with my kids and granddaughter. They loved the indoor pool which very convenient, the room service and breakfast Only issue sink was leaking causing big mess and housekeeping did not provide fresh towels when room was cleaned I had to get with front desk to provide fresh towels

Stayed at the Embassy Suite Hilton North Anaheim for 6 days during my recent trip to Disney and universal studios Hollywood.Staff were very welcoming and hotel was very clean. The complimentary breakfast and evening reception were excellent. Overall great experience. The rate was good to compared to all the ones around. The ART runs a route from there to the Disneyland park from morning to 12:30am.

Hotel staff were fine,helpful and friendly. Bar tender was great along with the complimentary drinks and snacks. Breakfast was also very good and that too was complimentary. The hotel was under renovation at the time of my stay but that was not an issue. The only negative things I can say was that our room had a very musty odor to it. Knowing we were only staying one night I did not make a big deal of it and did not ask to have a different room. Oh and one more thing, my daughter found a chicken bone in the couch cushion!
Manager Response: Dear Impy9331,  Thank you so much for your recent visit. We are very sorry to hear we fell short of your expectations of your guest room. We are very happy to hear the staff was friendly and you enjoyed the amenities.  We wish you well on your travels and hope to host you next time you are in town.  Best Regards,  Chris Jimerson Guest Service Manager D: (714) 618-9010 E: Chris.Jimerson@Hilton.com

Summary: Straightforward feedback: this is a poorly placed property and I'd never stay here again. Pros: the location off the freeway seemed convenient. This had downsides though. Traveling with 3 adults, I thought have 2 beds and foldout sofabed was a good idea. Embassy Suites are usually a solid bet and pretty nice. This hotel does not present the brand well at all.  Issues: Location next to a NIGHTCLUB in same parking lot - noisy and hard to find parking. Guests at the Embassy Suites appeared to be there for the nightclub, and were loud, intoxicated. It was under renovation - not mentioned when booked -  and it was a mess! Room keys didn't work at first - one of my pet peeves when checking in. You go all the way to your room and can't get in, so you need to go back to the front
Manager Response: Dear DMLehman6,  Thank you very much for your recent stay. We are very sorry for the challenging time you faced during your visit. The information provided is vital in our success as it will be used as a training tool for our staff.  Best Regards,  Chris Jimerson Guest Service Manager D: (714) 618-9010 E: Chris.Jimerson@Hilton.com

Summary Heading: Major Construction Taking Place Lots of Noise
Summary: Normally a great hotel. This was not the case, MAJOR construction is taking place and the Hotel should close for this. Work started at 5am and awoke my entire family nothing was done by hotel management to make the situation right other than arranging and early check in at another Embassy after I pushed for the to happen.

The size of the room was very good, comfortable beds, but the bathroom was dirty with some mold and the shower head pressure was low. The staff was very friendly and I always like the made to order omelettes

We stayed at this location due to a last minute change in plans. We did not realize they were under renovations. Our room was comfortable and the staff was courteous. There was a large group of teens (basketball team) staying at the time so it was very loud in the hallways. We called the front desk and a staff member came upstairs to disperse the teens. The beds were VERY comfortable and the rooms are spacious and newly redone. The breakfast was fantastic! We do not mind the drive to Disneyland, maybe 8 miles away, but give yourself 30 minutes due to traffic. The only drawback was noise during the day from construction. We came back mid-day from the parks to rest and couldn't really sleep due to the noise. Other than that we will return after construction is completed :)

If you are willing to drive to the Disney Parks each day, this is an excellent hotel!  Free parking, easy access to Disney & John Wayne Airport without being too close to either -- no late night airplane noise or tourists on the street.  Excellent staff, wonderful rooms, tasty breakfast.

It's a poorly managed property. We stayed in room no 618 which was booked by my sister in law. She gave clear instructions for payment options, but they were not followed in the name of hotel policy. Tap of our wash room was leaking, and it was not repaired in two days when we stayed there. Drawer of almirah  was not cleaned and was dirty. And now the most scary thing of hotel. We reached hotel at about 11 pm night. after check in we returned to reception as magnet keys were not working. And now the most scary thing the receptionist was saying to a guest who was just checking -- sir although you have booked the hotel,as we always overbook and today everyone has checked in. So now you go and search some other hotel. This may me mine if I would have reached there 15 mts late.
Manager Response: Dear Puneet265,  Thank you so much for your recent visit. We are very sorry to hear we fell short of your expectations of the hotel property. We are very happy to hear the staff was courteous and facilities were to your liking. We wish you well on your travels.  Best Regards,   Chris Jimerson Guest Service Manager Embassy Suites Anaheim North Chris.Jimerson@Hilton.com  714-618-9010

Summary: Stayed here for 2 nights with my mom and my 2 little kids. I was aware of them being under construction before I arrived, so I was mentally prepared to deal with that part.  Beds were comfy, and suite was spacious (2 Queen Beds & Sofa Bed Suite). I did find extra pillows in the closet which we needed, that was handy. The fresh made omelettes for breakfast was probably my favorite part of the stay in this hotel. Something that was unacceptable however, was that my mother decided to spend one whole day in the room and was trying to order lunch via room service - NO ONE ANSWERED THE PHONE UNTIL 4PM - when she called the front desk if she can get food ordered to the room, they told her to keep calling room service, that they're probably just busy... not acceptable! How is no one

Summary Heading: Sad Toilets and Bad parking with night club.
Summary: Had a toilet that would have to flush several times to flush anything Room 708.  Also night club would take up most of the parking at night.  Staff was friendly.  Breakfast was ok.  Hotel under construction was not Abigail issue.

My biggest frustration was the lady at the front desk said she "fixed" by Digital Key and it never did work. Breakfast was pretty standard. Bed and pillows were comfortable. Room was like a oven when I arrived and I thought the AC was broke but I discovered the glass sliding door had been open all day. It cooled down nicely once I closed the door.  Housekeeping left the ice bucket which I had moved sitting exactly where I had left it with it full of water from melted ice from the day before. They were doing construction but it wasn't that big of a deal. I was very frustrated my last night. I arrived at the hotel around 7:30 pm and there was a crowd of people 1/2 a mile long waiting to get into a night club across the parking lot. There was not parking! The club people took up

Arrived on Thursday for a 3 night stay.Things were OK until Friday night! Went out for the evening and when we came back around 8:30 there were parking cones scattered around the parking lot! We were told to park out back! My husband is elderly and has a hard time walking. Went inside to front desk and inquired why and was told they share the parking lot with the Night Club next door!! We should have been told that at check in. Also waited 20 minutes for a luggage cart so we could check out. They need more carts for the number of rooms this hotel has!! Breakfast was OK. The construction noise wasn't too bad.

Summary Heading: Under Constrution but a OK stay
Summary: Stay 4 nites here E/S was under constution , but has clean rooms,a very good breakfast, and nighty comp drinks, a good staff , a good pool and hot tube , free parking, close to  the 91 and 57 freeways a OK stay here

Clean hotel, even during construction. Breakfast had potential, but some of the food was prepared in bulk, sacrificing overall quality/consistency. I would also recommend taking advantage of the complimentary evening beverage service, that was a nice amenity.

If you want a hotel that is close to everything this would be the place to stay. If you want a hotel that provides a great customer service experience do not stay here you could do better at a motel 6. Save your money

On my 4th day stay, my family had good time. We used the swimming pool and complimentary  breakfast. However,  the bathtub was dirty before check in and during our 4 days stay at The hotel. We hope you fix the problem. Thank you.

I loved the staff and the hotel is well worth the price.  The pool and free buffet breakfast was awesome.  'Free Coffee in the room was appreciated, and having traveled alot in the US, I think the location is perfect, not only for Disneyland, but for getting to Newport Beach as well.

We usually stay at Embassy Suite hotels for the service and amenities. This hotel met our needs. All hotel staff were nice and professional. Yes..it's undergoing an interior makeover, but that should not deter you from staying here. There is no construction noise at night and during the day, if you're at Disneyland, you won't deal with the construction anyway. They breakfast buffet was great, offering the usual selections,including the made to order omelette bar. We stayed during the week and each day there were no crowds and plenty of seating. As for our room, it was the typical suite with a king bed in the bedroom and a sofa bed in the front room area. It was clean. Our son got the king bed and my wife and I slept on the sofa bed. To my surprise, the sofa bed was actually

We were excited to book embassy as we always stay at embassy suites when traveling.  Upon arriving, the hotel lobby looked great, but once we got to our room, we were greeted with a musty scent all over the room which we had to use aerosols to rid of the stench.  Additionally, when having breakfast, the chef was very rude and decided to ignore due to breakfast closing in five minutes and just pulled out his phone and walked away.  We will not be staying at this "newly remodeled" hotel again.

This is a typical embassy suite. Clean, well kept with friendly personnel. Good breakfast selection but their restaurant was under remodeling, so didn't have any in house dining available. We'd stay there again.

Service was great. Room had a musty smell. Breakfast was great except bacon wasnt crisp. Other than these, i might go back if the price is right. If I find another ES for same price, this location would be second pick.

Clean, great location, easy access to highway. We were upset at first because people were in the room we were checked into, but staff responded immediately and were very attentive. Will visit this location again. Second time staying here

Stay away from the King Suites unless you like the strong smell of Mildew and headaches! We checked into the Hotel, got to our room and were greeted with the strong stench of Mildew! We notified the staff and there solution was to leave us in the same room and send up a Staff member with a deodorizer to "freshen" up the room! This is after my wife and i started to experience Headaches...to top it off the pool was semi-clean but the HOT TUB was extremely dirty! Never again!!!
Manager Response: Dear Joseph G,  Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience with us. I am sorry to hear that the challenges within your guest room were not corrected prior to your departure. Next time you find yourself in the area, we'd love to welcome you back and show you that we can provide you with an overall experience that exceed your expectations.  Best Regards,  Chris Jimerson Guest Service Manager Embassy Suites Anaheim North Chris.Jimerson@Hilton.com  714-618-9010

Summary: The hotel had an awesome breakfast with a complimentary drink and snacks at dinner which we took advantage of on our arrival to the hotel. There was construction being done on the hotel and the whole atrium was covered in plastic which was really disappointing. The beds were super cozy and the suite was very roomy for the four of us. The staff couldn't have been any nicer.

Although the main part of the hotel was being remodeled we still enjoyed the friendly staff and the room was great for our party of five.  Proximity to Disneyland was decent and breakfast every morning was great and a nice savings to boot!

I stayed here for a conference and the facilities were excellent for that purpose. Nice open atrium area to sit in and relax with plentiful natural daylight. Parking was free. I found my suite to be spacious and a bit awkward in terms of furniture arrangement but fine for purposes of comfort. Our 7th floor balcony faced the parking lot of the adjacent mall. Room was quiet but event sounds on ground level drifted up. The evening hour drinks and "snacks" were confined to a bar and some tables with people swarming the area; the drinks were basic and the snacks consisted of chips and salsa and something like a chex mix. Not a particularly interesting offering. Breakfast was however much more robust, held in the pleasant ground floor atrium area, with a cook to order eggs station and

Although there were some renovations in progress at the hotel, the hotel rooms and common areas were clean and the staff was accommodating. I would definitely stay at this hotel again, for business or pleasure.

Choosing a hotel close to Disney that offers shuttles was hard. I finally found this one. The shuttle was not free, you have to pay a fee for it. You can pay per day, or for the whole weekend. You are provided a schedule for the ART shuttle. At Disneyland it is easy to access and super close to the entrance. Now for the room, as soon as we walked in, it had a musty smell. We called housekeeping and they arrived quickly to spray and open up the window.  After that, it went away.  The beds are comfortable, plenty of space for all the luggage. The staff is friendly. The lobby/restaurant is undergoing construction, so we did not have a great view.  Breakfast is included, there is a nice selection of food, pastries and a big dinning space.  After being exhausted of our 3 day Disney

The rooms...omg...the family suite is a joke...there is no way this fits 6 comfortably.  Full size beds...they could easily fit queens but scrimped on the size..so small beds combined with crappy pillows and lumpy beds left us exhausted and tired before our Disney adventure.  And the pull out sofa bed...you could literally count how many springs on the bed.  The hotel was booked to capacity.  The cable was slow, bounced you off every 10 minutes.  This hotel is out dated and not worth the money we spent.  The only redeeming thing was the happy hour...which I used to knock me out so I could get some sleep on the worlds lumpiness bed.

The hotel is a mess, under construction. Stay clear in until the renovations are complete.  Room also smelled of smoke. When I made my reservation the person I spoke with didn't mention the condition of the hotel. At reception I was told had I book on-line there is info available about the renovation.
Manager Response: Dear K4435URdavidf,  Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience at our hotel. I am sorry that you were not informed of our ongoing renovations at the time of your booking. I hope you reconsider staying with us once our renovations are complete July 2017.  Best Regards,  Chris Jimerson Guest Service Manager Embassy Suites Anaheim North Chris.Jimerson@Hilton.com  714-618-9010

Summary: We booked two room for our Disneyland trip and were very pleased with our stay.  The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and spacious.  Plenty of great choices at the breakfast buffet and the made to order omelets were fantastic and the evening reception hit the spot.  Will definitely stay here again and recommend to our friends and family.

We stayed here 2 nights to go to an Angels baseball game.   Location was only about a 5 minute drive to Angel Stadium, that's about the only nice thing I can say about the hotel.   We had a suite with 2 Queen beds and when we checked in Fri night the TV in the living area was not working.  We called front desk and maintenance came right up and within a few minutes had it working, while maintenance was there we questioned the AC in the room.  The room was super stuffy and warm after the air had been on for a while.   He messed with the thermostat and said that the AC was on full blast in our room.  You couldn't feel any cold air coming out the vents though.  That night no one in our family slept well because it was just way too hot in our room, I couldn't open the sliding door

no housekeeping for entire stay  3 nights.   Front desk was aware of it, but didn't help .  WE didn't get any fresh towels or get trash emptied. No in room coffee ot tea. The Disney shuttle takes along time. Runs once in hour.

Our bed in our room was the most comfortable I have ever slept in. The room was clean and the staff was very friendly. The evening reception had a lot of choices in snacks and drinks. This will be our hotel we stay at from now on when we're in Anaheim!

My son and I spent a single night at this Embassy Suites in Anaheim.  Major construction is happening in the atrium area and it caused disruption to the breakfast in the morning.  Staff needs to pay more attention to ensure that the food does not run out and left that way for 15 minutes.  Hopefully this is just an issue during construction.

Great hotel north of Disneyland. Awesome staff. Wonderful quiet location. Nice pool and hottub. Regularly scheduled affordable transportation to Disneyland. Very satisfying breakfast and manager's evening reception.

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for business and family.
Summary: Excelente service, big rooms, hotel provided crib and extra blankets when needed. Very cozy and quiet. Will stay again with family and I will recommend to friends. Shuttle service to Disney very convenient.

Good service. Good breakfast. Facility in process of renovation. Standard exercise room with new equipment. Guests are a mix of business and Disney families. Rooms are quiet. Could not hear neighbors nor hall activities. Will be quite good when renovations are complete.

This hotel is under construction and is messy.  The carpet throughout the hotel is disgusting as they are not clean and have stains everywhere.  I would image they have let the carpets go since they will be replaced but for those staying in between it was gross.
Manager Response: Dear Mateo C.,  We are sorry that you did not enjoy your recent stay due to our ongoing renovations. Thank you for the valued feedback and we hope to welcome you back once our complete hotel upgrade is finished July 2017.  Best Regards,   Chris Jimerson Guest Service Manager Embassy Suites Anaheim North Chris.Jimerson@Hilton.com  714-618-9010

Summary: This location is being renovated so you may want to call and see if they are done. Also ask for a room on the side away from their noisy neighbor and one that has been recently renovated. I liked the availability of a dedicated shuttle to Disney.  A good value for 5.50 a day.

Air conditioning didn't work. Wont provide fans. Had to sleep with the balcony door open and hear the freeway noise all night. Supervisor was upset that I was asking for some type of compensation for the lack of services. Really bad experience.
Manager Response: Dear 897nereidah,  I am sorry that you found your recent stay to be uncomfortable. The challenges you experienced are not typical of our hotel and staff and I hope you reconsider giving us another opportunity to provide you with the services you deserve.  Best Regards,  Chris Jimerson Guest Service Manager Embassy Suites Anaheim North Chris.Jimerson@Hilton.com  714-618-9010

Summary: Although the hotel breakfast area (downstairs) was under renovations, the entire hotel felt so warm/hot that you would have thought the roof was missing. It felt cooler outside when we left the hotel than in our rooms or the interior. I'm somewhat hot-natured, but I could never cool off enough to stay asleep. Decor and updates were nice, but that A/C was a big issue for me.

If like noise at night stay here. Hotel shares parking lot with large nightclub so you hear cars and motorcycles at night. Your conversations can be heard through walls. took three tries to get check out date changed. Beds uncomfortable,floors dirty,
Manager Response: Dear 716windys,  I am sincerely sorry that you experienced noise disturbances during your recent stay. Providing a great travel experience is the goal of our hotel staff. We hope you reconsider giving us another opportunity to provide you with a stay that exceeds your expectations.  Best Regards,  Chris Jimerson Guest Service Manager Embassy Suites Anaheim North Chris.Jimerson@Hilton.com  714-618-9010

Summary: Front desk people are very helpful and nice. Housekeeping was very bad, my room had leftover bread pieces in the living and bedroom. The next day it was still there and they didn't sweep the hair off the bathroom floor.
Manager Response: I am so sorry you found your housekeeping services unsatisfactory. I can assure you that is not the standard in our hotel. We work hard to make sure our housekeepers keep each and every guest room and bathroom clean; my apologies. I hope you consider staying with us again. We strive to provide gracious, engaging and caring service and we’d love to have you as our guest to ensure you have the best travel experience ever.  Sincerely,  Chris Jimerson Guest Service Manager Embassy Suites Anaheim North Chris.Jimerson@Hilton.com  714-618-9010

Summary Heading: Great place to stay with the family.
Summary: Great place to stay with the family for the price. Hotel is located away from the busy tourist area.  The interior of the hotel is under construction but it should be completed in the next month or so.

Worst location.  Entire atrium area enclosed with plastic for construction.  Drunken fights in parking lot both nights. Food at evening reception was disgusting.  Complimentary breakfast was OK.  Dinner at restaurant convenient and better than expected

Summary Heading: Great Long Term Stay and Embassy Suites North Anaheim
Summary: I needed to book a hotel for a two month stay while on business in southern California.  Most people choose an extended stay hotel for a long stay, but I like Embassy Suites hotels, and this hotel had everything I needed for a business trip.  The hotel is going through a major renovation, so be prepared for work to be occurring during the normal work hours (8 to 5).  The area is blocked off and tented to keep dust and noise to a minimum.  I was aware of this construction before booking, and the hotel manager offered me a better rate in light of the construction and the long stay.  The hotel staff was superb, dealing with customers in a professional, friendly manner.  I did not have any issues during my two months, but when other customers had issues the staff seemed to deal with

Summary Heading: The worst dirty rooms Dance place shares the same parking area under construction  and the room that are done falling ap
Summary: I have been going there ten years and i was just there last year .The rooms were not clean and told manager he did nothing .The parking lot was shared with a Dance place so there was no parking there was construction  going on and we had to all eat almost on top of each other. The rooms had  been done and were falling apart it was the worst.

Summary Heading: Very disappointing with construction going full blast
Summary: Booked this property through Expedia and no mention of any renovation. Walked in and it's a full construction zone.  I asked the front desk about it. Agent replied it was Expedia's fault. Having worked in the industry, I know for a fact the hotel is responsible to make sure renovations are included in the Expedia hotel description, not the other way around.  So much for a nice relaxing trip. I would have to thank the ownership of this hotel for its greediness and misleading statements.  By the way, the hotel website is mentioning a "refresh of our atrium". That's full on construction, not a light "refresh".  Don't stay here. There is literally only highways and empty places around this hotel. Bad pick, my bad, never again.

Summary Heading: Construction makes place depressing. Good breakfast.
Summary: Don't pay $154+ per night during construction. It's not worth it. Breakfast is always good at the Embassy Suites. Remember it's the same day after day though. Here are my observations:   - Good: indoor pool (only one probably in Anaheim), breakfast (on the first day, 2nd day and on gets a bit repetitive), flexible cancellation policy without penalty during construction, FREE internet (probably during construction), recycling plant (if you have a kid who likes science, like I do), 2 separate rooms and 2 separate TVs.  - BAD: housekeeping (we were serviced once in 3 days even though we were gone for most of the day 9-3:30pm), musty smell in room (cannot open windows), some front desk personnel (needs to smile more) and bartender (needs to be more friendly during happy hour),

Fantastic complimentary breakfast with made to order omelettes.  Managers reception with wine was very much appreciated; they serve a great Chardonnay.  My kids loved the indoor pool.  Very clean rooms.  All this and a short drive to Disneyland.  I highly recommend this hotel.

This has been a good place to stay for many years. Major renovation of the center atrium is now in progress and should be completed by June.  They are working around the construction very well and the employees there are top notch. The restaurant has quality food at a reasonable price.  The included breakfast and nightly manager's reception are both excellent. The pool and spa are indoors and there is an attached gym.   The Disneyland shuttle is non-stop from this hotel too.

Poor quality hotel. No customer service.  I stayed 4 days. I was given one king instead of two queens. I was told there was going to be minor repair in the lobby. There was jack hammering and debis all over the place.  Shuttle driver was speeding and failed to stop at a train cross. I asked for help to change hotel or get a refund. Not one manager approached me in 4 days

Very friendly staff. Second stay at hotel consistent quality. Will stay again when in area. Excited to see the remodel of the atrium, it was all closed off when I was there in April. Evening reception is nice but a variety of food from night to night would be nice for a long 7 day stay.

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay even under construction
Summary: Large clean rooms, comfy beds, easily holds 1-6 people in a 2 queen bed suite with L-shaped couch for other guests, tasty made to order omelette bar with breakfast extras. Very accommodating staff. Free parking, and convenient location. If the hotel did not upgrade, you would have complainers that the hotel was outdated. We had minimum disruptions even though the entire middle section of hotel was plastic sheeted off from hotel visitors. We brought in outside dinner food to feed about 40 water polo players and their families and the hotel was able to accommodate our group in the breakfast area along with a seperate breakfast area for all our players and families to eat an early morning breakfast. Would definitely stay again!!!

It was great stay, was accommodated for what we needed. Service was good, room was clean, bathroooms were clean and re modeled. Had fun and will comeback in future. Employees were very helpful and understanding and provided anything we needed. This hotel will be my future stays for a long time. Convenient located, close to the freeway and to Angels stadium and Honda center.

Comfortable beds, clean rooms and free hearty breakfast. Construction in lobby is major. Entire center of hotel is covered with tarp. We were warned in advance but didn't realize magnitude. We had weekend stay no major construction noise. More of a visual nuisance. Hotel is within 10 min of eateries and entertainment. Popular Nightclub shares parking which can be inconvenient for late night arrivals. Overall would recommend hotel.

My daughter and I stayed here for her spring break vacation even though they were going through renovations, we still enjoyed our stay. The bed was very comfy with lots of pillows and we slept like babies! My daughter also enjoyed having our own living room so she can watch whatever she wanted on that t.v. while I watched my shows in the bedroom. Another one of our favorites is waking up for the breakfast buffet!  We will definitely be staying here again!

We had a very horrible experience at this hotel. Dirty bloody needles, along with ashy tin foil and a mirror were found by my son. Not the best way to start our Disneyland adventure.  The staff was very accommodating and moved us to another room.  The new room had fresh bloodstain on the shower curtain, urine on the toilet seat, a box of food on the bedroom floor and construction debris everywhere. Yes, we should have just moved to another hotel, but realistically, we would have spent over $2000 to do that. Bath towels were rough and crunchy as they are not so new.  The carpets were so filthy, my toddler's brand new light pink velvet shoes turned grey after 10 minutes of walking around.

I'll start with the best part. The breakfast was excellent.  The fresh made to order omelets were excellent.  The room was clean and comfortable.  We were in the back of the hotel and that is really where the problem is.  The neighbors are a vehicle junk yard that crushes and disposes of vehicles all day and all night.  We could clearly hear the beeping of vehicles all night long.  It kept us up and was generally annoying.  I wont stay here again.

Summary Heading: Too loud. Not suitable for kids
Summary: Due to construction, only freeway adjacent rooms are available. If you are used to sleeping in a quiet location, this is not the hotel for you. This is a cost efficient Location. The little guy like you and me who want to stay in a room for a single night is far outweighed by the incentive of renting out a banquet hall for the evening. The 11:00 pm quiet time is way too late if you have small children. They have a band playing in the banquet hall until 11:00pm. The noise literally fills the entire hotel. If your kids need to get to sleep before 11:00pm, find somewhere else to stay. Not a kid-friendly Disney land adjacent hotel.

This hotel is  a Disneyland adjacent facility so it is not conducive for business travelers. It is under construction at the moment until June so be ware that the entire center atrium/lobby is not accessible and is complete covered up so you look at a large white tarp from your balcony. Complimentary internet was useless and I needed to use personal data service for receiving emails on my phone.

Summary Heading: Loyal Hilton Member, Never Staying Again
Summary: I am a Hilton diamond member so I always try and stay with the brand to keep my status up but I will never stay here again... first, I had my girlfriends name added to the room but when she went to get a key they wouldn't let her even though I had already checked in and called and made sure she was on the room. The worst part was the room itself. It was impossible to turn on the air or fan in the room. I was sick with food poisoning and was not feeling well. I was unable to control any temperature in the room because apparently they do not allow heat or air conditioning if the outside temperature is between 50-70 degrees. No air, no heat and no fan. So you're stuck if you're freezing or sweating. The air in the room is musty and stale. You cannot open the window/door to the

Perpetually under construction.  And apparently business travelers avoid this place as it was packed with busses full of students. The room is a suite, but the bathroom is so small that your leg will touch the toilet while using the sink. Drive further and stay somewhere nicer for little price difference.

Summary Heading: Wait till the construction is completed.
Summary: Each staff member I encountered was courteous and professional. I would have appreciated being warned that the room I selected was directly above where construction was taking place the morning I checked out - which was the only morning I planned to sleep in. Had I been warned, it would have influenced my room selection. Also, I was unaware that the windows vibrated to the music of the nightclub this hotel shares a parking lot with. Although I liked the upgrades of the room, I did not have a comfortable stay this (second) time around. I may have to consider selecting a different hotel during my next visit to Anaheim - at least until the construction is completed.

Summary Heading: Terrible Hotel worst Embassy Suites I have ever stayed in
Summary: This hotel is not only under construction there is plastic and dust everywhere but it's next to a nightclub so there is no parking and Security Guys from the club everywhere. Service was absolutely terrible. And the staff was uncooperative. I have probably stayed in 20 Embassy Suites over the years and never encountered anything like this period also be where it is almost 7 miles away from Disneyland.

Had a great stay at the Embassy Suites North.  Although the atrium was undergoing renovations, the breakfast and managers evening reception were well done and delightful.  The staff was great.  Only wish was that the tiles in the hot tub were a little cleaner.

This brand of hotel is quite good with their service and accommodations, I think the construction may have interfered with their level of performance.  I would give them another try once the construction/remodel is complete.

This hotel was wonderful to stay in. About 15 min from Disney. Retail stores available within a 5 mile radius. The front desk was very helpful. Bartender guy did not look happy to serve happy hour customers. A bartending lady was very friendly.  The room itself was good, perhaps a bit aged. But clean, big and comfy.  The beds were amazingly comfortable.  Atrium was being remodeled, but did not cause any issues.

Horrible experience! The room had wet sticky floors! The phones did not work! The smoke detector was hanging off the wall! There were gnats and mosquitoes flying in the room! The room was too warm and had a funky smell! I don't recommend this place!

I rate all 5's, we stayed here for our Disneyland trip, best sleep I've ever had at a hotel, the breakfast was delicious and the cocktail happy hour was nice too! The staff was all very nice and accommodating. We will return for our future vacations.

Price of hotel was a little bit to high due to hotel is under construction. During our stay my husband had horrible allergies due to all the dust. Over all we enjoyed our stay beside my husband. this is the only embassy suites we stay at while traveling to Anaheim with the family because is remodeled and clean . Breakfast is fantastic !

Summary Heading: The construction site was ok to deal with it, but the club's next door patrons were to much.
Summary: Some sort of police authority figure must look out when they exit to ensure and keep some sort of sense of security.  The location, affordability, and staff professionalism makes you reconsider to come back.

great hotel-- even going through remodel and construction the staff made it comfortable and nice. great value- eve. reception each night and we had dinner each night at the hotel was excellent- great value and food was great. cooked hot breakfast was awesome and substantial selection and quantity. Free parking free hot breakfast-  hilton honors free wifi and eve. reception made for  great stay and for folks on a budget ? Made it even better- only 10 min. from D.L.

Our family had just come from a stay at a Disneyland hotel and we needed to extend our stay to visit a sick relative so stayed at Embassy Suites.  Our experience was delightful and we all wished we had stayed at Embassy during our Disneyland visit instead of the overpriced and not as enjoyable Disneyland hotel.  Staff was attentive to our every need and the complimentary breakfast and evening reception were so welcoming.

Embassy Suites was very welcoming, staff was gracious and helpful. Hotel was under construction and was still a satisfying experience.  All amenities were available. I stayed in one of the newly remodeled rooms; it was excellent.

The food and service was all great, very clean room. We stayed with our family here while we went to Disneyland, was worth the money all the way. There was a club next door, music was going till about 1:30 - 2am, not the best when you have had a long day. Other then that great hotel.

Sure, it's undergoing a remodel...  That's desperately needed.  Our room stank, the front door was hard to open.  The shower door didn't close.  The door to the outdoor balcony was nailed shut and the windows filthy.

We usually stay at Embassy suites south but decided to book the North hotel for the price difference and free parking. It's definitely worth being a 10 min drive from Disney. They offer the same amenities and are currently updating all of the areas. Although the managers social hour was a little disappointing in the snacks and items for kids that we usually get, overall it was a good stay.   Beds are comfy, areas are clean and the staff is friendly.

The location, the service and the comfort is superior to most hotels. The rooms are very spacious and having a refrigerator and microwave, it was home away from home. I especially liked the free breakfast that included hot, cold and an omelet bar...can't beat that. All that and a free happy hour!

Summary Heading: Great Stay.  Restful Experience given our family had to spend 10 hours per day at a nearby hospital.
Summary: Great Stay.  Restful Experience given our family had to spend 10 hrs. per day at a nearby hospital. Knowing that we would be coming back to the hotel at the end of the day was the thing that got us through a very stressful experience.  As a sidebar, if you travel to Maui try the Embassy Suites there, they have a top-flight staff who can provide a wonderful experience-also it's located close to a golf course.

We stayed at the Embassy Suites for close to six weeks due to a water leak at our residence, the hospitality of the caring staff made our stay very enjoyable.  The food is excellent and Celso, one of our cooks was especially accommodating and pleasant every morning.  If you stay here do try to stay on the side of the hotel away from the freeway as it was quite noisy at times.  But other than that we would gladly spend more time at this Embassy Suites.

Stayed with family for a Disney trip.  Was very happy with the DIRECT shuttle to the park - and the amazing breakfast.  Hotel is under construction, so not as beautiful as usual - but still worth the price.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Would definitely stay here again.  Loved how large the two room suite was!
