I had to stay in this area for a very important exam. So when I checked in I specially requested a quiet room because I needed a good night sleep (all rooms should be quiet anyway right?). When I got to the first room the smell of cigarettes was horrible and the room was facing the highway. So I requested another room which they gave without a problem. The second room didn't smell bad. At first it was ok. But later there was a loud noise from the air conditioner main machine outside,  plus the highway, plus the car dismantling plant next door. So the worst sleeping I have ever experienced in a hotel.  Also, the hotel is under renovations, which they should announce before you book it.  The breakfast wasn't good with low quality products.  I don't recommend this hotel.

As you can see from the pictures, the hot tub looked like nasty dirty bath water with hair and debris floating in it. The pool was slimy, the atrium was not available and closed for construction, the carpets were dirty with stains and construction debris on them. I paid for the King suite which was about 500 for two nights, should have just stayed at a motel 6 and saved a bunch of money.

Had a very good time like always excellent service from the staff like always hotel is always in good shape food is great drinks and appetizers are always good rooms are the best pools are clean bathrooms clean and smell good

Great experience! I will recommend this Hotel to all my friends and family visiting this area! When we stayed at this hotel, the hotel lobby is under construction, but the staff keep the area accessible to what we needed. That you for great service.

I have nothing bad to say about this place.  Our family of 5 stayed for 10 day over Christmas/New Years.  The staff was lovely and helpful.  The breakfast with made to order omelets was amazing.  There was plenty of seating as they opened another room to accommodate for the sold out hotel at this busy time of year.  Staff kept the food stocked and fresh.  The manager's reception was lovely every night.  Had hummus, pita, chips, veggies etc.  Free alcoholic beverages.  State law says only two at a time, but you can get back into line after you finish them and get another two later.  Bartender even made me a special drink once when I hesitated as to what to order asking "what type of drink do you like?"  I said sweet and sour and he made me some amazing concoction.  Extremely

Was there for a few days for a work function, beautiful, clean suites.  All of the food we had from the complimentary breakfast to the sit down dinner was excellent.  Free drinks and snacks during Happy Hour 5:30-7:30 every day :-).  Hoping our company holds another function here, we have about 3 a year.

Embassy Suites Anaheim is the way to go if you're looking for a Disney getaway or Orange Country location! Comfortable and classy suite. Great staff on board - very helpful and attentive. Loved the complimentary breakfast. We also enjoyed the bar!

When I book this hotel I was looking for complementary breakfast, free parking, and shuttle to Disneyland. Found all three and it was perfect.  Usually  when we stay in a hotel it's just to sleep but we had a few hours when we got there and we were able to enjoy the swimming pool and the evening reception. Both were so relaxing and such a nice surprise.  We didn't want to go out so we just ordered the restaurants pizza and it was delicious !!  Love the spacious rooms. The hotel breakfast was great too.

It is impossible to provide optimum service when all your facilities are not in good working order. This puts an additional burden to try to explain deficiencies and then the guest must graciously accept service less than what the brand normally provides. Your customer base will always be with you, so why not show your appreciation for their understanding by discounted rates during periods of stay when optimum service is not available.

This is my second stay at this hotel. The hotel is beautiful and so conveniently located next to the rental car returns. The service is excellent. My only complaint is that both times I have stayed here the tubs were gross. Visible soap scum and looked like it hadn't been scrubbed in...forever!

Not fair to rate this hotela s they are going through some major renovations.  The rooms were large, service personnel excellent, very good full service breakfast with made to order omelets, scrambled eggs, bacon, waffles, fruit, yogurt hot and cold cereal.

So I generally don't like to bash a hotel, but some things need to be mentioned. Embassy Suites prides itself in its cooked to order breakfast and I know when you are in the middle of a remodel things can get turned around, however when you offer waffles on a weekend and then have no syrup, you should just not offer them. Honey on your waffle doesn't cut it for most and I see it as a complete waste of food. I saw so many people get waffles from the buffet and when they found out there was no syrup they didn't eat them. You should've posted a sign or better yet offered whipped cream and strawberries or bananas or other toppings or just not offered them. This wasn't the only thing your blankets for the sofa beds were absolutely appalling, old, hard, stained, shedding. Yours

Stayed recently at Embassy Suites North Anaheim..Clean comfortable rooms, awesome indoor pool and jacuzzi..spend most of my time there..Kids did too..  Complimentary breakfast was really great..something for everyone...near movies, shopping, Disneyland and other attractions right off the freeway..great location..  Take your family and enjoy!

I gave this hotel a 3 rather than 2 rating because their staff is fantastic. The majority of the downstairs is being renovated and inaccessible to the public. There was a slight chemical smell when you enter the lobby but it wasn't noticeable in the room. My room, on the 7th floor, was older and in need of some updating but it didn't impact my stay. What did impact my stay was being unable to adjust the heat/cold function in my room. Apparently, the entire hotel is only able to heat or cool, one at a time. I was not able to put the heat on in my room and so I was pretty uncomfortable for the 4 days I stayed. The light in the bathoom worked  during the day but in the middle of the night, it didn't work consistently. The final issue I had, and probably difficult to manage, 4

Whenever I come to Anaheim, I always stay at this hotel. The staff is exceptional, the experience at the hotel is unbelievable, and the food is incredible. I will always stay at this hotel it is convenient to where I need to go it's right near highways to get me in and out of LA. Well done Embassy Suites Anaheim North!!

Summary Heading: Older Hotel going through Reno - Great find.
Summary: My family of four stayed here for 3 nights.  I didn't realize they were in the middle of construction, but it really didn't effect our stay much.  The room was a spacious king suite with a sectional sofa (queen pull out) and a kitchenette.  Outside of the room, you could tell that this is a pretty old hotel (old windows, trim, paint, uneven/bouncy floor in places.  Breakfast, internet and parking were included.  Breakfast consisted of typical continental/hotel breakfast items (Yogurt, cereal, waffles, toast, bagels, etc.), but also included a made to order omelet station.  Initially, I was very excited about this, until I saw that they used latex gloves to prepare everything.  At that point, I realized that I wouldn't be able to eat anything do to a latex allergy.  (Come on

The hotel was obviously in need of renovations. We did observe that the process had begun with the lobby area. I stayed in room 635, the restroom's baseboard was dirty and in need of replacement, the toilet handle was worn out and in need of replacement, the bathroom cabinets were worn and also needed to be replaced. The room was neat upon our arrival. I wanted to leave and seek accommodations at the Embassy Suites South in Anaheim, CA, however, the funds in our banking institution had a hold for the 3 night stay we had planned, so we were forced to remain at the hotel. I don't recall if I could hear the vehicle traffic, commercial trucks backing up, or emergency vehicles sirens at the Embassy Suites South, but I could definitely hear all of this from room 635. Our first night
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and we’re very sorry you were unhappy with our two-room suites.  We will take your comments under consideration as we continually work to improve our guest experience.

Summary: Great place tucked away from the maddening crowd of the park and the Hilton convention center.  Service on par for the chain, rooms clean and well maintained.  Staff was great and knowledgable about the area and places to eat, etc.

The front personnel were very friendly and accomodating, food was great, the room was very spacious.  Very close to my US parent office.  A quick check-in and check-out.  Other than the construction, the stay was great

Not at all the normal Embassy Suite.. it's old , dated, smelled and was terrible.. under construction and noisy, poor ventilation and no heat/air control.  Old bed, drab, and everything was generic.  On the hotel TV the ad was describing the Gormet Coffee and tea selections, and the only tea bags were Lipton and NO Lemon or Honey, they ran out of coffee too
Manager Response: I am sorry to hear that we did not meet your expectations and that your perception of our hotel has been tarnished. This is certainly not our goal as we are in the process of enhancing our hotel for our guests. I assure you that we will take all of your feedback seriously and will use this as an opportunity for improvement. We hope that after our Hotel enhancement project that you will consider staying with us again so we can show you what our hotel is truly made of. Thank you for your feedback!

Summary: It was the perfect place for our Disneyland trip.  They have a designated shuttle, free full breakfast, a managers reception in the evening, and the rooms are more than comfortable.  We are very picky about our beds and these were awesome.

Hotel was under renovation.  Room was dirty.  I have stayed in many ES this was by far the most basic and in need of renovation.  The hotel staff was friendly.  The hotel can be noisy and is a significant distance from convention center and attractions.  They offer a shuttle to DL but charge for the service.  Hotel was pricy for the condition it was in.  The rooms need major renovation and to upgrade techology.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We greatly appreciate your feedback and we sincerely apologize for the disappointment with your stay. We will be sure to take your comments about our property under consideration as we re-evaluate guest needs and continually work to improve our guest experience. We hope that after our Hotel enhancement project that you will consider staying with us again so we can show you what our hotel and team are truly made of.

Summary: Newly remodeled modern rooms with comfortable beds.  My kids loved the indoor pool/spa but wished pool had been a bit warmer.  The breakfast was great with many choices including made-to-order eggs.  The only reason I would not stay here again is because it's too far from Disneyland.  It took us 20 mins. to get there.

Dried bloody booger on drape; housekeeping did not come and then woke us the next morning at 8:20am; heater not allowed to go over a certain temp; water gushing from tap for ages after showers; TV ridiculously small; no response to room service calls; requested space heater and no response after 30 minutes, called again and still took another 30 min; half size pillows, not even standard size. Maybe understaffed or just unresponsive.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback of your recent stay with us. We sincerely apologize for the housekeeping issues that you experienced; our hotel works hard to ensure the comfort and satisfaction of our guests and we are very sorry that we did not meet your expectations. I hope that if you travels bring you back to the area that you will consider staying with us again and give us a chance to make it right.

Summary: I can say we got the most of what we paid for in this hotel. Price is not that expensive but the place is outstanding! Service everywhere is excellent, the staff is really friendly, and the rooms are very clean.

We stayed in this hotel for 3 days and it was perfect! It is about 5 minutes away from Disney, and there are restaurants nearby if you want to eat out.  The room is really spacious and very clean, they have friendly staff, and the breakfast buffet is superb! We loved it! If you don't have a car, they have shuttles that will stop by in the hotel and can take you around the city! Overall our stay is wonderful!

I loved the feeling you get when you come into Embassy Suites. The water falls and food are fantastic. The bedrooms are immaculate and wifi is free. Great Ambiance. Thank you for making our stay not only professional but also felt at home.

Great indoor environment that make is very fun to hang out outside and not being cold or hot, or swim indoor swimming pool. Excellent Breakfast, variety choices of breakfast to fulfill anyone's needs. We went with groups of a basketball team and kids had a blast time.

We stay here every time we go to Disneyland. We love the atmosphere and my kids love the fake lion on top of the rock. All of their rooms are 2 rooms so the kiddos can sleep in the hide away bed in the couch. They are clean not like the other roach motels near dland.  Reasons why we choose this hotel is because of their breakfast. Its pretty big and decent. They have an omlet station and a buffet plus small breakfast items like yogurt and fruit. Every time we are here their breakfast lines tend to be super long but we go at peak time. We are not early risers so its extremely crowded when we eat. They always manage to have everything full and people moving. For those wanting to go to Disneyland catch an uber (which tends to be cheaper for my family of 4) or hop on the bus they

If you are taking your family to the attractions in the Anaheim area, this hotel is perfectly located with free parking.  The rooms are ok and the hotel is kind of dirty, but I did not expect a lot at this price.  The website says it was recently renovated.  I cannot imagine what it looked like before    The indoor pool was a great feature though it was CHILLY by indoor pool standards.  My child loves pools and could not stay in very long.  It was too cold.  I was quite disappointed with the staff.  The Front Desk was the worst of all departments - no sense of hospitality, genuine attention or personality.  They were very transactional.  I have stayed at similar caliber hotels where the Front Desk staff is great.  The quality of the hotel should not determine how helpful the

Great location. Breakfast is delicious just know on weekends it doesn't start until 7am so we often miss it due to activities in the morning. We also missed the evening reception due to timing. Love the lobby and the staff is friendly.

Excellent experience. Staff was very nice and room was very comfortable. Food was fairly priced as well as drinks. Hotel was perfect location for my trip needs. Overall experience was great and I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

I generally stay at Embassy Suites when I travel.If you are specifically visiting for Disneyland it is worth paying a little extra to stay at a closer hotel. The shuttle to Disneyland while direct only picks up on the hour. Disney is 30 minutes away. This Embassy shows wear and tear. Blankets are old,bathroom light only comes on with a fan and towels are scratchy. We called for an extra blanket and had to call again after two hours of waiting. If you get a room on the southeast side you face a junkyard and hear the forklifts. The parking lot is shared with a strip club. Easy to get on and off the freeway if you need to go to Irvine etc. Breakfast was tasty and service was pretty good except for the blanket debacle.

We had a very good stay.  We stayed at this location for a week, and found it to be centrally located which was great!  We went to Disneyland, Hollywood, Beverly Hills, Knotts, Orange etc... The staff was fabulous! The breakfast & cocktail hour was an awesome perk!

Would recommend this hotel to everyone. Very convenient location to Disney land and shopping. Excellent Breakfast and evening happy hour reception. Kids enjoyed swimming pool & zacuzzi. Ample and safe parking lot.

We were pleasantly surprised with this hotel, especially after reading some of the bad reviews. We were greeted by a young man who checked us in quickly, he was helpful and informative. We had dinner at the Bistro and enjoyed it very much. Marla was fantastic! She was friendly and efficient. We loved the evening reception with the drinks (beer and sangria) that we were able to take with us to dinner. Other family members joined us later in the evening and Juan, the bartender, was outstanding. He stayed open a little later, so that we could place our order and take drinks to our room. Everyone was courteous and professional throughout our stay. Our room was clean and updated. The beds were very comfortable and the room was quiet. The breakfast with the made-to-order omelets was

Hotel is overall great. They are nice and the rooms are really nice. We had a couple minor issues with the sink draining slow, fridge not working and the pool being closed but other than that the hotel is great.

Summary Heading: Very dirty, don't be fooled by their profile pictures.
Summary: The pictures of this hotel made it look very nice. Unfortunately, it looks like all of their budget goes into their courtyard and not the rooms. Our room had lots of spider webs right above the beds, the carpet was dirty (could easily tell on our clean socks), was fraying all over, the tub had a constant water leak, there was hair in the tub that wasn't ours, and that pretty much sums up the room. It felt very dirty to be in there.   They don't honor the hilton honors check in, as I had checked in the day prior and selected a room for a 4pm check in. When I got there around 6/630 the check in clerk acted like she had never checked in someone before. It took around 15 minutes to get the keys. They assigned a different room because the other one hadn't been cleaned yet. The whole
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us during your recent visit to the area. We apologize for our missteps in comfort and cleanliness, as well as the difficulties you experienced during check in. It is certainly not consistent with the standards we set for ourselves at the Embassy Suites Anaheim North. We appreciate you bringing these issues to our attention so we are able to use this as a training opportunity for improvement in the future.

Summary: Normally we love the Embassy brand by Hilton, though I do not recommend this particular property.  There are several other ES properties in the Anaheim area we stayed at & recommend those.  The food & beverage people were horribly rude, impatient & condescending. Room upon check in was hot & stuffy & we were told the hotel was in "neutral mode", and there was nothing they could do. We could only open the slider a couple of inches for fresh air.  Tables & chars in the room were dirty, wity crumbs & food all over them.  Flatware at breakfast was frequently dirty & caked with food.
Manager Response: We are terribly sorry to hear that there were so many challenges with your recent stay and that you felt you were treated rudely.  Please know that this is not typical of our hotel and staff, and we are sorry we didn’t meet your expectations during your stay.  We always strive to provide excellent service and a great clean hotel for our guests.  I assure you that we will take all of your feedback seriously and will use this as a training opportunity for improvement in the future. We hope you will consider staying with us again soon so we may have the opportunity to show you the wonderful service that we are known for.

Summary: Had a very nice stay for a surprise vacation. First visit to Disney with the grand kids.  Great place to stay with family and grandchildren, free made to order breakfast was the best part.   Staff was very attentive, rooms were clean, and free parking.

Although check in was at 4:00, my room was not ready until approximately 4:25 p.m.  The receptionist was very apologetic, but this appears to be a management issue. There was confusion as to what the delay was. As I was waiting, other guests appeared to be having similar issues. The receptionist was doing her best to assist.  The food was good, but felt rushed with breakfast shutting down at 9:00, especially when we're on vacation.  Happy hour was nice. The male bartender seemed a bit unhappy, not a people's person. The lady however was great. She kept the snacks going and assisted the bartender. She was friendly and made guests feel welcomed.  Overall, we were satisfied, with a few opportunities to take service from good to great. God bless!

We loved this hotel. Our only issue was they did mess up our adjoining rooms and put us apart and one wasn't ready at check-in. They breakfast was amazing. We were spoiled on food. The managers reception was drinks and snacks such as pita bread, chips and salsa and veggies. The bedrooms were in the back of the room which made it quiet at night. Rooms were clean.

Summary Heading: Embassy Suites with 2 queens instead of 2 doubles? YES!
Summary: I know many of the 3.5 to 4 star properties in the US offer a king or 2 double beds, but it needs to stop. I am bigger than most travelers but double beds are just too small for adults to share. I am so glad I found an Embassy with queens.  For Disneyland, do not use this property if you plan to return often to the room on multiple days. It is not a short trip. It looks close on a map but there is no direct route and it's 15-20 mins.  The sleep was great with comfortable beds. The value was above average because they can't compete with the Harbor/Katella properties on convenience. The eating was excellent as Embassy Suites properties usually are. The room was good enough with zero complaints.

Summary Heading: By far the worst Hilton stay
Summary: The front desk staff was rude, argumentative and unapproachable.  Room was dirty and cabinetry was falling apart. The sheets were stained and dirty. Upon check in, empty food bags lying on floor from previous guest.
Manager Response: We are very sorry we were not able to provide you with the quality of services you deserved during your recent stay with us. We are always looking for ways to improve our guest experience as your satisfaction is very important to us. We will be sure to take your comments about our property under consideration as we re-evaluate guest needs and continually work to improve our guest experience.  Thank you again for your feedback. We hope you will consider staying with us again soon so we may have the opportunity to make it right.

Summary: The location and quality was very good. Breakfast was crowded and there was a long line at the omelet bar. But, variety a quality of food was very good. Had a little trouble with the room key when we first arrived, but the problem was solved.

We loved our stay at this hotel. We did have a slight issue getting the internet to connect but other than that it was great. Breakfast was fantastic, especially since we went to the park each day and saved on food due to a nice large breakfast. I would recommend this hotel.

The place is beautifully done. The free drinks @ happy hour were great but the free breakfast was amazing, with eggs any style and all the fixins you would want: Coffee, Juice, Tea, Bacon, Sausage, Potatoes, Oatmeal, Fruit, Toast, etc, etc, etc.

Great accommodations. Hotel interior is beautiful. Can't beat manager's reception and hot breakfast. The room was very spacious and clean. Will definitely stay again and recommend to family and friends.

Enjoyed a beautiful clean room. Fresh towels and a clean bed. The room was excellent.The front office brought me  fan as I need it for the white noise to fall asleep. The room was quiet and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was extremely clean and the water pressure was excellent. All great qualities to have when looking ofr a hotel.

I stayed with my family of 4. We spent a lot of time in Disneyland. This hotel was a perfect addition to our stay. Very nice clean room accommodating us at every turn. The breakfast is always good and a good first stop each morning. We had a wonderful stay and excellent service from the staff.

Wonderful hotel.  We love it for all our Anaheim trips.  The indoor pool is great for the winter.  The kids love being able to go to the pool.  And of course I am in the hot tub.  New fish in the pond.  We love sitting out watching the the kids look for the turtles and such.  The managers reception is great.  So nice to be able to relax the night before a big trip to Knotts or Disneyland.  Kids love it.

This hotel must have been an old Granada Royale because it is massive! It has a huge atrium that goes up 8 floors and a an open airy feel on the inside. The rooms (suites) are super spacious with a living room/sitting with a pull out sleeper sofa are and a separate bedroom that has a comfortable bed. The really neat bonus of staying here was that they have an evening reception that features a nice selection of nibbles & drinks and a cooked to order breakfast in the morning. Be aware that the property share its parking lot with a nightclub next door so it fills up after 9:00.

Once we arrived we notice we were next a nightclub which I thought was funny as this suppose to be a family hotel. Our first room we came to the AC water leaked to the floor with a bad odor. Move to the next room where the bathroom sink overflow to the floor! The breaksfast was not cooked correctly and fresh. For the price we paid and location we will not be returning back
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We are sorry that the club adjacent to the Hotel was a challenge for you during your stay and that your perception of our hotel has been tarnished. We also apologize for the issues encountered in your room and at breakfast. We take feedback seriously and we’re working with our team to ensure the situations don’t happen again. We hope to have the opportunity to serve you again so we can show you a positive experience.

Summary: With free parking, convenient shuttle to Disneyland available for a small fee, many option free breakfast and fabulous staff, this is a great place to stay.  The interior atrium is beautiful, and loved the evening reception with free drinks and snacks.

The hotel is lovely and the staff were nice enough. However, because of the temperature in my room, we will never stay here again. The idea that a guest cannot choose the temperature in their own room is completely unacceptable. When we arrived for our stay our room was ridiculously warm. When I went to go turn on the fan and AC I was greeted by a sign that informed me that our only option (because it was cold outside) was heat. As a result, we didn't sleep well our entire trip. I did not complain to the front desk because there was nothing they could do since this is the policy in every room. (I assume.) It was far too hot to sleep and I woke up with a splitting headache our second day. If a guest wants it to be cooler in their room when it is cold outside, they should be able
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and we’re very sorry you were unhappy with the temperature of our two-room suites. We will take your comments under consideration as we continually work to improve our guest experience.

Summary: Free breakfast was great.  Omelettes for adults.  Cereal for the kids and everything in between.  Ample parking.  Friendly staff.  10-ish minute drive from Disneyland.  Great affordable option for visiting Disneyland Resort.  Rooms are huge and clean.    A great place to stay if you have a car.

This hotel group always provides a comfortable home away from home.  The suite was spacious providing nice amenities, helpful staff, complimentary breakfast with fresh omelettes and conveniently located for an event we were attending.  Couldn't ask for more.

Summary Heading: Nice place but showing its age
Summary: Nice place, good bed, small old tv, gym equipment old and falling apart. If you have a problem don't expect them to get fixed.   Evening reception is nice. Free drinks and snacks.   Workout area has 2 treadmills, elliptical, bike and weights. Treadmills slip and elliptical isn't real smiitg. Tvs fuzzy on all equipment and only a couple channels.

Very convenient. Great breakfast. The waterfall was nice to sit by. Fit my family of 6 great. Close to Disneyland and shopping. Right off freeway. Great for family reunions. No need to purchase a timeshare when you have these to stay in!

All in all, a nice evening and morning. The free reception left a little to be desired. We were already seated at the bar and had drinks prior to the free reception beginning. Apparently, a line forms at the other end. The bartender spent most of his time servicing the folks wanting free drinks. We were left with empty glasses and finally went to a nearby restaurant.

We were totally looking forward to our family vacation and the first day we got there my car window was broken into. Our purpose of this trip was to visit Disneyland the shuttle service could have been a little better. I think they need more shuttles and need to come more frequently. We've stayed at this hotel in the past and LOVED it so not sure what was going on.

Summary Heading: Standard Embassy Suites With All The Amenities
Summary: This embassy is out on its own compared to all the hotels a few miles away near Disneyland. Even with that, it was still busy.  I had checked in online before I got there so I took a room on the 7th floor.  I checked in and with my Hilton Honors Gold I got my 2 bottles of water and the normal note from the hotel manager.  The room was the standard 2 room suite.  This is always nice as it is quite in the back of the room.  The flat screen tv was rather small for the size of the room. Maybe 32".  The only real difference with the room compared to other Embassy Suites was the bathroom was in the back room instead of between the rooms.  I was in bed at 10pm and then I heard all this loud sounds as if there was guns being shot.  I quickly remembered I was near Disneyland and it was

Summary Heading: Good staff Roach problem in some rooms
Summary: Stayed 3 days two rooms and another associate stayed in another room. 2 rooms out of three had roaches.  Tile floor was sticky upon arrival, towel hooks kept falling off. Poor maintenance can not control AC or heat well.

We enjoyed the evening appetizers and complementary wine. For the most part the staff was very helpful and nice. The breakfast was great.  I just had trouble with checking in and getting my credit card refunded at check out time.

I'd definitely stay at this hotel again. The staff were friendly and the rooms were clean and spacious. I also enjoyed the complimentary breakfast and happy hour. This was a great stay and I'd definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends!

Great for families but need to drive to Disneyland.  Too far away to see fireworks.  Super comfy beds.  Breakfast can get really busy and they run out of tables and food.  Elevators are slow.  Friendly staff.

Had ongoing issues with my key cards during my two week stay on business on almost a daily basis which was very frustrating and inconvenient. Problem was never resolved. Staff kept telling me I must have a phone or magnets in my pocket which were affecting the keys. I've never had this problem before at other hotels. Also, had to hold handle down on toilet so it would flush. Definitely in need of some upgrading throughout.  As with what you would expect from an Embassy Suites, the evening reception, restaurant/food quality and breakfast were all pretty good. Staff was also nice, although they failed to ever resolve my key issue and never offered anything for my inconvenience, other than an apology and a suggestion to check for items in my pockets that could be affecting the

Summary Heading: Ideal Location for a Romantic Disney-themed Getaway
Summary: My fiance and I stayed at the property for a couple days while vacationing in California and were surprised and delighted by the experience. The staff constantly went above and beyond our expectations and the facilities were excellent. We were able to take a convenient shuttle too and from Disney, and the hotel's close proximity to the expressway made traveling to LA as painless as possible for staying in Anaheim. Breakfast every morning was great and we even stopped at the bar one night for drinks and snacks. Couldn't recommend this hotel enough to prospective travelers.
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review! We are so glad we could provide such a delightful experience for you and your fiance. We are also happy to hear you were able to take full advantage of our ART shuttle and complimentary cooked-to-order breakfast. We hope to see you in the near future and thank you again for your feedback and valued business.

Summary: Just awful breakfast. Simply terrible. Too many people, not enough food, not good quality food. Coffee was made with used grounds several times that I saw! So it was colored hot water. All bread products were old and stale. Rooms are fine but sofa bed was very uncomfortable. The sofa should just be another bed if a comfortable sofa bed is not possible.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We are sorry to hear we failed to meet your expectations! We will be sure to address each area you found issue with, to ensure a better guest experience in the future. We do appreciate your time in reviewing us and hope you will consider staying with us again in the future.

Summary Heading: Great staff. Good price for everything you get.
Summary: The staff at this hotel were excellent. Booked this hotel for our Disneyland stay. They offer direct shuttle to the park for a small charge. The staff did everything they could to accommodate us and make our experience great. It is very kid friendly. The pool and spa area were nice but it was slippery for all the kids even the adults. Overall it was a great plane to stay and I would definitely recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Thanks for this awesome review! We are so happy to hear our staff provided you with excellent service. We love providing great accommodations for families to make even greater memories, so we hope to see you again to relive the fun! Thanks again for the review and for your valued business.

Summary: Not very impressed. We have stayed at several Embassy Suites and this location was not as impressive as others. We have had phenomenal stays at other places so we had high expectations. I feel as though it was not as clean as others, and the service was not as expected. Overall, it was an average stay that we had. The complimentary breakfast was okay, and the price was good for the weekend we were there. Again, nothing extraordinarily special, just average.

Yes, I know it's a bit of a drive to Disneyland. But the quality of accommodations and the free breakfast and lack of nickel and dime charges makes this place worth staying at.  We love having a suite rather than a simple hotel room for our family.  And the breakfast is a big cost saver.

I usually will never complain about little things that I expect to find at any hotel but this stay was very frustrating. Several days of no maid service. Issues with bathroom. The wardrobe was not secured to the wall and fell over on me when I was getting up from using the safe. The biggest complaint is the safety issue with the wardrobe. If it was me I would have maintenance fixed this issue ASAP. I was shocked it was not resolved. I bet its still in that condition. Great hotel if you have a family going to Disney but if you are on business stay clear!
Manager Response: We are terribly sorry to hear that there were so many challenges with your recent stay and that we did not meet your expectations.  We always strive to provide excellent service and a clean, well-maintained hotel for our guests.  I assure you that we will take all of your feedback seriously and will use this as a training opportunity for improvement in the future.  Thank you again for your feedback.  Kristiana N.

Summary: So the hotel it self was pretty nice, the rooms (we stayed in 2) have some areas that are great and other things need fixed in a big way.  So the vents in the room rattled, shower head dripped all night (both rooms), the sofa bed was broken(1st room), the toilet paper holder(both rooms) wouldn't even let the toilet paper roll, the shower curtain rod was broken so the curtain would not stay closed, towel service was hit or miss when we called for towels. But those items are not the biggest complaint that I had.  Next door is some kind of recycling plant, which had LOUD tractors moving about with loud back up alarms, and they started working at 5:00am, on the dot every morning even on the weekends.  I complained to the front desk 3 of the 4 nights we were there and they were very
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide the Hotel with your feedback. We are saddened to hear that your recent stay did not meet your expectations. We truly feel that "feedback is a gift" that allows us opportunities to best take care of our guests. We will be sure to take your comments about our property under consideration as we re-evaluate guest needs and continually work to improve our guest experience. We hope you will consider staying with us again the next time your travels bring you to our area.

Summary: This Hotel has a lot of potential. It needs a little TLC and it would be awesome. Front Desk people are awesome. They went out of their way to make our stay better The suite was big and spacious. It does need a little upgrading. One of the Elevators wasn't working so that caused a little stress. We were on the 7th floor. The grounds can use a little more grooming. The breakfast was very good many items to choose from. I would definitely stay again because of the location. It is close to everything. easy access to freeways. Just a few minutes from Disneyland, angel stadium, Honda Center. Internet was included. With a little TLC I would give this hotel 5 stars
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review, Dominic! We are so glad you were able to take full advantage of our complimentary cooked-to-order breakfast and our location. We will definitely take your suggestions into consideration as we are constantly looking to improve our Hotel and guest experiences. Thank you for your feedback and for your valuable business.

Summary: Overall experience is good or above average. Price paid for room is not worth what was offered. Hotel itself is very dated but it is clean. Staff is very helpful and awesome. Wifi is does not work in bedroom but are very strong in living room. Would recommend this place if it had not been the price.

I will start by saying I got a full refund for my visit, but I will never be back. When we checked in, the room stunk horribly. It smelled like sewage, or something. The bathroom smelled like mildew. Every time the A/C kicked on, there would be a different disgusting smell. During the night, I went out to sleep on the sofa bed, and there was a horrible smell. It smelled like rotten food (I thought). Got up in the morning, and my husband used his fingernail to scrape MOLD from the shower. I asked him to go check out the bed, and when he pulled back the sheets to get to the mattress, we found a plastic cover that had holes in it, and when he looked at the stain on the mattress pad and sheets it was WET URINE!!! I have never been so disgusted in my entire life. Abbi came up to our
Manager Response: We are terribly sorry to hear that there were so many challenges with your recent stay.  We always strive to provide excellent service and a great clean hotel for our guests and we apologize for not being able to provide that for you on this trip.  I assure you that we will take all of your feedback seriously and will use this as a training opportunity for improvement in the future.

Summary: I have stayed at this hotel many of times. The rooms are nice and updated. The only negative is there's a nightclub in the same parking lot as the hotel. You tend to hear the music from it at night. I would recommend staying on the opposite end of the lobby if you're a light sleeper. This is not the hotels fault. But overall the hotel is nice and clean. Staff is pleasant upon arrival and checking out.

Summary Heading: Reasonable priced and good spot for a family Disney vacation.
Summary: Returned from staying four nights for a Disney Family reunion at Disneyland. There was a total of 9 adults and three kids across five rooms. The large room  with separate living room, pool for kids and the free breakfast was the foundation to a great trip. Only downside was parking in the late evenings was difficult due to the nightclub being in the same lot. Noticed security selling hotel parking spots on a Friday night. Would recommend if you are having a large family trip to Disney and can't afford the high prices of closer hotels. The shuttle bus works out well and it was the same amount of time compared to driving and parking.

Summary Heading: Fun times after watching our son's Cross country race at Mt. Sac!
Summary: This hotel was very nice and the updating going on is coming along nicely. This is a huge undertaking but our room was 701 and had a pleasant stay and tried to stay one more night! It took us about 17 minutes to get back from Mt. Sac which was not bad. Over the freeway was a mall but we didn't go there. We stayed for the snacks and happy hour. We ate at the restaurant which was a bit overpriced and very empty. $9.00 for Nachos, $15.00 for frozen fish and chips. A bit much. My pizza was good for 10.00. Knowing that children are attending with parents for Disney they should have a cost effective menu. Otherwise it beats venturing out when your tired. The breakfast was excellent. Coffee was ok but you need flavored creamers. Oh well otherwise it was nice. The pool and the jacuzzi

Summary Heading: Not a bad stay - could use a bit updating.
Summary: Stay was ok. For the money, the value was fine. Breakfast was good,  Good selection and value. Overall not bad at all. We had a very loud and squeaky bathroom door, there were some smal stains on the wall.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We greatly appreciate your feedback and are happy to hear that you feel your stay was a good value. We apologize however that you had some service inconsistencies during your stay. We are always striving to improve our service offerings so we thank you for making us aware. We do hope you will consider staying with us again the next time your travels bring you to our area. All the best!  Kristiana N.

Summary: Difficulty sleeping, construction behind our room waking us at 5 AM every morning.  Bathtub faucet falling off & water so hard to adjust the water temperature almost got scalded.  Bathroom fan attached to light so the person trying to sleep was disturbed anytime at night not happy about that.

We checked into our room and found trash everywhere and what someone left behind in the refrigerator. Housekeeping didn't do a very good job cleaning either. They failed to vacuum the room during their servicing.   Decent food and typical breakfast and receptions.   The facility isn't very clean and one of the elevators has been down for a day for what looks like painting leading to really long wait times. No coffee available after breakfast ends.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback of your recent stay with us. We sincerely apologize for the housekeeping issues that you experienced; our hotel works hard to ensure the comfort and satisfaction of our guests and we are very sorry that did not meet your expectations. I hope that if you travels bring you back to the area that you will consider staying with us again.

Summary: Good breakfast, good location but filthy, from the reception rugs to restrooms, nasty.  Elevators very slow, often too full requiring waits for the next car.  Policy trumps customer service here too. A host of  better options near by.
Manager Response: We are sorry to hear that we did not meet your expectations and that your perception of our hotel has been tarnished. This is certainly not our goal and for this we do apologize.  We take your feedback seriously and will use this as a training opportunity for improvement.

Summary: I would love to give a 5 star to this property, but i'll give 3, because  today Sat, October 29, the young chef (male) (no name on he's uniform) was with very bad attitude and he throw the plate to serve me, other customer was uncomfortable too, I eat that breakfast , but I don't feeling good because he's attitude. I don't think that I return to this hotel because him. The location is perfect , staff are wonderful! I love this property and I think its can be better. With the production this property can do, its very important the good treat for the customer.  I had other issues but customer service was great and fixed everything.  Good luck!
Manager Response: I am sincerely sorry to hear that your recent stay was not up to your expectations and that you felt you were treated rudely. Of course this is not ever our intention. We do take our guest feedback seriously and use it as a training opportunity to better serve our guests. We hope that you will consider staying with us again in the future.  Kristiana N.

Summary Heading: nice hotel but not that clean
Summary: nice hotel but not that clean. same breakfast buffet food daily. dusty sofa bed. and I also feel that the bathroom is not that clean. the entrance and the parking area though is spacious enough. elevator movement is very very slow. not enough toiletries, towels even if you booked the extra head.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback of your recent stay with us. We sincerely apologize for the housekeeping and maintenance issues that you experienced; our hotel works hard to ensure the comfort and satisfaction of our guests and we are very sorry that did not meet your expectations. I hope that if you travels bring you back to the area that you will consider staying with us again.  Kristiana N.

Summary: Embassy Suites North was incredible in their service and hospitality.  The full breakfast buffet was amazing, as well as the reception each evening.  There were business professionals and families vacationing (headed to Disney probably).  The exercise room was small and a bit out of date, but it had everything needed for a simply workout in the morning.  The location was close to the highway and easily accessible.
Manager Response: We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your recent business conference at the Embassy Suites Anaheim North. Our Team takes pride in delivering detailed and special service and I am so happy to hear that you were able to see and enjoy this first hand.  We hope you will consider staying with us again the next time your travels bring you to our area.  Kristiana N.

Summary: I do love Hilton as always and I do like this hotel.  I loved the huge room, and closet and drawer  space at this location.  The food at the hotel, Bistro 3100 was very, very good as well!!!   The hamburger melted in my mouth and my husbands food was very good as too.  Was really surprised as Hotel food can sometimes let you down.  You are close enough to Disneyland and other attractions and the hotel itself is very easy access of the 91.  Great for large families.  You can't beat the huge breakfast  that is included either!
Manager Response: Thank you for your GREAT feedback! We are happy to hear that you and your husband enjoyed our renovated guestrooms and that you were able to enjoy our delicious food offerings from Bistro 3100. We look forward to seeing you again soon!  Kristiana N.

Summary: I have been staying at this Hotel for many years. Always a favorite place of my entire family and friends. Clean Hotel, friendly staff, great cook to order breakfast, relaxing happy hour and a fun indoor pool. Great place.
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful feedback, Charles! We are so glad to provide you with excellent service time and time again. We do appreciate your continued business and the great feedback. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: i was at this location for a high school reunion.   pros-spacious rooms and nice brunch cons-delayed check-in, keys did not work and defective coffee maker   our double one had a separate sitting area with a sectional couch and table and chairs; i had to return the key twice as the others did not work.   when making coffee i burned my hand when trying to remove the overflowing cup of coffee.  overall, it was a nice experience.
Manager Response: Thank you for this great feedback! We are glad to hear you had a nice experience overall. We will be sure to have our housekeeping staff inspect all coffee makers and have engineering maintain the key readers. We do appreciate this review and hope to see you in the near future.

Summary: This hotel is setup for kids going to Disney and Freeloaders! Place is filth dirty, staff doesn't seem to care. Stayed for 7 days and my room was cleaned only 4 of them. Even after telling the staff that it wasn't clean when I got back that evening, still nothing was done. Told me they would send someone to the room but nobody showed. Food sat on the floor in the hallway for 3 days before I finally told the manager to remove it. Stains on carpeting everywhere from people stealing food and hoarding it back to there rooms.   If you plan on having breakfast down stairs, get up and be down there at 6 am or you will be run over by the hoarders running trays of food back to there rooms! Staff will screw up your fresh cooked eggs. The mornings I did go down to eat, they had to throw

Room size was excellent for a family of four. The complimentary breakfast was excellent, and offers a real value. Overall appearance of the hotel was impressive and relaxing at the same time. They had an affiliation with a nearby fitness facility so you could get an excellent workout with all the equipment you could need at no extra cost. Great location for visiting all of the coastal CA sights, as well as the theme parks.
Manager Response: Thank you for this great review! We are so glad to have offered you and your family a wonderful stay. We are glad you were able to take full advantage of our Hotel and we can't wait to see you the next time your travels bring you to our area.

Summary: Spent one night at the Embassy Suites North prior to a business meeting.  This is an older property but has been updated.  Staff were all very friendly and helpful.  Bed was comfy and the room was clean.  I am a light sleeper so the freeway is kind of an issue right beside the hotel.  There were not any restaurants, shopping, etc. in walking distance.

Summary Heading: Good place for family and kids
Summary: The room was really large which we needed (two adults and three kids).  The beds were comfy and the sofa bed better than most.  The only real gripe is the bathroom is tight.  There's plenty of free parking.  The complimentary breakfast is solid and the free drinks from 5-7pm is a great value.  Just remember to tip the great bartenders.

Our stay here was a great and memorable one. After three long days of walking in Disneyland the comfort provided by our room and the hotel itself was GREAT. the Managers meeting was nice and relaxing. The staff was excellent and adhering to all of our needs.

Rooms were typical for Embassy- bathroom shower flooded bathroom and faucet made mess on vanity.  Too far from Disneyland if that is why you are in Anaheim.  You have to pay to Use ART shuttle and it takes about 20 minutes.  We couldn't use it to go to Halloween Party because there is no shuttle from 11-3.  Asked for extra towels and housekeeping only left one for two days straight.  Also there is a loud nightclub in the parking lot- make sure your room does not face front entrance or you will hear it.  Will not stay here again.

Great room! The court yard is so pretty.  The complementary breakfast was amazing. Build your own omelet station, pancakes, bacon, sausage. They had a soda machine, juices, milk, and coffee. We loved this hotel

The bathroom smells like sewer that took over the bedroom. My family has to sleep in the living room. I told front desk but it is still the same. I guess that being a Hilton member doesn't really mean a thing.

This is a newer hotel which is very conveniently located off the freeway, I91.  There are a few restaurants and fast food places nearby and it is very easy to get to other local attractions such as Disneyland, Little Saigon, etc.

Summary Heading: Good location for various tourist activities
Summary: The hotel, being right off the freeway and intersecting with Glassell Street was great for heading off to various parts of Anaheim, Orange and adjoining locations.  The traffic on Glassell was not heavy so it was easy to come and go.  The hotel itself was great with excellent staff and very good complimentary breakfast.

The hotel was really nice I loved the inner circle with the trees and seating area. The bar and it's employees were amazing and friendly. The food was great. I had a suite and it was perfect. The pool area was large and very relaxing. There was an event that I attended there and it was a little warm, but there were 500 people so to be expected. However the hotel was on top of it. I recommend this facility.
Manager Response: Thank you for you wonderful review! We are so glad to hear you enjoyed your stay and that your event went so well. We appreciate you feedback and will continue to offer excellent guest experiences, such as your own. We hope to see you soon!

Summary: The room was clean and large.  My family enjoyed the pool and hot tub every night.  The breakfast was great and there was plenty of seating.  I really enjoyed the made to order omelette.  While walking through the atrium one night I glanced down and almost stepped on a frog.  For real, they live in the water and it scared me half to death.  My daughter and I picked him up and placed him back in his home.  We didn't have one problem with the elevators or parking.  My husband is in the elevator trade and said that hydraulic elevators are a bit slower, but we didn't even notice. We had only one problem with our 5 day stay.  We left one day for an adventure at the Happiest Place on Earth and upon return my son noticed that his necklace he received as a gift when he got engaged was
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback! We are both happy to hear you were able to enjoy all our hotel's offerings, and are also very sorry to hear about the missing necklace. We do take our feedback very seriously so we will be sure to address this concern with the appropriate departments to ensure this will not happen again. We do hope you consider staying with us again and hopefully we can make it up to you. Thank you again for your review and your valued business.

Summary: SAFE WILL ENTER YOUR ROOM WITHOUT knocking. And if you take more than a second if someone knocks they will still open the door. If you try to speak with management team they have no answers for you. They just reply I'm sorry.

I do not know what previous reviews are talking about, but we went to the Happy Hour last night Sat night and everything was great, hummus, salsa, potato ships, pita chips, drinks, non-alcohol and alcohol, I ate to much I couldn't eat dinner.  Also the breakfast this morning, WOW, I have never seen such a variety at a hotel free breakfast, you can't ask for more at a restaurant.  Everyone is so nice, so accomodating, I had a problem with my first room, they were right up to give me another key for a different room.  It is an older Embassy Suite, they could put new drapes and replace the furniture that someone let their child write on the couch with an ink pen, but it's very comfortable, I AM SO HAPPY!!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review! We are so thrilled you experienced nothing but the best of our Hotel! We take great pride in providing memorable guest experiences so we will continue to work to our strengths. Thank you for your feedback and for your valued business. We hope to see you in the near future.

Summary: The hotel is located 6 miles from Disneyland. The sheets on our bed was dirty. I complained the first day. Housekeeping changed the sheets with more dirty pillows and sheets. I would not recommend this hotel. I was discounted a one night stay but I should have had more than that for the filth I slept on.

I arrived on a Sunday with my reservation noted "Early Check-in". I've been a member long enough to know that they can not guarantee a Ready room available and was prepared to wait.   I was told by a new employee at the desk, that nothing with a King Bed was ready, but I could pay $20 more for a room with 2 Queen beds. I didn't want the hassle of dealing with corporate paperwork and reimbursement, so I agreed to wait for any first available room. The attendant said that he would notify me as soon as a room was available.   I sat in the bar area and after an hour, I started to nod off; so I stood for a while and glanced back at the front desk. I went back to the desk and was told that no rooms were available, but he would ask the girl (also at the front desk) that I inquired if I

The staff is amazing the place is clean and inviting. Darleen and Abbi truly go above and beyond the job to make us feel at home. These ladies are attribute to your success as a business. Please take care of Darleen and Abbi

It's a great vacation we experience during our stay in this hotel at anahiem Good staff,good food,clean sorrow dings and a very quite place we appreciate for everything thank you to all a you guys we are looking forward to Seymour on our next visit.

Summary Heading: Subpar experience for DisneyLand vacation - will not stay here again
Summary: Pros:  Nice room layout and spacious  Location relatively close to DisneyLand with free parking and an inexpensive Shuttle service that goes directly to/from DisneyLand (non stop)   Cons:  Shuttle service does not operate between 12 and 3pm so forget about coming back to the hotel for a break in the day.  Kitchen facilities are very limited - No proper freezer section in the fridge (just a mini bar fridge) so forget about storing anything substantial there or cooking anything beyond microwaving. Microwave was also near the floor so difficult to use. No plates/cups or cutlery in the room - had to ask the restaurant to borrow this  When I call in the morning and ask for the toilet to be unblocked I expect it to be done when I return to the room at the end of the day  Breakfast was

We often stay at Embassy Suites. They are usually great.   They said it was renovated but it did not appear so. It looked old. When you were in the lobby and looked around and at the vents they were very dirty. The place always seemed dirty. The phone in our room did not work. We called to get it fixed. They came and looked at it and said there was nothing he could do that they would fix it when we left. That did not help us at all. The safety lock was about to fall off so when we noticed it we called and to get it fixed, we left and they did not come by to fix it by the time we came back which was hours.  I went down and spoke to a lady and she said they would send someone right up. No one came.  We were leaving again and spoke to a gentleman and he said that was unacceptable

Family and child friendly, staff very attentive in getting requests made. Very convenient location. Buffet breakfast one of the best and loved ambience of lobby, common gathering areas.  Definitely will recommend to others and will come back again.
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review! We are so glad we could be accommodating for you and your family! We do appreciate you taking your time to give us this great feedback and will continue to provide amazing guest experiences. We look forward to seeing you next time!

Summary Heading: Great value and breakfast near Disneyland
Summary: Great value and yummy cooked breakfast. Rooms have been nicely updated. Easy to find and close to freeway. Easy access to Disneyland. Close to shopping and the beaches. Blots of room for everyone in the family.

Staff was very friendly.  Evening reception was excellent.  The back door states room key required for entry between 11pm and 6am and it was unlocked which is alarming because a very busy nightclub is in front of the hotel.

Let me start by saying we travel a lot and prefer to stay at Embassy because the rooms are large and the breakfast is great. From the moment we arrived at this hotel it was bad. First off they share the parking lot with a busy nightclub and there are not a lot of spots for guests to park. They have security but it didn't seem to help the matter. We stayed for 3 nights and it was the same problem every night. The rooms have been remodeled and the lobby but other then that hotel is old. The rooms are not very large. We had 2 queen beds but bathroom is extremely small. When you have 5 people staying in your room it's a tight squeeze. The breakfast was hectic all 3 mornings. The hotel does not have enough open seating to accommodate the amount of guests. They would have room if they

Summary Heading: Great hotel but depends on why you are visiting
Summary: Our room:  Our room was great.  It was spacious, clean, and very comfortable.  No complaints here!  It is a typical Embassy Suites with 2 double beds in one room and a good sized living room and desk in another.  In between is the mini fridge and microwave.  We stopped at Vons and got some snacks for the room in case we were hungry after Disney and that worked out well.  Location of Hotel:  This is the only thing I would change if I could.  This is about a 25 min ride to Disney and the bus comes so infrequently that it really is a hassle.  I knew the schedule when I booked but I did not think that my family would want to go back and forth like they did when we got there.  My son wanted to spend more time at the hotel than Disneyland which was a problem given the length of time

Staff very helpful. I enjoyed the overnight stay. The evening reception and breakfast were wonderful. The hotel was close to the freeway and had plenty of parking. The pool and jacuzzi were near my room and there was no noise which made it great.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We're glad we could provide and comfortable and accommodating stay for your business trip. We appreciate your taking the time to review our Hotel and we hope to see you next time your business brings you to the area.

Summary Heading: Great for a variety of reasons
Summary: For business the benefits: - complimentary cook to order hot breakfast with lots of variety of hot/cold items - suite - separate space for work/living vs. sleeping - complimentary evening reception with drinks and snacks   Disney is close for those that visit, even so the children's noise was not bad.   Try out "Pink Tuna" restaurant nearby ...
Manager Response: Thanks for the GREAT review! We're glad to hear you enjoyed our complimentary cooked to order breakfast and newly renovated suites. We are constantly looking for ways to improve our guests' experience and will continue to provide the excellent service you experienced with us. Thank you for your valued business and kind review.

Summary Heading: Not the Best Embassy Suites I've Encountered
Summary: There were a few nice things about this stay:  There were lots of pool towels at the pool.  There is a nice sun deck outside the pool area.  The room was clean with comfortable seating.  The breakfast staff were very friendly and helpful.  The rate was good, and the breakfast selection was good.  There were also a few problems with this stay:  The sink plunger lever wouldn't open the drain plug, so you couldn't drain water from the sink.  There were no towel racks in the bathroom for bath towels, only a small hand-towel rack.  How are you supposed to save your towels for another day with nothing on which to hang them?  There was a nice vanity in the bedroom, but no bench/chair for it.  The toilet paper didn't fit the dispenser, so it kept falling off.  They had only styrofoam

I flux between Gold/Silver level of Hilton points club so I have stayed at a LOT of Hilton properties. I can tell you this could have been one of the worst Embassy Suites I have stayed in over the past 10 years.   Lets start with the rooms - Starting with the check in. I drove up from San Diego with family in tow and stopped here to see if a room was available so we could freshen up and drop our bags before heading into LA. There was not one available but I was given a room number before leaving the hotel. Needless to say that room assignment changed 6 hours later when I returned to the hotel which was a bit annoying. Why not ask me to check in later and not "commit" me to a room because I am here - I offered that twice but the staff (although helpful) was insistent.  After all

Excellent place to stay but you need a car if you are staying here. The rooms, staff & service is excellent. However, this location is not ideal if you don't have your own transportation. It is not within walking distance of any place but there is a shuttle to Disneyland. The full breakfast is included in your stay and it is delicious. They also provide finger snacks and free drinks for happy hour in the afternoons.

Summary Heading: Another nice Embassy Suites, close to Disneyland & Knott's Berry Farm.
Summary: We decided to stay here for our weekend in Anaheim.  This is also close to Angel Stadium and the Honda Center.  Great access, just off the 91 Freeway.  Free Happy Hour and snacks, and also a FREE "made to order" Breakfast that's great!

Summary Heading: Needs improvement, but super nice staff
Summary: Super nice staff! Lobby is updated, but there is much improvement to be done to this property. The rooms have newer decor , but the paint is peeling in 3 Of the rooms and had ac probs wirh cooling in 2 of 3 rooms. The pool /hot tub esp seemed a bit dingy. Daughter got some type of infection on her lip a day after getting in pool. May be a coincidence. There was a balcony on one of rooms was pretty dirty same with door to my room. Its an older property, but like I said they are trying to update it seems. This hotel is comparable in price to others right by Disney which I don't understand, seems it would be less. If you have kids they can't just go walk down block here to get things.  By Disney they can, grab a del taco if worried about breakfast. Even if exploring the area the

The service and staff were excellent.  The facility was clean at all times. The location was wonderful and extremely convenient. The only inconvenience was when the electricity was off for a few hours.
Manager Response: Thank you for this great review! We strive to provide our guests with a wonderful experience and are glad to hear we did not disappoint. We hope to see you in the near future and thank you for your valued business!

Summary Heading: Embassy Suites Stole $1,168.40 from me, Corruption at its Finest.
Summary: I want to start by saying that I have enjoyed staying at Embassy Suites Hotels in my youth and have very fond memories with my family, but this is not the same Embassy Suites it once was.    I was passing through Anaheim and was tired from driving all the way from the Midwest so i made a reservation inside the hotel located at 3100 East Frontera, Anaheim, CA 92806. I booked it for two nights.  The lady at the front desk swiped my debit card and said it didn't go through, so she swiped a second time.  Being very tired i believed her, but boy was i wrong.    I get my bank statement and i see two charges. One for $1,168.14 on 3/7 and another for $171.65 on 3/8.  (I have evidence if anyone would like to see them). You will see that the $1,168.14 is covering charges all the way back

Nice location.  Clean and overall quiet, except for a little one that ran back and forth above us until about 2300.  A lot of nearby restaurants to choose from, but Hatam was the best!!! (Persian, Mediterranean) Wonderful experience overall!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We are so glad we could provide a relaxing and wonderful experience. We will be sure to continue providing the best for our guests. Thanks also for the restaurant tip! We look forward to seeing you again and thank you for your business.

Summary: Chose Embassy while vacationing with family when visiting Disney Land.  The Hotel is great and a wonderful place for family fun and activities.  Within 6 miles of the park.  We will recommend this location to friends and co-workers.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback, Brad! We're glad we could be of convenience for you and your family while you visited Disneyland. We hope to see you soon and appreciate your valued business!

Summary Heading: Spacious, Affordable, Out Of The Way. FREE BEER!
Summary: A nice hotel in the not so crowded part of Anaheim, just off the 91 freeway at the Kraemer-Glassell exit.   Less pricier than the one by Disneyland, it is a better hotel than others at this price range, probably because of the location.  The rooms are great for the price. The lobby is like an oasis with trees, a koi pond, and a glass roof. The semi-indoor (covered) pool is open until 11PM, which is good for people like me who don't like to be under the sun for too long.   There is a "Manager's Reception" at the bar from 5:30PM - 7:30PM with complimentary domestic beer or well drinks (limit 2 per person) for checked-in guests, as well as free soda, chips and salsa, and popcorn. There's a coin operated billiard table and a juke box.   One star is missing. I don't like the color of

My husband was on an extended business trip and we stayed here for several weeks in July/August 2016. The rooms are very comfortable and the hotel is modern and clean. There s a complimentary breakfast every morning and it gets quite crowded. There is a buffet with hot food, toast, muffins, pastries, fruit, oatmeal, yogurt, and a cooked to order line for omelettes and eggs. Juice, coffee and soda are available as well. Every night there is a complimentary manager's reception. For guests, there are well drinks, two varieties of beer, sangria, red and white wine and soda and juice served complimentary. Food is also served and seems to rotate with fresh fruit platters/crudite/cheese. Bar nuts and bar mix and popcorn are available every night. Say hello to Celestino and Kathryn at
Manager Response: Thank you for this wonderful review, Anne! We are so glad to hear you were able to take full advantage of everything we have to offer here at Embassy Suites Anaheim North! We take pride in our wonderful staff and excellent service. We hope to see you in the near future. Thank you for your valued business and feedback.

Summary: The best beds I have ever slept in!!!! Front desk very helpful!  Maid service was beyond disappointing!  A couple of days no maid at all or fresh towels. The bathroom floor was not cleaned the entire 8 day stay. Took 5 days to get my suite vacuumed.
Manager Response: Thank you for your valued feedback. We are so sorry to hear of the troubles you had during your stay. We do appreciate you taking the time to let us know how we can improve, and we will definitely use this review as a tool for further training. We hope you consider staying with us again and giving us a second chance to provide you with the service you deserve.

Summary: Nothing sets the tone like finding the previous guests dirty towels hiding behind the door.  Fixtures in bathroom falling apart, hole in door roughly patched.  Not what I would expect from this level of a hotel.  Location poorly maintained

Summary Heading: You know it's a comfortable bed when you have to look for the tags on the pillows and mattress so you can buy them
Summary: It was a perfect hotel for my family of 5.  Things I LOVED:  complimentary breakfast with EGGS made to ORDER- that's a real breakfast. Bacon was thick cut and of quality, sausage was okay, potatoes were good, fresh fruit, yogurt, breakfast breads, oatmeal, cold cereal, juices, and pretty decent coffee!  Indoor pool! while the pool itself wasn't that exciting it was indoors and as someone that hates to lie in the sun and swim/watch my kids swim, I was so happy that I didn't have to do that. For year round weather it's also pretty awesome to have that extra fun for the kids when it isn't warm outside.  Layout/ambience- great! The staff was welcoming and warm, easy check in, hotel was remodeled, the center atrium/lounge/courtyard/lobby or whatever it's called was really nice and my
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review, Rachel! It gives us great joy to hear our Hotel did not disappoint during your visit to Disneyland! We are constantly evaluating our services to make sure we provide guests with the best experience possible. Our beds are specially made for Hilton hotels by Serta. You can find the mattress, sheets and pillows all for sale at hiltontohome.com! Thank you again for your valued business and we hope to see you in the near future!

Summary: We found this hotel great. Staff were helpful. Breakfast was nice. Happy hour was great nice way to unwind after a hard day shopping. Bed was comfy room was clean and modern. Plenty of parking. Wifi great. I would stay there again without any hesitation.

On a west coast baseball trip with my son and I decided to extend our stay by one day (rather than stay close to Dodger Stadium) and it was a great decision.  We could walk to see the Angels and the room and service at the Embassy Suites was perfect.  We could walk to the Angels game.   All in all, a perfect stay.

We stayed here a few days when we were in the area. Check in was quick,  room was clean and the breakfast and reception were as advertised.  Our only negative is that breakfast and the reception are the same every day.  We'd definitely stay here again.

Tons of problems would not recommend this hotel.  Our room air conditioning did not work.room was not cleaned daily...  shower head was old and dirty.  The stairs were not accessible and breakfast cold..
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our Hotel. We sincerely apologize for the issues you faced and are sad to hear we did not meet your expectations. Rest assured we will be sure to look into each area of concern you addressed. We take these reviews very seriously and use them as a way to improve upon our guest experience. Thank you again for your time and we hope you consider staying with us again.

Summary: Clean roomy suites, very friendly & helpful staff. We would absolutely stay here again. The complimentary breakfast was nice each day, and the kids enjoyed the pool and downstairs atrium/Lobby area. Enjoyed our stay

We checked  in late in the  evening  and  it only  took  about  five  minutes! We  gave  our  name  and  our reservation  popped  up . We were  handed  our  keys  and  invited  to  help  ourselves  to  popcorn and  directed  to  our  room. Family  friendly. The  rooms  were  clean but  could  use  some  updating. Bed was  very  comfortable  and  the  room  quiet even  though  there we many families. The  breakfast  was  great with  all  the  favorites  from  fruit  to made-to-order  omelets.
Manager Response: Thank you for your GREAT feedback! We are so glad we could accommodate you with a quick check in, comfortable bed, and a delicious complimentary breakfast! We appreciate you taking your time to let us know what we're doing right, and will continue to improve. We hope to see you again in the near future.

Summary: Good experience overall.positives where the room was clean but bathroom was shared and located in master bed room.the complementary open bar was incredible!long shuttle to get to Disneyland takes a half hour only draw back
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, Mark! We truly appreciate all of our guest feedback and will continue to use it as a way to improve upon our services. Thank you for your valued business and feedback.

Summary: I am a hilton diamond member so I have been to a good number of properties across hilton and embassy brands.  I must recommend to my fellow travelers to avoid this particular property unless you have no other choice in the area.  This hotel totally missed the mark on every possible way.   1) Had plenty of rooms and requested a room on high floor. Got me a second floor room overlooking what appears to be a dumpster 2) Hairs in the bathroom (several) 3) Asked for an extra sheet at 11pm.  No one showed up for 30 mins. Called front desk 5 times and no one picked up the phone.  Went down after 40 minutes to see if anyone was working. 1 guy was standing in the front desk. Asked him what was going on, he said he was very busy.  Ok, almost mid-night, I did not see any guests. Anyways,

What began as an anticipated trip to Disneyland ended with an amazing experience at both the park and hotel. The hotel was so welcoming. The staff were very professional and courteous. They went out of their way to make our stay as unforgettable and as pleasant as can. My family enjoyed the pool as well as the workout room. I look to forward to staying there again in the future. Would recommend this hotel to everyone.
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful feedback, Cris! It gives us great pleasure to hear our guests have received unforgettable service. We are so glad you stayed with us and were able to take advantage of all the amenities our Hotel has to offer. Thank you for your valued business and for this great review. We hope to see you in the future!

Summary: July 2016 3 night stay with two adults and one teen. Suites are spacious with a large sofa that turns into a bed, desk, refrigerator, coffeemaker. Great service with employees at check in. Enjoyed the happy hour from 530-730 with drinks and snacks and a great bartender. Only problem experienced was breakfast on Saturday morning was packed with a long line for omelettes and some of the food on the buffet was cold(large crowd due to basketball tournament teams). Also difficult to find table to eat. But hotel is short ride to disney, knotts berry farm and anaheim stadium would recommend especially for families.
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review! We're so glad you enjoyed our newly renovated suites and manager's reception! We will continue to provide wonderful customer service and will use this feedback as a way to further improve our Hotel. Thank you for your valued business and wonderful feedback.

Summary: It was okay, I would have rather stayed near Disneyland, as this was too far. The rental car was also broken into. We where switched from one room to another, very inconvenient.
