I wouldn't recommend staying here for anything other than the parks or one night.

Summary Heading: Not up to embassy suites standards
Summary: we stayed here 5 nights, and were disappointed multiple times. 2 of the 4 elevators were broken down, the fan in the bathroom did not work, the shower door was off the track, the ac unit would not turn off so the hotel sent us a space heater to keep from freezing, and the worst part was the poor quality food at breakfast. The whole point of staying here is to get a top notch breakfast, and to not deliver on that is very disappointing. This would be a solid 4 stars for another lower priced chain, but I can't give it more than 2 stars given the expectations I have for embassy suites hotels.
Manager Response: We are so sorry to hear that we did not meet your expectations and that your perception of our hotel has been tarnished.  This is certainly not our goal and for this we do apologize.  We hope to have the opportunity to serve you again so we can show you a positive experience similar to what so many other guests are sharing while staying with us.

Summary Heading: A good value choice for Disneyland
Summary: This hotel was a really good choice for Disneyland.  The room was spacious and clean and had everything you need.  The free breakfast was really nice.  They actually have an omelet bar as part of it (plus the usually pastries, fruit, and yogurt).  The interior was undergoing some restorations and face lift.  This wasn't really in the way though but it did seem like it was necessary.  The hotel offers a shuttle to Disneyland for $5 round trip.  The trip takes about 20 minutes and the drivers were nice.  The front desk staff were extremely helpful and nice throughout our stay.  Overall, I thought this was a good value for a few nights and I would stay here again.  They do charge for internet access, which is unfortunate.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide us with your feedback. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay. We truly feel that "feedback is a gift" that allows us opportunities to best take care of our guests. Thank you for your valued business!

Summary: The staff at this property always excel at service and making me feel welcome.  I prefer staying at this property over others that may be closer to where my business site is located because of the quality of service.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback with us.  It is so nice to hear that our Hotel is your preferred place to stay while conducting business in the area.  Thank you for positive comments and for your valued business.

Summary: I was traveling with a group of teenagers for my daughters 16th birthday party. The plan was to stay two nights and spend the day at Disneyland. We arrived around midnight after traveling 7 hours by car. The girls were tired and ready for sleep for an early morning rise. I had requested adjacent rooms upon making the reservation a month earlier, then called the hotel the morning of arrival just to find out we were on different floors during check in. I wonder which part of traveling with minors they did not understand. I was told the hotel was completely booked and all rooms were sold out.   When I complained, the hotel manager looked at the group of tired girls and threatened eviction if they did not follow the hotel rooms and that I had to sign a code of conduct policy. Sir we
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Our Team greatly appreciates your feedback and we sincerely apologize that you were disappointed with your stay. Traveling (getting to the Hotel) can be very exhausting...we do understand that us getting you to your room to rest as quick as possible is definitely important.  We are sorry that this process was not as speedy as you had hoped.  Please know that our Team Member checking you into the Hotel was not singling you out by asking you to sign a minor conduct waiver.  Being that it is Spring Break (one of our busiest seasons) we do ask that all groups with minors sign this same waiver.  This helps us assure the safety and enjoyment for all of our guests including your group.   Please know that we will be sure to take your comments about our property under consideration as we re-evaluate guest needs and continually work to improve our guest experience.

Summary Heading: Hotel put 3 people in a 1 bedroom kingsize bed suite
Summary: I booked a 2 queen size bed suite for 3 people thru hotels.com.  When I went into my room and discovered there was only 1 king sized bed in the room, I called the front desk.  They rudely told me I booked thru a website and not directly thru them and if I wanted 2 beds,  I would have to pay $20 extra a night.    The shuttle to Disneyland is a city bus that you have to pay $5/person for the day and it  doesn't  pick up between 10 am and 3:30 pm.  The grounds are under construction and in need of renovation.  Internet is not free, it will cost you $11.95/night ...even McDonalds supplies free wifi.   Get into the 21st Century!
Manager Response: Dear Zareli~ I am sincerely sorry to hear that your recent stay was not up to your expectations and that you felt you were treated rudely.  Of course this is not ever our intension.  We do take our guest feedback seriously and use it as a training opportunity to better serve our guests.  We hope that you will consider staying with us again in the future.  If this opportunity presents itself please know that we do charge an extra per person charge for certain room types because we offer a wonderful complimentary cooked to order breakfast and complimentary evening reception.  So when a room type is changed from what was booked does change the rate.   Thank you again for your feedback and we hope to have the chance to serve you again and show you the wonderful service that we are known for.

Summary: It's going under minor construction to improve some areas but we didn't find the construction an inconvenience.  There is a nightclub that shares the parking on the westside and when we returned to our room in the evening their were orange cones blocking the hotel parking so we were uncertain where to park, but it appears it was for the nightclub guests to keep them out of the hotel parking.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us.  We do try our best to assure that our ongoing hotel renovation enhancements do not affect our guests negatively and are happy to hear that you were able to still enjoy the Hotel and your vacation during our ongoing refurbishment project. We hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: The hotel was very dirty both in the rooms and outside. There was standing water in one of our bathrooms and black hand marks inside the rooms. The bathroom smelled like sour laundry and there was plenty of mold in the shower. The elevators (glass) were filthy with film and prints. Carpets, both in the room and outside were covered in older stains.
Manager Response: Dear Kathleen & Family~ I am sorry to hear that we did not meet your expectations and that your perception of our hotel has been tarnished.  This is certainly not our goal and for this we do apologize.  Considering all of our guestrooms/bathrooms were recently completely remodeled we were surprised to hear your feedback about the carpet.  This being said because of your overall feedback I personally inspected your rooms and guest baths and did not find the mold you mentioned however the tub was soiled in one room and could have used more attention by our Team.  I assure you that we take your feedback seriously and will use this as a training opportunity for future improvement.   Thank you for your feedback! Tanya E. / G.M.

Summary: Great Rooms, very clean and treated very professionally.   The breakfast after 6 days of the same thing, was a little boring.    Great variety, however was looking for french toast or waffles one day.     Will definitely stay here again.  Was pleased with all aspects of our stay.
Manager Response: We are thrilled to hear of your GREAT stay at our Hotel while visiting Disneyland.  Thank you for your feedback we truly appreciate it.  See you next time!

Summary Heading: Fair But Not as good as most Embassy Suites
Summary: Overall is fair but the hotel is old and our bathroom wasn't clean when we arrived. The breakfast was fine but not up to par for Embassy Suites. I think for the overall price there are better options in the area.

This was a family vacation. We rented 3 rooms and all adults really enjoyed this hotel.  The rooms were large, sleeping four adults comfortly. The free breakfast was very good and the managers reception was a lot of fun and a great way to relax before going out to dinner. I would recommend this hotel!!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide the Hotel with your feedback. We are happy to hear that you and your family enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your valued business!

Summary: Good and nice location easy access to highway. Breakfast is good. Spa,pool and gym good. Manager cocktail @ 5:30 very good. Nice dance club Xalo in from the parking lot safe and nice. wfi internet is $15.00 a day is sucks.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide the Hotel with your feedback. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay. We truly feel that "feedback is a gift" that allows us opportunities to best  take care of our guests. Thank you for your valued business!

Summary: excellent hotel, staff very respectful and ready to assist in your every need, breakfast excellent, rooms clean and very roomy, worth the short drive to Disneyland to save on a affordable hotel for room up to six people.
Manager Response: Our Hotel Team could not be happier to hear that after your extended stay with us that you had such a great experience.  Thank you for your delightful feedback and for your business!

Summary: Had trouble finding hotel space in Anaheim due to Valentine Day and Presidents Day weekend, but came across this hotel using Priceline.   Struck gold with this choice.  Could not have been happier with our stay.  Hotel is undergoing renovations but this did not affect our stay.  The rooms now have been updated with a very modern decor.  Comfortable beds and large walk-in shower.  Staff very courteous and accommodating to our needs.   Free cooked to order breakfast every morning and the managers reception every evening added to our relaxing stay.  Hotel located off highway CA91 and provided easy access to area attractions and beaches.  Looking forward to returning to this hotel once all renovations are completed
Manager Response: We are just thrilled that we had the opportunity to have you stay with us.  We try our best to assure that our ongoing hotel renovation enhancements do not affect our guests negatively and are happy to hear that you were able to enjoy the Hotel during our ongoing refurbishment project.  Now that you know how wonderful our Hotel is (location, staff, facilities etc.) we look forward to welcoming you back again in the future.  Thank you for your feedback and for your valued business!

Summary: We always enjoy our stay at Embassy Suites, We also love the managers reception and B-fast , I would 100% refer any of my Family and friends to stay w/Embassy suites. And would return personally and appreciate any discount Promo you may offer throughout the year
Manager Response: We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your valued business and for your 100% loyalty to Embassy Suites...we truly appreciate this!

Summary Heading: A great hotel to stay but far from activities
Summary: Stayed there for 2 nites.  The hotel was undergoing major renovation and indeed its noisy during the day time so we really do not have a chance to wake up late.   Check in time was smooth and we were given free wifi probably in compensating the noise.  The room was huge ! I love the breakfast, especially the omelettes !  The pizza served by the restaurant in the hotel was great.  Everything about the food from breakfast to our lunch in the restaurant was great.  The only thing I was disappointed was the location.  There's really nothing around the area.  The only way is to take the shuttle bus (pay $4) for a 2 way trip back to Downtown Disney.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide the Hotel with your feedback. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay. We truly feel that "feedback is a gift" that allows us opportunities to best  take care of our guests. Thank you for your valued business!

Summary: Recently, I moved with my children to Orange, only our house was not completed.  Originally, the contractor got a room for us at Extended Stay (NIGHTMARE!) and then moved us over to the Embassy Suites, where we "lived" for almost three weeks.  Over this period of time, we interacted with the staff on a continuous basis, and I can honestly say that every staff member was friendly and did whatever they could to make our stay better.  The complimentary breakfast was an amazing start to the day, and the rooms were spacious and comfortable.  The Wifi is a little expensive (especially after using it daily for three weeks), but I appreciated the USB port located in the bedroom so as to allow me to work from multiple spots.  Even though renovation is going on, the noise was basically
Manager Response: Our Team could not be happier to hear that after your extended stay with us that you consider us you’re "Home Away From Home".  After all...this is what Embassy Suites is all about...our Hotel and Team making our guests feel as comfortable as possible.  Thank you for your delightful feedback.

Summary: Stayed here 2 nights on business in early February 2015.  While there was some construction going on it was not a bother in any way.  The property is getting updated and some rooms (my associates) are nicely redone.  Mine was not yet done but was clean and fresh, though a bit tired.  The evening reception is about as minimal as I see these days - - chips and salsa for food along with up to 2 drinks.  You can't get by with this as a meal as you can in many other places. I ordered the sliders appetizer for a meal and they were okay.  The service was very slow with only one person waiting on many tables. The breakfast was very good with a lot of good sides along the made-to-order omelets  or eggs. Overall the staff were very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide the Hotel with your feedback. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay and that our Hotel renovation enhancement project did not affect your stay. We truly feel that "feedback is a gift" that allows us opportunities to best take care of our guests.  We will sincerely consider all of your feedback.  Thank you for your valued business!

Summary: The whole staff seemed to love their work and wanted us to feel at home and comfortable.  They were quiet and got their job done with respect to others.  We felt very safe there.  No noises from traffic even though we were very close to the freeway.   Food was good .  Atmosphere was very comfortable and welcoming.
Manager Response: We are just thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay and that our Team was so hospitable with you and your family. Our Team takes great pride in the Hotel and truly enjoys connecting with our guests.  Thank you for your feedback and for your valued business!

Summary: Currently under renovation on ground floor. Room is spacious and clean. Beds are very comfortable. No usb charging port in room. Flat screen tv in room with decent selection of stations. The renovation had me concerned when i arrived but have not heard any noise during sleeping hours at all. Happy hour was good. Breakfast was acceptional with made to order short order cook. Only reason for 3 stars was the renovation. I will return.
Manager Response: Thank you for your valued feedback.  We try our best to assure that our ongoing hotel renovation enhancements do not affect our guests negatively and are happy to hear that you were able to enjoy the Hotel during our ongoing refurbishment project.  As you noticed we assure that there is no construction during sleeping hours.  Since your visit we are happy to say that our refurbished Pool, Lounge, and Restaurant are officially open and we are receiving great comments about the enhancements.  This being said...we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back again so you can experience these hotel enhancements first hand.  Thank you for your valued business!

Summary: So much noise across the parking lot with bass reverberations with music and club patrons milling in the parking lot drinking beer and sitting on the cars of hotel guests.   Motorcycles racing in the parking lot at 3 AM.  Empty alcohol containers in the parking lot around my car upon departure.  Lack of response from management when complained to the front desk.

I've stayed at this hotel many times.  Overall I give it a big "meh".  Not great, not terrible.  Just kind of there and if you need a place to stay you could do a lot worse.  The rooms are pretty dated but they are going through a refresh.  On some nights it can get a little loud from the dance club across the parking lot.  I'd recommend bringing ear plugs so you don't get woken up early with the trucks driving to the scrap yard nearby.  Probably the biggest negative to this hotel is the location.  There are exactly zero places within walking distance, so don't even consider staying here if you don't have a car.  But overall the place is reasonably clean, the staff is okay, and I've never had any issues with my bill.

This is one of the better Embassy Suites due to the location and LOWER prices. Easy access from freeway and close to all Southern California areas I needed. Its under some construction now - a $10 million renovation but I've stayed here before and it's great!

Really enjoyed having two room suite because my husband sleeps in longer than I do, and I personally loved the desk and the  desk chair was SOoo comfortable. I felt a few of the employees were exceptional to name a few; Alex at the front desk, and for breakfast in the morning Celso who makes excellent omelettes according to my picky husband and Francisco who bused the tables (he never stops moving). I requested a room on the South side with a view of the "River" and I would open the sliding glass door and get some sun. We stayed thirteen nights because we were visiting family for Christmas. There was construction going on and a few times we heard it but most of the time it was quiet.

Wonderful ambiance, very peaceful.  Staff is very gracious and helpful.  The breakfast experience is wonderful, with a great variety of choices.  The availability of the meeting room was great and the staff was very attentive

Even-though this hotel is under going a renovation & "refresh" they still offer all the traditional amenities that they have built the Embassy Suites brand on. Deluxe free breakfasts that have something for every type of diet as well as made to order omelets. In addition they still offer the free happy hour from 5:30 to 7:00 pm. Light snacks, beer, wine and an "open bar" liquor really highlight this complimentary event as a fun way to end the day & start the evening. The construction noises did not bother us as we were gone during business hours and by the time we returned everything was cleaned up, very neat and quiet again. Congrats to the management team running this "refresh" project and Thank You for  the construction room discount, we enjoyed our stay.

Even with the construction the hotel was perfect. Since for us it was a family meeting and we didn't need the pool or gym it was great. The relocation of the lounge worked well. We really enjoyed our stay.

We made this reservation with the off-premises Reservation for the purpose of using the exercise room,Spa, & Pool. Not a word was said about what we would be greeted with. Only upon arrival did we get told that all facilities were Closed for construction. Moreover, a Manager letter was on the counter that advise guests (belatedly) that major construction was creating unbearable noise & suggested that guests find somewhere else to go during the day. Lobby & Restauant were boarded up. No discounted rates & were told that our reservation charge would occur unless we traveled to distant Embassy Suites. New staff & no problem solving ability. Were promised a later courtesy stay but have never been contacted. Avoid this place like the plague! No Manager either.
Manager Response: Dear Brian U,  When I saw your review with "Bait and switch", I could not understand what you are referring to!  Did we bait you into making a reservation?  Did we not offer you a brand new suite?  Did we change your rates?  You made your reservation on the same day of your arrival and our website had the construction banner all over it.  I am sorry you missed it but you cannot blame us for tricking you.  In fact when you did not like the construction, we offered you without penalty to cancel your reservation immediately, to relocate somewhere else.  My sincere apology that the pool was not available.  We are still offering all our Brand pillars: our free cooked to order breakfast, Evening reception and a Brand new two room suite.  We also ensure that there is no construction on the weekends.  I am sorry that you find it necessary to write such a misleading review.

Summary: We have stayed at this location many years ago and forgotten about it because it was just ok. And then this year we booked our hotels and found a deal and was surprised it was the same hotel. lol we didnt' even remember until we drove up into the parking lot and kinda recognized this hotel. We are used to staying at Embassy Suites and some are nicer than others and this one definitely from the front and outside not the nicer newer ones but I heard it was renovated since we have been here and my husband remembered that last time they put us right in front of the elevator which we heard all night long. Funny how I didnt' remember that. So this time around he specifically asked if they can put us away from the elevator but in the newly renovated area. The funny thing is they did

The hotel has convenient shuttle service to Disneyland and the breakfast  in the Koi pond area is a nice feature. It is currently under renovation and so the guest business center, pool, and health spa are not functional at this time. Parking is abundant and well lite.

Summary Heading: THE BEST PLACE TO STAY WHEN VISITING DISNEYLAND
Summary: The location is far enough away from the parks that you are not crowded and dealing with crowded restaurants, etc.  There is a shuttle to and from the parks if you don't want to drive the 6 miles.  On the way there a plenty of places to eat.  2 miles away from the Orange mall.  You can get one room for your whole family.  The included breakfast saves time and money especially with kids.  The manager's reception is great for the parents and you can order from the menu to feed the kids if you choose.

Great service, prompt, and efficient. Never waited got in and out right away. Didn't mind the construction and the rooms were modern and clean.  There seemed to be plenty of space for parking and eating!

My wife and I planned out son’s first trip to Disneyland in Feb of this year. We booked our rooms here in Aug, and when we arrived in Dec. to find out that the hotel was under re-construction. The pool, spa and work-out facilities were closed, and most of the hotel was covered in plastic. The advise of the manager was to “drive to the Orange ES, to use their pool, and workout room”. CRAZY!!! We have counted on the amenities that Embassy Suites are known for such as the pool, spa, and workout room. There was no notice given at the time we booked about these conditions, nor were we notified of any possibility of reconstruction following the booking. When we arrived, we were ambushed with the conditions, and the manager was unwilling to discount the rate. Frankly it was THE WORST
Manager Response: Dear BWilliams2015,  Thank you for posting your feedback regarding your first impressions when arriving at our location.  BWilliams2015, we were not hiding the facts about our renovation.  When you booked in August, we did not have any firm dates for the work.  As soon as we had confirmation we immediately posted it on our website and emailed all those reservations with valid emails.  It looks like you decided not to stay with us and moved to another hotel.  I am sorry for your inconvenience Bwilliams 2015.

Summary: This hotel is under construction.  If you want to sleep in, I would recommend another hotel.  However, if you wake up early in the morning, then stay at this hotel.  Very clean, staff is very kind and very professional.

This hotel is under construction for renovation.  We picked it because we have stayed at Embassy before.  Our granddaughters were very disappointed about the pool being closed. The atmosphere was one of construction. The rooms are set on heat or a/c depending on the outdoor temp.  Our room was very hot, but outside was cool, so we could not cool it off.  We opened the slider at the balcony and the screen door fell off.  We propped it up so we could get some air. The shower curtain fell down when we attempted to shower.  The room had other problems. There are lots of good hotel rooms in this area.  Pick elsewhere.
Manager Response: Dear dlw50,  My sincere apologies for your disapointment during your stay with us.  We had notification on our website in regards to areas being unavailable during construction and I regret that you were not informed.  By beginning February we should have the guest amenities back in service, especially pool, fitness center, restaurant and bar.  I am sure this does not help you, now.  By May, we should have everything done in the hotel for all to enjoy.  Thank you for staying with us.

Summary: This wasn't the hotel I planned to stay in.  However, it is a very pleasant surprise, as I had never stayed in an Embassy Suites before.  What a surprise I was in for!  Very comfortable, very attentive staff.  The free breakfast, while good, wasn't overwhelming.  And I could've used free wifi (there was a charge for wifi access), but I suppose they have to make their money somewhere.  I have another trip to plan for in March, and may well be staying here again.    It is worth noting that the parking lot is shared with a nightclub.  If you're staying on a weekend, try to be back at your room early to avoid having to park far from the hotel.

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay With Family
Summary: We stayed at Embassy Suites two nights while visiting Amaheim. The rooms were a nice size with comfortable beds and a great free breakfast. They had switched from A/C to heat and the first night our room was way too warm ( we were on the 3rd floor). My son-in-law when down to the front desk and told them and they fixed the problem right away so that the room was much cooler the next night. There was construction going on, but didn't cause any problems for us while there.

We stayed here during our visit to Disneyland for 10 nights and it was wonderful!! We saw the fireworks from our hotel if we happened to be there..Breakfast was wonderful and manager's reception great for us adults!! Really a special hotel for a little more money if you can do it!!!
Manager Response: Dear brendi934,  Thank you very much for your great review.  After 10 days of experiencing everything in our hotel and writing a beautiful review, is a credit to our staff.  We truly appreciate it and hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Had a weekend getaway with the family, the room was nice, looks like they were just remodeled,  the hotel is about 15 min away from Disneyland, there is shuttle service, location is nice, if your coming from outside of the area, its right off the freeway, you can't miss it, there's some construction going on but they start around 10am, by then we were at Disneyland, had a good time, employees were friendly. I give it a thumbs up, we got back to the hotel at midnight and they had Security personnel in the parking lot, I liked that, and had plenty of parking spaces ready for the Hotel guest, I guess they've been paying attention to the comments on trip advisor

Be wary of the construction, its not limited to the areas they say. Hammers just above you at 0730 in the morning on your vacation is quite annoying. There is a Night Club across the parking, late arrivals have to park rather far from the hotel and avoid the night club crowd to get to the front door. Night Club Goers obnoxiously party inside the hotel as well as outside.

Summary Heading: Construction... Night Club... Quarry...Locked out of room every night & Overcharged
Summary: Okay, so this hotel was recommended to me by a co-worker who recently visited with his family.  He raved about the indoor pool and awesome breakfast.  So I thought, well... the rate was good, free breakfast seems like a hit, they have a shuttle to Disneyland can't forget that, and rooms were recently renovated is a good sign.  I gave it three stars because I think it has the potential to be a great hotel. I have stayed at other Embassy Suites and was very impressed.  I may not return to this one because of what I didn't know and my experience with surrounding businesses...   1. Indoor pool and Gym is under construction (date on site stated it would mid-December, it actually started December 1st).  So much for my boys to swim and us to bringing our work-out clothes.  But, if you

Had my work party here while there was construction taking place. They did the best in covering the remodel sites. The rooms have been updated and are nice and clean. There was an issue with parking because the hotel shares the parking lot with a night club that charges for parking. Was disappointed with the morning breakfast. They were limited on the choice of items and some of the food was over cooked. Front desk staff was very friendly. Great place for the Disney weekend.

Summary Heading: Wouldn't stay here again if they PAID me to
Summary: This is going to be a very long and detailed review, but I certainly want everyone who uses Trip Advisor to KNOW what they are getting themselves into before booking a room here! I am a Diamond Hilton Honors member and I've spent more than 100 nights in hotels just this year. I thought I had experienced everything until I stayed at this Embassy in November. There are multiple issues, so let me get started.........  There is major construction at the hotel. Yes, I understand that construction will eventually end. I get that. I also understand that they are only working on a few floors at a time. I get that too. But what I do NOT get is the fact that this hotel does not give any type of WARNING when reservations are made. Yes, there is a sign posted on the wall when you check in,
Manager Response: Dear TNharleychick,  Thank you for your detailed review for our facility.  Unfortunately it is very unflattering but we do respect your opinion and some of the items you brought up, would be rectified.  I am very sorry that you did not enjoy your stay.  Yes, we are under construction but it does not start until 9 AM on weekdays and 10 AM on weekends.  We have hired security to facilitate the parking situation with our neighbors.  It is a Dance night club but the soundproofing was done in a way that we cannot hear it from our building and you can check the Anaheim City Building Department, because it was tested before issuing a permit.    Again my apologies for your lack luster experience here.  We are always striving to do better.

Summary: This hotel is great. The rooms  have just been remodeled and are gorgeous and CLEAN. The breakfast is fantastic as it is at all Embassy Suites. This location was cheaper than the others closer to Disneyland, but it was an easy quick drive and not an issue for us. Would highly recommend this or any Embassy Suites hotel.

Hotel was very clean and very convenient to locations visited. Easy access to intersate system for travels to the different locations in Anahiem and Long Beach during my stay. The food was good and staff showed high levels of commitment to customer service. Vey accessible parking and convenient elevator locations. Will stay there again on my next trip to this area.

Everything one would expect from the average Embassy Suites. Same layout, nice amenities, breakfast, etc. Some noise from 91 freeway though. Under construction at present time but didn't interfere with much, we didn't have time for pool or fitness club. It was a great price for the accommodations but, I would not stay here again when visiting Disney. Too far from park, so Anaheim Transit only comes every hour. Not as convenient.

Great experience even with 2 floors under renovation.   Notice the hotel caters to the family crowd with Disneyland as the main attractions.  We were there for other reasons besides Disney. Great location to local food and ease access to the freeway.  Would stay again.
Manager Response: Dear James K,  Thank you so much for your great review of our hotel, even considering the on-going renovation. We really appreciate your feedback.  Just to let you know that we have completed the renovation of our second floor and should be done with the seventh floor by mid December.  As of right now, we have half the lobby, the lounge area, the restaurant, pool and fitness areas under renovation which should be completed by year end.  We serve all our food services and Evening Reception in the breakfast area.  The current minor inconveniences will result in a brand new product for all to enjoy.

Summary: We went to stay one night while we were visiting the Disneyland Resort. Although the site is a bit of a drive from Disneyland, it was well worth it. I recommend this site for anyone on a budget but still wanting to experience quality accommodations and good service.

Construction, Construction, Construction! Noise, Noise, Noise the staff was not helpful and the breakfast was gross, old potatoes runny eggs. dried out  sausage. Do not stay here. Do not stay here. Do not stay here. Do not stay here. ........
Manager Response: Dear Rachel C,  Yes I am sorry we had construction going on Monday starting at 9AM.   We have it posted on our website and many posters throughout the property.  My apologies for the inconvenience.

Summary: We usually love Embassy Suites. However, this one is under construction and sandwiched between a night club and a quarry.  We were down by the quarry.  Beginning at 6am each day, we heard beep, beep, beep of trucks backing up and the ringing of the elevators went until mid-night and started first thing the next morning.  Also, breakfast wasn't as good as most Embassy Suites.  There was no computer to use while we there but they wanted us to pay for internet.  At the $125/night we paid, I would not recommend it.  I wish we'd stayed at the Hampton Suites for $90 instead.

We really like Embassy Suites. We were not informed of the construction which took away from the experience, although the construction workers were very pleasant. We were told that the room was a renovated room, which it was, the tub didn't drain properly, filling with water as you showered, and the drywall around the door in the bedroom was cracked and looked bad, not what we are used to at your hotels. The staff who cleaned the room did a good job but failed to restock the coffee in the room. These are just small things and we will stay again next year at this hotel.

Summary Heading: Next to a nightclub - car broken into --
Summary: Where do I even begin?... I guess I'll start with my subject line... This hotel shares a parking lot with a nightclub. We were staying here with family for a wedding and when we returned last night there was an abundance of young people standing in lines for the club and in the parking lot. When we went to our car to leave this morning, the back window of our car was smashed in. Okay, people suck and things stolen can be replaced, but the worst part... The hotel took no responsibility for it. The man at the front desk did not care, continued to take phone calls and basically said there was nothing they could do. They didn't even come out and help us pull the rest of the glass out of the car. But as we were leaving they sent someone out to sweep up the mess. Wouldn't want any of
Manager Response: Dear Danielle A,  We DO CARE about customers, otherwise we would be out of business.  I sincerely apologize for what happened to you.  Cars get broken into anywhere, even with security present.  I wish we can help it.  My biggest concern was the lack of compassion and understanding shown to you.  In fact, I understand that the person that came out to clean was to clean the inside of your car first then the outside but you were ready to leave.  Dear Danielle A:  Because of the construction we are undergoing, we kept our prices below the competition to make up for the inconveniences.  Thank you for your review and again with my apologies.

Summary: 2 defining qualities; the location was close to clients; overall service and amenities were spot on; quiet is most important which this venue clearly succeeds. Service of staff is very evident as they look to ensure you get your needs met.

We stayed while they were undergoing a major renovation to the hotel, but we weren't inconvenienced at all - it still seemed just as perfect as any other of my stays at an Embassy Suites.  The breakfast was still complete and made-to-order (excellent omelettes). The construction only took place during the daytime, so we never heard a thing until about 10am on the day we were checking out.
Manager Response: Dear Byrd11,  On behalf of the entire staff, we "Thank you very much" for your great review.  As a "Top Contributor" your opinion means a lot.  As most guests are out during the day, whether on business or pleasure, we restrict the big drilling noises from 9AM to 5PM, which seems the least inconvenient for our guest.  On weekends we do quiet work, in order not to disturb our valued guests.  Again, thank you very much for the recognition.

Summary Heading: No Parking - Very Noisy to2AM - Staff basically shrugged
Summary: No parking for Hotel Guest - parking taken over by nearby NightClub  Nightclub guests avoided paying for their parking by taking up the Hotel spaces then spent hours under our windows cursing, vomiting, smoking, and causing commotions all to the very strong BASS Beat  from the club.   Time on the Alarm Clocks in our 2 Suites were wrong and can't be adjusted by the Guest   If you do wake up on time  - No Hot Water for your AM Shower (in either Suite we reserved)  Staff seem uninterested in finding solutions - especially locating the Embassy Suites Driver to move his Van that was taking up 4 to 5 parking spaces  - She assured several hotel guests ( as we were stacking up at the front desk) he would take care of it BUT that she had no estimate of when   Upon check out I told the
Manager Response: Dear JDFAB 707,  I am soooo sorry for your bad experience.  I know our Director of Front Office has been in touch with you in the hope of rectifying the situation.  Your challenge with parking was in fact a problem that night.  We had a very large group meeting that was suppose to depart at 9 PM, before guests returned from the Park.  Unfortunately, they stayed until 10:30 pm.  Between this meeting and the club patrons that ended up parking on our side, it was a challenge for all.  Your experience with the lack of hot water is disturbing, as we never had that problem before.  We also checked our water boilers and it all seemed fine.  I can only apologize at this point.  Through all our reviews, no one ever mentioned that challenge before.  I hate to lose you as a frequent customer and a Diamond member and hope you will reconsider us again.

Summary: 1. Switched rooms from 2 Queens to a 1 King due to water pipe bursting. 2. Pool was going to be closed for renovations during stay 3. Construction in the hotel made unbearable sounds - jack hammers, hammers, in the early AM!  4. Manager racially profiled husband at breakfast claiming that he was dressed differently. We were all in PJs! My husband was wearing jeans and a shirt!!!
Manager Response: Dear Evelyn J.,  Thank you for posting your comments.  If I may respond to the points you made: 1- I am sorry about your bed request.  It was made through a third party website as a request only and we did not have the room type next to your other party. 2- Pool was not closed and we would not close it before alerting arriving guests. 3- Yes, our renovation includes some jack hammering.  It does not start until 9 AM on weekdays and not on weekends.  4- My sincere apologies again for asking a guest in your party if he was staying in the hotel, which I do occasionally.  It had nothing to do with racial profiling and I apologized to your entire family while you were here.   Thank you again Ms. Evelyn J. for your feedback.

Summary: To sum up the experience, they select what type of room you get even though you book 2 queens they fail at holding your reservation.   Also if you like to find somebody else's worn underwear and t shirt in your room when you return to your room, definitely book this place.  General manager doesn't even take the time to call you back.  The construction is ridiculous when you book and they say the lobby is getting redone but actually the bar and late night food service is closed.
Manager Response: Dear Mr. D.,  I am very sorry about your experience during your last visit.  Because of the construction going on, we had a mishap that caused some rooms to flood.  This lessened our inventory of the queen beds, you booked.  We were only able to accommodate one of your rooms with the needed beds.  As I mentioned to you, I apologize for not getting your message.  It is still my responsibility to have my staff follow-up properly on any guest's request, including the need to call a guest.    During the bar remodeling, we have temporarily moved the beverage service to the other side of the lobby but have not discontinued nor limited service hours.  Our Director of Front Office has been in touch with you, to ensure your satisfaction for this last stay.  Thank you for giving us your feedback.

Summary: Extremely satisfied with Hotel and Staff. Everyone was very friendly and helpful.  The gentleman who took care of our meeting room was very efficient and helpful.  He kept everything stocked and fresh. The lunches served each day were very good and on time.  I would definitely recommend this facility for meetings.

Great staff very hospitable the food was great .. The hotel was under construction but that did not effect my stay or the staff from doing an exhalant job....  The room that were done looked fabulous .. Free Happy hour made my Co workers Happy ...

We stayed here for a trip to Disneyland and Universal Studios with our son and his family. The hotel staff couldn't have been nicer. Checkin was quick and we stayed in one of the newly renovated rooms. It was spacious and comfortable. Breakfast was very good with the option of made -to- order omelettes and many other choices. My husband had left his noise-canceling headphones and i-pod in the nightstand and we did not discover this until we were at the gate at the airport. I called the hotel and housekeeping found them and mailed them to us. I was very thankful for their honesty and promptness.

Summary Heading: Great but Disneyland Shuttle Was Terrible
Summary: This was a great hotel and exceeded my expectations. If you are planning to take the shuttle to Disneyland (ART), find a different hotel. If you're staying for something else, or will drive to Disneyland, great hotel!

Summary Heading: Watch out for unremodeled rooms' bar lock
Summary: Great hotel, free breakfast, quiet location, and free happy hour. Hotel is also being remodeled/renovated.  The only negative thing I have to say is if you are staying in a room that has not yet been remodeled (I stayed in room 234, on Halloween night), PLEASE be careful of the bar lock that is on the sliding door to the balcony. My boyfriend and I got locked out on the balcony after I shut the door and the bar lock fell, locking us out for over an hour or two. We had latched the room door, so the front desk could not get in.   The only way we got back into the room was when I crammed my fingers between where the doors meet, and unlocked the bar lock. Both of us are still young, so there was no harm done other than wasted time, but please be aware of this if you have a family,

If it doesn't matter, this place is located near a metal recycling facility.  They have huge trucks dumping scrap metal to cars all night. They do shut down over the weekend though. This hotel is near enough to Disneyland but can be a bit confusing to get to the park even with gps. We finally got it figured out after 3 days. Was about 15 minutes to the Mickey and Friends parking garage lot at Disneyland which is the main parking lot.   The newly renovated rooms are just re-wall papered, new pictures on the wall, etc.  There is mold in the grout in the shower. The shower faucet wasn't even connected to the wall completely.  There were cobwebs with lots of dead bugs in them right outside our door by the light on the wall. The room doors didn't close by themselves like most hotels.

We have stayed a few times at the Embassy Suites in Orlando and always had a great stay.  This helped me decide to stay at this hotel on our way to our cruise vacation.  When I made our reservation, I asked for a higher floor with an already updated room away from the elevators.  Upon check in, I stopped at the ladies room close to the bar.  The floor was completely flooded by an overflowing toilet.  This was rather disgusting and I informed the front desk about it.  From the amount of water, the toilet had been running for a good amount of time.    We were given a room on the fourth floor away from the elevators.  The room was updated but some items were not.  The doorway entrance had paint chips missing from it.  At first glance, I thought there were crushed potato chips in

Summary Heading: Clean and Comfortable with a Friendly Staff
Summary: We recently stayed here for 3 nights for a Disney and Universal trip. The shuttle to and from Disney is very prompt. The hotel is not close to Universal but we knew that in advance and chose to stay at a hotel closer to Disney. There are closer hotels to Disney but they are a little higher priced and book up a lot faster. Our room was very clean with comfortable beds to sleep in after long days at the parks. The staff was very friendly and accommodating and the cooked to order breakfast was great each morning. Will definitely stay at this location again.

If your staying there to go to Disneyland it's not very close, The front desk people will tell you it's a 10 minute ride on the shuttle bus, it's actually 20 mins. The shuttle is very efficient and runs on time.  We have stayed at lots of embassy suites and the evening reception is by far the worst for the food offered, Popcorn or chips and salsa. If you want a coffee in the morning after the breakfast service is done at 9 am there's no where to get one.  The housekeeping service was horrible 1 day they left us 1 towel for the entire room and the next day they just never bothered to clean the room at all.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.     Darrell

The hotel was ok but will never stay here again when going to Disneyland it is much too far from the park and there is a nightclub in the same parking lot of this hotel and so it is very hard to find parking late at night.  Both night coming back to the hotel from Disneyland we had to drive around for 20 mins to find a parking and then had to park in the back of the building very far from our room with two sleepy heavy kids.  I will never stay here again if going to Disneyland.  This hotel is better for other stays.  Stick to the Embassy on Harbor when going to Disneyland

The front desk was not friendly but the rest of the staff were very friendly and helpful.  Dinner was fabulous and a great surprise.  The room was very clean, quite, with warm relaxing colors.  The water in the shower was not as warm as I would like but the room made up for it.

I stayed one night at this hotel to be close to a morning event we were attending.  We arrived late and had to wait (not in line) to be checked-in.  The HHonors station was unmanned.  There were 2 agents - both attending to a group check-in.  Neither of them so much as looked up to acknowledge other guests. After finally getting checked-in, I had to ask if my HHonors number was on the reservation before I was handed two bottles of water.  In the grand scheme of things, that was not as disappointing as the room itself. The smell of the room was musty ... and the location was opposite of what is on my HHonors profile. It was on a low floor and as far away from the elevator as you can get.  The furniture in the room needs a serious upgrade.  The upholstery on the sofa bed was
Manager Response: Dear Judith S.:  Thank you for your survey and comments on your stay with us.  My apologies for not acknowledging you as you stood to be checked-in, we should have paid more attention.  You are correct, the room you stayed in was not our best room.  It is scheduled for complete remodeling next Monday, thus completing our entire hotel's guestroom renovation.  We were trying to place you away from the very large group.  Thank you for your loyalty to our Brand and please give us another try.

Summary: Hotel is a few miles away from Disneyland, but the Disneyland shuttle picks you up just outside the front door of the hotel.  Very convenient as the shuttle makes only one other stop on the way to disneyland.  Breakfast is convenient and not too shabby.

Summary Heading: Don't stay here is you have children with you
Summary: Too far from Disneyland when they said it was only minutes from there. It is more like 40 minutes from there. You take a bus--not a taxi as we were told.  The rooms have a musty odor. The lobby and view from elevator are BEAUTIFUL. The coi pond is a delight.  Do not count on the pool (it was closed). Breakfast is NOT when they say it is.  But, the personnel are GREAT.
Manager Response: Dear 8Emm8:  Thank you very much for your compliments to our Staff.  That was great recognition. It sounds like you got stuck in traffic, I am sorry about that.  You can google our location, it is exactly 6.4 miles or 11 minutes.  As far as the pool closure; a child had an unfortunate accident in the pool.  For everyone's safety, we had to close the pool and shock the water, which takes 48 hours to clear.  Having many kids around, accidents like this do happen.  I apologize for the inconvenience.  Thanks a lot Emm8 for staying with us and for your feedback.  We appreciate it.  Would you please give us another chance?

Summary: Had a great stay-relaxing, quiet, the room was clean & very nice. Was close to the Convention Center and Downtown Disney where we spent our weekend. The breakfast was great and the atrium area was so beautiful We'd definitely stay again.

I just had a few days and the experience was perfect since the beginning. I had a room book for more days than needed due to change in plans and was not able to change it at all due to the hotel being booked up. however the supervisor Christiana was able to change the booking to what I needed, she was also there at my check in and she made sure that I was taken good care of. because of her and the Hotel I recommend this hotel any day.!
Manager Response: Dear Carmelitan75:  It was a pleasure reading your Trip Advisor review.  On behalf of the entire Staff, we thank you. Just to let you know that Kristiana was appropriately recognized for your feedback and her efforts.  We are all proud of Kristiana.  Thank you so much for staying with us Carmelitan75 and for your wonderful review.  We really hope to see you again.

Summary: Love the atrium lobby area, and the complimentary drinks and snacks. Breakfast was good but the bacon and sausage a bit soggy and undercooked the first day. We were picking out the more cooked ones.  2nd and third day that it was a different cook and it was better. My daughter and her husband experienced the same thing for breakfast at the other Embassy Suites South. Rooms were comfy but outdated and in need of repairs, fan in bathroom not working and was terribly hot and humid after a shower. However looked like repairs were in the works as the whole 2nd floor was under construction. We stayed on the 6th floor. Staff was really friendly and kind. We would stay there again in the future.

We mstayed at Embassy Suites North min Anaheim Ca.  The hotel was great in every aspect other than having to wait 2 hours before check in and the so called hors d'erves consisted of chips and salsa and chex mix.  The staff werre very aimiable, courteous an d treid hard to please.  My7 family and I were extremely happy with our stay and I wished I could say the same for Disneyland.

Very nice hotel, felt very comfy there. Staff wonderful, very clean, Area friendly, close to everything. Went to a family function, was only 6 miles away, really liked that. Pool area  clean, liked the pool opened till 11:00pm. Had lunch there, also very nice.  Freeway access perfect.  Will stay here again!

Summary Heading: Authors in the OC book signing event
Summary: With over 300 women at one event you would think that someone would leave unhappy with the services but EVERY attendee left happy.  The hotel staff was always willing to help with anything that came up.    I am signing a contract again for next year because I honestly do not think another hotel would be so accommodating to so many women.

First time staying in this place, I would recommend it to my friends and family, breakfast was great. Receptionist who checked us in was very nice and helpful. My kids had fun in the pool. Didn't get to make it to the happy hour they provide, hopefully we'll get to experience it at our next stay here. A bit far from Disneyland Parks but I would definitely would stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Irma P.,  We are very happy that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you so much for your kind words regarding our services.  Hope to see you next time you are in the area.

Summary: I reserved a room for $159/night and was charged $229/night.  Food was lousy.  Room was clean and people were nice. Blanket quality was very low and there was only one thin blanket in the room.  I would not stay here again for the price.
Manager Response: Dear Lin W.,  Thank you for giving us your feedback on your stay with us.  My apologies if you felt that we baited you then switched the rates.  Your original reservation was for 2 adults and you ended up with 4 registered adults, which increased the rates.  We were not trying to cheat you!  In fact when you voiced your dissatisfaction, we adjusted off the difference and only charged you for 2 adults instead of the 4 you had.  Sorry that you felt as if we were trying to over charge you.  We hope next time you are in the area you would stay with us again.

Summary: We specifically asked TWICE for a quiet room and so out of the SEVEN floors in this large hotel, that was less than half full!, they put us between two noisey neighbors and right above the LOUD construction blasts EARLY in the morning!  Is a quiet room too much to ask for over $150. a night??  We got very little sleep.   The nice rooms did not make up for lack of sleep!  The one thing we paid extra for...a good nights sleep...they did not provide.  We have stayed here before but this will be the last time.  They also could not even provide free wi-fi.
Manager Response: Dear Tigger92,  Please accept our apologies for the loud neighbors you encountered during your stay with us.  I hope you know that we had no way of knowing the behavior traits of your neighbors.  We were trying to accomodate your request for a quiet room and placed you on an upper floor.  As far as the construction noise, we try to minimize it and only allow work done between the hours of 9AM and 5PM on weekdays, with a start time of 10AM on weekends.    Based on the less than satisfactory/ restfull night you had here, please Tigger92, call me next time before your arrival and I will do whatever it takes to make you happy.

Summary: Being remodeled and will be incredible.  The two room suite was HUGE and staff was pleasant.  Very nice lobby area to relax with foliage, etc.  Need to drive to get anywhere though.  I would stay here again should the opportunity arise.

Summary Heading: Don't expect to use the fitness center
Summary: Overall, staff is very nice and most of the amenities are the typical Embassy Suite level and quality.  There is an exception. The exercise machines in the fitness center. Something is broken on every one of them. I mentioned this to the staff. They pleasantly listened, but no action was taken. Even the same after a return several weeks later. Sad.
Manager Response: Dear TravlinRon2014,  Thank you for giving us your feedback on your recent stay with us, especially your good comments on the Staff here.  which we really appreciate hearing about.  Regarding our fitness equipment, I could not find the detail challenges with each machine but asked the maintenance company to come out and check every machine.  I appreciate you reporting it, as no other guest did and yet they are used heavily.   Dear TravlinRon 2014, please let me know on your next visit if it was all taken care of to your satisfaction.  Thank you.

Summary: Great place to stay while visitng disney parks... it is very family friendly, the complimentary breakfast is a major plus and great quality as  well as kid friendly. Very clean and comfortable. The shuttle service to the parks makes it very convenient. And the very clean and very nice pool/spa area are perfect for relaxing after a long day at the parks.
Manager Response: Dear Shenny D.,  It was a pleasure receiving your beatiful endorsement for our property.  It was great hearing about how much you and your family enjoyed it, here.  When you travels bring you back to our area, please come back and stay with us.  Thank you very much for your review.

Summary: We booked the "free Shuttle special" online via the Hilton website however upon attempting to retrieve our shuttle passes Wednesday morning we were told this wasn't what we booked. A manager was retrieved and after explaining and showing her our reservation confirmation and walking her through your OWN website, she requested I email her the website I used, a screen shot of the offer for the Anaheim North location and a copy of my reservation confirmation. Now we had missed the shuttle, our Magic Morning opportunity was gone and we had to wait some more because they were calling us a Taxi. Reluctantly she provided us with passes for the remainder of out stay. The interaction wasn't pleasant at all and I felt like I was being treated as if I was some sort of con artist as opposed

Stayed here for one night on my way to Disneyland as we arrived early for our reservation at the Grand Californian. In all honestly we should of just stayed here, the grand Californian is nice but it was no nicer than this place. The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable and it was quiet. For the money it can't be beat. I will be staying here on my future trips to Disneyland. It only took about 10 minutes to get to Disneyland and roughly 15 minutes to Knotts Berry Farm.

Nice hotel I wish there were other restaurants around and Disney was future I thought.  Breakfast was great and the hotel is very clean and the employees were very friendly.  Location is not the best if you want to do other things besides Disney.

Summary Heading: Our Stay at Embassy Suites Anaheim
Summary: The room furnishing have been tastefully updated.  The complementary breakfast buffet is excellent and includes a chef who can prepare custom-made omelets.  The bar is also excellent with an evening reception that offers free drinks.

My wife and I stayed at this property while visiting Disneyland .... our third trip. The rooms are even better now that they have remolded. While visiting my wife celebrated her birthday and two beautiful young ladies (Olivia & Darlene) at the evening front desk REALLY made her birthday even better and sweeter. Once we were back from Disney they surprised her with a slab of delicious chocolate cake. This property is not far at all from Disneyland if you want to drive and they have a GREAT shuttle service to and from. As always the breakfast was incredibly delicious and my jalapeno-jalapeno-jalapeno cheese omelet was the best  See you in 2015

Summary Heading: Sure didn't feel like an Embassy...disappointed!
Summary: This hotel was disappointing. The room was dirty, the employees were extremely rude. The breakfast was awful, and the cook has a potty mouth. The girl at the desk charged my credit card wrong twice and kept my credit card. Embassy hotels are my most favorite of the Hilton and Marriott brands. This hotel is currently getting a renovation. Might need to renovate some employees as well.
Manager Response: Dear Italianmission:  Thank you for taking the time to express your feedback about your hotel stay.  Based on your experience I could not begin to apologize for such a bad visit.  Could you PLEASE call the hotel and ask for me.  I would love to get some details from you in order to be able to address these defficiencies. Please call me Mr. Italianmission.  I do care about every guest's experience.

Summary Heading: Afordable suites with transportation to Disney
Summary: We stayed here back in July and enjoyed our stay in the 1 bedroom suite.  We really enjoyed the breakfast buffet.  Since it was farther away from Disneyland it was cheaper than the other closer Embassy Suites.  We also booked here because they offered discounts for Disney park hopper tickets.  For the Anaheim Resort Transit to Disney, make sure you buy your transit ticket from the front desk before you need to get on the bus.   The elevators near the lobby  could be busy at times, so we used the rear elevators.

We came to Anaheim to celebrate our Daughter's 7th Birthday at Disney.  This was our 3rd trip to the area in as many years, and was by far the most memorable to date.  We had previously stayed at locations much closer to Disney, but found that the service always seemed rushed and not worth the additional cost.  This year we took a chance on a hotel a little further away.  This was a wonderful decision and really made our trip.  The staff was absolutely AMAZING!  They really made an effort to make this trip special for our Daughter.  When the Front Desk Clerk found out that it was her birthday, she made a point to bring up a plate of cookies and a card for her to find when we returned from Disney.  This was a home run, of course.  During breakfast the next day, one of the servers

Service was Excellent. I was late booking my room for a business seminar, and Hotel staff stepped up and took care of it. They've earned my loyality. 5th floor appeared to be under re-furbishment, but no construction sounds, ( I was under it, 4th floor , very quiet ). Fantastic Koi pond in garden area, Decent complimentary breakfast & pleasant complimentary 'Happy Hour'. I would recommend staying here.

Summary Heading: BEST HOTEL FOR A QUICK GETAWAY
Summary: Our stay was absolutely wonderful.  It was quiet and very romantic, and the staff was great!  The complimentary breakfast was a good variety of healthy cereal & oatmeal to splurging on pancakes, bacon & sausage.  Also the hotel grounds was breathtaking from the indoor swimming pool to the beautiful atrium and exotic fish pond.  We will absolutely visit again real soon!

Summary Heading: Good central location to many attractions.
Summary: Great location right off the freeway. Family vacation visiting Knotts and the beach. Great managers reception and breakfast, quiet rooms even on freeway side. I've elevator was down due to repair and slow to clean up tables during breakfast, but other than that it was great.

Great experience. Well worth the price. The rooms were nice, and the beds were clean. Two TV's - one in the living room area and one in the bedroom area, and they both worked. The hotel staff was very nice. the lobby was impressive. If I'm ever in this area again, I will be staying at this hotel. BOOKING DOT YEA!!!

This embassy Suites is a little off the path of most tourist attractions but close enough to enjoy them. The rooms were very well done and I could not complain about any part of the hotel and the rooms. So if you decide to go you'll will be pleased. They do offer the breakfast and happy hour which are both excellent. The pool is indoors so you know your kids are close by. Well worth the stay...

Great place to stay great new rooms , bed very comfortable , great food in the restaurant. Awesome Staff. I love the open Atrium with lots of live plants and Koi Fish in an open pond. A really nice place to relax and get some fresh oxygen. This is one of the best overall places I have stayed and I travel a lot.   Thank you, Jeff

I chose this hotel based on location, internet reviews and my Hilton Honors status.  I rate this hotel excellent across the board including the sleep quality (i.e., bedding and linens).  I will certainly return to Embassy Suites Anaheim North.

I almost exclusively stay at Hilton hotels and have come to expect a certain level of quality and service and this hotel missed the mark on many fronts. There are two quality embassy suites near Disneyland in Anaheim South and Orange, do yourself a favor and book at one of those.  Managers reception was crumbled chips, salsa, jalapeños and popcorn.   Managers have no sense of service and it took two hours to get a rollaway to my room.  Location is terrible if you are going to a theme park! There is a reason the parking is free.
Manager Response: Dear Buzz84:  Thank you for sharing your feedback on your stay with us.  Obviously, we wish we had made a better impression and delivered better service.  We do not carry rollaway beds in the Embassy Suites because all our suites have already the pull-out sofa bed.  It is possible the Staff were perplexed about fulfilling your request.  We should have informed you immediately of the situation.  Please accept my sincere apologies for not meeting your expectations.  As a frequent Hilton traveler, thank you for your loyalty Buzz84.

Summary Heading: Not all Embassy Suites are alike
Summary: I enjoy staying at Embassy Suites when I am with my kids.  The pool is inside (This one open until 11pm), free breakfast, separate room with TV for the kiddos, frig and microwave.  However, these rooms in this Embassy Suites was poorly designed and could be overhauled.  The bathroom door is in the master bedroom so when the master bedroom is closed, the kids have to knock on Mom and Dad's door to go to the bathroom.  It was chaos in the morning with the kids traipsing through our room to shower, get dressed, etc.   They should invest in some upgrading and especially move the door.  The whole point of separating the kids from the adults is to get some privacy.  The bathroom should be in the middle of the two rooms like most embassy suites are!  Also, my husband and I got bitten

Great breakfast selection, nice ambience, nice spacious suites, great atmosphere. Staff was kind and efficient. Also has an indoor pool and hot tub. Definitely would recommend this hotel. Dedicated shuttle to Disneyland Resort a plus (with a $5 fee for an all day shuttle pass)

I can only review on my experience of the poor handling of overbooking by the hotel.   I had called Embassy / Hilton at 10am the morning of my check in date to notify the hotel that I would be arriving past midnight, and ensuring that my room be guaranteed with a credit card.   The agent told me that no problem, a note will be left for front-desk.   After arriving at the hotel at midnight, I was told my room was given away and I was being moved to the Hotel Fullerton.   I said I had called ahead and the front-desk staff just said , "i don't know.  I didn't get here till 11 am."    In the meanwhile, I see another guest walking in and getting a room.  Listen, when I call the hotel, I don't care/know if I'm talking to a contact center or the front-desk.   My family was asleep in
Manager Response: Dear Sweetand sour:  My sincere apologies for not honoring your reservation.  It is not a normal practice as we had some unforeseen circumstances.  Hotels are like any other building, where things happen.  Of course our job is to prepare for all emergencies and I am sorry this time we could not take care of you at this Hotel and hopefully your stay at the Hilton Anaheim was pleasant.   Please contact me next time your travel brings you to our area.

Summary: This hotel was phenomenal in every way!!! First the price for a two night stay was really affordable. The room was spectacular and the style of the hotel had a classic, family friendly feel to it. Since it was my anniversary with my girlfriend I pre requested a fruit platter and the hotel was able to provide it! The hotel staff went above and beyond and contributed to making the engagement I planned for my girlfriend really special. They were so amazing! The morning buffet was excellent. The hotel provides hourly shuttles to disneyland and other locations  which makes it convenient to enjoy the major attractions around Anaheim. My fiance really enjoyed this hotel so much that she wants us to come back here for our yearly anniversary. This was one of the best hotels I have stayed

Every time we go to Disneyland we stay here. Being annual pass holders we go about 4 times a yr for 3 to 4 days each time. We love that a cook to order breakfast is served every morning, which saves us about about $90 during are stay. Disney is about 15 minutes away but they do offer a shuttle service every 30 minutes for a fee. The staff is great but down side is room service stops around 10:30 to 11pm, so be prepared to order out if you arrive back hungry after hours. Oh they also have a manager reception from 5:30pm to 7:30 pm, where they serve wine, beer, sodas,  popcorn and chips and dip for free :) It really is a nice hotel.

Summary Heading: Would stay again in a heartbeat
Summary: We enjoyed the spacious hotel, would have a couple of points to make that did not detract from our stay, just some pointers for the managers:  1 - after the manager's reception on Saturday (where we never saw the manager), the elevators close to the lobby and the floors were littered with popcorn from kids running around with popcorn from the reception.  I would have thought by Sunday morning this certainly should have been cleaned and it was not.  There was a plastic fork under our pull out bed, makes one wonder what else might have been missed.  The pool on Saturday night was dominated by a family making a lot of noise, it was annoying at 10 oclock at night when after a long hard day we wanted a little relxation in the hot tub, maybe a quite time could be enforced from 10 to

This is a great place for family to stay, the service during the morning buffet was excellent. Room might need updating specially the noisy doors and the swimming area needs to be more pleasant and clean. Otherwise I would stay here again.

Stayed here for 1 night. The room and bathroom need to be updated. Sofa bed is old too. We could hear the kid running around the room on the floor above us until after 10 pm, that is pretty bad. Breakfast was good.

My family of 5 stayed here Friday and Saturday night as a last trip before school starts.  I received the usual pre-checkin request email of HiltonHonors asking if we wanted anything in the room prior to our arrival.  I chose 2 extra towels (since hotels only give 4 max even though I reserve with 5), 2 extra pillows and 2 extra blankets.  All complimentary, which was cool. I received the confirmation email.  Checked in, but nothing extra was in the room.  Sigh...  The hotel is like other original Embassy Suites with the beautiful atrium, Koi fish ponds with Turtles, lush tropical landscaping, elevators with glass so you can look out going up and down, and a couple of bridges to cross over the pond.  Complimentary evening happy hour was great. Line was only 4-5 persons deep at

I am a Hilton diamond member and hands down, this is the worst embassy suites we have ever stayed at.  There is nothing close by and the restaurant/bar in the hotel is not good & slow service.  Ordered a turkey and avocado club - it arrived missing the avocado & cheese.  The room smelled like urine from two couch coushions that were urinated on.  We were told the cushions were switched out, but they still smelled in the same spots - guessing they febreezed and vacuumed & left cookies so we would put up with it.  We were supposedly in a newly renovated room, yet the room has several issues - grab bar coming off the wall in the shower, drain in tub falling apart, toilet leaking on the floor, outlet loose, shower curtain dirty with a big pink stain, door by handle & light switch

We chose this hotel because it was close to attractions we were going to - mainly Disneyland - but not too close to be noisy and full of kids. It was close to Disney took less than 15 minutes to get there, but it still had the Disney crowd. HOWEVER, the location itself was not ideal. Our room was on the back of the hotel and our view was of a metal salvage yard. There was some noise with trucks bringing in loads and such. The room was not up to the level we have come to expect in other Embassy Suites, and there was a big water leak or something in the lobby that disrupted getting around. The elevators were oddly placed as well, which made for some long hikes to our room. Overall, it was ok. I will probably look elsewhere if I return to the area.

Great customer service, the complementary breakfast was excellent. The suite was very clean and comfortable, felt like if I was at home. I would definitely stay in this hotel. I recommend it for any business or family travel.

It is was a very hot day in the area but I still expect the AC in a hotel room to cool the room - especially overnight in California where the temperature drops dramatically once the sun goes down but no such luck.  The room was not hot hot but it was not cool either even though I tried lowering the thermostat down.  You should also be aware that this hotel is 15 minutes from Disney so expect LOTS of children in the hotel.  The clerk checking me in was pretty clueless.  Could not find my reservation - took way too long.

Summary Heading: Staff was helpful and very nice
Summary: We had a really bad day of travel to get to California .. When we arrived at the hotel the staff noticed our despair on our faces and took action.. They really cared and even sent cookies and apologized for something they didn't don.. I really appreciate great service..

Great hotel chain with a great variety of amenities. The hearty breakfast with it's choices is the best part of the stay. The evening manager's reception has a great choice of snacks and drinks available for almost two hours

The Embassy Suites Anaheim was a good affordable choice for us.  It provided a great breakfast and lots of space in our room for us to spread out and feel comfortable.  They also have discounted Disney tickets available.

I liked the nice big rooms. The pond area down stairs was nice with the turtles and fish. It was  a roomy place and pretty quit overall. I would stay there again. I would like to see more healthy choices on the menu and I wish they had snack machines in the hotel.

Before I stayed at this hotel I read a lot of negative reviews about this hotel mostly about the remodeling going on and how the rooms were outdated and in not the best of shape. When I checked in I asked about the remodeling and they placed me in one of the refurbished rooms which had new furnishings smelled new and everything was very clean. The complimentary breakfast was great as usual and the staff was very friendly from the cleaning staff to the front desk. I don't know if all the rooms are as nice as the one I stayed in but I have no complaints and would definitely stay there again.

Hotel staff is terrible, maids will come and go out of you room when told you don't need them(don't leave valuables in your room). Elevators are constantly not working properly, staff keeps working ones locked and in use for themselves. Its quicker to use the stairs. Exterior doors are not secure at night(1 you cant even close without forcing it)which is real nice when 3 out of 4 nights I saw people sleeping in the parking lot.

The room itself was clean.  The bathroom was gross and old.  The thing that got me, though, were all of the gnats everywhere.  I stopped counting how many I killed after about a dozen.  The one thing I did like was that this hotel was far enough from the park that they didn't charge for parking.  I took that savings and drove my family to the park and paid for it there.  It may be cheaper, but if you can't stand small flying bugs, maybe this isn't for you.

Our family of 5 decided to venture out of our usual accommodations and try out this hotel. Check-in took longer than I expected due to some glitches in their online booking system. I normally book all our travel accommodations online and did the same for this particular stay. Because the baby was fast asleep in the car, we opted to have my husband stay in the car with the kids while I went to inquire about early check-in alone. When I was finally helped, the employee at the front desk was unable to find the reservation under my name. Fortunately, I had the reservation number with me on my phone. The reservation was under my husband's name which was a surprise since I had made the reservation utilizing my HHonors number. I did authorize for my husband to be able to check in under

Summary Heading: Crappy accommodations, sold out of the non refundable,  non transferable disneyland package!!!
Summary: I booked this hotel as a last minute surprise vacation for my daughter. It was a hotel that offered the Disneyland package at an affordable price.   Although the package was non refundable and non transferable I decided to purchase it anyway. After reading the many reviews on this website and others, I wanted to go ahead and take a chance on it. Big mistake!!!   When I arrived and checked in, not one person said anything about our Disneyland package. I had to initiate the details of my reservation. After doing so, I was told that this hotel was sold out of the Disneyland tickets and that I would have to go directly to the park and purchase more tickets. Who takes an extra $800 on vacation to purchase tickets that have already been paid for? I was also informed that in my package
Manager Response: Dear Ms. Bonham:  Thank you for your review.  It looks like you kept up with your threats to give us a real bad review if we did not give you all your money back.  It is regrettable that you used this unprofessional tactic to make your point.  We all apologized for having ran out of the 3 day park hoppers and we gave you ample credit to offset this inconvenience.   I am sorry that you found it necessary to write such a review.
