Summary Heading: Nice hotel with great customer service.  Currently undergoing $10 million renovation.
Summary: Our family of six stayed on the sixth floor and it was a suite that had already been renovated as the hotel is undergoing a $10 million renovation.  The fourth floor rooms were being renovated during our stay, but the renovation work was not loud or bothersome.  The hotel staff exhibited great customer service and were very friendly.  All amenities were operational during our stay.  The hotel is about a 10 minute ride from Disneyland.

Needed a place close to Doctor's office - we live out of town - and found this Embassy Suites.  Huge rooms, very friendly staff, excellent breakfasts.  We'll stay here again.  Nothing more to say. Is this 200 characters yet?

Here with family for 2 nights for a trip to Disneyland. Everything was awesome in the hotel.   5 STARS FOR Bryan: Bryan helped me with checkin.  As I was traveling with family I had a special need and Bryan understood it well and got me into a perfect room. He also ensured that once I see the room and disliked anything about it, I can get back to him and get another room. Both nights Bryan offered me and family with free water bottles,  which never happens in any good hotel across USA. I am a frequent traveller.  The room was really good. It was 2 rooms; one with 2 full sized beds and other had 1 sofa bed.  The beds were nice and the ambience of rooms was very good.   Complimentary Breakfast is a winner. There is enough choices for everyone.  They also have complimentary snacks

I love this hotel with plants, setting around the rooms, nice place to have a cocktail  and dinning, staff very friendly and professional, rooms are spacious, clean and nice to relax.this hotel is in a quiet area with free parking, free breakfast and reception is always nice to have additional amenities.

The hotel is very clean, rooms are spacious. We really liked the free breakfast, a lot to chose from  eggs, bacon, sausage, omelets, fruit, yogurt etc. it was perfect for our family of 5. Only negative is that the pool is very small for such a big hotel but it was clean. (indoor pool) and not a lot of restaurants around to chose from.  Other then that hotel is very comfortable.

Summary Heading: Service is ok but dirty hotel
Summary: This place is dirty..and it's not from the remodel.. I stayed here in January and in March because they were close to where I needed to go and I'm a Hilton honors member. After the hotel being dirty two visits in a row I sent an email to hilton. I figured that might prompt housekeeping to step it up so I tried it again in May. That is my last visit. I'm never staying here again. The bathrooms were not clean they had dust build up in the corners. I had blood on my cover sheet, crumbs were still on the desk from the occupant before me. When we checked in several rooms had dishes outside of them from room service..the same dishes with crusted on food were still sitting by the doors when we checked out the next day by all the doors. I used my Hilton points for my May visit and I
Manager Response: Dear Jen R.,  Thank you for your feedback on you last visit with us.  I sincerely apologize for the lack of cleanliness you experienced.  Let me assure you that it is a priority for myself and the Housekeeping staff, while there is no excuse for it.  After three visits and based upon your review I am actively participating with our housekeeping staff to ensure that we improve our cleanliness standard. Would you please contact me at the hotel?  Thank you.

Summary: I travel weekly to Southern California and needed a centrally located hotel to visit my reps in Orange County and the Inland Empire.  I also wanted a place with breakfast included, so Embassy Suites was top on my list.  This hotel is right off of the 91 freeway offramp, making it very convenient as a business location.  I also noticed that the hotel is on the local ART tram route, transporting people to and from Disneyland and other area attractions (great for the family).  Service was friendly and the room was spacious.  The only downside of this hotel is that it is right in the middle of nowhere - my view was of a river which had no water, the alternative would be the 91 freeway.  That being said, there is a shopping center about 4 miles through local roads and the hotel has a

Summary Heading: Not the quality I've come to expect from Embassy Suites
Summary: My family and I love staying at Embassy Suites but this particular hotel does not measure up.  When we checked in for the room we reserved through their website, they said we had reserved two rooms and required handicap access. I showed them our reservation confirmation and had to argue with them a bit to get things corrected. The hotel is under construction so there was only one working elevator on our side of the hotel and a five minute wait wasn't uncommon. The only stairs exited outside of the hotel.  About 8:30 in the morning we would hear construction above our room that sounded quite similar to a jack hammer. Occasionally it smelled as if a sewer line had broke and our room smelled awful. When we mentioned this to the front desk, the response was, "What do you want me to

This hotel was great!  I had booked a large party (7 rooms total) and they were able to quickly accommodate us,and even gave us the conference room to store our bags while we went to Disneyland!  The breakfast was incredible and all of the kids in the youth group loved it!  I will for sure be booking this hotel in the future for all of our trips!

Summary Heading: Wanted to be close to Disneyland and Convention Center.
Summary: I thought my stay would be close to LAConvention Center but realized traffic makes everything a 2 hour jaunt.  The hotels food was awesome for a hotel.  Our room was clean it was quiet until what must be Disney closing hour then hallways were bit noises.  We now choose corner rooms And that makes huge difference.   If you are coming from north you must pass Disney for few miles which means traffic.   Over all no complaints high score for food.

Summary Heading: Keep looking especially if you are a business traveler
Summary: This place is a dump. They respond to maybe 30 percent at best to maintenance requests. It's always hot not to mention unclean. The sofas are far too old while the carpet is damp in half the rooms I have stayed in over the last 6 months.   Housekeeping is terrible with dirty sheets and unswept and dirty carpet and tile. They don't mop consistently. Proven by broken glass in my room that should have been found by housekeeping if they actually mopped. Managers could care less. If you want a quiet, clean, cool room, keep looking. I have had quieter Hilton property rooms next to Disney.  One positive note is the speed of the internet here.
Manager Response: Thank you Ms. D. for your feedback.  I was hoping we had already addressed your concerns during your last two visits.  We do appreciate your business and hope you will be coming back soon.  Sincerely,

Summary: The team here treats you like family and always is accommodating to reasonable requests.   I always greeted like I’m special and will continue to come back.  Yes, the hotel is under renovations and could cause a little delay here or there but it will be worth it.   The complimentary breakfast and cocktail hour are also really good.

The entire hotel is under construction and I would not advise to stay here.  It is VERY loud and no appreciation given to those that are paying to stay at the hotel.  Many things were broken.  Other problems were the quality of the breakfast buffet.  Powdered eggs, etc...

Summary Heading: Construction in the hotel is your 6AM wakeup call
Summary: We were awoke each day by the pleasant sounds of an earthquake like drilling sound. Of the 2 west side group of elevators one was completely shut down the whole time and the other has a sign that elevator being used for construction crew daily from 6AM-6PM. We waited for between 5-15 minutes every time for the one elevator. Oh and dont be fooled by their Disneyland Shuttle package. We booked it and wanted to go to Disneyland at 11AM but guess what!? Their shuttle service takes a break from 11-4PM daily!!! Wow so we had to take a cab. Also they DO NOT charge for parking so you arent really getting a deal on that even though they mention Free Parking in room packages. Stay away, not worth the deal at all!
Manager Response: Dear Kent A.:  Thank you for your review.  Yes we were renovating 2 floors and the elevators in the same time.  Work does not start until 8 AM, but we are all done for now.  I am sorry you did not get to enjoy your stay with us.  Please try us post renovation and you will be amazed at the transformation of our property.  Sincerely,

Summary Heading: Went above and beyond in service
Summary: We have stayed here before and it's our go to place when we come to Anaheim. It is about a 10 minute drive to Disneyland but we enjoy being away from the craziness. The other plus is free parking. It is starting to show its age, however they are in the process of renovating the rooms which I can't wait to see what they've done. The only noise we encountered from the renovations was a bit of hammering during the day when we had decided to come back for an afternoon nap and it really wasn't bad. Breakfast was great. It would be nice if they had peanut butter and changed the fruit selection but still better than a lot of places. Manager's reception was excellent. Service was really great. The second day of our stay we came back to the room after being gone all day only to find that

We have stayed her a couple of times, great location and big rooms. It does get very busy in the summer and breakfast can be traumatic. Some of the American guests are so greedy, piling trays high with food they will never eat and taking it back to there rooms. It's a good value but don't expect 4 star expect premier inn standards. Pool needs to be bigger. Managers reception great.
Manager Response: Dear Kingomorg:  Thank you very much for your objective review.  I could not disagree with you more Mr. Kingomorg.  We see this all the time.  Those guests that pile the food up, don't even eat it and we end up trashing it.  What a waste and yet we cannot prevent it! Thank you for staying with us.

Summary: Rooms are Average, Reservations Dept needs more training to accurately enter the information for your trip.  Disney tickets were not ordered as confirmed.  Had it not been for Lilly and Desiree at Central our trip would have been a complete waste.

The hotel was not too far from the Airport. The shuttle service was stellar. They offered transportation to several attractions, shopping and dining. It is convenient having breakfast and reception at the hotel. It is cost effective and the staff is very friendly.

Loud construction during room renovations! Not satisfied. The hotel was not located near any grocery stores or shopping where guests could run out quickly to pick up forgotten items. We stayed here because of the Disneyland package which offered a free shuttle, breakfast, and internet. What they do not disclose is that the shuttle is not operated by the hotel and stops service in the middle of the day and does not resume until 3:30 p.m. Which was a challenge to work around with children who needed to nap.

Had to stay here, unfortunately one night only, excellent check-in service, nice room, very quite considering it's right off the highway.   Ate supper at the bar which serves the restaurant menu, food was great, slept like a baby, just wish it was longer.

Pictures are worth a thousand words. Up to date accurate pictures are priceless. I booked my stay for Saturday May 31st and Sunday June 1st. The plan was to take my family to Disney. Our room faced the freeway. No big deal because I wasn't at this hotel for a view. But, it sounded like there wasn't a door or wall between us and all of the cars. Truly felt like I was trying to sleep on the shoulder of the highway. Room was disappointing too. Needs updating in every way.  I don't know what it is with Embassy Suites? Some are brand new, and other properties aren't up to the standard you expect with Embassy Suites. Breakfast was good. Needless to say I didn't stay for Sunday. Told the front desk the problem but they wouldn't refund the night. I gladly went to another hotel and paid

This is a big hotel, so there are challenges, but it's a good place.  Nice staff and great suites.  breakfast was good, as was evening reception.  Renovations are happening, which is a good thing.  I would return.

I had occasion to do business in the area two weeks ago and stayed at here because it is part of the Hilton Family. The hotel is undergoing renovations, so you may want to avoid the floor directly above or below the floor they are working on. Other than that, the staff are very friendly and conscientious and really try to be as helpful with your stay as possible. They have decent 'manager's receptions' in the evening and breakfast in the morning. The rates were pretty reasonble, probably due the renovation, and the location is convenient for business in central Orange County.

We booked this hotel because we were going to Disneyland.  We used the shuttle service during our stay.  Hotel was clean staff was pleasant, breakfast was a good.  Make sure when you book your stay you ask to be placed on the quite side of the building because there is a recycling plant that runs 24 hours.

The water was shut off 3 times in 2 days with little to no warning.  The elevator malfunctioned, trapping a child inside. His cries were heard throughout the lobby.  The AC/Heat don't work at all.  I've never stayed at a hotel where you couldn't control the temperature of your room.  The complimentary cocktail hour and breakfast is the only thing that saves this hotel from a "Terrible" rating right now.

Summary Heading: Excellent staff/customer service, but rooms in need of renovation!
Summary: Just returned from a two-night stay at this hotel (we stayed here while on vacation at Disneyland).  We had stayed here ~5 years ago and had a very pleasant experience, but unfortunately the years have taken their toll on this hotel.  We stayed in one of the older rooms that had not yet been renovated.  Was disappointed - severely outdated decor/carpet/furniture/draperies, worn sinks/fixtures, peeling paint above tub/shower, broken door handle to bathroom, saggy beds, etc.  Also, we stayed in a north-facing room facing the 91 Freeway, and it was very noisy all night long.    When we stayed previously, we were able to take advantage of a free Embassy Suites shuttle back and forth from Disneyland.  However, we discovered that you now have to pay for this privilege ($3 one-way, $5

This hotel is easy to get to from the airport and had good, well lit parking. The service was fantastic, but the decor is dated. The hotel is undergoing renovations, so hopefully they will modernize the furnishings a bit. Breakfast area is a bit cramped for the size and capacity of the hotel. The food was good and again, all of the staff was so friendly and helpful. Olivia at the front desk always had a smile and was very accommodating.

the facilities are very nice and the happy hours are great. I noticed I had flea bites on my legs after sleeping on the sofa pullout couch. May possibly need to fumigate. The rooms are well equipped and fairly quiet. The cooling system is very good. Overall, we were quite comfortable.

As you see by my reviews i am usually a very positive reviewer...well not this hotel.  There was a bait and switch on my rate, the service was terrible, room was dirty and they are under a renovation!  I would STAY away from this hotel.  There are so many choices in Anaheim...GO to another hotel!!!
Manager Response: Dear UsaLovestoTravel:  Thank you for your feedback.  I wish you would call me or explain yourself, so we have a chance to correct our mistake.  I am sorry you feek like to took advantage of you, by playing a game with your rate.  All Hilton properties have a very high standard to follow when it comes to rate integrity.  Would you please contact me at the hotel?  Or call Hilton Corporate with the details?

Summary: A beautifully appointed hotel; near to highway access, yet it is very quiet; freshly made breakfast items with a good assortment to choose from; near to Disneyland Parks and Knotts Berry Farm Park; very professional staff at all levels; great value for this type of hotel since it gives you a suite in every room. We definitely would plan to stay here on our next trip.

stayed here before with no issues.  showed up this time to a 10 million renovation with no warning on their website.  the fact this room was prepaid something should have been put on their site warning you.  2 of 4 elevators inoperable.  no water between 12 and 530.  frustrating,

Great place for a family stay. From the free breakfast to the pool, the amenities are wonderful. Nice clean, comfy room too. The back rooms are up against a recycling plant which can be a bit noisy at night, but it's fairly minor.

Summary Heading: If You Want to Keep Your Sanity, Avoid This Place!!
Summary: We stayed at this property on May 20/21, 2014 to celebrate a birthday.  I saw in the description of the property they were doing renovations.  I contacted the front desk before I made my reservation, and the woman I spoke to said she had not heard any noise at all and there shouldn't be any noise at all.   About 8 a.m., banging on the pipes started, following by sawing noises.  And we were supposedly two floors below any renovations.  The banging on pipes continued for over an hour, when we started to use the bathroom to check out.  And there was no water!!!!!  And this was without no advance warning that there wouldn't be any water from 11 a.m. to 3 p.m.  So we left the hotel without showering, even brushing my teeth.  There were some wonderful other things, but leave it to say
Manager Response: Dear Bluejay19golf;  I’m sorry we were not able to provide you with a better experience during your recent stay. Your satisfaction is very important to us and we appreciate your feedback about the noisy renovation. I’m sorry that you weren’t made aware that the water would be off in your room for a short period of time.  I have shared your review with our staff to ensure that this is not a problem in the future. We hope you will consider staying with us post renovation or the next time you are in the area.  Unfortunetaly, we have to go through some noise in the beginning of a major renovation.  It has subsided already from the time you were here and currently it is only cosmetic work. Mr. Bluejay19golf, please accept my sincere apologies.  Respectfully,

Summary: We stayed here because Embassy Suites are typically roomy and totally work for our family of four.  We were not let down.  The hotel is close enough to Disneyland to make sense, and you can't beat the free breakfast they offer.  The price is reasonable. The hotel is clean.  The rooms are nice.  And the pool is perfect for the kids.  We had a great time - and heartily recommend this hotel.

Our problems started at check-in when we were lied to about how much they charged on our credit cards. The rooms are being renovated, but ours was dusty and grimy. Manager's reception drinks were good, but snacks were from Costco, despite onsite restaurant. Other guests were allowed to scream, control indoor pool, and break elevator. Horrible experience!
Manager Response: Dear Jason C.:  It was very painful for me to receive your feedback on our property.  There was an obvious missunderstanding on how payment is done at a hotel.  You expected to check-in with no form of payment or valid credit card and was shocked that we asked you about it. For the first time, I made an exception for you, based on your situation and waited for your payment until you got paid five days later.  I am sorry that I bent the rules for you.  If this was a Horrible experience for you, it was for me too.  But, you are the customer and I wish there was anything else I could have done to make it better.  Thank you for your feedback.

Summary: Staff goes out of their way to assure your taken care of. when we arrived your front office staff went out of their way to assist. We had arrived a little early, staff check availability, put us in our room and noted that the adjacent room will be available soon. My parents were able to stay next door.  Great staff and facility.

My family and I have stayed here several times and always had a great experience. The staff is always friendly and super helpful . I wish I could remember the name of one employee who was incredibly helpful when I had to extend my stay . The breakfast is good and can save you a lot of money if your vacationing with a large family as in our case . Disneyland is a short 15 minutes away on the freeway . There is no resort fee parking fee or other hidden costs . We always returned to a clean room w/ clean sheets and towels yes the freeway is on one side and a recycling plant on the other but the I never had an issue with any excessive noise .

Pleasant accommodations, convenient location, complimentary breakfast was great, no problems.  We left the hotel early and returned late but the time we spent at the hotel was flawless.  Free wifi would have been nice but with all the other amenities I can't complain.

Summary Heading: Nice size suite, but needs furniture update
Summary: Suite was good size & clean.  However, the furniture is old & needs to be updated. Balcony is too close to the Garbage Dumpster.  Need to move dumpster further away from the hotel or keep it enclosed.  Balcony needs to be thoroughly cleaned. Breakfast had a good selection & quality was fine.

I've stayed in a lot of properties for my business/personnel travels but this hotel is like my second home.  I'm always greeted when I come in by the ladies at the front desk with a warm welcome.  They are sincere when they ask how my day is as well as how my children are.   I feel like I'm at home.  The breakfast and managers reception are great and the staff always knows your favorites and show they care.  The one thing that sticks out is the staff and their sincere treatment of guests.   Great job Teresa and the rest of the staff.  You guys are the best ! -  Jim P.

The breakfast was great, rooms were clean and quiet.  My coffee maker didn't work.  The snack items are priced high in the lobby.  I suggest bringing your own snacks and at least running the coffee maker once to make sure it works so you don't find out in the morning.

2 room suite as expected, breakfast as expected.... Location -- not real close to Disneyland, but drivable -- I did not use shuttles, but it seemed that there was one down in the parking lot ever time I was downstairs.  Ate at the restaurant--food and service was good--bought D land tickets at the front desk--skips standing in line at D land and $$ went to help earn more hilton honors points. A lot of young people running around the hotel, but that should be expected at a hotel near a amusement park attraction.

We stayed here over a summer vacation with my husband, two little girls, and mother.  We were very impressed  We were able to purchase our disneyland tickets, and reserve a shuttle to the park in the lobby.  The breakfast was good - made to order omelettes, and other "normal" breakfast items.  We never had an issue with anything being unclean, our rooms were spotless upon arrival (that quickly changed with a toddler) and the staff was always very pleasant.  This is a chain that I grew up staying at - and will continue -

It was the third time I've stayed at this property in the last couple of months. I've decided that this is my home away from home when I visit Southern California. I want to mention Ms. Malia who seems to be magically appeared whenever I needed assistance.    The staff were professionals and very good in their jobs. From the time I walked into the lobby at check-in/out and to a fresh immaculate suite, to the morning breakfast (they made awesome omelet), etc., I was greeted by my name and with a genuine smile.   The atrium was also perfect for my business meetings and the Business Center was accessible and convenient too. The last time I was there (two days) I did not even leave the hotel property. I held business lunch meetings there and invited clients for dinner at the

I had to put up a business guest at this hotel and had a great experience. He told me the  breakfast was great and even though it was during spring break the lines were minimal and food was awesome. I had no problems and the front desk was great. Thank you Teresa!

The rooms have comfortable beds, but the service of the staff is very unwelcoming.  Be prepared for bathrooms that smell musty and damp with pealing paint and missing fixtures.  The complimentary parking and free breakfast is a bonus, but the are long waits and little seating areas for a family of four.

Like it was stated, this ES is satisfactory, and likely the one of the chain that could use some internal improvements. Why would it take an employee to bring over a replacement hair dryer? One elevator broke down...who knows what other issues North Anaheim has. There were some positives: breakfast and happy hour were delightful, and some of the other employees were cool and friendly, but compared to the other ones I've stayed at, it could've been better.  But I do see the popularity in this particular location (I believe you don't have to use as many HHonors points for this one). There is another ES closer to Disneyland, but they charge for parking, as do many other hotels near the park. I wouldn't mind staying here again, but I hope management makes those improvements.

Room had a terrible smell which I was aware at first, but  discovered the cause after midnight (when I had to get up in 6 hours and did not want to lose more sleep changing rooms)---it was coming from a soaking wet carpet outside the bathroom that had to have been in that state for a couple of days and most likely came from a waste line overflow judging from the smell.
Manager Response: Dear Mr. H1877MCmarkr:  Thank you for your feedback and I apologize for your inconvenience.  I wish we had known this challenge while you were at the hotel to immediately rectify it.  Nevertheless, our Front Office Manager already communicated with you on the subject and hopefully you were satisfied with the resolution.  Thank you for your business Mr. H1877MCmatkr.

Summary Heading: Not good, not bad, simply average
Summary: This is a decent hotel, but fall below standard of Embassy Suites elsewhere. It is pretty old, not renovated, rooms are quite noisy if you are facing the highway, and generally lack the cleanliness of other hotels I have stayed. The lobby and atrium is nice, breakfast is typical Embassy Suites but the food is really oily and breakfast area is crowded. I would give this hotel maximum of 3 stars overall. The location is pretty bad, out of the way in the middle of nowhere. Generally not recommended.

My family and I stayed here while attending the Wondercon at the Anaheim convention center. The Hotel is less than 5 miles away and covenient to the highway.  We only used the Breakfast so I cannot speak to the restaurant or Complimentary happy hour.  Overall a very good choice for us.

Property was close to the Honda Center. Good location off the 91 Freeway. Reception and cooked to order breakfast was great. The grounds were very nice with Koi, waterfalls and streams. You cant go wrong with Embassy

My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights while we celebrated my birthday and took in some local attractions. ((Disneyland, California Adventure and Knott's Berry Farm)) This Embassy Suites us one of the prettiest and elegant hotels I've ever stayed in. The staff, including front desk manager Malia, and her co-workers Reuben, Jasmine, Teresa and Josefina were all so very courteous, friendly, and professional. They all went out of their way and above and beyond to make our stay extremely memorable. We will always use this hotel when we're visiting Southern California.   .... Oh, one more thing, their "made to order" complimentary breakfast is out of this world delicious.

We stayed here because it was close to my child's prom and on the way to a visit to a college the next day.  It is a bit dated, but, as a family, we enjoyed the central indoor courtyard with its greenery, fish and turtles.  The huge skylight makes it energy-efficient and feels outdoorsy.  Probably built in the 1970s, but ahead of its time, energy-thinking.    Comfortable beds, pillows and very nice sheets and comforter.  Bathrooms are updated.  Large TVs and large rooms.  Beds should be queen-sized (there is room for them).  Cute balconies to step out onto, although we overlooked the freeway.  Steady drone of freeway noise, but you get used to it (windows deaden the sound pretty well).  Would ask for a room on the other side next time, though.  Convenient to Disneyland (they

Although this Embassy Suites may not be in a touristy or high-end location, it has all the Embassy Suites perks, free parking and beautiful peaceful decor.  We will stay at this Embassy Suites again when in Orange County.

Summary Heading: Dirty, Gross, Awful – the WORST hotel experience I have EVER had!!!
Summary: First off, I am not a reactionary.  But this experience was so awful that I had to write a review and warn you.  Do NOT stay here.  I am frequent business traveler.  I have stayed in hundreds of hotel.  This was the WORST ever.  Upon checking in the could not find our reservation.  After some long back and forth they were able to get us two rooms for our party of 7.  I had a reservation, it was confirmed.  Three of the four elevators were out of service, so the line just to get to the elevator to get to the room was frustrating.  Upon entering the room I was grossed out by the musty odor.  I went to check on my in-laws room and it smelled worse.  We found rotten food stuffed in the desk drawers.  It was very old and was missed by several cleaning crews.  There was mold on the
Manager Response: Dear Mr. Troy K.:  First of all, we are very sorry that you did not enjoy your stay at Embassy Suites. We already spoke with your father-in-law upon his check-out, and addressed many concerns about the stay, and I believe that we addressed them to your father-in-law’s satisfaction. I can assure you that we take your concerns very seriously and are doing everything we can to make your next stay with Embassy Suites a pleasant one.  I do want to respond to some of your specific concerns, however, just to make sure that they are addressed to YOUR satisfaction. As a blanket response to ALL of your concerns—we are in the midst of a MULTI-million dollar renovation that begins in earnest next month.  We are replacing/renovating virtually EVERYthing in the hotel. Also, I really wish that you had brought your concerns to us immediately so that we may have attempted to remedy them AT THE TIME. We are always willing to do whatever it takes to make sure that our guests are satisfied with their stay. 1.	At no point have three of our elevators been out of service. As part of our renovation process, we have been taking one elevator at a time out of service. I apologize if you had any difficulty getting back to your room because of a delay in elevator service. 2.	Our housekeeping staff is always available to clean rooms, and had we known about any apparent food that was left in your room or about any apparently dirty carpet, we would have been happy to clean the room again, to your satisfaction, or if necessary, to move you to another room, if one had been available. 3.	It looks like your wall vinyl was forcibly removed over the door frame!!!! Not sure when that happened! It was not like that during the last inspection. 4.	We also have a maintenance staff that is always available to fix much of the equipment/fixtures in our rooms, and we would have been happy to fix/replace the security latch that was apparently loose in your room. And, again, if necessary, we may have been able to move you to another room, if one had been available. 5.	While I understand your very legitimate concern regarding possible mold, we were never made aware of this problem, and had we known, we would have immediately moved you to another room and had the room quarantined for removal, which we just did.  As an aside, we are subject to routine inspections and cleanliness ratings by the Orange County Department of Public Health, and you can check our record with the Department. We have always received the highest “A” cleanliness ratings, and have never been fined for any violations, especially not for any rodents infestation, you claimed.  We again apologize for your obvious disappointment with your stay, but we do hope that you will give us another chance to accommodate you and your family the next time you visit Anaheim. We will absolutely do everything in our power to make sure that your next stay is to your satisfaction. Please also keep in mind that we will be undergoing a full renovation during the next 2 months, so we are happy to accommodate you and your family now or after the renovation is complete.

Summary: Housekeeping is horrible.  Front desk, while polite, can't seem to control the housekeeping staff.  Found pretzel in a pillow case 2 days after check in.  While there, witnessed 3 cases of guests taking front desk to task about housekeeping staff being unprofessional.  First hand experience with the housekeeping staff showed them to be uncaring and not willing to do anything other then the bare minimum (if even that).  The Bistro was filthy and the food wasn't even as good as one could get at a 7-11.

The maid did not come at all, and when we called the front desk to complain, all they did is bring us fresh towels. We paid way too much to be treated this poorly. They also said they couldn't find the things we needed to make coffee in our room (creamer, coffee stirrers, etc). We found these items ourselves at the breakfast buffet. In addition, one elevator was broken and the remaining three ran SO SLOWLY.

I was very impressed with the hotel, I was here for a quick business trip. Went home and told my friends all about the great size of room and breakfast. Great location and service if you are vacationing at the local parks. Evening reception was great and the breakfast was awesome-omelets to order?? WOW great

There certainly are some positives for this property; breakfast, manager's special, cleanliness of the lobby area, pool and hot tub, however I was somewhat disappointed. As a HiltonHonors Gold member I made advance requests for a pack and play ( this was placed in my room) but was not recognized as a Gold Member, didn't receive the additional towels requested or the bottles of water - despite staying there for 3 nights. The front desk staff was not rude but "dull", appeared to be just doing a job. There are no automatic doors which makes luggage handling difficult and the elevator was out for a period of time in addition to being slow. The ART Disney shuttle runs once each hour which requires additional planning for families with small children  Overall this is not a bad place

This hotel was a terrific and convenient to the many activities we had planned while in the Anaheim area.  The room was clean and comfortable.  The staff for friendly and helpful in every way.  The complementary breakfast was terrific. Although the hotel is a little older, it is a great place to stay.  This hotel met or exceeded all our expectations.

Summary Heading: I would not stay here again.
Summary: Plenty wrong.  Noisy at night, sleep sofa terrible, frig FROZE everything and then when an earthquake hit there was juice all over the frig. and when we told them, nothing was done.  They would not work with us at all when travel plans changed to circumstances way beyond our control.  OLD, and needs updating for sure.  They had also told us when making reservations AND when we arrived, that Disney was less than 15 minutes away when it was clearly 30 minues.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, for a great trip
Summary: All the staff was really friendly and helpful, with one of the elevators being worked on, they told us best one to use for our room. The breakfast was great, and was really cool having the manager's reception which is free beer if your over 21 :) I plan to stay at embassy suites from now on.

Prior to coming to this hotel we were somewhat nervous about by some amazingly negative reviews.  I have to say that based on our experience I really don't understand the complaints.  Our experience was terrific.  We were on the 6th floor and our suite was spotless, well equipped and comfortable.  The free breakfast was up to Embassy Suites standards and quite enjoyable.  Further, all aspects of the service could not have been better.  In fact, after a 5 magnitude seismic event caused our TVs to fall to the floor while we were out, maintenance staff came to our room at 11:00 pm on a Friday night to replace and reprogram new ones.  The complex of course has a little age on it but the four of us in two different rooms for a 3-night stay could not have been more pleased.

Lackadasical approach to the public areas.  This hotel lacked the zeal for cleanliness I have noticed in other Embassy Hotels, however I still had a good time--the beds were comfortable and it was not that bad.

I have been traveling to Fullerton for work for the past four weeks and I have the opportunity to stay at many hotel chains, but the service level at this Embassy Suites has been exemplary.  The staff has been kind (every level of the staff providing "Hello", "Have a nice day", etc) and very responsive to any needs that I've had (utilization of the workout facilities, flexible with my arrival/departure dates, etc).  Despite the high level of kids/family, the facility is well-maintained and I've had no issues with loud noise.  In particular, Teresa Weinstein, has gone above the expected level of service.  Every day she greets me by name, asks if all of my expectations are being met and does the little things that show that they care about me and my well-being.  Teresa's outgoing

We checked in late. Check in process was smooth no probelms. The room needs updating.  I like Embassy Suites but it wasn't up to their normal standards. Only one night - we were gone by 7am. This hotel felt forgotten.

Upon arrival with a large group, one elevator was out of service and they decided to paint the inside of another.  Made it a very long process to get the 175 people up to the upper floors.  Housekeeping was horrible.  Many rooms were not serviced daily.  Several rooms had door knobs that were broken and my room had mold in the bathroom.  My biggest disappointment was that my son had his therapeutic pillow taken from the room while we were at Disneyland for 15 hours.  It was quite different from the hotel pillows but when I spoke to the front desk personnel they were less than helpful and of course swore that none of the maids would take it.  Very disappointed in the stay overall.  We will not be reserving rooms at this particular Embassy again.

Summary Heading: Dirty, Filthy, Sub-standard; Might as well have been Motel 6
Summary: Do not stay here. This is a filthy hotel.  The carpet and bathroom are so dirty.  You will need to wash all of your clothing, kids clothing, stuffed animals, pillow pets, blankets, etc. when you get home. The breakfast is horrible, not made to order like other Embassy Suites Hotels.  The management in the breakfast area treated the cook and wait staff with such disrespect it was embarrassing.  The hotel needs to be shut down, bulldozed and rebuilt.

Summary Heading: Not the usual Embassy Suites Experience
Summary: We checked in late at night and when we got to the room everything was fine. The next day we were gone by 9 AM and when we got back at 3 PM our room had not been cleaned.  I just assumed they were behind until about 4:30 when I called and was told that the housecleaning crews were all gone and they would not be able to clean our room. We asked for new towels and they did bring an abundance of towels up. The second day they did clean our room and everything seemed fine. On the 3rd day we were getting ready for our day and at 7AM we had house cleaning knocking on our door trying to clean our room already. Not because they wanted to be more timely with us but to just get the job early.  We were with a group and most people in our group said they came to their rooms about the same

This place is a must ! great customer service and the amenities are unbeatable. All rooms are more than spacious and the room service is prompt. They really go out of their way to accommodate any request. We will definitely be coming back!

The Embassy Suites is the place to stay.  Their suites are always clean and smell fresh.  They are always nice and spacious.  The breakfast choices are a plus.  No one can compare to the made to order egg omlets.  Awesome customer service.

We traveled to the area for a national conference and were very pleased with the hotel amenities.  The complimentary breakfast was delicious, the hotel was very clean and spacious, the manager's reception was great, and the Bryan (at the front desk) was so friendly and helpful.

Did not have a good experience here. Too noisy, elevators did not work, toilet over flowed. I don't think a vacuum cleaner touched the floor of our room. Although cigarette smoking is not permitted, we smelled it in our room at night

We stayed here for a trip to Disneyland. The hotel staff was excellent. They were friendly, could answer questions and were very helpful. The room was okay. They do need to update the rooms and the hotel looks a bit old. But the room was clean and the bed was comfortable.  If you are going to Anaheim and want a suite hotel, this is the best one we have found off premises. It is 10,000 times better than the Embassy Suites Anaheim South.

This is a great hotel for the family pool and breakfast are great,bathrooms could use some renovation other then that overall experience was great. Kids loved the evening reception staff is very helpful and shopping and dinning are within in minutes of the hotel

This is definitely the place to go if you've got the little ones! They will love the indoor rainforesty theme. Rooms are clean and room service was prompt. Id definitely come here again, but not exclusively.

This was my worst experience at a hotel and I would never go back to this hotel.  I have been to many Embassy hotels and had a great experience.  I think it is just bad management. Management should be trained and willing to listen to all guest not a selected few.
Manager Response: Dear Laura A,  I am sorry that you had such a bad experience at the Hotel back in October of last year. We need your help: Could you please call me at the hotel, for me to learn about the details?  we can only get better if we know what are the shortcomings  Thank you.

Summary: The hotel was clean, staff friendly. I chose it because there was an indoor pool and our trip was in February and swimming was just as important to the kids as Disneyland. The complimentary breakfast was convenient and my husband appreciated the evening reception. The shuttle service to the park worked out well. On day two the bus was so crowded we were at standing room only. Our room included daily shuttle passes but there was absolutely no shuttle service to or from the airport. If we ever need an indoor pool again I would go back, otherwise I would probably chose a hotel a little closer. It took at least 20 minutes each way to get to the park.

This is an older Embassy Suite, the hotel smelled like it used to allow smoking and not they can't get that smell out so it blends with cleaning products. Only one working elevator when I stayed due to repairs and room was not ready at check in time. these might be small things but it is part of the hotel experience.

Summary Heading: Getting a little tired, needs more than a facelift
Summary: This is a good central location with a very expansive, beautiful lobby.  From there however, the hotel really shows it's age.  A microwave with a dial - older than my adult children.  An older toilet that wasn't water efficient - ought to be a crime in water-deprived So Cal.  The room was quiet and clean (good thing, housekeeping missed us one day) but in need of renovating.  The hotel elevators were undergoing long-term repair - only 2 out of 4 worked at all during our stay, one of those was out part of the time.  Breakfast area is not what it used to be - Embassy is really the best free breakfast out there - except this time.  We have seen Hilton dump one other Embassy that was too old and tired to rehab - could this hotel be facing the same fate?  Location within easy driving

Summary Heading: NICE HOTEL BUT A FEW ISSUES
Summary: I read from other reviews about the front elevators being broken and they still were when we were there. It was a slight inconvenience to walk all the way around. Breakfast was great. Pool and spa were nice and indoors.  Good selection of breakfast and nice eating area as you would expect from Embassy Suites. Night manager reception is nothing to run back for: chips, salsa and some popcorn, but free drinks!  Front desk was super nice.  Just a warning to anyone that isn't into pets, ask for higher floors that are not pet rooms. Only other thing is the walls are pretty thin.  We could hear our crazy neighbors TV in our bathroom fairly loud and them opening their balcony doors.  They also started smoking in their non smoking room and we could smell that.  I did report it but it was

If you want to pay full inflated price for a room that has no Heat or AC, freeway noise, slow internet (at an outrageous additional cost), and breakfast designed to raise your chance of a heart-Attack.... Then this is the right place.  Just to make the experience complete, the staff has learned not to ask how your stay was.  Go sleep under the bridge - almost the same experience!
Manager Response: Dear Clarke A,  Your concerns are our concerns and we appreciate your honest feedback. We're dedicated to providing a comfortable stay with personalized service and regret that you had an unsatisfactory experience. We've shared your concerns with our staff and are working to improve some of our offerings and services in the very near future. We hope that you'll reconsider giving us another opportunity to serve you, should you travels bring you back to our area.

Summary: This is a nice hotel.  My girls love the jungle theme.  It's about six miles from Disneyland.  We love the big rooms (suites).  The kids can sleep in one room and we can sleep on the other side.  Breakfast is included.  This is a big deal when you have a family.  Customer service is good.

Where do I start... Took my family here to stay while we were on vacation. let the nightmares begin...Two of the elevators were out of order, the rooms are SO outdated & the rooms had a musty smell (like a basement). To top everything off, My 8 year old son cut his finger on a rusty old box cutter that was in the cushion of the chair in the room!! So off to the ER we go. Immediately we started looking for a different hotel to stay at but since it was spare of the moment trying to find somewhere else everything was already booked up. We ended up having to stay there that night, in a different room. In this other room...The lights turned off and on in the bathroom by itself. The door handle was falling off, and had a musty smell again in the room. We ended up checking out the next
Manager Response: Dear HAZELEYES 7704:  We apologize for the unfortunate incident that occurred during your stay and we are addressing it with our housekeeping staff.  Most importantly, we sincerely hope that your son is okay.  We investigated the incident and could determine where this blade came from but we obviously did not catch it.  I am sorry. The comfort and safety of our guests is our highest priority and we hope the next time you are in the area you would consider staying with us again.   Thank you HAZELEYES 7704 for bringing this incident to our attention.

Summary Heading: Well Maintained, Good Value but Dated
Summary: Took my daughters here to take advantage of the indoor pool. Southern California, believe or not, has very few hotels with indoor pools. The hotel was very well maintained but the décor is VERY dated. The room have been updated a bit but the common areas look exactly as they did back in 1985. Took advantage of the breakfast which was fine. This hotel is a great value. The one negative is that as I walked by a conference room on the 4th floor I was hit by a very strong wall of smoke. Whether the hotel turns a blind eye to such deviations from business clients I don't know (and it also could have been coming from the maintenance room nearby as well) but it was strong enough to notice.

Staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was spacious. However, the living area smelled like sewer the entire two days we stayed. Only one working elevator which was the furthest from our room so it was not convenient with two kids and a stroller. I did enjoy the pool and the gym. The complimentary breakfast was good until I fell violently ill the second day we had the breakfast there. I believe the sausages that are laid out in a batch are not fresh and sanitary. Within two hours of leaving the hotel after breakfast, I became nauseous, vomited and unpleasant bowel movements several times throughout the day and the next day and had chills. My entire family than fell ill within the next day or two...norovirus??..One child vomiting all over me and himself on our Alaska Airlines
Manager Response: Dear Betsy C., Thank you for your compliments regarding our Staff.  I am very sorry that you fell ill during your visit with us.  You know that hundreds of people eat here everyday.  If there was some kind of problem with the food, we would have a pandemic on our hands.    To claim or insinuate Norovirus at the hotel, was truly uncalled for.  Looking at your stay, you had no issues reported with us.  In the hotel business we live and die by our reputation and word of mouth, and your implication was honestly unfounded. Again, I am truly sorry about your family's illness.

Summary Heading: You Get What You Pay For
Summary: This is just an average Embassy Suites. Furnishings are old. Mattress was soft. Housekeeping is okay. On the other hand, the rates at this hotel are the lowest I have seen for an Embassy Suites ever. This hotel is not close to any attractions and there is nothing within walking distance in terms of restaurants or shops. This hotel is located adjacent to the 91 freeway, so there is traffic noise. On the other hand, staff were friendly. The breakfast was fine. The Manager's Reception area is nice, and you can have dinner in the bar area if you would like. There are decent menu selections with decent pricing.There is also a seperate restaurant area. The indoor pool area looked well kept, as well as the fitness area. I probably would not bring my family here simply because I am sure

Not up to the standards of most Embassy Suites. Living area furniture was dirty and smelled. The bathroom had alot of mold and the tub had a stain from a constant dripping faucet. Beds were the best I have slept on.

Summary Heading: Charming and dog-friendly, but not close to Disneyland
Summary: There are very few hotels near Disneyland that accept dogs. I am determined to try all of them during runDisney marathons. The inside of the hotel is pretty cute, with koi pond & a little waterfall. The exterior is not cute at all and the location is completely blahhh, next to recycling plant. While the atrium is beautiful, it's a bit dysfunctional as it's loud and echo-y and everyone has to walk by your room to get to theirs....or maybe it just seems that way because I brought my dog and was assigned the loudest room near the elevators just 1 floor above the breakfast area. Free breakfast is nice. Omelette chefs are very nice, & very patient in spite of the chaos. OK, so I had the loudest room in the place in front of the only elevator bank that was working....but my dog LOVED

It was very close to Disney land, the Baseball diamond, the ice rink and the beach and airport. it was a very clean hotel and I loved the fish and turtles. the restaurant was very nice and the food was great and I am a chef!!! I would stay their again for sure. thanks for a great time at the Tinkerbell run. hope to retune there some day

This hotel was a great find. Only a short shuttle ride to Disneyland. Beautiful lobby and breakfast area. Staff were very helpful. Breakfast had a great range of choice. Room service and restaurant reasonably priced also. Pool was not very well heated though - so if you like to swim maybe something to consider. Our family were very happy here.

Older hotel, showing its age.  Room had musty oder.  For government travelers, be certain you don't have to alter your reservations, or it could cost.  Love the Embassy Suites brand, but this hotel falls below the others where I have stayed.  Also, a bad location.  No where to walk.

Summary Heading: noisy on freeway side of hotel
Summary: the freeway side of the hotel is very noisy and I would ask for room away from freeway side of hotel if you want a good night sleep.  the pillows are very stiff and I would ask for softer pillows next time,

First room assigned was on East side with metal reclamation factory.  Noise from outside was so loud I could not hear my radio that I usually fall asleep listening to. It was constant rumbling, with interrupting crashes, and heavy equipment backing-up beeping sounds.  I was actually surprised that they would put a Hilton Diamond level member (the highest level you can attain with Hilton) in that location.  I don't expect extra-special care, but was surprised.  I finally couldn't stand it any longer and request a new room.  They were pretty booked, so the choices were limited.  New room was not ideal, but that I get.  Breakfast was fine, did not like that the TV station they chose to play in the breakfast area was Al-Jazerra.  Would prefer something a tad bit less controversial.

Rooms are decent sized.  Housekeeping did not replace any towels which we had to call for.  Bathrooms had musty smell.  Breakfast was good, good varieties to choose from.  Front desk on late check in was not the most efficient and assisted a person who came in after us as we were standing in the Hilton Hhonors line.

Our family made the trek to Anaheim over the Christmas holiday.  One of the hooks for Embassy Suites is the free made to order breakfast.  The breakfast is excellent, lots of choices, anything you want added to your omelet, fruits, pastries, coffee, juices, etc.  Complimentary parking is also a plus.  Shuttle service to Disneyland is free if you purchased a package deal, otherwise there is a small charge.  One small hiccup was that we did not get our towels until approx 6pm our first night and had to ask a housekeeper for additional towels the next night.  In one of our suites the comforter was not delivered our entire stay.  The Embassy Suites could use some updating... things look pretty old and worn.  But with that said, the kids had a ball, the adults enjoyed the free

The first room we were given reeked of cigarette smoke even though it was a designated non smoking room. The front desk was very nice and gave us a new room. This one had a strange odor stained carpeting and furniture and appeared over all dingy. The atrium and walkways were also very dirty with trash and dirty dishes left outside rooms all day. Elevators were broken on one side making it a long wait. I will give the front desk bartenders and housekeeping 5 stars for friendliness but this hotel is really dirty and run down. My son has bites on his arm which I'm hoping aren't bedbugs. From reading previous reviewed this is nothing new for this hotel

Check in was easy, so was check out for that matter.  The room was pretty basic.  Definitely needed upgrading. It was clean but had icky grout. The sink stopper did not work.  Towels were fresh and fine. Nice breakfast in the morning.  No problems with seating.  I probably would not stay here again.

This hotel has a beautiful lobby. However, the rooms are all visible from the lobby, which was a bit creepy for me as a woman staying by herself.   The room was pretty bad. It was old and a little gross and kind of falling apart. The bathroom was old. The bedding was old. It was clean, but it was not fresh.   I would not stay here again.   However, the restaurant was really nice. The food was good, the ambiance was nice. The bar hosted a happy hour with free drinks and snacks.
Manager Response: Dear kslfla,  Thank you for taking the time to share feedback on your recent stay with us via TripAdvisor. We appreciate your honest input on the comfort and appointment of our guestrooms and we will use your comments as we continue to evolve our guests' experience.  We also appreciated your positive feedback on our retstaurant, food, lobby and ambience of the hotel.  We hope you will return to stay with us the next time you are in the area so we may better demonstrate our commitment to your satisfaction.  Sincerely,

Summary: I hate to write bad reviews - but this hotel needs some attention.  Reserved 3 rooms for my family trip to see the mouse.   Every night we played towel lottery.  For 4 nights we never knew which rooms would have towels and which had none - and Never did we have a night where all three rooms had towels.   They cleaned the rooms (and did a nice job) but wouldn't put new towels in.   First few times we would call the desk and have some delivered - average was 3 calls and a little over an hour to get towels up to the 7th floor - then we resorted to going down to the front desk and not leaving until we had towels in hand.   My other complaint was the elevators - two of four where out of service - but I can forgive this since I actually saw them working on them trying to get them
Manager Response: Dear Steve D,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your experience.  I am extremely sorry about the towel situation.  We did experience a bad shortage.  We lost an unusually high number, could not keep up and could not get any deliveries due to the Holidays.  Please accept our sincere apologies as it should not have been your problem. Also want to thank you for the compliments you had for the room cleaniless and staff in general.  Happy Holidays and Thank you for staying with us.  Sincerely,

Summary: A whole mess!! The worst Embassy I've stayed!!! Dirtyness was their most!!! Really disgusting!! I even talked to the manager to have our room clean, and nothing happened!!!! No towels in the room, garbage let from previous guests, they don't change the sheets!! A complete mess! Avoid it!!!
Manager Response: Dear tan_tan 1974:  Thank you for your candid feedback of your stay with us. I apologize that we did not meet your expectations and I am actively working with our housekeeping team to ensure cleanliness and comfort are our first priority for all guests. I am always looking for reviews to provide insight into our guest experience.  Thank you again for your feedback and I invite you back to stay with us the next time your travels bring you to the area.  At your service,

Summary: My husband and 5-year-old son vacationed to Disneyland for the Christmas season. This is a great hotel choice for visiting Disneyland whether you are driving or taking the ART shuttle.  The hotel elevators were under construction, but it did not negatively effect our stay. The hotel staff was amazingly helpful. Upon arrival I was greeted by Kristina and Malia who went above and beyond their normal job description. Throughout our stay Jasmine and Karen were great as well!  Collectively, the staff was awesome and the room was very comfortable.

Summary Heading: Just might be the worst stay at a hotel...ever
Summary: When we arrive into out=r room, the toilet is clogged and so nasty that I almost lose my dinner. Then, we arrive late one night on this multiple day stay and wake up the next morning, only to find the shower curtain missing along with the towels. It took 30 minutes for someone to bring in a shower curtain in the morning. Then another 30 minutes for the towels to come. Therefore, we missed the complementary breakfast. So, now we had to find a place to eat breakfast...in the end we missed half a day at Disneyland, and had to pay for breakfast. And this was only one a few of the many problems experienced at this hotel. At this hotel, don't complain about anything or else, they will get back at you. I really feel like shredding my hHonors card.
Manager Response: Dear BobBillyBob:  Thank you for giving us feedback about your stay at the hotel.  Would you please call me at the hotel directly to be able to assist you?

Summary: Lots of room. Helpful staff .Best free breakfast I have ever seen. Quick to Disney & beach spots Equal distance from Long Beach & Santa Ana airports Very close to freeway. It wo,ild be silly to pay twice the money for a disney hotel if you already have a car anyway

Summary Heading: Non-Renovated Embassy Suites, BUT Still a Good Value if Visiting Disneyland
Summary: We opted to stay at this hotel for a few reasons: 1) I wanted to earn Hilton points; 2) It was a short drive to Disneyland; 3) Free Breakfast; 4) Free Parking; and 5) It was overall significantly less expensive than comparable hotels in Anaheim.  The drive to Disneyland is a no brainer.  10 minutes tops.  With weekday rush hour traffic, maybe 15.  Not bad at all.  The hotel is clean, but given that I have stayed at several Embassy Suites across the country, I could tell this one had not been updated.  Outdated furniture and wardrobes in the bedroom that used to house a t.v. in the upper shelf.  The bathroom wasn't as sleek and the showerhead needed some tlc.  Plus the bathtub faucet dripped so my conscious was tugging at me for the water that was being wasted.  The staff was

My family is a huge fan of Embassy Suites as well as the entire Hilton brand. My father is silver Hilton Honors member, so needless to say, we have stayed at our fair share of Hilton and Embassy Suites hotels. We are familiar with the older styling of Embassy Suites like this one, so we weren't at all put off by the look and design of the hotel. However, there were quite a few things that were subpar.   First off, when we arrived, there were two functioning elevators. By the time we left, there was only one functioning elevator as yet another had gone out of order. This would be fine, except that due to a number of large groups staying at the hotel (bands, pagent girls, etc), at one point it took us up to 15 minutes to get on an elevator. Now you may be thinking, well, don't be

Canceling reservation due to my mother going through chemo/ radiation and no sympathy or compassion for the situation. Just a Sorry from an agent saying it's our policy and we are charging you for one nights stay!! Disappointed in their customer service!! :'( I'll make sure NEVER to book at an Embassy Suites again. Being a Front Desk Manger for the Marriott chain for several years I know this is not the way to treat customers!!
Manager Response: Dear TavelerJer747:  Thank you for your feedback on your regrettable experience.  I am sorry that your mother was not feeling well on the day of your arrival.  Rest assured that there was no charge made to your account for the guaranteed reservation you held since September 7.  It was a sold out night for the entire Anaheim area and it was unfortunate that we did not show you enough empathy for your situation.  Please accept my personal apologies.  Sincerely,

Summary: I have stayed at this hotel several times and have been very satisfied. The rooms are very comfortable and quiet. The hotel location has easy on/off freeway access and is close to multiple shopping, dining and entertainment venues. The managers reception every night in the hotel lounge is a wonderful perk to unwind and the daily breakfast can't be missed.

I was staying for 2 weeks on business, this definitely seemed more like a family hotel than what I'm used to. No noise issues (or any other issues for that matter) but elevators did get a bit crowded during "rush hour" when everyone was getting ready to head out to the parks, and so did the breakfast area. Good value for the money.

I stayed at this hotel on a business trip. The hotel is nice. The rooms were good size and it was quiet! It was located by a busy highway. My room was on the opposite side and I did not hear the traffic. I saw several staff walking through the hotel and they always greeted me. The parking is right outside the hotel. There aren't many restaurants around the hotel. There is a mall about 2 miles away.

I try to always stay at an Embassy Suite.  I believe that this property is in need of a facelift.  There was quite a bit of peeling paint around the windows and rust on the metal findings on the windows.

I was pleased as was my family.  We wish we would have had more time to use the nice indoor pool and enjoy the other amenities. The staff was friendly and helpful. I would recommend this facility to my family and friends and look forward to visiting again in the future and also to visit the many other Embassy Suites throughout our many travels.

Excellent complementry Breakfast and rooms were really nice also. Elevators seemed to be slower then what I would have exspected. Would like to see that in the future you have free wifi for all the rooms. seems kind of silly to have to pay for service.

below par for an embassy suite. I have stayed at other Embassy Suites and this was by far the worst. No air conditioning at night and room was very warm so you sweat all night. Elevators are unpredictable, had to use stairs at time to get to the first floor. Furniture is worn and outdated like most of the Hotel Would not recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear STEVEN F,  I’m very sorry to hear that you did not have a pleasant experience at our hotel. Guest satisfaction is extremely important to us and we apologize for letting you down. I will be sure to keep your feedback in mind as we're always working to improve our overall guest experience. I thank you for your review and I really hope you'll give us a second chance if your travels bring you back to our area.  Best Regards,

Summary: Nice hotel for the value.  Breakfast was great.  The fitness facility was nice.  Business center was open and available.  The evening snacks were great.  The bar and pool table are a nice added feature when traveling - it was nice that friends could meet at our hotel before heading out to sight see.  Very nice location.
Manager Response: Dear Diana O,  We are grateful for your beautiful review of our Hotel.  We truly appreciate it. On behalf of the entire staff: Thank you.  Sincerely,

Summary: The staff was awesome and check in was a breeze. Kid friendly staff (hard to find now a days) I definitely recommend this hotel. Rooms are comfortable and clean. The breakfast was great and the lobby was amazing! Fun for the kiddos :)
Manager Response: Dear Julie S,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write about your experience at our hotel.  Your very positive feedback is truly appreciated. Please come back again.  Sincerely,

Summary: This is a good, decent place to stay in Anaheim. The rooms are large and quiet, the service is excellent, and the breakfast is terrific. The evening drinks and snacks are ok-  however the bar staff can be a bit off-put if you don't immediately tip when you walk up to the bar counter. The front elevators are in a constant state of repair ( I stay here repeatedly...). All-in-all, it's a good business stay hotel.

The Embassy Suites offers a great value for comfort, a safe enviorment and a service committed staff.  Our stay included 3 adults and 2 small children.  We found we were very comfortable in our suite with room to move.  For added value, the breakfast provided in the morning is excellent and extremely convenient.  The manager's reception during the evening also was a surprise value with drinks and snacks all complimentary.  At the end of the day in the lobby was a water blend which was different each day.  We found it thoughful and refreshing.  The property could use some improvements with paint and some furniture upgrades.  However, the staff is very well prepared to meet customer needs and that out weighs the cosmetics for me and my family always.

We love this hotel and this location and we return every chance we get.  The open bar and the great hot breakfast is wonderful.  We highly recommend this location.  We love the great staff that greets us when we arrive.  The rooms are large and comfortable and beds are great
Manager Response: Dear Valerie M:  What a beautiful review you wrote about us.  We really appreciate you taking the time to let us know. Thank you very much for staying with us and hope to see you back real soon.  Sincerely,

Summary: Shabby furnishing, blocked up toilet that leaked all over the floor. Staff was not very concerned...even when I pointed out it was possible the leak would go to the floors below. This may be why the furnishing were "well used" or "beat." Management did not have an interest in guests...probably figuring their location near Disney Land would make up for the tired and nonfunctional elements of the hotel. Since I wasn't going to Disney Land, they were just a poor hotel, in my opinion.
Manager Response: Dear LorenBhl,  Thank you for posting your opinion regarding your experience with our hotel.  I am sorry we disapointed you and you got the feeling that we do not care.  It is our job and our goal to care and I apologize for not taking great care of you, while here.

Summary: Stayed here while visiting friends in the fullerton area. The hotel was very easy to find off the 91 freeway. Checkin in was a breeze and great. the room was typical Embassy fare.....The only downside about the room was the fact that the AC system had issues. I guess they are on an ancient HVAC system and they can't cool the rooms individually, you get either heat or cold. When we were there it was an in-between time. But since we had a balcony we just opened the door overnight. Hotel is definitely older and showing its age in some spots. Dinner in the restaurant was very good. The beds were SUPER COMFY!!!!!!

The hotel is a older ES.  The rooms, two room suites with bedroom and living room with sofa bed.  Asked for   hypo allergenic pillows, first said they did not have them, then sent them up.  The common areas were nice. The hotel is freeway close and  located in an industrial area which was quiet at night.  The hotel is close to Disneyland, Knotts, etc. The hotel has an Indoor pool and spa, and small workout room.

The staff at this location provided awesome customer service. It was quiet and the view toward the city was nice especially watching the fireworks at Disneyland. We rode the shuttle to Disneyland everyday, the parking was free at Embassy Suites North, South charges $12.00 a day. Breakfast was great a full buffet plus a chef to cook omelets upon requests. I really enjoyed our staying at this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Mary C,  Thank you so much for your wonderful compliments regarding the hotel and the staff.  We really appreciate you taking the time to share your positive experience.  We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: The beds were comfy, definatley a plus.  The furnishings, meh.  Seems if you offer a sofa bed you would have adequate blankets and pillows-not.  The price was a bit steep, the area not so pretty, the hotel needs some updating and love.  BTW-quite a drive from disneyland.

Summary Heading: Some good, some bad, some average
Summary: I chose this ES cause the website says "shuttle to Disney" - I supposed I should have looked for the word FREE cause I was surprised to find out there is a fee for the shuttle.  It's minimal - $5 for the day for adults and $2 for kids.  Still beats the parking fee at Disney although our park hopper tickets included parking.  But the shuttle worked good for us except the shuttle leaves the hotel on the hour and leaves the park on the half hour.  I went down at 3 minutes to 7pm one night and saw the bus leaving the parking lot.  I asked at the desk why the bus left early and she said they had been getting lots of complaints so she called and had the bus come back to get me.  That was nice but I think the driver must have told the other passengers that they had to turn around so

Summary Heading: Low standards and poor customer service
Summary: ·There was no welcome as a diamond member.  There really wasn’t any welcome at all. ·There was a letter stating that we had complimentary waters and a snack, but nothing in the room ·Two of the four elevators were out of order ·There wasn’t a single towel at the pool, although there is a sign instructing everyone to dry off completely before leaving the pool area ·There was no hair dryer in our room.  I asked for one and was told they’d send it up but it never arrived and the desk never called back.  I went down to the front desk and asked again for a hair dryer and let them know that it was our second time asking.  The lady said she'd have one sent up, it's now 20 minutes until checkout and still nothing. ·Although our reservation was for a family of four, we were only given

We had a great time there.  First day the pool was closed (outdoors) due to wind conditions.  One of the 4 elevators was also broken the whole time we were there (4 days).  Not a huge inconvenience, but it did slow things down a bit.  The room was nice and clean though, and the service was mostly friendly!

I would usually give an Embassy Suites a minimum very good review and the overall stay was not bad.  The staff was helpful and friendly. Hot breakfast was good. Our room was clean but showing it's age. (frayed carpet and slow draining sinks).  The thing that makes this review "average" is the hotel A/C & heat policy.  It was a warm morning, so after two showers the room was uncomfortably warm  I went to turn on the A/C and noticed the sign by the thermostat that said if the temp. is under 50 degrees outside they turn on the heat.  If the temp is over 70 they turn on the A/C.  There is no choice except the fan which did not help.  I did request a fan from the front desk (which took about 30 minutes...and we are trying to get ready so we can check out) and that helped a little but

Summary Heading: Not in line with past Embassy Suite experiences
Summary: We are Embassy Suites people and have always had great experiences with the brand, so we were disappointed with our most recent stay as it did not live up to expectations. Maintenance was not consistent or of best quality, and some services had to be "chased down" rather than being automatic.

Summary Heading: Horrible maid service, needs help all around
Summary: We arrived on 10/3/13 with room requests of a high floor, roll-away bed, and room away from the elevator. We were told that the hotel doesn't do roll-aways because of the fold out couch bed and that our other requests had been met. We went up to the room on the 4th floor and realized that the room was directly outside the elevator. I also saw that the bathroom was only accessible by going through the bedroom. Usually these Embassy Suites rooms have bathrooms accessible by the coffee area. This was very uncomfortable for my mother who was sleeping on the couch, to walk into our room in the middle of the night to use the bathroom. I went back downstairs to explain the problems and the lady said that all of the bathrooms are only accessible from the bedroom. I asked about a room
Manager Response: Dear Roook,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know in detail about your experience at the hotel.  Even if it is a negative review, giving out all the details, helps us work on finding solutions to our shortcomings.  I apologize that Housekeeping kept removing your extra blanket, which you needed.   You are correct Roook, that most Embassy Suites have the bathroom access from the living area.  If it is a couple, they would prefer the door from the bedroom, if it is a family, you will either disturb those sleeping on the pull-out or sleeping in the bedroom. We are working the details for our upcoming renovation and hope that you will be able to visit us again and see all the improvements.

Summary: Quick and friendly checkin/checkout process. Excellent breakfast and evening reception. Near to Disneyland, excellent shuttle service even  thought it is not free. I like Embassy suites franchise for the complete package
Manager Response: Dear Rafael S,  Thank you very much for the high marks you gave us.  We hope to see you again on your next visit to our area.

Summary: Property looks to be a bit older, but rooms were very spacious. Breakfast was excellent! Managers reception was busy, but good. Staff was very friendly. Overall a wonderful stay! Would definitely stay again. Free parking, easy access to hotel.

Summary Heading: Should have requested a room change
Summary: Negative - Our room was directly across from the elevators which I discovered, after my 3 kids were asleep, made this loud dinging noise every time the doors opened on our floor. Had I known that sooner, I would have requested a room change. I think the guy checking me in should have reviewed our reservation before putting us there. Positive - comfy bed, breakfast staff was super helpful in creating a table for a hungry family of 5 during rush hour, checkout was quick

My husband and I had planned to visit his sister's in San Bernadino and then the next  day go see Dr Phil. I was trying to figure out what was in between so we tried This Embassy Suite in Anaheim. I was a great surprised. It was blistering hot out so when we walked into the lobby there was a but fresh container of water with cantaloupe and cucumbers in it. What a delight after a long trip. The hotel was beautiful, kind of open air feel to it like in New Orleans. Room was really nice. It was 2 rooms Living area and bedroom. Very spacious and very clean. It had a frig and a microwave. Big flat screen TV's in both rooms and a coffee machine. Couldn't have asked for more. We hit the pool and Jacuzzi and that was awesome. We were the only ones there, again very clean. The beds were

The hotel itself is satisfactory. Free parking is good. Free cooked breakfast is good. I went 20 minutes before it was over and unfortunately a lot was gone and they won't bring more. Hotel is adjacent to freeway so noisy at night. Hotel is also far from Disneyland. There's a shuttle that leaves once an hour so if you miss it, you must wait another hour.

Stayed couple of days for Disneyland with family. Decent hotel, typical Embassy design, with spacious suites, excellent free breakfast, beautiful lounge area. Free parking. Location is in the middle of nowhere - some garbage processing facility on one side and highways on the others. If you are for Disneyland, consider staying at Embassy south - much closer to the tourist places, you can basically walk from there. From this hotel you can only drive if you want to go anywhere.
