But the other hotel is more expensive and parking there is 12$. Here it is free. But if you go to Disney u have to use the shuttle 5$ pp or park there 16$, so see for yourself. The restaurant closes at 10 PM, which was a bummer. There are no restaurants in the area, and driving to the nearest is probably 30

Back in 2012 we moved from Houston, Texas to California and this hotel was basically our home for 2 1/2 weeks.  This hotel accommodated 6 of us total!  Kids enjoyed the breakfast and the pool.  For our 1 year anniversary here in California we attended this hotel again!  It was definitely a nice get away just to relax!

Staff is wonderful. Just needs a face lift.  I stay at this every year for work and have never had an issue in past but the food was horrible although I liked my room. Just seems that the whole building needs a rehab. I had never eaten dinner in the past but next time I think I'll pass.
Manager Response: Dear Mary M,  Thank you so much for the compliments regarding our Staff.  We do appreciate hearing about our service.  The "Face Lift" you are referring to is coming soon and you will be pleasantly surprised. I was sorry to hear that the food quality was not up to standards.  Please accept my apologies.  We will be able to determine which menu items you had and have the Chef work on it. On behalf of the entire staff, we thank you for your yearly patronage of our hotel.

Summary: Managers reception was a joke. Pool was over chlorinated .  No working air conditioning in our room.  When we called and complained because the room would not cool down the staffs solution was to give us a fan. The positive, Great breakfast. This is not normal with our past experience of Embassy Suites.

My experience was very good. I have not had a bad experience yet. I don't stay in hotels often but if you can get a promotional deal it is affordable for most people. Rooms are large, bathrooms are large. This is a huge plus when there is more than one person. I like the evening complimentary gathering. I like the cook to order breakfast. The inside of every hotel I have stayed in is different. I like the variety they provide.

Summary Heading: nice hotel, not so nice A/C
Summary: The hotel has had some recent renovation and actually looks nice for how old it is. the staff was very friendly and helpful at check in and it was very easy to buy our disneyland tix at the front desk. Hotel is on an hvac system so you can never really get a comfortable temperature in the room because the whole hotel is on the same system.We had to request a fan from the front desk to even get the room manageable enough to get to sleep. They were willing to sen someone up to work on it but we were on a trip alone with out our four kids and didnt want to share the night with a repair man. Other than the A/C system it was a pleasant enough experience.

Faryn checked me and was very pleasant and professional.  The bar staff was very freindly and the drinks were fantastic.  The chef preparing the omletes had an unprofessional appearance and he mopped the floors while preparing the omletes.  Not appetizing at all.  I know there is little a hotel staff can do regarding loud children these days, but the guests next to me had very loud kids.  The parents seemed to do nothing to quiet them down.  I thought about calling the front desk, but they eventually quieted down.

Summary Heading: Family loved it but the room smelled
Summary: I used my honors points and stayed one night. The entrance is beautiful and I love the fact they have a shuttle that takes you to Disney. However, my room smelled like a smokers room. This is a non-smoking hotel but I can only assume they gave me that room because it was free using my points. Bathroom had mildew. But the pool and breakfast was good. Needless to say, we didn't stay another night and went to Fairfield Inn.

The chain is consistent; i.e., you know what to expect from the check in, room and layout, reception, room service, breakfast, and checkout. Price is competitive for the level of service and accommodations. It would be nice if the internet were free with Hilton Honors.

Summary Heading: great hotel all are 2 room suites
Summary: went to disneyland for 2 days they have a shuttle that runs every hour cost 5 dollars for the day unlimited use this is the second time staying with them highly recomend this hotel, staff, rooms, beds,cleanliness,full breakfast are all wonderful it was my daughters 17th birthday on her bithday when we got back to the hotel they had put ballons drinks and a basket of snacks also a personalize card nice touch we will be back soon i hope great memories thanks

We had a good stay, though would have liked our room to be at a cooler temperature.  Otherwise we were comfortable through out our stay.  We would have liked the Disneyland shuttle to come more often to and from the hotel.

Summary Heading: Great comfort and amenities - awful breakfast!
Summary: This is a great hotel location for business and family purposes, and the rooms are amazing!  Comfortable bed, large rooms, and amazing staff! The downfall is the free breakfast...our experience was dealing with all the Disneyland families with out of control kids leaving messes, wasting food, and very disrespectful.  The food was atrocious - the omelets overcooked, the orange juice was watery, the tables sticky - even my 14 year old son wouldn't eat it!  So, if you are in it for the rooms - I would highly suggest staying here.  Just watch out for the rude breakfast rush and the bad food!

For Embassy Suites, seems to be aged quite a bit but still the rooms and beds were very comfortable.  The only "flaw" I found with the room was an open pipe about 1/2 inch protruding from the ceiling over the tub which may have once been part of a fire safety sprinkler system.  The breakfast was good as it always is at Embassy Suites and my 13-year old loved the pond and fish at the center of the bottom floor.

I appreciate the quality of the hotel and the excellent service I receive from all the staff. I would have liked to have been given a chose to have meat other than pork in the morning for breakfast. I also would have liked to have known the bathroom was in the master bedroom, because of another guest. Having them having to come in the bedroom was an inconvenience.

This hotel is in the same parking lot as Buca di Beppo and the hotel offers coupons to it. From our room we could see Disney's fireworks so we did not have to stay late at the park. Nice hotel, nice location.

This hotel has a wonderful staff, great cooks, a beautiful interior setting, and is totally smoke-free.  A great place to stay on travel or just to get away with the family. Being just off the 91, you could take two turns and you are on the road directly to Disneyland parking, so you totally avoid the freeway traffic.

loved the staff, they were very nice.  even met the GM who was a gentleman and extremely caring.  the hotel was clean, and parking was fine.  Family Friendly, and the breakfast was great! I will stay here again!

Summary Heading: More like a two star old hotel than usual Embassy Suites
Summary: We picked this hotel because we have always had a good experience with Embassy Suites, however, this was not the case here.  This is an old hotel and my room had me fearing bed bugs.  I didn't see any but just the look of the room and the ancient furniture gave me pause.    Our shower was so old too and the carpet was worn.  I would not stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Liketlab,  Thank you for your candid feedback of your stay with us. I apologize that we did not meet your expectations and I am actively working with our housekeeping team to ensure cleanliness and comfort are our first priority. I understand the condition of your guest room was of concern. I am always looking for reviews to provide insight into our guest experience and I will keep your review in mind as we look towards refresh options. Thank you again for your feedback and I invite you back to stay with us the next time your travels bring you to the area.

Summary: We recently stayed at the Embassy Suites North Anaheim. It was a good stayed for the most part. We dropped off our son at Chapman University. I picked this site because of the distance between the school and our hotel. It was about 4 miles away. It is a quiet and isolated hotel. The location has no other restaurant or shopping center nearby.  So, if you need to go to a store or chain restaurant. I recommend, go before hand. Our room was interesting at night. Because of the freeway, it was a bit noisy. However, it was better than a view of the factory behind or a dusty ditch.  Regarding the stayed, I notice everybody slamming their doors. What is up with that?  Plus, it was funny, while getting ready for the day. In the bathroom, I heard some family conversation. It was like

Summary Heading: LOVE THE HOTEL But in need of updates
Summary: This is my third stay at this hotel in seven years. I like the hotel's location which is right off the free and has easy access (close enough to Disney) to Anaheim and Hollywood (about 35 miles away). What I like about the hotel is the rooms are spacious compared to many hotels, they have a free hot breakfast, and boast a clean indoor pool and hot tub (I just wish they would give us free internet access!) During this stay which was booked last minute, I reserved two king rooms one next to the other which were extremely comfortable for our party of seven- four adults and three kids. The downside on this stay is that the rooms have began to age and bathrooms need desperate updating. The showers did not function properly- half the water did not go up the shower but instead flowed

Worked well for a Disneyland stay. The bus ride was 15-20 minutes but for the price and full breakfast was worth the bus ride. Even had time to come back for a break to swim and have room service before going back to Disneyland for the evening. Staff gave excellent service.

Personnel very professional.  Lobby very impressive.  Breakfast just OK.  Restaurant, for lunch, pricey and not worth it. Room could use better entry and toilet maintenance.  Room could use updating.  Indoor pool and spa very clean and attractive.

We used this hotel to have our High School Reunion at.  We had rooms blocked for any classmates that wanted to stay.  Everyone that wanted to stay was able to.  We used the big room for our reunion and the hotel staff was helpful and had the room ready for us.  The hotel suites were very roomy and nice.  I would recommend Embassy Suites-Anaheim North it is a beautiful hotel

During our last visit to Anaheim, we had the pleasure of enjoying this stay at the Embassy Suites.  We all enjoyed the breakfast which in my opinion takes a lot of extra stress of any vacation.  As always Embassy Suites comes through when it comes to needing a place to rest while we play!

Summary Heading: One night stay for Knotts Berry Farm
Summary: My wife, sons and I stayed at this hotel before going to Knotts Berry Farm. We were supposed to stay there two nights. We checked in late the 1st night so didn't get a good look during the day. We have stayed in Embassy Suites in other parts of the country and have been very happy. The room was dated, the hot tub was scummy and the tables and chairs for breakfast were sticky. We found a different hotel for the second night in lieu of staying for 2 nights like we planned. Once plus, was to omelets were fast and tasty.

I really enjoyed my stay in the hospitality that was given. Very polite and punctual. I will be visiting again. I think the location was and an excellent location. All the convenient stores and shopping malls was in reasonable distance. IN really loved the weather out there. the front desk clerks was very professional.Thanks for the service and the hospitality.

The staff makes it worthwhile. They are very helpful. The rooms are great, the ambiance is perfect, and the food is great.  The only negative is that the elevators are a bit slow.  Ok, so relax and enjoy the ride... they have windows that overlook the giant central area.

given false information in order to book us. If we had known there was not really adjoining rooms, one for my 88 year old,  handicapped uncle and us, we would have probably chosen a different hotel.  Or, if we would have been told the truth, and an acceptable alternative had been suggested, at least we would have felt as though we were not lied to in order to get our booking.
Manager Response: Dear David S.,  Please accept my sincere apology for not conforming to your request of adjoining rooms.  I will not attempt to make excuses for this inconvenience.  There was no deceipt intended, just that we did not make every effort to accomodate your request. Again Mr David S., I am sorry.

Summary Heading: Too short a stay, a hotel that is handling well the crush of presumably enchanted Disneyland bound revelers, families
Summary: One look at the Embassy Suites omnipresent breakfast buffet betrays the "reason for being" of this property; the hordes of family groups massing about the orange juice dispensers, the multiple food serving lines, and their patient hiking towards open tables sprawled over the atrium floor of this hotel says "Disney: Today: and Evermore"  Aficionados of Embassy Suites understand the value propositions, the specific charm and mode of operation of such a place; spacious rooms, dual televisions in the rooms, in many instances the ubiquitous atrium, bountiful breakfasts and just enough amenities, now sans Garfield the Cat, to keep families occupied, adults exercized, and the guests streaming back for for.  And what if

This hotel is further away from Disneyland than they'll have you believe. Additionally, the hotel was oversold so we experienced people during check-in who had no rooms. Thank god we're Hilton Honors members & they called us ahead to check us in & insure we had a room.

The suites here are smaller than other Embassy's, however it still ranks up to the others. Upon check in we where given the key to some one else's suite. Luckily the lady was still awake and heard us trying to open the door and advised the room was occupied. God forbid shed be sleeping or in the shower. I advised the front desk of the mistake and they apologized and blamed it on a staff member that's shift had ended. I hope they gave that hotel stayer some type of complimentary gift because that situation could of gone worse!   My husband and I have been Embassy suit fans for the past 3 years now and it wasn't until our stay this year that we knew they offered free baby cribs (play pins). It was really nice not to have to share our comfy bed with our squirmy toddler while on

This hotel is very run down. The rooms feel more like a motel than an all-suite hotel. Everything except the atrium is run down and vaguely dirty looking. And the worst part is that our room smelled, which gave us all headaches within an hour. I also seriously doubt the cleanliness given that I found a dirty sock in the sheets.  Service was good.
Manager Response: Dear MyFamilyVacations,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us.  I apologize that our suites did not meet your expectations.  Our product may not be new but we take pride in keeping it fresh and clean.  Thank you for recognizing our good service levels and we hope you will keep us in mind if you are visiting the area next year.  You will be pleasently surprised.

Summary: My husband travels almost monthly to California and stays at the Embassy Suites Anaheim North because of it's proximity to his office. My daughter and myself travel down with him several times a year. This last trip in June we noticed a decline in the customer service, could be because they have almost an entirely new staff. They are not knowledgeable and don't seem to have a desire to go above and beyond. Additionally, asking for simple items like towels that should have been in our room took about an hour to reach us or the bedding for the pull-out bed took almost two hours to reach us. This is not the closest hotel to Disneyland so if you are looking to go there are other options that would place you closer for the money. We are disappointed that many of the individuals who

We had 3 rooms booked for our group stay July 5-7.  I traveled with my dog and was given a room on the 2nd floor (216) close to the elevators and heard no noise or elevator dinging from inside my room.  We had a 2 king suites and 1 with 2 doubles.  Everyone in our group remarked how the beds and pillows were so comfortable they wish they didn't have to get out & it was the best sleep they had in a hotel bed ever.  The staff were all very nice, front desk made a mistake on our bill and fixed it immediately.  Managers reception was VERY well-liked by our group and made-to-order breakfast was fantastic...everything you could possibly ask for was available.  I must say I was initially very hesitant to book at this hotel due to prior reviews about the recycling plant, from our

We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights while we were in the area for a family wedding.  We often stay in Embassy Suites as it allows us to have our entire family in one room.  We always enjoy the manager's reception and the cooked to order breakfast that they offer every morning. Check-in was very quick even though we arrived an hour earlier than check-in time.  We required extra towels, blankets and pillows to be brought to the room and they were delivered fairly quickly.  The down side of the stay was a bathroom door in our room that was swollen and so was difficult and noisy to close, water in the shower that was only slightly warm, not hot.  In contrast to the other review which says that their suite was cold, I was hot  when I was inside the bedroom portion of the suite but

I reserved a 2 room, 1 king non smoking suite. Upon arrival we were given a 2 room, 2 queen bed suite right outside the elevator. When I notified them about this, they said it's the only room they had and to check back tomorrow for availability since the hotel was full. You could hear the bell every single time the elevators were used, which there were 2.   I'm not sure the point of making a reservation and paying ahead of time for my stay if we weren't going to get the room we reserved. Day 2, I came and asked to see if there was availablity, but no one assisted that day either until way late in the night. We left the 3rd morning at 7am, so it was pointless to move into a different room. Our experience soured by this.
Manager Response: Dear Linda L,  My sincere apologies for not being able to assign your requested bed type at check-in.  I always appreciate hearing from our guests - including areas where we haven’t met our guests’ expectations. Our front desk goes through a lengthy process each day to ensure that our guests receive exactly the room expected, however at times we do not have the same availability due to varied reasons. Once again, I apologize for the inconvenience and do hope that the next time you travel to the area you will consider staying with us again.

Summary Heading: No free wi-fi and the rooms are always cold.
Summary: I love staying at the embassy suits. But I don't know why the rooms in this embassy suit are always cold, I stay here at least 4 times a year for a week and its always the same way, I wish they can just leave the AC off. On the plus side the staff is really friendly one of the butler is always trying to make my kids smile with his card games and the free candy hi gives them. And a young Latina lady that works at the breakfast area is  always really friendly and recognizes us every time we stay there. We keep coming back to this embassy suit because they make us feel welcome.   But please consider the free wi-fi.
Manager Response: Dear Lovemy,  Thank you so much for your great compliments about our hotel and primarily our dedicated Staff.  As parents, we know that if the kids are happy, the whole family is happy.   It will be my pleasure to pass along your recognition of these staff members that made your stay very special.  My apolologies if you felt that our rooms are kept at a cold temperature, we are trying to prevent having warm rooms especially in the summer. Dear Lovemy, we appreciate your loyalty to our property and thank you for your business.

Summary: Nice hotel overall. Great looking courtyard. Being in the Hilton family of hotels, I was very surprised that they offer free custom breakfasts and drinks (2 hour window), yet charge for wifi access and the fitness center. Deal breakers for me - 3 stars.
Manager Response: Dear Texastraveller2012,  Thank you for your compliments on our hotel and courtyard.  Could you please let me know where you heard about charges for the fitness center?  There has never been a fee for that service and I am sorry you were misinformed.   Thanks again for taking the time to let us know.

Summary: Booked hotel for 6 nights for a family vacation. Hotel is clean, staff pleasant and accommodating.  Very nice to have a suite when traveling with  children. Only wish they had Queen size beds instead of Full. Very convenient to have a free breakfast daily with a good variety of foods to choose from as well as have a nightly Manager reception after a long day at Disneyland.  Had one instance where outside noise was loud early in  the morning as workers were power washing beneath our room. We informed the manager on duty who politely apologized and insured it wouldn't occur again...and it didn't. She even gave us a gift voucher for dinner at the hotel's restaurant as compensation.   Although, we didn't feel that was necessary at all, it  did made us feel as though she really cared

Summary Heading: Dirty and nasty room that was not clean
Summary: The room we got had dirty kleenex in the drawers, a pair of soiled mans underwear on top of the hutch,empty and half drank booze bottles that were left under the sink along with a bag of garbage, the sofa bed was stained and the sheet still had crumbs in it. It was gross!!!
Manager Response: Dear Stanley C, Again, please accept our sincere apologies for your first night experience at the hotel.  It was a mistake on our part, which we had hoped that we made up for it with the room adjusments.  I was anticipating that the following 10 nights you spent with us were incident free but it looks like it was impossible to make up for the first bad impression. On behalf of the entire staff, we are sorry for your first night experience here and we would like a second chance to make a better first impression. Thank you again Stanley C, for taking the time to let us know.

Summary: My kids and i enjoyed our stay.  We utilized the pool and spa.  The kids really enjoyed the evening complmentary popcorn and drinkd.  I also enjoyed this area and time of socializing with the other guest there.

This was my second time staying here I think it's just alright. It's getting a little old but, it's pleasant. The happy hour helps. The male bartender was so nice, he was the best part. Our room key slot was shorting out I believe so I ended up running back and fourth way to many times. We went to disneyland the shuttle ride is a little long but not terrible. I would stay again for a good deal but not worth the big bucks. I'd stay closer if you are going for the Disney experience.

This a beautiful hotel! The staff was amazing and the "made-to-order" breakfast was delicious. We really enjoyed our visit. Wonderful also to have free wi-fi and free parking... many hotels near Disneyland charge for both. This hotel is a find!!!

An overall excellent hotel with friendly attentive staff an awesome cooked to order breakfast yet a less than inspireing managers reception limited choices to off brands and no name liquors. As usual the beds were hard as stone and the room clean as could be.

Summary Heading: If you could live without one thing....
Summary: Great looking hotel and great service from the staff. You can't go wrong in choosing this place for what ever your need will be. Except, the only thing that today's modern family needs: free WiFi. I don't know if this is a new Hilton policy, that unless if your one of their elite club members you get it for free. Or if you don mind paying the $9+ per device per day charge just to log on and surf the World Wide Net. But to their credit they do have a special business "cubical" where you can access the net. Great place, just one notch short of perfection.

Good hotel to stay for families. Close to Disneyland and free shuttle to Disneyland. If you are a couple, young or old, and you are looking to relax - this is not the place to stay. To be fair I was there during summer vacations and it is noisy, very crowded at breakfast & happy hour - kids running around everywhere.

I have stayed at this hotel numerous times in the last ten years and have enjoyed my stays.  I have also stayed at other Embassy Suites and have been happy with them all in general.  I make a point of going to an Embassy Suites if at all possible, whenever I travel.

Nice place to stay with a good breakfast and enjoyed the happy hour one of the nights I was there.  The room and the bed was comfortable and clean.  The only problem we had was that the key to the room wouldn't work several times and had to go back downstairs to take care of it.

this embassy suites has a ALL NIGHT recycling center next door. Good if your a vampire and up all night. spoke to the front desk they did not help with my concerns. Sounds like trash trucks with the beep, beep, beep all night. We will not go back to this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Craig C,  I’m sorry we were not able to provide you with a satisfactory experience during your recent stay. Your satisfaction is very important to us and we appreciate your feedback about the noise you encountered next door. I will certainly keep your feedback in mind as we're always trying to improve our overall guest experience. We hope you will consider staying with us again the next time you are in the area.

Summary: My husband and I went the last weekend of May, just for a getaway weekend. We probably stayed at the wrong time at this hotel because they were doing renovations to the place. It is a little outdated....our night was not very comfortable either. The room was hot and we were unable to adjust the temp. You can also smell fumes...which I believe was from paint. Clean, yes. Breakfast was okay. Needles to say we only stayed one night and moved to another Hilton Hotel in the morning.

I stayed in this hotel for a few days with my family. I am a diamond member and expected more! First, the bathtub was clogged and the room furniture looked outdated. I was disappointed as the bed was uncomfortable, the housekeeping did not do a good job, and front desk people were not the friendliest bunch. I would not recommend this hotel!
Manager Response: Dear R R,  Thank you for your review of our hotel and loyalty to our Hilton Brands. We're very sorry that you were disappointed with your stay and for the inconveniences that you experienced. We thank you for sharing your feedback about our furniture, bathtub and housekeeping, and will keep those in mind as we're constantly working to improving our guest experience.

Summary: There were three rooms reserved for my family, the hotel did a great job arranging all three rooms on the same floor near each other.  Good choice for visitors going to Disneyland, close enough to be quick to the park.  Would suggest extending weekday breakfast hour to 10 am.
Manager Response: Dear JamesP,  Thank you very much for your 5 Star rating of our hotel.  We are very thankful that you took the time to acknowledge our efforts.  We hope the entire family enjoyed the vacation.

Summary: We have stayed at embassy suites both for business and vacationing, we've stayed at this particular one over the years several times, however the bathrooms in particular are in need of a major renovation, this is the first time we brought a pet which we won't do again we were told to alert housekeeping when we took our pet out so they could clean our room, we did and for our entire stay our room was never cleaned, we made our own beds and cleaned up as best we could, also the pillows were awful, we enjoyed the location as we were going to Knotts berry farm, the only other suggestion I would give is brunch should last at least an hour later as most people are down there between 8:30 and 10:00 so after 10:00 it would be manageable. If this hotel goes under a major renovation we
Manager Response: Dear austinsydney,  Thank you for your feedback in regard to your recent stay with us.  I am sorry that it was not as enjoyable as you have experienced in the past.  We are looking at a major renovation in the near future and we hope to continue to be your favorite spot.

Summary Heading: A good place to stay with big families
Summary: Staying at the Embassy Suites hotel with my family was really nice and beautiful. The presentation of elements in the hotel were grand. The atrium is really beautiful with koi fish ponds, plants, and pathways. The staff were very friendly and attentive to our needs, and provided us with information about breakfast and what great attractions are nearby. The room was very nice, with the first part being the living room with a couch that has a pull out bed, a table with chairs, and the TV. The bedroom had two queen size beds and one bathroom. Wait one bathroom?! That is probably the only thing I didn't really like was there being just one bathroom. For a big family, it can take a bit time to get ready/showering, but other than that the room was good. The swimming pool was quite
Manager Response: Dear Gprior364,  It was a pleasure reading your review of our hotel.  Thank you for the compliments and detail description of our facility. We truly appreciate your feedback.

Summary Heading: Good - but could be better - esp for the price
Summary: We stay at the Embassy Suites often, this particular hotel is a little run-down. We like to stay here, but this particular time was a little frustrating and the price was certainly steep for what we received...

We loved this hotel... it was perfect for our family.  We had trouble checking in but after that was resolved we completely enjoyed the hotel and the numerous amenities offered.  The Shuttle to Disneyland was very convenient.
Manager Response: Dear Margo T,  Thank you very much for your great review of our hotel and amenities. We hope you come back and see us in the near future.

Summary: This was such a surprise!  I loved the courtyard inside. There is a small waterfall AND koi and turtles. The room was unusual in that we had 3 sinks.  One sink was in the mini kitchen that had both a microwave and mini fridge. The breakfast was free and featured an omelet made to order.  We ate breakfast next to a pond and enjoyed the view.  The hotel is located near the highway which makes getting around very easy.  The only down side was we asked for a 6am wake up call that never happened.  Also, I knew there would be a pet fee but the web site did not state the amount and the $75.00 was a surprise and is a bit steep.  Still, all in all, we enjoyed the stay and will go again.
Manager Response: Dear Sarah B,  It was great to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and especially the koi pond and water fall.  It is regrettable that we missed your wake-up call.  This is a major lapse in our service and I apologize.  We will look into this breakdown.   Thank you for your review and we look forward to your next visit with us.

Summary Heading: Nice, but left feeling that hotels standards are going downhill
Summary: I have stayed in embassy suites before so I thought this would be safe bet when booking our Dusney vacation. The staff, especially Jon, was great. However, rooms need updating. Furniture from the 1980s. Some of the plates at the breakfast Buffett were dirty. I still recommend this place due to the price and the short 10 min drive to Disneyland. When you book, must request a room not overlooking the 24 hour recycling plant. When that room became too noisy to handle, they did move us to a different room
Manager Response: Dear Apierce66, We thank you for your review.  We appreciate your feedback and your recommendation for our hotel.  We are preparing for a major renovation.  We look forward to being of service to you in the future.

Summary: This hotel is nice.  The ambiance is great including a koi and turtle pond.  The omelet bar is the star of this hotel, which is free!  The rooms are spacious and the bed is very comfortable.  The bathroom could have been a little nicer.  There's not much around the hotel, but the restaurant is good.
Manager Response: Dear Timothy S.,  Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your experience and recommendations. We are happy that you enjoyed our breakfast.  Next time you are staying in Anaheim, please come back and stay with us.

Summary: Everyone who works at this location has one goal in mind. Serve the customer! From the front desk to the houskeeping to the bartender it was amazing.   When I checked in, I was greeted by a smiling face and there was no delay. It's always nice when you can check in with no problems.   My room was immaculate each day I came back into it. I'm not a messy person when it comes to hotel rooms, but the housekeeping was able to make my room even cleaner each night.   The best display of customer service came from the waiter/bartender Juan. Each of the two nights I went to the restaurant, he was extremely quick with the drinks and very good with food suggestions. I suggest the chunky tomato!   Thanks to the entire staff for making my stay so amazing!
Manager Response: Dear MarshallFriday,  On behalf of the entire Staff at the hotel, we sincerely appreciate your great feedback.  I will make sure to pass on your comments to our Bartender Juan and the Houseekeeper, that served you. Thank you for your business MarshallFriday.

Summary Heading: Paid for a non refundable room in advance, get there, room is not availabe, UGH
Summary: Hotel is OK, typical Embassy Suites, not happy that I paid for a King bed on a non refundable reservation through the hotel directly on the phone, when I get there they said they are all out of Kings, not a good policy to give away something someone has paid in advance for,  they did not even call me to double check if I was coming or not.  Dont get a room on the far end of the hotel, have to listen to generators or some motors running all night.
Manager Response: Dear Mark M., Thank you for letting us know about your experience at our hotel.  We apologize for not honoring your room type request for that night.  We hope to have another chance to serve you.

Summary: I will NEVER stay at this hotel again. Additionally, I will be very wary about staying with this chain again. I realize that there are other chains that have lower prices and offer more service. This just did not make sense. The room was not clean, the bed was extremely soft and uncomfortable, and the quality of service by the staff was noticeably absent!
Manager Response: Dear Carol A E,  Thank you so much for your review of our hotel. We take all of our guests' feedback very seriously. We'd like to apologize for the negative experience that you had during your stay. Unclean rooms are certainly not typical of our hotel and we will be sharing these comments with our housekeeping staff to make sure that this will not happen again to future guests.  We received numerous accolade on these very special mattresses but we failed your expectations.  At Embassy Suites you get 2 rooms, complimentary cooked to order breakfast and a free evening reception.  We are known as the best value chain.  I regret losing you as a customer.  We'd love to have you back and hope you'll give us a second chance if your travels bring you back to our area.

Summary: We had stayed here 2 years ago and loved it and this time was great as well. The employees here are really top notch. We were always greeted with a smile and a hello by any employee we came into contact with. You can tell they really make a good effort to provide good service. Our room was clean and comfortable. I had requested extra pillows, blankets and towels and they were there waiting in our room when we checked in. Housekeeping was outstanding. The breakfast had everything imaginable including made to order omelettes, bacon, sausage, fruit and pastries. In the evening there is a managers reception with free drinks and snacks. The manager came around and personally greeted people which was nice. The pool was nice and although I didn't try the fitness room it looked like it

This hotel is an experience! It is gorgeous inside they give free drinks at the managers reception and an awesome free MADE TO ORDER or buffet breakfast in the morning what more could you want! If you are feeling really inspired by the turtles and fish in the freakin indoor pond they have you can hit up their fitness center in the morning before you go to disneyland, you do not want to lose that pump know'm saying! The bartender is a great man I can't remember his name but he will treat you well! AWESOME HOTEL

We stayed for business and pleasure. From the moment of our late arrival, staff was professional and very friendly.  The complimentary breakfast was awesome and Happy Hour a pleasant and enjoyable surprise. The hotel was clean and shuttle service prompt and courteous. We will definitely return and recommend to friends.

This hotel was not my first choice, I was working in Brea and the embassy suites there was sold out. Noise was a big issue at this hotel.  Lots of annoying tweens running around, yelling, doubtlessly hyped up on Disney.  It was made worse when several tour buses arrived and those kids started running around, banging on doors.  Kids everywhere, even at the bar, during the managers reception, climbing up, not listening to their mostly inattentive parents.  Many guests allow their door to slam shut from fully open, which, without any closing mechanism, slams shut with an almighty crash.  There's a steel reclamation plant right next door where you can hear and smell diesel engines and the constant beeping of reverse gear warnings, well into the night.  I generally avoid pet friendly

This hotel compared to the embassy suites nearest the actual DisneyLand park was a better value. The drive is about 12-15 min to the park which i pretty good. The staff are very Helpful and attentive. The breakfast is excellent ..its fresh and the selection is plentiful, it will save you about $15 per person to eat here before heading out to Disneyland. Cozy room/good value!
Manager Response: Dear Ashley,  Thank you very much for your upbeat and well appreciated review.  We thank you for your business and the compliments.

Summary Heading: Off the Disney strip, but WELL worth the drive!
Summary: We have annual passes so parking at the resorts each day wasn't an issue.  For some, the distance from Disney (if that is your destination) might be a bit of an issue.  We LOVE the Embassy Suites hotels and stay there whenever possible.  The atmosphere is so fun and inviting, even better than the Disney themed/owned hotels in my opinion.    All of the room doors face an open lobby with a glass ceiling allowing in natural light and gorgeous starlit night views.  The lobby is filled with ponds that are home to turtles, ducks, and the biggest koi I have ever seen!  Several pathways wind around the ponds, taking you over bridges and past delightful waterfalls.  All of the lobby trees are wrapped with tiny lights so at night, the area takes on a magical quality.    The hotel has a
Manager Response: Dear Jaelyn M,  What a wonderful detailed and very positive review.  Thank you so much for taking the time to give us your feedback.  We hope we can be of service to you and your family real soon.

Summary: No connecting rooms. Freeway noise is unacceptable. Good cook to order breakfast - a little to greasy. Beds comfortable, pillows suck. Pool smelled nasty. Late check-in. Why do I have to write 200 characters.. you just want people to blather on and on?
Manager Response: Dear Bryan K.,  My sincerest apology for the misunderstanding between your need for connecting rooms and the reservation request for adjoining rooms.  I am sorry the Staff could not do anything about it, as we physically don't have any connecting rooms.   Also on your request to be transferred to another hotel could not be honored.  Rates differ substantially between individually managed branded hotels and you had prepaid with a non-refundable deposit, so your price could not be honored at other Hilton branded hotels in the area. Thank you for your compliments on our breakfast cook and our comfortable beds.  Sincerely,

Summary: This hotel is great, nothing to complain, Staffs is very night, Manager Reception every night is very nice, friendly. Spool is great, we can swimming in morning since in door pool, Breakfast is great, Lunch/Dinner is good. Room very large, it has more space for kids to play, environment is nice and friendly. Really relax when stay in this hotel

There are many other hotels in the area that I would use before staying here again.  The place needs some updating.  Dresser handles came off several times. Room was not cleaned one day and the bathroom counter was not cleaned thoroughly when we arrived.  The morning breakfast was only "so-so."
Manager Response: Dear Jim T.  Thank you Jim T. for taking the time to let us know about your experience with our Hotel. In fact we are currently planning a major renovation but it is no excuse for not keeping the Hotel 100% clean at all times, which we strive to do.  I apologize if we fell short of providing you and your family a care free stay.  I will be sharing your comments with our Staff and I sincerely hope you would try us again, soon.  Thank you.

Summary: Great clean rooms, very comfortable. Easy Freeway access and close to L.A., Orange, Riverside & San Diego counties. Great staff, great rates. I had family & Business that worked out perfectly! Convenient, friendly, good food and business center was a real life saver!
Manager Response: Dear Kenneth W.,  We are grateful for your beautiful review.  We hope to see you again soon.  Sincerely,

Summary: Nice hotel, employees very helpful and friendly.  The room was a little worn but clean and met my needs for a room near Kaiser hospital.  The restaurant served a delicious hamburger and our server was attentive and charming.  Had to eat alone one evening and server was kind and watched to make sure I had everything I needed.
Manager Response: Dear Vickenme, Thank you very much for taking the time to write a positive review about our Hotel. Your comments regarding our Restaurant food and the server paying extra attention to you while eating alone were truly appreciated.  We are very happy that you enjoyed your stay.  Sincerely,

Summary Heading: Nice stay, the staff took care of us
Summary: We stayed at the hotel for 7 days. The hotel was very clean and the staff were very polite and courteous. The housekeepers were friendly even though they did not speak English. I had to communicate with front desk if I needed extra towels or when my room was clean. The breakfast buffet was generous and good; however after the third day, we went out to get our own breakfast (the repetitious menu was getting old). The hotel offered made to order omelette and it was good. The bed was very comfortable and the room was generally clean and very spacious. The fridge and microwave was much older and not as dependable as it needs to be.  Since we stayed at the hotel for 7 days, we used the on site laundry and dryer. We had problems with one of the dryers as it did dry our clothes after
Manager Response: Dear guyscholar, It was a pleasure reading your comments, especially after staying 7 nights with us.  Thank you for letting us know about the dryer malfunctioning, the company came and took care of it.  Sometimes in the Hotel daily life, challenges do occur but how we react makes all the difference.  Thus, your compliments regarding Malia our Front Office Manager were really appreciated.  Thank you so much for your business and your review.  Sincerely,

Summary Heading: It's about what matters to you...
Summary: I stayed at this hotel on a business trip with a duration of 10 days.  This was my first trip to this area and I originally wanted to stay in Brea but this was one of the only hotels available when I booked my travel.  Overall, I’d say that this is a nice place to stay.  I checked in easily and had a quick ride to my 7th floor room with a view of the river.  The room was tidy, typical of an Embassy Suites room.  The bathroom was a bit dated – the fixtures had hard water stains and the tub was a bit drippy, but overall it was fairly clean.  Interestingly, only 1 of the three landline phones in my room worked.  In addition, two of the light bulbs were burned out.  This didn’t really bother me though – I don’t use the phones and the bulbs were replaced with a single call to the
Manager Response: Dear gargamel,  It was with great interest to read your very objective review of our hotel during your extended stay with us.  Thank you for your compliments on our internet, Lobby, Breakfast service and Happy hour. I am sorry that the housekeeper did not want to discard of your trash and kept saving it.  I will be sharing these comments with the department. As part of our upcoming renovation we will be replacing our sliding glass doors to improve soundproofing. We really appreciate your comments and business.   Sincerely,

Summary: I went with my mother and father on a trip to Disneyland. It has been the nicest hotel I have stayed at.. The breakfast was delious!! Bacon everyday??? Yum!! And the shuttle to Disneyland is nice. I even got my own room!!  I also love the view of the hotel inside :) and the fish. Stay here when you go to Disneyland!!!:)  I actually stayed here 5 years ago. Not June 2012

I had my wedding reception here and it was amazing! Leala Conners did an awesome job helping us coordinate everything. Food was amazing at our reception and everyone had a great time. Thank you for a wonderful and memorable night!

Very nice Emassy Suites.  Not too flashy, service from the front desk to the bar staff was excellent.  Rooms were clean and comfortable.  The mattress was very comfortable.  Fitness area was small but weel stocked and had soft, clean towels and cold water.  Adjacent to the fitness room was an indoor pool and jacuzzi.  Breakfast was good...not a big fruit selection, though.  Stayed there for business but could have easily stayed there for a Disneyland trip as well.  Not the nicest Embassy Suites I have stayed at, but I would not hesitate going back.  The were no restaurants in walking distance, but there was a bar on the far side of the parking lot.  Easy access to Hwy 91.
Manager Response: Dear silverstater,  We appreciate your positive feedback and loved that we will be your choice on your next visit.  Thank you for your business and we hope you will be back soon.  Sincerely,

Summary: Everything was exceptional.  Breakfast was superb, staff was very courteous and management was always around for anything needed.  Can't wait to come back.  I visited Disneyland, and this was a perfect location to be close to disney without all the traffic.
Manager Response: Dear William S.,  Thank you so much for your very positive feedback.  I am glad you enjoyed your stay with us and we look forward to your next visit to our Hotel.  Sincerely,

Summary: It's not the Embassy Suites fault it's next to a scrap metal yard and the sadly concrete-channeled Santa  Ana River but it doesn't help the atmosphere. However, I think this is a good choice for families going to Disneyland due to location and the fun fish and turtle pond running through the middle of the hotel. Staff was wonderful but the htoel is in need of many repairs.
Manager Response: Dear HappyApex Traveler, Thank you very much for taking the time to share with other travelers your opinion regarding our property.  On behalf of the entire Staff, we appreciate your positive feedback on the hotel Staff. We are planning a full renovation by middle of next year.  We hope you come back and visit it again.   Sincerely,

Summary: Staff was really nice.  I like that Hilton hotels provide evening reception with free drinks, and complimentary breakfast in the mornings.  Location was perfect for our meeting, but I probably would not stay here for vacationing.

These folks really make you feel like you matter to them.  A quality that you don't see much of anymore. From the time of check-in to check-out they concerned themselves with our needs and more. Thank You for great experience once again.

So I had the occasion to stay at this hotel for a networking event and family gathering. I have stayed at quite a few Embassy Suites over the years. It used to be one of my favorite hotels. The staff was ok, not over friendly or customer service oriented. My room must have been in the cross hairs of every plumbing pipe in the building. I had the displeasure of hearing toilets, showers and water running all night until after 6am the next day. I could not wait to get in my own bed at home. We ordered room service the food was worse than diner food, the am free breakfast was plentiful but average. When I checked out and requested a copy of my bill, the woman at the desk was on a personal call and not very interested in helping me. Overall it was not an awful stay but for $200 plus

Summary Heading: Great Hotel but request quiet side of hotel
Summary: Great place for families and located close to Disneyland.  But be sure if you want a good nights rest to request the quiet side of the hotel.  Also double check disneyland park hours; front desk isn't always right!!

Hotel provides great customer service.  I was welcomed quickly and efficiently.  Breakfast was great, and the manager's reception had a nice selection of snacks.  Hotel décor provided a nice relaxing ambience, and the rates were a lot better than the hotels closer to the convention center and Disneyland.

Summary Heading: A perfect location for a family to stay - wonderful complimentary hot breakfast.
Summary: The atrium is lovely and really adds to the experience.  The location is easy to get to right next to the freeway.  Caters to family groups and had a large Disneyland crowd.  The breakfast had several options and varied slightly every day.

Summary Heading: Not the best Embassy Suites experience
Summary: This was our 2nd stay at this Embassy, and the 2nd time is mistook it for the other Embassy suites closer to Disney.  They should change the name to "fullerton embassy".  That said, on this stay our room had a stain on the carpet, and ink pen marking on the chair.  I didn't mind so much since there are a lot of kids using this hotel, so I understand. I had less consideration for finding only 1tv remote in the room (yes, there were 2 tvs), and then having the phones not operating as well. Speaking with another visitor, Our issues with the remote and phones wasnt isolated.  Additionally, the omelette station only offered limited choices: ham & cheese or mushrooms.  I'm used to having 5-7 options. The service staff was friendly and helpful though,

We have stayed here a few times on our visits to Anaheim. What I like best about this hotel is easy (check in, breakfast, checkout). We especially like the fact that the complimentary breakfast is both easy to access but plentiful in food\food selections.

This was our Disneyland vacation of a lifetime and we couldn't have been happier with the hotel and it's amenities.  We read reviews from other travelers and had none of the "issues" others reported.  Our room was clean, quiet and comfortable.  The breakfast was a great value and delicious with plenty of variety.  Staff were all very friendly and helpful, especially Stan the bellman :-)  We would recommend and stay again.

Summary Heading: Embassy Suite Not Up to Standards
Summary: My recent stay at Embassy Suites Anaheim North was uncomfortable because the furniture is old and uncomfortable to sit on. You cannot control the heat or air in your room; the carpeting is old and dirty and needs replaced. Too bad because the location is perfect for my needs. For the price paid, I would expect the room to be updated. They really need to do that.

Embassy Suites has gone downhill. I booked my room online. Little did I know that I was getting a "smoking" room. Seriously? In California, that's illegal. No smoking allowed. I had no choice. Then the noise was extremely loud.  Do NOT stay here unless you are a smoker and don't mind noisy kids.  Plus, my room was dirty. GROSS!

Hotel was very well kept and facilities were excellent. Staff went out of their way to make sure our stay was perfect, everyone was very friendly from front desk to breakfast staff. Pool & hot tub area was clean and inviting and rooms were clean & well appointed. We would definitely stay at this hotel again, pricing was well worth it. We took our son for his first visit to Disneyland and our stay capped a wonderful vacation.

This hotel is great!!  Staff is wonderful, helpful, friendly and really takes interest in your comfort during your stay.  Beautiful setting inside and out.  Small outside property but very well-kept.  Easily accessible from freeways for travel.  We were there for Disneyland and had no problems at all.  We needed to take our dog and the staff welcomed her as one of the family.  Just a great experience all the way around!  Thanks Embassy Suites!

My sister made all the travel plans and picked this hotel. Although I am familiar with the Embassy Suites chain, it's not always easy to find a good hotel in Anaheim, so close to Disneyland. The suite was bright and clean and comfy. The free breakfast was amazing. Wonderful omelets, bacon, fruits etc. As an added bonus, there was a nightly Manager's Reception, with snacks and drinks were free. The  tropical atrium was delightful. The only downside I observed was that the hotel had almost nothing within walking distance. So, if you didn't have your own transportation, you were limited to the hotel.

First off I am surprised I seen so many bad reviews on this hotel. At first I was kind of scared after booking the room because I kept hearing bad stuff about the place but I thought why not give it a chance Upon arrival the front desk person was  very nice and answered all of my questions. The suit was really nice and clean the furniture was in great condition and the bed seemed perfect. The free snacks and drinks were good:) the breakfast was delicious overall I would recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: Best Hotel Breakfast, Plus Disneyland Shuttle!
Summary: Best hotel breakfast ever, with made-to-order omelets, waffles, bacon, fruit, the works.  This is an "occasion" every morning as it's served in the sky-high skylight central atrium with fountains, water and big orange and white koi.  Atrium is great if you get stuck in the hotel while the kids nap. ART shuttle bus leaves for Disneyland every hour on the hour, so you actually can send some home to nap. About 7 miles to the parks. Rooms not fancy, but plenty of storage.   It's really nice to have a separate living room with dining or office table, mini fridge and microwave. Indoor pool is heated nicely, probably 87 degrees.

Full time business traveler: The Embassy Suites Anaheim is a solidly decent hotel. It does not have a new feel to it because, well, it isn't. But it certainly is not unduly worn. The rooms were adequate, the bed is fairly comfortable, it provides a good working space/desk, audio/video is solidly good, environmental controls were good. The rooms itself have some wear on them but they are not unappealing but any stretch.  I personally like the Embassy Suites that have balconies and this one does.I prefer the Embassy Suites with bathroom access between the living room and bedroom. This one has bathroom access from the bedroom. The atrium area is quite green and nice. Staff was friendly and professional. It is right next to the freeway but I did not have an issue with freeway noise.

Summary Heading: Marvelous staff at this location...they made the stay truly enjoyable.
Summary: I've stayed at other Embassy locations and they are a good value when travelling with children.  However, this stay was made quite enjoyable by the staff.  Always patient, polite and striving to accommodate, these are the type of staff one should expect at a Hilton property.

Our room had carpet patches, broken furniture, very old and worn out mattress and comforter.  There are better choices in this price range.  We enjoyed the breakfast service, but the service at the evening manager's reception was terrible.

Typical Embassy Suites.  Either you like them or you don't.  Large comfortable rooms with the usual amenities.  Good work space with separate sitting area for reading or watching TV.  HDTV flat panels in sitting area and bedroom.  Lots of storage space for longer-term stays.  Plenty of pillows.  Exercise room is small but has good equipment.  Large indoor pool and hot tub. This property is starting to need a freshening up but the staff was very friendly and helpful.  Usual echoing noise from the atrium that died down around 10:00,  The only two negatives were that the wireless was very difficult to connect and stay connected and there are no good eating places within walking distance.  (Walk? this is LA)  There was a very nice looking restaurant off the atrium but it was not

I did not personally stay in this hotel, but my co-workers did and this is just a summary of the issues they experienced. They stayed for 5 days.  Many things were mentioned to management - some were addressed, but no compensation or offer to move their room was offered.  This was during a very large food show, so there were not too many vacancies.  -Upon sitting on the bed the first time, the headboard basically fell off the wall onto the bed.  Luckily no one was hurt.  -The faucet in the wet bar area broke off when used and water kept running.  This was addressed right away.  -A/C was down in parts of the hotel and in this room for two days. Windows opened so since it was warm w/o A/C they windows were opened - this room faced a scrap yard - so the noise was horrible with the

Summary Heading: A very enjoyable experience for our family
Summary: We stayed here for 11 nights, and were very pleased with this hotel.  Staff was friendly and prompt in tending to us.  The first night we were there, our bathtub water was backing up so we called the front desk.  Maintenance was there in 5 minutes and unplugged the drain, and we never had another problem with the tub after that.   The hotel decor in the lobby and atrium is beautiful and well maintained.  Breakfast was just fine, with delicious fruits, yogurt, cereals, juices, bagels, etc.  My 2 pre-teen boys said the sofa bed was fine, and the beds in the room were comfy.  Parking was ample.  The kids enjoyed swimming in the pool, and also playing pool at the pool table during the daytime when the bar was empty ($1 per game of pool).    We do not drink so we didn't attend the

Summary Heading: Not a good example of the Embassy Suites brand
Summary: Embassy Suites is often a great deal but this location suffers from an aging and poorly-maintained facility and lackluster management.  I've stayed here a few times over the past couple of years because it's close to my company's Anaheim office, but after this last stay I'm giving up on them.  No heat in the rooms on one of the colder days this winter.  Breakfast variety has declined -- undercooked, wet eggs, no veggies at the omelette bar, not much else available.  Nothing horrible, but given how much they're charging they need to do MUCH better than this.

Summary Heading: Right for Families Going to Disney, But a Tired Hotel
Summary: If you need a safe place to base the family as you go to local attractions eash day, this place will work. It has the extra room, standard free breakfast and free drinks in the afternoon. Just don't expect too much. I was here on business, so except for the extra room, it was just ok. The place is a little tired, no free internet, and there is nothing to do in the area but go drink, eat or see a movie. Also it's full of kids. I love them (got two), but other may want a more adult place.

Summary Heading: A very worthwhile anchor for Orange Couty excursions
Summary: We really enjoyed our two-day mid-week stay here over Valentine's Day.  The rooms are very comfortable and the complimentary FULL breakfast is tasty and very efficiently prepared ( omelletes to order - great!). The pool is small but warm and the overall decor has more of a small resort (big atrium, natural light skylights, koi fish ponds, etc.). Its location (close to Disney but not too close and quick access to Newport Beach make this a very strategic place to stay. The check-in staff was very courteous, efficient, and polite - better service than I have gotten at fancier places like the Four Seasons.

This hotel was really gross.   The furniture was dingy and dated, the chairs/sofa were stained, the walls were scuffed. It was awful, dingy, and dark.  Parts of the elevator door were peeling off.  The breakfast buffet was kind of nasty (and I know what to expect).  The sofabed, which I slept on every night of our three night stay, was positively awful. My back still hurts.  Also, it is a good 20  minutes from Downtown Disney.  We ended up driving every day rather than opting for the shuttle.    I am normally a huge fan of Embassy Suites and we actually thought we were booking their ES South location (due to a misleading pic on the http://hotels.com web site), which is definitely nicer and closer to DL.  There was also tons of construction going on our front, which made parking

This place was a terrific value for our family of 5. Rooms were large, although a bit dated. Breakfast buffet was chaotic at times and food quality and type varied, but still a great value. We made use of Happy Hour and breakfast buffet. The WiFi was really poor however. Major confusion over Disney bus route caused us to miss bus on way back one day. ART buses are very schedule strict, we showed up 30 seconds late and it was gone - but we were late. Took taxi to the park that day and it was a bit pricey.  Hotel could use updating in all spaces, rooms, hallways etc.  Restaurant was very spotty, it was actually closed our first night due to a lack of staff, but they still were able to bring us food - just not real table service. They apologized and gave us a discount, that was

Stayed January 17-22, 2013.  Trip to Disneyland, family of 4.    Rooms:  The rooms were clean and large.  Plenty of room.  I really liked having the two separate rooms.  Nice to have the sink area with the fridge, coffee pot, etc.  Also, in the main room there is a sink outside the bathroom, so someone can be getting ready while someone else is taking a shower.  Beds:  This is my biggest complaint.  The beds were horrible.  They are very small...they say doubles, but honestly, they are barely larger than twins.  Hard and uncomfortable.  We let housecleaning come in every other day, our sheets were never changed.  On my bed, the sheets were inside out.  I have a picture of a stain that was there the whole time...  This really bothered me.  Pool:  The pool was great.  The kids

Great breakfast and happy hour.  Rooms are ok except no central heat at night. happy Hour and breakfast are great. The indoor pool looked nice and there was a jacuzzi.  You have to pay extra for internet access.

The hotel is a bit dated but it is well kept. The kids loved the fish and the turtles in the lobby. The rooms have been updated and are clean.  The breakfast was delicious. The staff was always helpful. We will stay here again. Overall we were very satisfied with the hotel.

Summary Heading: Embassy Suites you are better than THIS!
Summary: This place is NOT near Disneyland. This would be fine if it was not such a dump. For the rate they should do better. Not even the free breakfast and watered down manager's reception cocktails can save this place. Old and run down facility, terrible depressing location, and outdated rooms. We stay at Embassy Suites pretty regularly and this is the worst by far. We did have the pleasure of a superior view of the car wrecking facility, lucky us :(

Summary Heading: FREEZING COLD ROOM and LOUD CONSTRUCTION!
Summary: We arrived after spending the day at Disneyland.  It was a cold day in February and when we arrived in our room, the heater would not turn on.  I spoke to the hotel staff and they said that the UNIVERSAL heating system only comes on from 8:30pm - 3:30am. WHAT? I have never stayed at a hotel where I couldn't regulate the temperature in my room.  The heater did not work and we were cold all night.  And then in the morning, the jackhammer started outside my window.  It was loud and obnoxious.  It wasn't just the noise, it felt like the room was shaking.  This was my worst experience at an Embassy Suites Hotel.

The staff were great! The breakfast was awesome, we stayed for a week and only on the last day were we tired of having a cooked o order omelette :). The kids enjoyed the pool and the fish/ turtle pond was really neat.  We stay again, only 20 mins or less to Disney!  The rooms are nicely updated, but the hotel itself is dated.

Great location, excellent staff.  We held our wedding here and were very satisfied with our room and reception.  The staff go out of their way to make everything a wonderful experience.  They went out of their way to see thnt all the details were taken care of, tables, dance floor, sound system etc.  The food was excellent..  Leala Connors was amazing and 'right on' with recommendations.

I chose the Embassy Suites because I am visiting my brother, who is a single person living about a mile away and suffering from cancer.  Although my room rate of $151 cost more than I wanted to pay, I was willing to pay for proximity to my brother, and the fact that there is a two room suite with a fridge and microwave.  My brother rents a room in a house, so I brought him here to the hotel for my 5 day visit.  I need to be able to feed him in the room as he can barely walk.  On check-in, I was absolutely horrified to learn that on top of the $151 room rate (and that is before taxes), I would have to pay $20 a day for internet connection. It is $10 PER DAY PER DEVICE!!  My brother and I each have our own laptops, so this will add an unexpected $100 to the cost of our stay.

Summary Heading: Do not stay here if you need Internet access.
Summary: I have stayed here on business twice in the last four months. Both trips were about two weeks long.  Each time, the Internet access (at $9.95/day) was slow enough to be unusable.  I was unable to connect to my office.  In fact, I couldn't even get Netflix to load.  I ended up having to tether through my iPhone to get any work done.  The long and the short of it... If you are on a business trip and need Internet access, stay somewhere else.  If you are on a family vacation and the kids plan on watching Netflix, stay somewhere else.

Summary Heading: Stay at the Hampton or the Embassy Suites South
Summary: We stayed here November 2011 (the date below didn't go back that far).  We choose this hotel to be near Disneyland and we should have stayed in the Embassy South.  The Embassy South charged more for parking or it cost a little more and we had a car.  This hotel was run down.  It wasn't very clean.  The toilet backup up on us and over flowed and always had trouble flushing.  The pool was nice because it was in doors and the breakfast was really good.  They had a flyer out saying there was an ice cream social.  We went there and it was suppose to be for employees only.  I don't know why they had the flyer out for everyone to see.  It was a little awkward.  We will never stay in this hotel again.  The location was a lot longer than I thought it was be to Disneyland and then you

Summary Heading: Not the same as in past years
Summary: Family stayed in two rooms because of having 6. In past, we could all stay together. Not anymore. It was constant noise, no regards for others trying to sleep. We complained at 3:15 in the morning and nothing was done. We will not stay there again. We hace stayed there 5 times in the past ten years and never had such a bad experience. We changed reservations for day 4 and 5 just because of the noise.

My family stayed at this hotel for 6 nights on our Disneyland vacation. This hotel is located within an easy 15 minute drive to Disneyland. The rooms were clean and large. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Compared to the prices at the Disneyland resorts, it was a no-brainer for us to stay at this hotel. I will swap a short drive anytime in order to save $100 plus per night. Also, these rooms are larger and better equipped than those at Disney. Not to mention, you also get free cook-to-order breakfast and evening cocktails at the Embassy Suites. As a side note, request a room that does not face the scrap yard or interstate. Also, there aren’t any places to eat within walking distance to this hotel, so a car is a must. All and all, I would definitely stay at this hotel

During our stay for 5 days there was never a quiet moment there. There were kids running on all floors and shouting down stairs and up stairs at all hours of the day and night. Our non smoking room smelled like it was previously a smoking room. The toilet did not flush properly and would over flow onto the floor( very Disgusting). So we eventually had to move rooms but this time we had a leaky fawcet and a drippy bath tub that kept dripping all night. The floors and carpeting were not clean and the noise from the scarp yard next door and the freeway on the otherside make getting any sleep here impossible. You are better off sleeping in your car than at this hotel. The breakfast area is gross and has wet dishes and coffee mugs that have not been properly washed and have stains on

This hotel is in Placentia, close but not Anaheim. Looking at the location at the 57 & 91 it is much more convenient for business travelers but Disney is just a short ride but not that close. Having said that it is an excellent hotel which cannot necessarily be said about many close to Disney. Great rooms and even better service with a smile. I'll be back.

We have stayed in many Embassy properties and picked this one due to its location fairly close to Disneyland and John Wayne Airport.  The property itself is about average for an Embassy, although they were in the process of painting the exterior.  Lobby, atrium, etc. were about as expected, although looked a little aged.  Rooms were fine, but some of our party got cold in their rooms, as the temperature was unseasonably cool in California for the time of year.  Manager's Reception was excellent, with friendly bartenders, popcorn, chips and dip, etc.  After a day at Disney, we were too tired to go out to eat and had dinner in the hotel restaurant.  We were just about the only people in the restaurant, but the food was very good.  If you stay here, be aware that it is located in

you cant go wrong with embassy suites once you factor in the free breakfast and evening cocktails. this hotel was family friendly,great staff and great rooms our only complaints were noise from the banquet room below us and the fold out bed was not very comfortable.we will definately stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great landing spot after long day at Disneyland
Summary: This was our home base for our MLK Holiday weekend at Disneyland.  I was very happy with the suite and the hotel in general. Having lots of space in a room shared by 5 people was a huge plus. We had 3 young adults with us. One member of our party was wheelchair-bound, so we had a handicapped room on the 4th floor. It suited our needs perfectly. The hot breakfast was very good. We went to the evening reception only once. My husband and I each had a draft beer. There was chips, salsa, popcorn and pub mix available, also. The reception was from 5:30 to 7:30. The hotel had a shuttle to and from Disneyland that the kids used once to come back early from Disneyland. It was $3 per person and was handicapped accessible.  It was a 15 minute drive to Disneyland. The hotel was right off

Summary Heading: Distance to Mickey the only (minor) problem - otherwise just fine
Summary: Previously I have stayed at the Embassy Suites South property in Anaheim, but the rate was better during my stay at the Embassy Suites North property, so I decided to give it a try. It also has an indoor pool, and I was ready to see if the Happy Hour offerings were any better. ;-)  I can report that the Happy House was a little better! There was chips and salsa, as well as popcorn and the pretzel/chex mix. They also sold pizza slices for $2.00 (I think the other ES does too). One night, a hotel staff member was handing out board games to families at tables with children, which I thought was nice! (You can also check these out from the front desk.)  However, due to meetings, conventions, retirement parties, whatever, there were significant lines at the bar at times (unlike at the

Summary Heading: Good choice for families going to Disneyland
Summary: My family and I stayed at this hotel last summer.  Overall, we had a good stay and I wouldn't mind staying there again next time I take my kids to Disneyland.   Location - it is not that far from Disneyland but you definitely need to drive your car to go to the park.  A shuttle is also available for FREE if you buy park hopper tickets at the front desk.  There is a minimal fee for those who didn't buy disney tickets from them.  The only drawback from taking the shuttle is the frequency of the service.  It's only once per hour.  We waited for over 30 minutes the first night we went to Disneyland because the shuttle was late.  We even called several times to confirm the shuttle was coming.  It's a minor inconvenience that we were willing to accept because we didn't want to drive

The hotel is great, we even extended an extra day.  My kids really like the Koi Pond and the swimming pool.  This is our second time at the same location, and it will not be the last.  Breakfast came as a package, but we only made it on the first day, just got too tired to wake up early enough the catch it.

Summary Heading: Very friendly, and suprisingly quiet hotel
Summary: I just spent a week here on business and was a little concerned about noise due to the fact that it is close to Disney and attracts families.  I should not have been.  It was one of the quietest hotels I have ever stayed in, partly due to being able to shut off the front part of the suite with a door from the bedroom.  Even in communal areas though there was still a sense of calm; no kids going crazy everywhere (not that I don't like kids!)  The thing that I really liked was the friendliness of the staff.  Every single one made an effort to say hi, and be helpful.  Cannot say enough about that.  The rooms are ok to good.  They are clean and the bed was comfortable.  Not the most up to date, but also not worn or dated.  I as disappointed that the gym only had two treadmills and

We stayed 3 days at this hotel.  The lobby was nice and the other open area with the pond and bridge was nice.  All staff was friendly.  Rooms were large, nice and clean.  Breakfast was good and included made to order omelet's, pastries and other hot items, there was also plenty of tables available.  Evening drinks and snacks of popcorn and nachos and salsa were served which was a nice touch.  The restaurant had good salads, soups and sandwiches.  No complaints.

Summary Heading: Not the worst, not the best.
Summary: We generally stay at Embassy Suites at Lake Tahoe, which serves our purpose, so we thought that we'd get a similar experience at the Embassy Suites Anaheim North. I knew it was not the closest to Disneyland, but it's only a ten minute drive, no big deal. They also have a shuttle that leaves every hour, if you're so inclined.  Our room was clean, if a bit shabby. The carpets in the hallways were pretty dingy, and when we arrived in the evening there were trays of dirty dishes left in the hallway outside of different rooms. Not an unusual sight for a cheaper hotel, but when the trays were still there the next morning I thought it was a bit much. After a nice long day at Disneyland, there were coffee cups lying in the hallway, which stayed till the next morning. When we left

My family have been staying at embassy suites since we have young children who likes to swim in an indoor pool. This hotel is the most terrible hotel we've stayed in. First, they've put us in a room where someone is already there! They said it's just a system error! Then we got assigned to another room where the shower drain is not working! On our third move, we  found chicken bones on the floor underneath the lamp! This all happened at about 10pm where our young kids are already sleeping and had to move to three different rooms during their bedtime. The first staff "Taryn" wasn't so helpful and coudn't care less. She won't even smile and didn't even sound apologetic, talk about bad customer service! At least the second staff was a little helpful! He gave us free internet access

Summary Heading: A Third Stay at Embassy Suites North, Anaheim
Summary: This is our third stay at Embassy Suites North in Anaheim.  The concierge is accommodating.  We're a family of five and the double suite suited us just fine.  The breakfast selection is wonderful, can't beat the hot food menu.  There is a shuttle that runs every hour (except 12:30 to 3:30 p.m.). The four-star rating is due to the worn-out carpeting, outdated decor, and small pillows; however, the concierge did mention the hotel will undergo renovation soon.  I will definitely stay at this hotel again.  The big plus for me is the complimentary hot buffet breakfast.

Summary Heading: Found a new place to stay
Summary: We usually stay at the Embassy Suites south, which is much closer to Disneyland. However, I liked this site much more. The hotel has a pretty French colonial style in the lobby. The room was clean and had an extra sink in the master bedroom which was a plus for our family of four. The manager's reception was the best!! The wine was great and the kids loved their nightly Shirley temples. Breakfast was also good.   If you are driving to Disneyland, I highly suggest getting on the freeway and then taking the next exit. We drove through downtown anaheim to get to the parks and the traffic was much better than what we encountered on the freeway. The shuttle cost us a dollar less than Disneyland parking and we wanted the freedom to come and go .

I've never felt so torn in rating a hotel. The staff at this hotel is everything you want hotel employees to be:  incredibly friendly, helpful and accommodating. The rooms are certainly more than sufficient, and typical of Embassy size and space but with a more dated feel. The decor of the hotel and the rooms are kind of charming in their own way, but it reminds me of those really bad decorations that your grandmother had in her house in the 1970s.
