Slightly charming, somewhat tacky and kitsche. The manager was happy to provide a bill adjustment for me, and the breakfast every morning was better than some Embassy hotels and really outstanding. The bartender at the free happy hour knew my name and drink selection by the 2nd night. I enjoyed the indoor pool and the gym. Overall, I

We stay at many Hilton Brand hotels and we do like Embassy Suites due to room size, a good breakfest variety, and happy hour drinks.  The one thing that would make this brand better is if they offered free wifi, at least in the lobby area.  It's about 5-6 miles from Disneyland, but you can take the Anaheim shuttle from the hotel to the park.  We would for sure stay here again.

We visited Disneyland the weekend before Halloween, and were moved to this hotel due to overbooking.   We have never stayed at an Embassy Suites because it is usually not in our price range, so this was a real treat!  The large atrium was beautiful-reminds me of a cruise ship.  We stayed on the second floor in a suite with two comfortable double beds.  My two young boys loved the glass elevator, and the koi pond.  We used the indoor pool which was nice as well. The breakfast was excellent, with made to order omlettes and Mickey shaped pancakes.  The only cons were having to drive into Disneyland, and the highway noise.  We usually stay within walking distance of Disneyland so we can rest and then "hop" into California Adventure the same day.  I mentioned the highway noise to the
Manager Response: Your positive comments are greatly apprciated & will pass them along to our deserving staff...

Summary: We were a family of (6) on holiday, my wife and myself with my mother and 3 kids under 12. Full schedule of 6 parks in 7 days. Thank goodness we had the ES to come back to every night. We only booked the 1 room two Queens with rollout in the TV room. As a family that can 'make do' in most situations, there was plenty of room for us to live together for the week. Facilities including the pool, laundry, bar and daily well presented breakfasts including made to order omelettes made this place a favourite for the kids as well as the adults. The staff are very friendly and helpful. We intend to revisit Anaheim and the ESAN in 2013
Manager Response: Thank you......we're extremely pleasesd that you enjoyed your stay!

Summary: The wife and I stayed at this hotel in October due to a business/family visit to the area. As with most Embassy Suites we knew what to expect and were not disappointed. The staff was extremely helpful when we were searching for a special place to have dinner. We took advantage of the managers reception for drinks each evening and the breakfast each morning. We went to the pool and hot tub one night but the many kids and noise drove us out, but what do you expect from a hotel full of families located near Disneyland.    Carpets looked a bit old but overall I have nothing major to complain about and would recommend the hotel to families especially.
Manager Response: We appreciate your comments and glad that you enjoyed your visit.....

Summary Heading: Free Drinks + Free Breakfast= Suite Deal!
Summary: We've stayed at this location multiple times, but hasn't been here in several years. It hasn't really changed, and that's not a bad thing. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The open atrium area is still beautiful and very relaxing, with the water and koi pond. The waterfall drowns out the other ambient hotel noises without being too loud. The room was spacious enough, clean, and well appointed. The furniture is showing a little bit of age, but was still comfortable. The bed was a soft, cushiony bit of heaven. Bistro 3100 had good service and food. The manager's reception in the evening, home of the free alcohol, was a great way to start the night. The complimentary breakfast buffet was busy but delicious, with all the basics, plus an omelette station.   The only drawback
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive rating of our Hotel.........

Summary Heading: Was ready to leave after checking in...but the staff saved the day!
Summary: No gonna lie, my wife and I were ready to get another motel shortly after checking in. There were some issues with our room. It was clean but dated, rust on some fixtures, grout missing, paint gone, etc. Not many channels to view, and changing them was a pain with the remote we had. So anyway, we decided we were gonna have dinner and split the next morning to a motel a little newer and closer to Disneyland. We went downstairs and found out the restaurant was not open until dinner. While waiting in the lobby, a staff member checked on us and when we told him we were waiting for the restaurant to open, he brought us out some snacks and sodas to hold the kids over till dinner. That was the start of what would turn out to be the BEST service from motel staff we have ever had,
Manager Response: We are excited to learn that the team was able to turn a negative experiance into a positive. Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to do so......

Summary: WE just got back from 8 days and it was great! My Grandson loved the Koi and turtles - the atrium is beautiful! The breakfasts are restaurant quality and the staff go out of their way to make sure your stay is special! If you really got picky - the pillows are too small!
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind & positive comments. We're extremely grateful that you selected our Hotel for your extended stay and I'll pass along your comments to the team.

Summary: This hotel is great for families! We stayed during our recent trip to Disneyland. The suites are comfortable and plenty of room for our family of 5. The breakfast is good and the staff working there are great! The manger's reception from 530-730 (free drinks) was a nice touch! Would definitely stay again!
Manager Response: We're pleased that you han an enjoyable stay!

Summary: As a Hilton Diamond member, I usually stay at Hampton Inns 90% of the time due to the number of locations all over the US, as well as the price and consistency within the Hilton brand. However, when the opportunity arises to stay at an Embassy Suites, I almost always try to if the price is acceptable.   I was able to get a very reasonable rate at this property from 10/1/12-10/5/12 for a business trip. Upon a quick and smooth check-in, I was greeted by a friendly staff. My room was up to standards for an Embassy Suites, and it was clean. The hotel is set up like other Embassy Suites properties in that it has the beautiful atrium with the ponds, greenery, and glass elevators, giving it a luxurious touch.   On my last night there, I decided to have a few much-needed cocktails at
Manager Response: I'll pass along your positive comments and overall experiance to my Team. And most importantly thank you for selecting our Hotel.

Summary: Stayed here for three nights.  Had a great stay. No complaints. Breakfast was very good. Swam in the pool a few times.  Place was clean, not too noisy and we felt it a good value. Didn't try the restaurant or shuttle to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for positive your comments. We are pleased that we we're able to meet your expectaions.........

Summary Heading: Great stay for Disney or business
Summary: Each suite has 2 rooms with TV's so great if you are with kids. Free breakfast made by chef plus free drinks between 5:30pm and 7:30pm, beer, wine and a cocktail. Indoor pool is long and well looked after.  The ceramic and stone tiles on the ground floor and pool is expensively done and still looking great after many years. As with most of the L.A. area you need a car as this hotel is squeezed between a river, freeway and steel recycling plant so you can't walk to stores or restaurants etc unless you want to stroll along the river. Rooms are starting to show their age, dirty wallpaper, slight musty smell and a little noisy unless you face the river.  Elevators have a mind of their own and the wait is sometimes long, taking the stairs leads you to outside. Front desk staff aren't

Highly recommended!  This was my first Embassy Suites experience and I loved it!  The happy hour open bar was great; the room price was reasonable; the ENTIRE hotel staff were professional and VERY helpful.  I will certainly return for a future trip to Disney.  They offer a shuttle to Disney for $5 and it was on time and easy to use.  Very worth the price.

Summary Heading: Not Very Satisfied for this to be Embassy Suites
Summary: The first room had a backed up toilet and when we informed the front desk they brought me a plunger so I could take care of it myself, the room also faced the highway so I listen to traffic all night long.  We move to a quiter room but the toilet did not work in this room as well but the hotel took care of this while we were out for the day.  There was hair on the bathroom floor and towels.  The hotel seemed very dated and did not display the look the I expected a hotel carrying the Hilton brand to have.  The rooms also had a musty smell to them causing us to check out a day early to stay at another hotel.
Manager Response: My deepest apologies for the maintenance issues you experienced during your stay.

Summary: I prepaid a 5 night stay for my family while traveling to Southern California parks with a City Pass, so we needed a central location.   Pros: The staff was incredibly helpful and friendly. The daily breakfast was great. The size of the room/suite was spacious and very comfortable. There are washers and dryers for you to use if need be, which is nice for a family.  Cons: The room was marginally clean; there was black mildew underneath the small fridge, rust around the faucets, stray hairs (that weren't ours) all over the bathroom, and all of the counters were poorly wiped down. The bed was much to firm to my liking so I woke up with neck pain each morning, and I actually ended up sleeping on the pull out with my son, finding it to be more comfortable than the king bed. The fixed
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to repond concerning your experiance at the ES Anaheim. I'm excited to report that the Hotel will be receiving a significant renovation in the near future and look forward to show casing the improvements during your next visit.

Summary: First I was very happy to have a place that sleeps 6 in one room and at this rate, most hotels sleep only 5 per room.  I really liked the rooms and the breakfast.  We payed $125 + taxes = $143 per night for our rooms. If we had purchased breakfast each day it would have cost us at least $60 for 6 of us making the same type of room without breakfast only $65 per night + tax.  These are large suites, they have a bedroom with 2 queen beds and a living area with a pullout couch. They also have coffee in the rooms (which I like).  Very nice breakfast that includes: cold cereals,yogurts, fruit (whole and sliced) freshly made omelets, french toast, bacon, sausage, sweet rolls, bagels, toast, several kinds of juice, coffee, hot chocolate, milk, tea etc... Nice indoor swimming pool the

Stayed here for one night while traveling to Disneyland.  We drove from Florida to the Grand Canyon and on to Disneyland staying mostly in Embassy Suites along the way.  This Embassy Suites is definitely not up to standard.  The room was not clean at all.  There was something sticky on the carpet that my shoes kept sticking to.  Don't even want to think what it might have been.  Bathroom not clean and we killed two spiders in the room.  Front desk staff not very friendly.  Would not stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments and my apologies for the inconsistant cleanliness issues that you experianced during your stay. We certainly understand your disappointment and please know that we are committed in learning from this unfortunate situation, as we continually attempt to improve the service we provide our guest.

Summary: Planned to go at Disneyland and this is the closest hotel we found for it's a late reservation. It's a good place to stay at with kids. Clean room but the noise bothers me at night time for it is so close at the highway. They charge for WiFi. And transportation going to and from Disneyland is $5 per head each way.

Summary Heading: Good family hotel with lovely atrium
Summary: Stayed here two nights with two 11 year old granddaughters, one of whom exclaimed, "this is the most beautiful hotel I've ever been in!" when we entered the atrium.  There is a stream with koi and turtles and greenery all around.  I always ask for a quiet room, so we were on the 6th floor at the edge of the walkway overlooking the atrium.  Our stay was Tues and Wed nights and we found the hotel to be very quiet both nights.  The suite was clean, comfortable, and nicely decorated.  With four of us we really appreciated the three separate sinks; besides the bathroom there was a sink in the bedroom and another sink in the wet bar between the rooms.  The bedroom faced the highway, but we did not hear any highway noise. There is a shuttle to Disneyland which is $5/person and good for

Hotel is a local area specializing in folks going to the S. California theme parks.  Stayed here to take my niece to Disneyland for the weekend.  Couple of problems with this hotel. Upon arrival they were supposed to have a Mickey Mouse surprise and $50 gift certificate for my niece.  They had the surprise, no gift certificate.  Asked if it was in the safe, no.  Asked if someone knew what was going on, no.  Had to make 5 calls to finally be told the hotel did have the gift certificate and it was in the safe.      Friday night was our first night after driving most of day.  Kids were running rampant around the hotel until after 12am.  It's a big courtyard, so loud voice all over the place and doors slamming.  Had to get up several times to tell the kids next door to quiet down,

We checked yesterday, but our room wasn't ready at check in time.  We were in a pinch for time due to a tour we had booked so we told them, they tried to give us a King Room instead.  We have 2 adult kids with us, and need 2 doubles.  They kept trying to push the king no matter how many times we expalined the need for the 2 beds, as booked.  They made us wait another 45 minutes because we would not accept the king, knowing we were about to miss our tour.  Despite our frustrations with the front desk, our room was clean and nice, beds so much more comfy than any of the other ES we've stayed at on this trip yet, and that means more than anything at this point.

We stayed at this hotel for a night during a 3 day stay.  The hotel is not super new but it is still in good shape.  The rooms are really big, clean, and the service was great.  Things you should take advantage of that are included in the price are FREE drinks from 5:30pm to 7:30pm.  Always a plus!  The bartender was awesome and always made sure we had full drinks and bar nuts!  Also, they offer free breakfast from 7am to 10am.  They have a nice pool and is very family friendly.  When we come back we will be staying here again and was much nicer than the other two hotels we stayed at during our trip.  The also offer a shuttle to disneyland that they dont advertise!

First time I have stayed at Embassy Suites. The suite was roomy for all 6 of us. Nice large bathroom. Great breakfast buffet, loved the omelet man. Everyone was very friendly at the hotel. Room was clean, comfy beds, wish they were queen sized instead of doubles though.

This hotel is dated, in a poor state of repair and not very clean.  We are a family of five and always look for suite hotels with a separate living room and sleeper sofa to accommodate us all.  Although architecturally speaking, the open atrium design of this hotel is attractive, if you have to sleep in the living room which shares a wall with the atrium, you may have trouble getting to sleep as sound carries in the large open space.  I could hear people in the courtyard until fairly late in the evening.  There are three washers and dyers for all of the guests to use.  I found myself waiting at the slow elevator to get from floor to floor to find one that was available.  One of the dryers that I found open, failed to dry my clothes at all.  The front desk was very courteous

Summary Heading: nice hotel but next to a car recycler smelter factory
Summary: We stayed ( family of four) one night to go to Disneyland the next day. I love Embassy Suites so I chose this location since it was cheaper than the Anaheim S. Very nice staff, good breakfast, nice room amenities, fitness center, etc but we faced the back of the hotel. Right next door is a car recycler with trucks full of smashed up cars coming in ALL NIGHT long. They work 24 hours  a day so we heard the BEEP BEEP BEEP all night long with occasional car smashing. Either the windows need to be sound proofed or earplugs provided to guests who stay in the back.  I can't believe that factory works all night long but they do. I also can't understand why the CIty of Anaheim would allow for the mixed use of a hotel next to an industrial 24 hour operation. I didn't complain to the front

Summary Heading: Good for Families, So-So for everyone else
Summary: Biggest drawback:ALL ROOMS HAVE BATHROOM ACCESS ONLY THROUGH MASTER BEDROOM.  That means kids trooping through at all hours.  Friendly staff.  Breakfast prep could improve...stems still on grapes, seeds floating in melons.  Omelette chefs very professional and friendly.  Pool area hot, humid and stings nose with chlorine smell.  Water was out in gym room.  Toilet flushed very slowly, after reporting problem to front desk.  Love Embassy...would definitely pass on this site in the future.

We stayed here during Easter and the place was packed. But if you woke up early you had no idea  how many people were around until after you had breakfast. Anyone staying at an embassy knows how it works, so how does it rate compared to all the other embassy suites - a four-. Not the new, but clean , good food, drinks, and nice management. But not like going to a full service hotel, no recognition of member status, no bellboy or help with luggage.  tips- try to get the larger king suite the extra space was helpful One Main problem- the Lion it roared all night- where is the off button, I think if i had stayed there one more night I would have found a way to unplug that thing. It really bothered all of us.

Our family of 6 (including 4 young children) stayed at this particular Embassy Suites for three nights in April for a (non- Disney) family trip. I've stayed at one other Embassy Suites last year, and I remembered their gorgeous atriums and FANTASTIC breakfasts. It wasn't until this trip that I realized that all Embassy Suite hotels follow the same design. If you are traveling with kids, this is the perfect place... tons of "distractions" in the hotel to keep the little one occupied. The indoor pool is beautiful, and my kids got a lot of use out of it. The made-to-order breakfast was always wonderful with tons of selections. Seating is in the beautiful atrium with many tables near the multiple koi ponds. Our kids loved watching the fish and walking around the bridges during

The staff was very attentive and pleasant, Jack at the front desk made you feel welcomed, Anna the shuttle bus driver to Disney Land was great, she was very personable and knowledgeable, great sense of humor - I actually enjoyed the 15 minute ride to Disney when she drove.  We were in Disney Land for my daughters wedding.  When Anna found out the reason why we were there - she had a plate of chocolate dipped strawberries delivered to her room with a hand written card.  Stan was another shuttle bus driver that totally went out of his way for us, the original shuttle broke down prior to us and he was sent to the rescue, he apologized over and over for the inconvenience, during our ride back to the hotel he had overheard my husband and I talking about how we forgot the “car paint”

I was traveling with a coworker and he stated his room was so unclean he requested another upon check in.  Mine looked like housekeeping had been there, but the duvet had lots of hair on it and there was hair in the bathroom. On a positive note, the front desk staff was friendly and when I requested the duvet changed, they did put a clean one on the next day. The breakfast was excellent, as expected from Embassy Suites. I only gave it two stars because when I am in the area again I won't be staying here because of chancing getting a clean room.
Manager Response: Thank you for notify us concerning your recent stay at our Hotel.  Above all, please accept my sincere apologies for the cleanliness issues that you experienced during your recent stay. And please accept our deepest apologies for any inconvenience this may have caused.  Your comments concerning the Front Desk Team are greatly appreciated and will I will pass along your observations to our Team members.

Summary: My family and I have stayed here several times and are always happy to return. Of all the ESs we have stayed, this one has the most friendly and helpful staff. Even the manager was in the breakfast area cleaning tables and making sure everyone had a clean table for their meal.   The rooms at this particular ES are very spacious and the house keeping staff does a wonderful job making up the rooms each day.   Also not far from all the theme parks and restaurants.

We stayed at this hotel for a week for a wedding we attended to and visited Disney as well since we flew from east coast.   Pros: Very spacious rooms, easy access to freeways, near John Wayne Airport and free parking. Courteous staff and were very helpful with all our needs. Good breakfast with lots of food to chose from. Daily manager's happy hour which included alcoholic drinks and snacks.  Cons: The hotel is pretty outdated, and the rooms could have been more clean. The convertible sofa bed was pretty bad. ( we are family of 5 with 3 young kids ) I think sleeping on the floor is a better choice instead of the sofa.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments concerning your recent experience at our Hotel. I believe that once the Hotel receives its much anticipated renovation all noted issues will be addressed.  Again, thank you for taking the time to communicate your experience......

Summary: Property has easy access to freeways, 20 minutes away from John Wayne Airport. Hotel is a little run down, but is very clean and rooms have a lot of space. You can hear freeway noise, a little hard to sleep through.  Complementary happy hour and breakfast was plentiful and good. Hotel does have a very nice sitting area and Koi fish pond to relax at on the first floor.  If you are looking to do some shopping, “The Village at Orange” is a nice mall that has stores like Sears, Old Navy, Ross, Wal-Mart, World Market etc.  It also has some good restaurant options.  It is about 5 minutes away from the hotel.

We appreciated a relaxing hotel on a trip to Disneyland with the kids, that was a comfortable suite big enough for a family of five.  Kids loved the indoor pool, we loved the complimentary happy hour in the atrium.  The atrium area was very pretty, with a pond and foliage and quite large.  The buffet breakfast was generous with eggs, pancakes, omelettes, and fruit.  Our only complaint is that room was in the back of the hotel. over the air conditioner unit, which was loud.  Also, the large recycling center behind the hotel was loud, so ask for a room in the front.
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful comments and will pass it along to our Team.  We are extremely grateful that you enjoyed your stay....

Summary: This Embassy Suites was a good hotel, not great because it's an older one.  We usually stay at an Embassy Suites whenever we travel.  This saves us a lot of money with the free breakfast they provide. We are usually four to six people traveling together. We were there 04/09-04/14 and breakfast was very busy, not enough tables for people to sit.   The only problem I had with this hotel was the elevator.  Embassy Suites elevators are very slow and it didn't help that the elevators that were near our room had a mind of their own.  For some reason one of them (there is 2) loved the 5th floor, it automatically stopped there and took about 1 1/2 minutes for the doors to close and continue.  This was really irritating.  Also one was completely out for a day.   The other was the view.

Every year we stay at this hotel and every year it proves why we come back, the rooms are fantastic, always clean and friendly staff. Both the evening drinks and the breakfast were brilliant. Would definately recomend it to familys.

We have stayed here several times as a family and my husband stays here frequently for business. I will say we stay in a king suite with our 10year old daughter. She stays on the comfortable pull-out in the front room while we are in the bedroom. It works out very nice and everyone has plenty of space. There is a breakfast in the morning which is ok but definitely works for free! The cooked to order omelettes are a great way to go. We always rent a car and take side streets to Disneyland but I understand they have a shuttle that will take you there. All in all the hotel is clean, comfortable and well located for Orange County attractions. They do have an indoor pool too..
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind comments & delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay. We look forward to your return visit to OC & our Hotel.  Best regards,  Michael

Summary: Hello, I just thought I would share my recent experience regarding this hotel so that other travelers are prepared. First of all, I have stayed at this hotel before with my entire family and our pets. Yes, the hotel staff was nice enough to accomodate our needs, and they do allow pets! We stayed for 2 weeks while escrow was closing on our home. We felt completely comfortable, loved the buffet breakfast every morning, and enjoyed our room which was right next door to the (then) manager. He was a world traveler and the nicest man you could meet. We also enjoyed happy hour because they had snacks for the kids and a pool table. The lounge was comforting, relaxing and had plenty of room. All of the guests seem to be enjoying themselves, just like we were. We spent time at the pool
Manager Response: My upmost apologies in not providing you with your guest room preference. Clearly, we could have provided you with the option to relocate to another Hotel. Please know that we are committed in learning from this situation and apologize for any inconvenience.  Thank you for taking the time to notify us.   Michael

Summary: We went there for our Disneyland trip. We booked here because it's not too close to the park, free parking and free breakfast. Overall, the hotel is great. Our room was spotless, lots of space and clean bathroom. Our only complaint is that we booked 3 weeks ahead for double queen suites, but when we got into our room its a king suite. I asked the front desk, she said they dont have any available queen suites rooms left. I was hoping to be more comfortable to have separate bed for my 4 year old son instead of putting him in a pull away bed. I didn't want to make a big deal out of it, but I was a little disappointed. The free breakfast really do saved a lot for our stay there. They have many variety of food, even I found something to eat for my very picky son. The manager's
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind comments concerning your recent stay. We anticipate that during the next renovation we will address the queen bed type issue more readily. Again, thank you for comments and above all we're glad that you and your family had an enjoyable stay.  Best regards,  Michael

Summary: Having stayed at this property a few months prior, I thought I knew what to expect...but what I learned is that it appears that the rooms on the top floor may be better maintained than the lower floors.  Perhaps this was just my experience, but there was a big difference between the condition of the bathroom I had on the top floor, as compared to the room I had on a lower floor.    Pros:  Excellent for families, free hot breakfast, spacious suites, indoor pool and spa, free manager's reception  Cons: Close to freeway, bathroom could use some paint and replacement of rusty vents and sprinkler heads, the fact that there is a per-person charge for the shuttle (free at many other area properties)  In short, this hotel is still a very good value for family travel.  The shuttle cost

Great value and still close to Disneyland.  This is the second time we've stayed here.  Staff is very friendly and helpful.  Food is excellent.  This has the only pull out couch that was comfortalbe to sleep on.
Manager Response: The Team appreciates your positive comments. Above all we're extremely pleased to learn that you enjoyed your stay and look forward to your return in the near future.....   All the best,  The Embassy Suites Team

Summary: We chose this Embassy Suites because the South closer to Disney was booked full.  When we arrived we were told they did not have enough rooms with double beds so we would have to be in a King room and then switch the next day.  For the inconvenience we were offered free shuttle service to Disney and $20 off our bill for each night of our stay.  Our room was never cleaned the entire duration of our stay (3 nights) and I had to remind the front desk each day our shuttle service was comped.  Upon checking out I also had to tell them we were offered the discount on our stay because of the room mess up and finally got that straightened out.  One elevator was broken 3 of the four days we were there, which made wait times long with no stairs in site.  The rooms were just ok as well as
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to respond to your recent experience at the Embassy Suites Anaheim.   Your observations and comments concerning our hotel are greatly appreciated. Above all I sincerely apologize in not meeting your service expectations.   We certainly understand your disappoint and please know that we are committed in learning from this unfortunate situation, as we continual attempt to improve the service we provide our guest.   Once again, please accept our sincere apologies and we hope you will allow us another opportunity during your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: You'd expect so much more from Hilton
Summary: I've stayed at this Embassy Suites several times, mostly because it's selected for me for a business meeting.  I've also stayed at other Embassy Suites, which just seem much nicer.  This location is on something of a frontage road near a busy freeway.  There's nothing much nearby; nowhere to walk to.  The parking lot is always dirty upon approach to the front entrance.  Lots of cigarette butts and plain trash.  It doesn't look well kept at all.  The room was as expected -clean and with lots of room to spread out, but the sofa in the living room had a big dark stain on it and the walls near the bathroom had chipping paint.  This place is in need of an update and regular routine maintenance. I spent time in a lobby level meeting room.  The food was very good.  Unfortunately, the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to respond about your recent experience at the Embassy Suites Anaheim.   Your comments concerning our hotel are greatly appreciated and I sincerely apologize in not meeting your cleanliness and maintenance expectations and for any inconvience this may have caused.   We certainly understand your disappoint and please know that we are committed in learning from this unfortunate situation, as we continual attempt to improve the service we provide our guest.   Once again, please accept our sincere apologies and hope you will allow us the another opportunity during your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Not as good as other Embassy Suites
Summary: We chose this property vs. Embassy Suites Anaheim South because of the free self-parking.  The South charges $8 per day.  The North is farther from Disneyland however and that did make a difference to us.  We have stayed at both in the last year and would definitely choose the South again.  This hotel is right next to the freeway.  The breakfast is not self serve like all other EStes we have stayed at, instead you have to wait in a line to be served the eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, etc.  This is hard on a mom of hungry twin 4 yr olds who want food now!  The manager's reception is ok, but there is limited seating and broken down tables.  The room was perfectly fine and the pool area was clean and neat.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to respond to your recent experience at the Embassy Suites Anaheim.   Your observations and comments concerning our hotel are greatly appreciated and I sincerely apologize in not meeting all your expectations.   We certainly understand your disappoint and please know that we are committed in learning from this unfortunate situation, as we continual attempt to improve the service we provide our guest. To that end, our breakfast is now self serving and operates more efficiantly.  Once again, please accept our sincere apologies and hope you will allow us the another opportunity during your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary: We booked this hotel believing we were actually near Disneyland which was simply not the case. The rather dated facilities and the totally off the beaten track location were two of the early warning signs. This is one of the few times that I felt that the evaluations let me down. True enough, there is a full breakfast served but it is like a free for all jumble that sours the experience. Previously, we stayed at the Doubletree Suites that was within walking distance of Disneyland and a much nicer area of town. Definitely a much better value if you get the breakfast package.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to respond to your recent experience at the Embassy Suites Anaheim.   Your overall comments concerning your experiance is greatly appreciated.   Additionally, we looking forward in receiving a complete renovation in the near future and hope that we can showcase our hotels improvements during your next visit to our Hotel.

Summary Heading: Tired, but fine if the price is right
Summary: I've stayed here 3 or 4 times over the years.  Little has changed either good or bad.  Rooms are quite dated although the carpet looks new the basics are worn and a major remodel is overdue.  Things are clean.  Breakfast is chaos (we are 5 miles from Disneyland).  The typical Embassy model just doesn't work when you add 100 kids who all want to get to the park a the same minute.  A lot of this is overcome with very low rates, you do get a lot of space for little money.  If when booking you don't feel like its a value - look elsewhere.

I had written a review of the ES North in February of 2011 and was pleased enough to return again for 4 days in July of 2011...and then again for 3 nights in December 2011, again nothing but good things to say about this property.  Our first impression was not just that but it set the standard for the Employees of this property.  We visited July 10-15 2011 for a visit to Disneyland and had the Grandparents book there as well. They being somewhat "Hotel-Snobs" were quite impressed and again for the cost and location to Disney, a wonderful experience.  We visited this property 3 times in 2011 and being from Sacramento after a long drive, it's always a pleasure to check in and get settled in before long days at the park. Free parking, excellent staff, great prices, accommodating

This hotel has very good rooms, nice breakfast, helpful staff - everything clean and tidy.  The only drawback to the hotel is it is in the middle of nowhere - no shopping centres, restaurants etc in walking distance.  Also a bit too far from Disneyland.  If you have a rental car it wont be a problem but if you are relying on the shuttle - dont.  On our only early morning entry to Disneyland we booked the shuttle for 6.30am and it never turned up - the driver was still in bed when the hotel called her.  On the plus side the hotel did pay for a taxi to Disneyland so we could get there in time.  Service was very good.  The only other thing I will have to complain about is the airconditioning.  We all melted every night for five nights even though we had it on the lowest setting.

Summary Heading: Great value for money - pay a little get a lot
Summary: The hotel was very cheap and I wasn't expecting much. The hotel however was a great surprise with nice room size and helpful staff.   The only thing I would say is that the hotel is not really a hotel ideal for Disneyland unless you have a vehicle.

I'll start with the one low point: the room we were in was quite a bit dated and the bathroom had that "dank shower curtain smell" the entire week we were there.  Our maid could have paid just a bit more attention to that.  On the flip side, we did spend quite a bit of time at the hotel as our children are too young to be able to spend an entire day at the theme parks.  It was close enough to go back and forth to Disneyland and we took advantage of that.  The indoor heated pool was put to good use!  The made-to-order breakfast bar was great and the cooks/wait/cleanup staff were incredibly friendly and got to know our kids by name.  They made a huge deal of our kids as we had the kids help bus our table.  The staff absolutely gloated and praised our kids for being so helpful.

Summary Heading: Close enough to Disney and free parking
Summary: We stayed only one night for a quick Disney getaway.  Although we didn't spend much time at the hotel, we were favorably impressed.  The rooms seemed a little larger than some Embassy Suites, and we especially liked the extra vanity sink in the bedroom.  Everything looked clean and fresh.  The desk staff was cordial. The breakfast area was arranged well and the food was good.  The heating/cooling system is weird, but weather was moderate for us so it didn't matter.  The value was good compared with other properties in Anaheim.  We had a car and appreciated free parking, but there is a shuttle to Disneyland, and we noticed that it left in time to make the park opening. The hotel is right off the freeway, but was quiet.

We recently stayed at Embassy Inn North and were very satisfied with all aspects.  The staff are very friendly and willing to help in any way possible.  The free breakfast was a bonus as we found the food to be very expensive.  There was a great variety at the breakfast and the staff were very nice.  The pool was great and our children enjoyed it very much.  The room was very spacious and had everything we could have asked for.  The shuttle drivers were very friendly, accomodating and were even willing to take us to the grocery store!  We had no problem paying 20$ for our family to use the hotel shuttle all day to and from disneyland as a cab ride one way was 28$.  As the days were very long at the parks and the crowds were insane I appreciated coming back to this quiet area at

I have to say that overall this was a great place to stay. This was our first time and was a reccomendation by a friend who is an Annual Passholder for DLR. We stayed 5 nights, November 18th to the 23rd.   The cooling/heating system is very weird and we never were able to get the room to cool down (BF is always hot) even though there were directions on the wall explaining how to get the hotel controlled thermostat to be more comfortable in the room. We ended up having the sliding door open most of the night every night (lots of noise from the freeway). The room was very clean.  One disappointment is that in room video game console was not free to use, even though that wasn't mentioned on the booking site we used (entertainment.com/hotels a Hotels.com affiliate) like the wi-fi

I am a long time customer of Embassy suites all over the states. I love them. I have stayed at ES north several times, but on dec 6 I had a bizarre experience. Checked into room, and it was freezing. played with thermostat (which showed 96), but couldn't get the heat going. Had to meet client for dinner, so stopped at lobby on way back. they advised that the maintenance had control of heat and would only turn it on at 10pm and off at 5am. I advised that I would be sleeping between those hours, and really wouldn't NEED heat then, but WOULD need heat when I was in room in the evening prior to 10PM, and when I got up to take shower after 5pm. They could not explain WHY this new procedure was in place.   I said that they owed me the courtesty to advise me of this situation PRIOR to
Manager Response: Thank you for your response. This property, as well as a couple of others in the area, were built on a two pipe system many years ago. This means that we can run on either hot, cold or neutral. Often times during the winter, we delay turning the system on to heat as the hotel heats up rather quickly and then recieve complaints that its too hot. It seems a bit odd I know, but this is a dilemma that we have had since opening the property in the late 80's. This should have been explained to you and my sincere apologies if it wasn't. I am happy to hear that the front desk staff was able to offer you a heater and compensate you for your inconvenience. I hope that you will return to visit us again soon!!!

Summary: Saturday Night, Dec. 10, 2011. I am a HUGE fan of Embassy Suites...just not this one anymore!  I am Hilton Gold and there were no pre-ordered towels and sheets in the room, no bottles of water that are always gratis and the place was overall pretty worn out. Though we were 20 feet from the elevator, heard it go up and down all night, there was a party downstairs (Holiday event?) that kept my kids up, and goooooooooooood luck getting a luggage cart. Breakfast was a disaster: not enough people to serve SO many people. The omelet/pancake staff did indeed work their tails off...fastest worker I have ever seen IMHO.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for recognizing the very diligent efforts of our breakfast staff. Yes, we can get quite busy during breakfast hours which is why we post the "best times to eat" schedule in each sleeping room. There was in fact a Holiday Party that evening and I apologize if it was a bit noisy. Unfortunately in an atrium type hotel, this can be an issue but we do try our best to keep the noise to a minimum especially after 10pm. Hilton Gold members are not typically delived water to their rooms but should be asked upon check in for their preference in amenities. You can choose between points or a bottled water. I have reminded my front desk staff of this and they are aware. I do hope that you will visit us again in the future and appreciate your honest feedback.

Summary Heading: Awesome staff, everything else was mediocre
Summary: Have stayed at Embassy Suites before and am usually quite happy!  Booked this hotel through Priceline where it says, "Near Disneyland" in the title.  This should not be advertised as such.  It's at least a 10 minute shuttle ride from Disneyland, which includes a trip on the highway.  It's located in what appeared to be a dead end road, with only a divey looking sport's bar nearby.  While the staff was unbelievable (polite, courteous, helpful), the room seemed dank.  I couldn't shake the feeling that it was a little dirty.  The second day we were there, we returned around 4:00, only to find that our room hadn't yet been cleaned by housekeeping.  When she finally did arrive/clean (we went down to the pool), it was if nothing had been done.  They only provided one thin/non-warm
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words about our staff as they do take pride in being warm and welcoming to our guests. We are located approximately 6 miles from Disneyland and have a shuttle designated specifically for our Disney guests for a nominal fee of just $5.00/ person for all day use. We are located on a side street adjacent to the 91 fwy which provides easy access to 4 major highways. I am sorry to hear of your dissatisfaction with housekeeping and apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused you. We really do hope that you will visit us again and allow us to be of service to you and your family.

Summary: This hotel was fantastic. We had a 2 room unit and we had a great time. The staff were very friendly/helpful. The free breakfast every day was great - such variety. Then free drinks and nibblies each night for 2 hrs. my daughter had her 8th birthday there and the breakfast staff (thank you Cisco)  gave her a bundle of balloons and huge slice of cake in the morning. When we got back to the room that night, there were even more balloons and cake and candle and card from the staff at the front desk :)   No charges for parking - this was noted as we were charged at The dana. The hotel was gorgeous, the Koi in the big pond and waterfall were a great place for photos. Our shuttle bus drivers - Rey and Stanley were so helpful and friendly - they made our stay :) Definately stay again :)
Manager Response: Happy belated Birthday to your daughter!  I am excited that we made your trip memorable and appreciate your kind recognition of many of our fine team members.  They certainly try to pick up on special occasions and do their part to contribute to the festivities.    You are bringing up a good point for photographers.  Our atrium is definitely a great spot to take all kinds of artistic pictures.    Jürgen Oswald General Manager

Summary: I stayed at the Embassy Suites Hotel Anahiem North on 11/07/11 I must say this was one of the best Embassy's ever.  The service was amazing I was very impressed with the Front Desk Staff at check in.  And every other employee I came in contact with.  The housekeeping staff did a wonderful job with cleaning my room. Breakfast in the morning was great.  I have been at some hotels where they kind of lack on this, but not here the omlett station was clean and the service was fast. I did have a chance to take in a glass of wine at the managers reception and I was very pleased at the service I recieved there also.  I will visit this hotel again in the near future.
Manager Response: Wow, I am deeply humbled by your kind comments.  It is very gratifying that our team made such a favorable impression on you.  They will be very happy to hear how much their efforts are appreciated.    Many thanks for taking the time to share your feed-back and we certainly look forward to welcoming you back soon.    Jürgen Oswald General Manager

Summary: We have tried this hotel and Ayers. This hotel is way better!! Especially with children. My kids loved the fish and water. Breakfast was great. The big open space was perfect for the kids to run around and could still keep an eye on them. Also really liked coming back from disney and ordered some kids meals on the van on way back to hotel, n they are reasonable, so kids could eat n go right to sleep after a long day at the park. The free reception in the evening is great also, you can sit in the atrium n enjoy a free drink n have a nice view and kids can play. The rooms were nice to have seperate spaces for the kids n parents. Plus having a fridge in the room is great for cold drinks to take to park.
Manager Response: Your story really shows and tells a very typical Disney vacation and how our hotel fits in nicely in the overall trip.  Thank you for sharing your experience with your fellow travelers.  It will certainly help them to consider our hotel as their perfect Disney base station.    Hope to see you return soon.    Jürgen Oswald General Manager

Summary Heading: ONE OF THE NICEST HOTELS WE HAVE STAYED IN.
Summary: 4 grandparents, 2 parents and 2 grand children stayed for a week Nov.5-12. The hotel was great. Rooms clean and very large. Every one the hotel staff  was extremely  pleasant and  and would go the little extra and that makes a stay above the ordinary. The hot breakfast and free 2 hour cocktail hr make the hotel and exceptional value.
Manager Response: I am very pleased that you and the extended family had an enjoyable time at our hotel and found the offering of value.  Thank you for recognizing our team as it is our goal to focus on the small things; they most often make the biggest difference.    I also appreciate you posting a picture of our resident koi.  It looks like they were posing for the shot.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary: Had a pleasant stay at this friendly hotel during the month of November 2011. Check in was quick, smooth and easy as was check out. Jack at the front desk was most helpful with assisting us in our sight-seeing. Breakfast was excellent, rooms were clean and comfortable, swimming pool was a hit with the kids. Manager's reception special was a nice treat.
Manager Response: Would love to see an encore.  Thank you kindly for your compliments, especially about Jack at our front desk.  He is definitely an up and coming hotel professional.  Your recap definitely touches on all of our most popular features.    Until next time.    Jürgen Oswald General Manager

Summary: I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.  Nearly everything from the time we checked in, until the moment we departed was great. The one exception was the internet service, which was down during the entire length of our stay.  Though that issue seemed as though it should have been resolved sooner, overall the stay was wonderful.  Jennifer, an employee at the breakfast buffet, was a treasure.  I lost count of how many times she went out of her way to assist guests.  I certainly hope the hotel management knows how lucky they are to have such a dedicated employee. She made a good stay even better!
Manager Response: Believe me, we know that we lucked out with Jennifer.  It was not so much luck though, as her father is also working in our breakfast area.  I always tell him that he did a great job raising her.  I am very excited that you got to meet her and thank you for your recognition in this forum.    My apologies about our Internet service.  We had some "growing pains" during a provider transition, but all the kinks have been ironed out.  I agree with you that it was a frustrating experience for a few days though.    I appreciate your recommendation and look forward to welcoming you back soon.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary: It was great. I was there for 2 nights for a quick disneyland trip with the family. The staff was great, and the rooms were clean and spacious. The complimentary breakfast had a variety of food, and the business service center had everything you could need. There was also the restaurant on site, which we didn't have the opportunity to use, but their menu was vast. Great job!!
Manager Response: Thank you for joining us during your Disneyland trip.  I am pleased that we did our part to make it an awesome experience.  I appreciate the kind compliments and look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Hopefully you will have some time to check out our restaurant then.    Many regards,    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary: The staff at this hotel exceeded our expectations. Everyone at the front desk were extremely helpful and friendly (and we asked a lot of questions). The lobby and interior guest area felt like a park, there was a koi fish and turtle pond that the kids loved. Breakfast was good, lots of hot and cold selections along with an omelet bar where you pick your own ingredients. The pool and hot tub were big and clean. Our room was also very clean.  The person who made our trip exceptional was our shuttle driver, Stan. He was our driver to Disney and also dropped us off locally when we went to pick up our rental car. He was very informative and funny!! We enjoyed our shuttle trips so much when he was our driver. All the drivers were helpful and nice, but Stan really stood out!  The only
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing our hotel in such detail.  I am very fortunate to have my office overlook the atrium.  It is truly a serene setting and I personally love the soothing sounds of our waterfall.  I am very excited that our team made such a great impression on you, especially Stan of course.  He is a gem and we get many kind compliments just like yours about him.    We certainly look forward to welcoming you back whenever your travels take you to our area.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary: Great breakfast. Pool was refreshing. Service was great. All employees were freindly and helpful. Make it your next stay.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your kind compliments about our hotel and team.  We are always happy to read this type of feed-back as it confirms that our efforts are appreciated and recognized.    Until next time.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary Heading: Great, but Not Safe to Leave Things in the Room
Summary: Beautiful hotel, but our ipod was stolen from the nightstand where it was charging, while we were at Disneyland. Excellent staff, service, breakfast, location ... but having something stolen from our room  and knowing the person who burglarized us was in our room while we were away, left us with a horrible, vulnerable, sick feeling inside. DON'T leave anything of value in your room if you're staying at the Embassy Suites Anaheim- North location.
Manager Response: I am very sorry that your otherwise pleasant experience was marred by the missing item.  We are involving our Loss Prevention Department to get to the bottom of the situation and will be in touch with you.    Thank you,    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary: First time staying at an Embassy Suites hotel.  During the check-in, the gentleman at the front desk was more than helpful.  He recommended shopping and dining in the area.  And, provided pre-printed directions to various destinations in the area.   The room itself was just "okay".  There was no safe in the room.  The room seemed to have a dank smell.  And, the exhaust in the bathroom was way too loud.   Considering breakfast was free, it was doable.  A lot of variety (hot and cold choices).
Manager Response: We are very proud to have introduced you to Embassy Suites.  Believe me, there is no going back once you get that taste of the "suite" life.   Thank you for recognizing our front desk agent that was very helpful to you and for pointing out the great variety of our complimentary cooked-to-order breakfast.  Our breakfast is certainly a signature item next to our large suites and complimentary Manager's Reception.      Although we don't have safes in our suites, we provide them on a complimentary basis at the front desk.  My apologies about some deficiencies in your suite.  Please e-mail me the suite number you stayed in so we can take corrective action.  My e-mail address is juergen.oswald@hilton.com.    Many thanks for staying with us.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary: This hotel would have gotten a higher score from me, except there were a few things I didn't like about it.  First off we were going to California for Disneyland and this hotel had no Disney channel, which really bummed us out.  Next the scrambled eggs from their free breakfast were runny and the last thing i didn't like about it was the shuttle.  I have the biggest complaint about that.  First, You can't pre-pay for the service, second it's expensive at $5 for everyone including children, were most other hotels have $5 for adults and $1 for kids.  (That's if it's not already included in the price of your hotel stay).  Next we had to call every time we wanted to come and go to Disneyland and make a reservation, which was annoying and once we even got told we would get picked up
Manager Response: Thank you for titeling your review "Awesome Experience" even though we have some opportunities for improvement.  It's great to see though that you were able to weigh the items you liked and the ones you did not like and still be excited about your stay.  I am proud that our team made some good gestures when we had a shuttle mix-up; this is what we expect when things don't go just quite right.    One slight correction to your review is that our pool is heated to 84 degrees.  This may be a little cool for some people, but if you like to swim laps, anything warmer would be too hot.  That's why our hot tub is always available for guests that enjoy the water a little warmer.    Thanks again for the many positive remarks and until we meet again.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary Heading: Standard Embassy Suites....with a few quirks..
Summary: Stayed for 4 nightes..This Embassy is nice.. standard for this chain.  Rooms and grounds are clean.  Front desk and breakfast personnel very friendly and helpful.   My stay here was generally a good experience.  The location is nicely centralized to all the places we visited.   However, there here were 3 things that we found as "cons"... 1) highway noise can be heard from our room, 2) there was no safe in room and 3) the light switch in bathroom also turns on the exhaust fan - which sounded like an airplane engine.  We didn't use the pool b/c it was crowded during our stay but we did overhear a parent say the chlorine level was irritating her son's eyes (maybe b/c it's an indoor pool w/o sufficient ventilation?).   I would recommend requesting for a higher floor away from the
Manager Response: Thank you very much for recognizing our teams at the front desk and breakfast.  They certainly have the most guest contact out of all departments and I am very proud that they provided noteworthy service to you.    Our maintenance team checks the pool chlorine levels and other water measurements twice every day and makes necessary adjustments.  The pool area is also properly ventilated.  Nevertheless, it is certainly possible that chlorine may irritate eyes which is not unusual especially if you are not used to it or are in the water for a long period.    If you happen to read this response, please send me an e-mail at juergen.oswald@hilton.com with the suite number you stayed in as we definitely would like to check out the bathroom fan.    Many thanks for your other recommendations and we are looking forward to welcoming you back soon.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary: This a great place to stay, fantastic service and the food was fabulous. I am returning to Anahiem again and already booked my stay at the Embassy Suites; its out of the way as to where I am conducting business; but because of the service they provided I wouldn't stay anywhere else.  Thank you Embassy and see you soon.
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind compliments.  It makes me very proud that you already made another reservation even though we are a little further from your place of business.    We will continue to strive for excellent service and can't wait to see you again.    Jürgen Oswald General Manager

Summary: I love the Embassy Suites chain, (I'm not that enamored of the Hilton Loyalty Program, but that's another review!)  and this one ranks as one of the best.  This is an older Embassy Suites, but it is impeccably kept; the rooms are clean and updated, nothing worn down.  The decorating in the enclosed courtyard area is beautiful and also perfectly clean and nothing looks old or worn.  In addition, there are koi swimming in the fountains that are the size of redfish.  Truly amazing in a hotel courtyard!  The staff were, without exception, friendly and helpful and went the extra mile to ensure that my stay went well.    The breakfast area is huge and has all the traditional favorite of an Embassy Suites; the omelet makers are, to a one, friendly.  The bar area for the manager's
Manager Response: Thank you kindly for sharing your positive observations.  Our team will be very happy to hear that they made such a great impression.  Your level of detail is certainly very descriptive and helpful to travelers that have not stayed with us before.    Best wishes and looking forward to welcoming you back soon.    Jürgen Oswald General Manager

Summary: I would recommend this hotel for either business travelers or families. I was here on business and saw quite a few families here for their Disney vacations. Like many of the other reviews, I concur with the hotel staff being very good, courteous and professional. Of note is a young man by the name of Tony. He was able to handle my transportation issues without a problem.  The hotel offers a shuttle to and from the parks and convention center, and it seems they are willing to take you wherever you need/want to go wtihin reason. The breakfast is good, as good as it gets, and of course the Manager's reception is always nice. Our room was comfortable and typical of an Embassy Suites room.  I would come back to this hotel again, and I think mostly because of how well I was treated by
Manager Response: Thank you very much for this nice testament of our team, especially Tony.  As you mentioned, we offer all the great features of an Embassy Suites, but the icing on the cake is certainly our staff.    I can't wait to share this wonderful review with all of them.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary: My family and I always stay at this Embassy. It frustrates me when I read some of these reviews because to me, they aren't warranted. People must remember this isn't a brand new hotel. Yes it has some things that need work, but overall this is a great hotel. The staff is AMAZINGLY great!! I was in the Disneyland 5k and asked them if they had a shuttle that would take me there, I had to be there by 6am, the staff went out of their way and ordered me a cab that they paid for. The morning staff is excellent also. One morning I went up to get some breakfast, the chef seemed a little tired of the demanding guests, so when he greeted me he just said a quick, how do ya do, so I said I was great and asked him how he was, well that put a smile on his face and he said he was good and let
Manager Response: Thank you very much for the many great examples of service you received.  I am very excited that you had these experiences across the board from various departments.  This is excellent prove that our focus in this area is paying off.    We are also diligently working on making some of the improvements you are pointing out.  I appreciate you keeping us on our toes.    Looking forward to welcoming you back soon.  Can't thank you enough for your longstanding loyalty.    Jürgen Oswald General Manager

Summary Heading: Warm, friendly staff, average facility too near the freeway
Summary: First, let me say there is nothing glaringly wrong with this property. The rooms are typical Embassy Suite decor, the staff is friendly and helpful and the lobby nicely appointed with waterfalls, winding paths and ponds. The management reception is always nice as well. However, if you are unfortunate to get a room facing the 91 freeway - you had better like the sound of traffic. The windows do not block out enough sound and the HVAC units fans do nothing to drown it out. All in all, it was OK, but I would have opted for a hotel in a more rural setting.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for reviewing our hotel.  I especially appreciate the nice recognition of our team.  They really aim to make a difference in our guest's stays.    I recommend that light sleepers or people that live in rural environments always contact any hotel ahead of time to request a quiet room location.  This way you are setting your trip up for success and give the hotel the opportunity to fulfill special requests.      Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary Heading: Good bargain and a nice place to stay
Summary: We visited with our young son on a trip to -- no surprise -- Disneyland and came away impressed with the rooms, facility and service. The breakfast is a very nice spread. Getting to and from Disneyland on the shuttle wasn't a problem at all. It's fun watching business travelers sharing elevators with kids and adults wearing mouse ears and buzzing from too much sugar and stimulation. We were very glad to find this hotel and recommend it to other families. Proximity to downtown Fullerton and its great restaurants is a plus. Just don't order mixed drinks from the bar. Worst margarita of my life.
Manager Response: I am pleased that we impressed you.  Thank you for the kind feed-back and appreciate the recommendation.     You are absolutely correct about Downtown Fullerton.  It gives you a great visual of California from days past.    My apologies about the Margaritas.  Thank you for letting us know so that we can follow-up.    Jürgen Oswald General Manager

Summary Heading: nice and comfortable, but a little far away from Disney
Summary: The staff was very helpful and friendly. It is nice to have some extra room when travelling with kids. Cooked to order breakfast in the mornig was very busy with long lines. The hotel is not really in Anaheim, but they have a shuttle that runs during the opening hours of Disney for $ 5.00 per person per day. The price of the hotel is very reasonable for what you get.
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing our hotel.  Our team is always happy to hear when their efforts are recognized.    We are sometimes victim of our own success, therefore breakfast can be busy, especially on weekends towards the end of the serving time.  Guests that come prior to 8:30am usually have a very leisurely experience though.  Our hotel is actually in Anaheim, we are just not in the immediate Disney resort district.  We are certified as a Disneyland Good Neighbor hotel and therefore are offering Disney tickets for sale and provide shuttle service to the park.      Juergen Oswald  General Manager

Summary: My family, consisting of two adults, two children and two dogs, really appreciate the Embassy Suite's room layout.  There is room for everyone, and multiple televisions for adults and kids.    The service at the Anaheim North Embassy Suites was very good.  We called ahead to see if early check-in was available (at 9:30am) and were pleasantly surprised to be told we could go ahead and check in.  The dinner at the hotel restaurant was good, service was decent.  Also, food was not outrageously priced as in most hotel restaurants.  Breakfast, as with almost all Embassy Suites was good, but somewhat busy.  The only complaint I would have is that the back of the hotel backs up to a LARGE metal recycler, which can be fairly busy and loud.  Luckily they do not appear to work late hours.
Manager Response: I am glad that our hotel is able to accommodate your extended family and appreciate the detailed review of your experience.    Until next time.    Jürgen Oswald General Manager

Summary: The pool is clean, the staff is friendly, the rooms are clean and the food is good
Manager Response: Thank you very much for giving us 5 stars across the board.  We are very humbled and appreciate your kind consideration.    Looking forward to seeing you again very soon.    Jürgen Oswald General Manager

Summary: This hotel had everything that you would expect from Embassy.  The bathroom is located in the privsate bedroom, making it a bit less private... some signs of age is starting to show.  Ask for a room opposite the 91 for a quieter side of the hotel.  The breakfast was good.  125 is what we paid Aug 2011
Manager Response: Thank you very much for reviewing our hotel.  This means a lot coming from an Embassy Suites expert like yourself.    We appreciate your loyalty and look forward to welcoming you back wherever we have one of our hotels.    Jürgen Oswald General Manager

Summary: after staying in a few Best Westerns, we stayed at Embassy.  Our kids loved it and said "thanks!"  I asked them why and it seemed that they liked the large rooms and 2 tv's.  Then we took them to "happy hour" and they were hooked.  Happy hour had free drinks for kids (and adult drinks), light snacks, and pop corn.  The morning breakfast is just over the top.  No disrespect to best westerns which are generally a little cheaper.  I told my wife that now that the 4 of us are traveling together, we should first look for an Embassy Suite.
Manager Response: Yes, that's our strategy.  Hook 'em while they are young!    Many thanks for sharing your experience and pointing out our key value differentiators; extra space and lots of complimentary things.    Until the next time.    Jürgen Oswald General Manager

Summary: My family of 3 stayed at Embassy Suites Anaheim North for 3 nights after enjoying our stay at another Embassy Suites in LA.  We booked our reservation on-line a few days in advance of our stay.  Check in was very quick and easy.  Our room was huge and very comfortable, 2 queen beds.  The cook to order breakfast and managers special in the evenings are amazing value.  So good.  The pool and spa (are both nice) but are indoors - which is a bit odd, such a same to not be able to enjoy the beautiful California sunshine.   Our over all stay was fab!
Manager Response: Thank you for keeping your hotel stays in the Embassy Suites family while in the L.A. area.  I hope that we will be able to export our great product to the U.K. soon.  Until then, please continue to be our ambassador.    Even though our pool is indoors we do have a sun deck to enjoy the nice California weather.    Cheers,     Jürgen Oswald General Manager

Summary: Manager's reception and cooked to order breakfast, what more could you ask for. Very nice, roomy rooms and a great staff. We frequent this hotel and are always happy that we did.
Manager Response: Thank you for referring to our main competetive differences; a spacious suite, complimentary cooked-to-order breakfast, Manager's Reception, and a friendly staff.  And you get all this for the price of a regular hotel.  This is why we are known for our fantastic value.    Looking forward to welcoming you back soon.    Jürgen Oswald General Manager

Summary: The hotel was great. Clean and good size rooms. The location is far from Disney but they do have a shuttle. The downside about the shuttle is that u have to make reservations for each trip back and forth. Good continental breakfast and good free happy hour   Overall its.a.good hotel and.very quite even though its right off the freeway. I would stay there again.
Manager Response: Your testimonial and intent to stay with us again says it all.  I am glad we impressed you and thank you for sharing your experience with your fellow travelers.    One clarification that makes a big difference to our guests. We do not have a continental breakfast, but rather a full cooked-to-order breakfast. Whereas hotels with continental breakfasts don't serve warm dishes, we offer omelets, scrambled eggs, pancakes, sausage, bacon, and a multitude of other items.    See you soon.    Jürgen Oswald General Manager

Summary Heading: We absolutely love this hotel and staff!!"
Summary: We stay at the Enbassy Suites at least twice each year while on vacation to Disneyland (we are annual passport holders living in Northern California).  The hotel is always immaculate, the staff goes overboard to make you feel welcome, and the entire experience is a wonderful part of our vacation.  Not only is the hotel very affordable, but the free breakfast is a very nice touch.  They have a granola cereal that is fantastic and very low points on weight watchers!  They also have a managers reception each evening that provides a nice break from Disneyland. This hotel is not just your average Embassy Suites (which is indeed a terrific hotel), and that is due to the employees!  They go out of their way to provide great service!  They seem almost invisible until you need them, then
Manager Response: Wow, what a great testimonial to our hardworking people.  Thank you so much for recognizing their efforts.  This is particularly impressive as you are such a frequent guest with us.    Seeing regulars like yourself is the fun in our job and we look forward to welcoming you back soon.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary: Unfortunately, our stay here was not a good one. We ended up checking out and staying at a different hotel.  1) The main problem was that the room that we were given smelled musty and reaked of smoke. I called the front desk and was told  the hotel was booked and if I could just wait it out until the morning I would be accomodated. My daughter has asthma and I'm not sure if the hotel staff is aware -that a smoke smelling room with a child with asthma can cause major problems.  2) The room we were given was at the back of the hotel near the elevators which was kind of annoyting because - I called prior to my arrival I specifically asked for a room near the river side away from the elevators.  Needless to say I was unpleasantly surprised...Embassy Suites has always been our #1
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience thru our internal feed-back channel as well.  I know that our Front Office Manager Malia talked to you already and I am glad that she was able to assist.    We are looking forward to welcoming you back soon to restore your faith in our hotel.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary: We checked in the hotel after a long day of car trouble.  We were happy to finally get there.  Room was clean and ready for us!  My son took a shower and the drain did not go down well.  Since it was already 11 pm, we thought we'd just call maintenance when we got up and the water would be drained by then.  Unfortunatley, when we got up in the morning, there still was about 5 inches of dirty water in the tub.  I had to call to have it unclogged.  Tony came up right away.  What a great guy!!  I just had to ask myself, didn't the cleaning crew notice this when they cleaned the tub (or did they just no clean it????).  The drains in all the sinks seems to take a long time to drain. The shuttle is the way to go to Disneyland!  The cost was $5 per person, but well worth it.  Come and
Manager Response: I appreciate your detailed feed-back.  Even though not everyhing worked out 100%, I am glad that several people on our team made a real difference for you.  They will be very excited to being recognized in this fashion.    Thank you in advance for giving us another opportunity in the future.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary: We recently visited the Anaheim area for family business and selected this hotel because of it's central location for our needs, the distance from Disneyland (not too close) and the positive reviews here on Trip Advisor.  Unfortunately, I didn't read past the first few pages and didn't see the negative reviews; a mistake I won't make again.  Upon arrival at the Orange County airport I called to see if there was a possibility of checking in early and was told to call back at 1:30.  We decided to have lunch at the hotel and check with the front desk afterwards.  The restaurant seemed to be open, but was completely empty.  We seated ourselves (per the sign), and sat for several minutes without seeing anyone who appeared to be an employee.  Finally I got up and found someone
Manager Response: I am very embarrassed by your experience and thankful at the same time.  It reminds us that we can never relax.    Please call me at -------------- so I can personally apologize.    Thank you.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary: The hotel staff, especially the manager, were very friendly and catered to my needs when I wanted to check in early after a long cruise. Although the room was not ready when I wanted to check in, (11:00 am), every effort was made to meet my request and to make me feel comfortable and happy.
Manager Response: I am glad that we were able to pleasantly surprise a local.  It certainly makes it fun to discover new things in familiar surroundings.    You are absolutely correct that we have a subtle New Orleans decor.  My favorites are the jazz murals in our bar.    Thank you for staying with us.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary Heading: Great hotel but nothing within walking distance
Summary: Hotel includes a great breakfast and free managers reception from 5pm to 7pm including free drinks and nachos. Rooms are all on 4 sides with a covered atrium. Very atractive. The Santa Anna river is to the south and offers great walks, jogging, cycling or equestian rides if you happen to bring a horse with you. The building is surrounded by the River, freeway and a metal recycling plant so it can be noisy if you face the recycling plant.  Rooms are a suite with 2 rooms and 2 TV's.  There is an indoor pool, exercise room and sun patio. A great stay for visiting local attractions.

I consider myself a local, being only an hour and a half away from Disneyland, but I was surprised at the location of the hotel.  It was nestled among the freeways, with no Disneyland in sight.  Turns out they have a great shuttle, and it's the Embassy Suite style all the way, with the great breakfasts and spacious suites. The decor is even early New Orleans Square. Still, I wish I'd had a better map...there are so many alternatives closer to the resort.

Summary Heading: Excellent service and wonderful streem that runs through the lobby
Summary: The service and the rooms are great.  I loved the location because it was so close to Diseyland. There is breakfast in the morning with a stream that runs through the lobby and around the seating area, with Koi fish and a turtle or two.The rooms are large and comfortable and the prices are excellent.
Manager Response: Thank you kindly for taking the time to review our hotel.  I am very excited that the relaxing atmosphere, service, and fantastic value added to a nice trip.  Embassy Suites is known to give MORE, especially MORE space in our suites compared to a regular hotel room.    Until the next time.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary: My family were caught off guard with the "out of the way" location (we were dropped of at ES South and had to catch a taxi to ES North due to location not being on Grayline's route!).  However, the manager was very accomodating as were the staff (though we did encounter a newby desk clerk who was in training).  Given those false starts, we had a great time and I am looking to return Sept 1 (hint-hint) with my entire gang.    As the manager says, "choice is a good thing".  I agree.  I was a good choice staying at ES North.  Check it out!  D Slade
Manager Response: I am glad that your false starts had a happy ending.  I appreciate your patience with our newby at the front desk.  She is learning fast and is super friendly most importantly.    Looking forward to welcoming your gang back in September and would be great meeting you in person.  Thank you for reading my posts and your encouragement to "check us out".    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary: This place is away from the tourist area of Disneyland, but they have their own shuttle. Buy your Disney tickets at the hotel and the shuttle is included.  Some rooms have freeway noise. Our room needed some updating and a new mattress, but it was 'OK'. The lobby and atrium area were very nice.  Every employee we contacted was helpful, polite and informative. The included breakfast and nightly manager's reception are great benefits. Free parking too.
Manager Response: Dear 1947-Ford:    I hope you will read this reply.  Thank you for staying with us and for your feed-back.  In case you did not report some of the challenges in your suite, please send me an e-mail with the suite number to juergen.oswald@hilton.com or call me at 714-618-9007.    I am very excited to hear that our team made such a good impression on you.  They are certainly eager to please.    Juergen Oswald General Manager
