Summary: Stayed over July 4th weekend with wife and daughter's family in Embassy Suite near Disneyland.  From the start it was a nightmare.  We had multiple problems with access to room.  Took over an hour to get help.  Front desk is a joke, they do not listen.  The breakfast was the worst I have seen in an Embassy Suites.  Later in our trip we stayed in Embassy Suites - La Jolla near San Diego and the experience was 1000% better, professionals in every way.  For the price we paid at Disneyland Embassy Suite we would have been better to stay at a Hampton. Please avoid the Disneyland Embasy Suites

Summary Heading: We will definately be staying here again!
Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights and we very satisfied.  At first I was kind of worried with it being 4.8 miles away from Disneyland but all the extra's, friendly service and awesome breakfast it was all worth it! The employees were top notch!
Manager Response: Now that's a promise I like to hear.  Thank you for the confidence in delivering a quality experience and your kind compliments.    I appreciate you posting the pictures about our vast atrium.  I can see quite a few of our guests socializing during our complimentary Manager's Reception.  It's always a party at the Embassy Suites from 5:30pm-7:30pm daily.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary Heading: Great breakfast but hotel is far from Disney!
Summary: We stayed here in April for Spring Break to go to Disneyland. Reserved for 3 nights but ended up checking out after the first night to move to a hotel closer to Disneyland. The hotel is ok, but there are better options closer to Disney.   PROS:  * Great breakfast * Room is clean and spacious * Beds are comfortable  CONS:  * Far from Disneyland (about 10-15 min. drive) * No good restaurants around * Hotel is a bit dated * Shuttle service to Disney is extra
Manager Response: Thank you for accurately pointing out our distance from Disneyland which some guests prefer and see as an advantage, whereas others like to be in the very busy, immediate resort area.  Choice is a great thing.    No hotel beats our spacious suites and bountiful complimentary cooked-to-order breakfast.  Embassy Suites just won the J.D. Power Award for a record 9th time for best upper-upscale hotel chain and beating out strong competitors like Marriott, Omni, Hilton, Doubletree, Sheraton, etc.    Downtown Orange is only 4 miles from the hotel and very easy to get to; you make one left turn as you exit the parking lot.  It is a picturesque and scenic California Downtown with quite a few nice restaurants to choose from (Italian, Mexican, Brewery).  Without a doubt do we have good restaurants in the vicinity of the hotel.  Of course, there is always Room Service; can't get any more convenient than that.      Our classic, New Orleans influenced design may seem "dated" to some, especially if you like modern design with lots of chrome and minimalistic features.  Our lush, tropical atrium with koi ponds and resident turtles is a big hit to many.  It is correct that our Disneyland shuttle is extra, but so is the transportation service within the actual Disneyland Resort District (if you book a Disney Package through our website though, the shuttle service is included).    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights at the end of June to visit Knotts Berry Farm. I know that Embassy is always a great stay and that you get more bang for your buck with the complimentary manager's reception and hot breakfast. Breakfast was great and there was a lot to offer. I would say the cocktail hour and breakfast pays for itself.   The hotel is only a short commute to Disneyland and Knotts. In fact, I like that it's a bit farther and not in the hustle and bustle of either park.  The only thing I find odd is that the pool is indoor. An indoor pool in sunny south CA, I find that extremely odd.   Other then that, we had a great stay and nothing to complain about. Rooms were clean, staff was great!
Manager Response: I appreciate the very good insight.  It is truly amazing how much you can save by partaking in our complimenary breakfast and evening Manager's Reception.  We also hear it frequently that people like to be a little away from the immediate congestion of Disneyland; it makes the experience more relaxing.   It is interesting that our indoor pool is actually a positive differentiator.  Even though we are in sunny SoCal, there are surprisingly enough days (and particularly mornings and evenings) where an indoor pool is a better choice.  We still have a sun deck right outside the pool area where you can absorb some rays though.      Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary Heading: Great hotel. Will definitely be back.
Summary: We stayed for 7 days. We are a family of 5, finding a reasonably priced place for all of us with plenty of room is difficult, but we did here! The service was great, clean rooms, friendly staff. The made to order breakfast was great and so convenient. The managers reception was nice as well. A good place to relax and have a drink after spending the day at the parks. You could sit have a drink and watch some games or talk with some of your fellow hotel neighbors.
Manager Response: I love your header, "will definitely be back".  Can't ask for any more.    I am pleased that we provided you with a pleasant experience and that you enjoyed yourselves.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary Heading: Great experience, Great sevice, We loved it and we'll be back
Summary: We stayed for 1 week loved it, great suites, clean and service was awesome, very friendly and courteous, can't wait to come back.
Manager Response: I am very proud that we contributed to a nice vacation.  Having you stay with us for an entire week is certainly a pleasure.    Looking forward until the next time.  Thank you for your patronage.      Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary Heading: Great place for business traveler - bar open late with meals, big value in happy hour and big breakfast included.
Summary: As a business traveler I often work late - found that other hotels in the area close their bars/restaurants at 9 or earlier.  Most nights the Anaheim Embassy Suites North bar is open until 11, to include a good food selection that is well-prepared, and their bar staff is attentive to your needs.  Over the last two years I have had the opportunity to stay at most nearby hotels and have picked the Embassy Suites North as my seleciton of choice.
Manager Response: You are absolutely correct.  Our bar is open every day until 11pm with the exception of Sundays and Holidays when we are open till 10pm (room service has the same hours in case your clothes of choice are PJ's).  Besides our bar menu, we also have the full restaurant menu available.  It's all about MORE choice at Embassy Suites.    I am glad you found a home away from home during your business trips and are very honored to provide some solitude and comfort.  Good tip about the suite location too.  This is what sharing your experiences in a forum like this is all about.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary: Rooms were spacious, staff was extremely friendly, and breakfast was delicious!
Manager Response: I call this a trifecta.  Thank you very much.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary Heading: We are return visitors and will be back yet again!
Summary: Very friendly staff, shuttle service to Disneyland is very helpful and drivers are great. Full complimentary breakfast is wonderful. Room service was great and the staff were very friendly and interested in my children and our experiences at Disneyland.
Manager Response: It is always great to read when our team is the star in a review.  Thank you for taking the time recognizing them.    It sounds like the entire family had a magical time at Disneyland and we certainly look forward to welcoming you back soon.  We appreciate your loyalty.      Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary Heading: our great stay a embassy suiets in Anaheim CA
Summary: Great warm welcoming.  Staff always smile make you feel at home. Eager to assist or help with anything. Thank you.
Manager Response: Thank you for recognizing our biggest asset; our team.  They are eager to please and work hard.  Sure, our hotel is nice, offers many features, lots of value, but at the end of the day, it's our team members that give it personality and soul.    I always like to hear how our team has made a difference in a guest's stay.  It's the simple things that matter most; a genuine smile, a helping hand, a personal suggestion.      Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary Heading: We love this hotel and stay only here every time we are in Anahiem
Summary: This is the best hotel for it's price. We have stayed here at least 6 times. The staff is friendly, the hotel is clean and the food is great. The rooms are a great  when you have a big family like me.  It is conviently located to Disneyland. Everytime we stay here we have at least 15 people togther.
Manager Response: Thank you for pointing out the things that matter most when staying in a hotel.  Research has shown again and again that cleanliness, value, and service are the top reasons why people choose to stay in a hotel and return.  You are case in point, having stayed with us at least 6 times.    We are looking forward to making this an even dozen soon and very much appreciate your family's loyalty.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary: My family and I recently spent almost a week at the Embassy Suites Hotel in North Anaheim.  I was very impressed with the staff.  It is apparant to me that the management has a good relationship with the employees because at each level, I noticed smiles and a desire to help customers.  I was impressed with Anna at the front desk when she went out of her way to help me with some phone challenges and with helping our family decide on where to go while visiting Los Angeles.  During the awesome breakfast buffet, I was asked by Bonnie if everything was to my satisfaction and she, although management (I assume) was out there amongst the people and helping out.  Anyhow, I like what I see and I will be back.  Keep up the superior work and thanks for a great place to stay while away from
Manager Response: I like what I read! I am very appreciative of you pointing out two of our superstars, Anna and Bonnie.  Anna is a member of our shuttle driver squad, and as you can see, she is not shy about being at the front desk too. Bonnie is in fact a manager, Human Resources that is, and you probably noticed her during one of her Breakfast Ambassador shifts. All of our managers rotate in spending time during our Breakfast and Manager's Reception hours as well as during certain hours in the lobby. It is just part of our "Make a Difference" culture as we all strive to make a difference in the lives of our guests, team members, and communities.    Thank you for spending nearly a week with us and we can't wait to welcome you back soon.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary Heading: We had a great stay and would highly recommend
Summary: We just returned from a one night stay at this hotel.  We arrived at 8:30pm from a long day at Knotts Berry Farm.  We were all hungry ( 3 families) so we decided to eat at the hotel.  The restaurant had great food and service.  We than went to the bar and enjoyed a couple of cocktails.  The room was perfect -everything that we needed.  We had two double beds but the kids decided to sleep on the sofa bed so they could have their own room.  The room was spacious and clean.  The next morning we had breakfast at 8:30am.  We all enjoyed our meal and being free was the best part.  The staff was very friendly during our stay.  We will return to this hotel on our next trip to Disney.  We like to arrive a day early for Disney and stay off property the first night until we go to the Grand
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience.  I have heard your approach to a Disney trip a few times now.  Stay with us first and then spend a day at one of the pricier Disney resorts.  Your dollar definitely goes much further at our hotel, as you pointed out, by enjoying our complimentary full cooked-to-order breakfast and a cocktail or two at our Manager's Reception.    While we do have a nominal charge for Internet access there are a couple of options to avoid it. Our Hilton HHonors Gold and Diamond members receive complimentary Internet access as part of their membership benefits.  If you are not a Hilton HHonors member yet, please go to HiltonHHonors dot com, sign up (it's free!), start consolidating your travel at Hilton Family branded hotels, and you will be an elite member in no time. The 2nd option applies to all of our guests as we offer complimentary Business Center services including free Internet access in our Lobby Business Center 24 hours a day.    We are looking forward to welcoming you back soon.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary: The staff was wonderful, and the room spacious. Pool area Is great after a long day at Disneyland. I will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: I appreciate you pointing out some of the core benefits of Embassy Suites:  Value, Space, Service.    I just returned from a trip myself and "had" to stay at a non-Embassy Suites hotel.  My wife complained the whole time, ha-ha.  Once you are hooked on Embassy Suites you can't go back.    Looking forward to welcoming you back.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary Heading: Love embassy suites and will be coming back to this loaction!!!!
Summary: we are a family of 5 , this was by far one of the greatest trips I and my family have taken. we decided to go to disneyland for my daughters birthday. I was a bit ansy about staying  here because of all the reviews i had read, but i went and took a chance i mean how bad could it be right. we got to the hotel a bit early. I asked if we could do an early check in and the young lady at the  front desk was very friendly and helpful, and got us to our room quick and easy. the free breakfast was delicious i love how its cooked to order.  the breakfast staff was very friendly my family and i enjoyed the managers reception it was great. I called down to the front desk to ask if there was anything to do besides disneyland  and the gentleman that answered (tony) was very friendly and
Manager Response: It is so great to hear that we contributed to one of your best trips ever.  Happy belated Birthday to your daughter and we are very humbled for being part of her memories for many years to come.    Thank you for recognizing Tony and our front desk team in general.  They are very eager to please and I am glad that he gave you a few nice pointers.    We also can't wait to welcome you back.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary Heading: Excellent value for money. Free fully cooked breakfast. Clean and spacious.
Summary: We are a family of 4 – with 2 teenage children - who spent 10 nights at this hotel. We flew 14 hours from Sydney Australia and it was great to see that the hotel we took a chance on over the internet was better than expected!  We thoroughly enjoyed the free breakfast each morning with so many options such as cereal, fruit, pancakes, eggs cooked to order, French toast, pastries etc. Cisco, one of the employees, was there to greet and serve us each morning which was wonderful. His enthusiasm and passion for his work is certainly an asset to the hotel. It was lovely to chat to many of the staff especially Neville (the front desk manager) and Azza (the sales manager) and even the General Manager who all had time to devote to guests.  The rooms were clean and spacious. The children
Manager Response: Thank you very kindly for your extensive review of your experience and all the features we are offering.  I particularly appreciate the nice recognition of our great team members you interacted with.    I remember talking to you at breakfast one morning and I am very glad you enjoyed your adventure in our area.  Until next time!    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary: My husband travels with Southwest for a living. He stays all over and we stay at many different hotel chains. We know travelling with kids u need a suite. We loved the spacious lobby and pond area. Nothing better with kids, they had plenty of room to explore, look at fish and turtles while we had a free happy hour drink.  The eggs and waffles in morning before heading to Disney were great for the kids, n room service had some good priced kids items when we made it to the room at night. You can't beat open beautiful space, some hotels have very small lobby and lounge areas, and you have to spend most of the time in your room. We had a great experience and getting ready to book another trip here soon.
Manager Response: I can't thank you enough for sharing your experience.  You are mentioning an important facet of our hotel - space.  You are so right about the open feel either in our soaring atrium or in our spacious suites.  You definitely don't feel boxed in.    I am glad you are planning your next trip already and we are certainly looking forward to welcoming you back soon.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary Heading: Great for the price, 5 adults, 2 teens and 1 youngster...
Summary: Eight family members decided to take a last-minute trip to Disneyland for the kids' Spring Break. We looked for close hotels and saw that they were pretty much all booked. This hotel came up on a search and it stated that it’s about 4.5 miles away. It is—however, these are freeway miles and the freeways were packed the entire trip, so a shuttle ride to the park takes about 25 minutes. As I read the amenities, I thought it might be too good to be true...but they definitely delivered.   I am very particular about where I stay. Although my hubby would stay at a Motel 6, I usually win and we stay at the California resort, so know that I when I say this was a great deal for the price, the staff was SUPER nice and accommodating and the beds were comfortable--I mean it.   Our
Manager Response: I am glad that you were really able to take advantage of our many value added amenities that you either don't receive at other hotels or add out of pocket expense to it; why spend extra elsewhere when you can get it for free with us?  I particularly appreciate you recognizing our driver Stan.  He is a true superstar and a great ambassador of our hotel.    My apologies about the delay at check-out, but I am glad it all worked out.  We are looking forward to welcoming you back soon.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary Heading: Clean, free breakfast and free parking.
Summary: Stayed for 3 days during spring break.  Overall look of the hotel was lovely.  My son adored the koi pond, waterfall, and turtles.   Rooms were great - a lot of space and two flat screen TVs.  Housekeeping came knocking really early though (8 am) and we were still trying to get a few extra winks of sleep. At most hotels I've gone to they usually wait until Mid morning so they aren't waking anyone up.  Pool water was pretty cold...wished it was warmer!  We had a car so we could get around easily (hotel is right off the freeway), but this isn't a walking type of hotel and defnitely not close to disneyland. Free breakfast was very convenient, and even though they end breakfast at 10 am, there were still people in line so they made sure everyone got served, which was nice.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking the time to share your experience with your fellow travelers.  Our tropical atrium with its wild life is certainly a tranquil area for adults and offers lots of excitement for the little ones.  Having a leisurely breakfast in this environment makes for a great start into the day; an added benefit of course is that it's FREE which is especically important to families.     I am sorry about the earlier than desired housekeeping service.  I use the Do Not Disturb sign whenever I stay at a hotel and it is really the best way to tell the staff about one's personal schedule.  Be sure to take advantage of this simple tool.   We did have some challenges with our pool heater recently, but it's all taken care of now.  Back to 84 degrees water temperature.   Having a car is definitely a great advantage wherever you go to in Southern California and it's 6 miles from the hotel to Disneyland.  We also have a Shuttle for those who prefer not to drive.   I hope your son is not too sad now that school is back in session.  See you at the next break!    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice place for the price--didn't love the location
Summary: I am a Southwest Airlines employee that was getting away for a quick Disney trip with our 4 kids.  Since we are a family of 6, we always need a large room/suite which is never cheap.  I set out looking for the best value all around including parking and breakfast. Pros: This room was large, had 2 TVs, was super clean and the beds were comfortable.  There is free parking and they have a free shuttle to Disneyland.    The free breakfast was great....cooked to order eggs and omelets.  Plenty of stuff for kids, pancakes, cereal.  It was also in a large area so there was plenty of tables for everyone.  The staff was very friendly upon check-in and in breakfast area.   Cons: Since we had to use the couch bed for 2 of our kids, we had to request bedding for it.  I had to wait 30+
Manager Response: I appreciate all the positive comments, but particularly the ones about the friendliness of our team at the front desk and in breakfast.  You are a pro as it comes to service working for Southwest, so this means a lot (by the way, I'm flying to New Orleans on Southwest in a couple of weeks, I'm glad to personally return a business favor).   I am sorry about the wait when the sofabed was not already made up.  This was definitely an oversight on our part as it is a standard to have it automatically prepared for any new guest; good opportunity to remind our team to always check.     Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary: Family visit to Disneyland, including senior and children, service was excellent from front desk to shuttle driver.  Suite was clean, supplies provided in a timely manner.  Breakfast was great, everything from pancakes to muffins.  Location is not the best, somewhat isolated but the shuttle service was good.  Very good value for the money.
Manager Response: I am glad we contributed to a nice family visit to Disneyland.  Our hotel is perfect for families; extra room in our spacious suites, significant savings opportunity as full cooked-to-order breakfast and Evening Manager's Reception are complimentary, and free parking.   I appreciate the kind compliment about our friendly team members that provided you with a clean and comfortable suite.  Until the next time.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary Heading: Great location for visiting Southern California attractions
Summary: Staff willing to help, so ask questions about shopping, directions or entertainment. Take advantage of the great breakfast, many choices for adults and children. Easy access to freeways to get you to your destination quickly. Hotel provided shuttle service to Disney , for a small fee, but you were able to come and go during the entire day with no additional cost.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review.  Our team is very grateful to be recognized in this fashion.  I am glad you enjoyed your time with us and look forward to welcoming you back soon.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary Heading: Embassy Suites - An Excellent Choice for Business Events
Summary: Our company has held five events for our clients at Embassy Suites over the last few years, the most recent being in March of 2011.  From the beginning, the staff at Embassy Suites made us feel very much at home and worked hard to accommodate our every request.  Our clients were thrilled with the events and appreciated everything from the complimentary parking to the beautiful atrium in the hotel.  They have a conference room for every size of event, and are happy to help you find the right one.  The conference rooms have excellent lighting and an overall fresh feel.  We took advantage of the A/V Equipment and Embassy Suite's Catering.  We were very happy with both.  Our staff is still talking about the freshly baked brie and cookies.  We will be sure to contact Embassy Suites
Manager Response: We are not called the "small meeting" specialists for no reason.  Many repeat customers have been booking their events with us for years.  It is great that we did our part to make you look good in front of your clients.     Thank you for being so loyal and we can't wait to be of service again real soon.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary Heading: Will only stay at Embassy Suites thanks to this visit!
Summary: I was also a bit afriad to stay at this location based on previous reviews, but many of the negative reviews to me seemed a bit unrealistic, or like someone had a bad day and just gave this place a horrible review.  I am glad we did stay here.  The price for our room was at least $40 cheaper than the next closest Embassy, and just as nice.    Positives: -The staff at the front desk were always friendly. -Free cook to order breakfast -Long pool hours -Free drinks and snack at happy hour (limited selection, but still free) -large rooms -Quiet, was never disturbed while sleeping -Beautiful Koi pond -Nice shower pressure -They offer shuttle to Disneyland, sign up early if you plan to use it!! We just asked about it, but figured we probably drive anyway.  At 10 am the next available
Manager Response: Thank you for being so diligent in pointing out the many pros.  I'm glad you had a hard time finding the cons and had to make some up.  The picture of the mountains did turn out great.  Sometimes they are just within hand's reach it seems.   I am sorry about the wait in the restaurant.  This is certainly something we need to do better.  We just purchased some cordless phones for Room Service to ensure that calls are answered promptly.   I hope you will make it back our way sooner than you are expecting it and appreciate your intent to see us again.  Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary: We stayed at this hotel at the end of March for a week when we went to Disneyland. Since we had a rental car we decided to stay here because it wasn't so close to the craziness  of Disney (but still a quick drive) and they had a great rate for an advance purchase. I was really happy with our stay here.. The hotel was very clean and the rooms are huge! Housekeeping always did a great job with cleaning our room. My boys loved the atrium with the fish and the turtles and I found it gave the hotel a peaceful feel to it. Breakfast here is worth it alone. I loved the variety of items and how they were always replenished, even when it was getting close to the time that breakfast was over. Having pop at breakfast was great too! The lady that was cooking breakfast ( I think her name was
Manager Response: It is great to have gained another fan.  Many of our guests prefer our hotel over the hotels closer to Disneyland.  You are right on that you are away from the congestion of the immediate Disneyland area, but still close enough to get there in no time.   Thank you for recognizing Aida (our breakfast cook you are referring to) and the rest of our team.  We are all very appreciative of your compliments and look forward to welcoming you back soon.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary: This review is a little late since we stayed here two years ago, but while reading a few of the poorer reviews I just couldn't help but add my experience... which was great! I travel to Anaheim quite often with my daughter for volleyball tournaments. We are usually up there for a few days (sometimes we stay an extra day and go to Disneyland the second day) and this Embassy Suites is in a great location for us! It's nice to have such large rooms, and we also love having the breakfast. The only tough thing is that we have to be at the venue for the tournament by 7:15am, so we miss the breakfast on tournament days. Wondering if we call ahead of time, and there are a few volleyball families staying, if breakfast could start earlier. Other than that, the staff is great, and I am
Manager Response: It is very kind that you are taking the time to share your opinion for a more balanced review of our hotel; especially as it has been a little while since your last visit.  Where have you been?  We are still getting lots of volleyball groups due to our convenient location to the venues, and of course the extra space in our suites.  We certainly try to accommodate early risers on weekends that would like to have breakfast prior to our official opening time of 7am.  Our team starts preparing breakfast at 6am already and you are able to at least get some continental breakfast items like cereal, fruit, pastries, or yogurt.  Please feel free to shoot me an e-mail at juergen.oswald@hilton.com in case of special needs.  This way we can properly prepare.    Thank you for your kind review and I am glad that your experiences have all been great.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary: This hotel was absolutely fabulous! The service was great, very clean, helpful and friendly staff. The only con was the mattress on the sofa sleeper was in very poor condition and needed to be replaced. I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: I appreciate the kind compliment about our hotel and the team's service.  Feed-back like that always inspires them to do more of it.   I am sorry about the condition of the sofa bed mattress.  I hope that you read this response and it would be great if you could e-mail me the suite number you stayed in so we can get it immediately replaced; this way I don't have to personally test-sleep all mattresses for comfort as I already have a full time job, ha-ha.  My e-mail address is juergen.oswald@hilton.com.   Looking forward to welcoming you back soon.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, Great Staff, would stay again..... but....
Summary: We actually LOVE Embassy Suites, in general. We have both Teens as well as a set of 6 year old triplets. The breakfast, GREAT Pool GREAT snack bar, GREAT. Staff GREAT soooo here's the BUT We called before our reservations, this is 2011. FREE WIFI should almost be a must, but $10.00 A NIGHT is way to steep. Our only other issue was this, The Shuttle to DisneyLand i feel was over priced, it cost us $25.00 A DAY, which ok, BUT the shuttle hours are horrible. Those should be more accommodating, much more so! 2 of the 3 nights we used the shuttle, the driver alloweed it to be OVER packed (literally by 20 people, whom where then left there at the park) all because he brought the wrong shuttle. The next morning, the other driver, was GREAT and very apologetic. over all, we LOVED it,
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind compliments about the hotel and the staff.  Especially for a big family our hotel is definitely a great choice.  Lot's of space in our suites and you can't beat our complimentary cooked-to-order breakfast and Manager's Reception in the evening.    I encourage all of our guests to sign up for our free frequent traveler rewards program Hilton HHonors.  Besides earning hotel points and airline miles, Gold and Diamond members receive complimentary Internet access at all Family of Hilton hotels.  Existing Hilton HHonors members should consolidate all of their travel with our hotels to get to the Gold status as fast as possible.    I appreciate the feed-back about our shuttle service and apologize about the inconvenience caused by a mistake.  I am glad the person on the following shift did an exceptional job.    Until next time!    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary: I especially enjoyed the spacious rooms, room service and fitness room.
Manager Response: I just spent the entire weekend of 3/11-3/13/11 at the hotel as a guest. I can't tell you how many people I talked to who commented about the spaciousness of our suites. It did not matter if it was a single business traveler in town for a convention who hates to have the walls closing in on him when he can't stay at an Embassy Suites and has to make do with a regular hotel room; or the family in the area for a Disneyland getaway who appreciate that their kids have the opportunity to play in the living room while the parents watch a movie in the bedroom.   Our room service is definitely a popular choice for people who just want to have a quick bite in the comfort and privacy of their suite after a long day at work or out in the sun having fun.  The fitness center has the latest equipment by Precor and can be followed up by a few laps in our pool or a relaxing soak in the hot tub.    I had many people telling me this weekend not to work too hard, but I was just having fun staying in the hotel like the rest of our loyal guests who sold out the hotel.  It's nice to be popular!    Jürgen Oswald General Manager

Summary: What a beautiful hotel.  The staff, food and ambiance could not have been better. The location is perfect.  Just hop on the freeway to go in any direction. I highly recommend this hotel for business or leisure.  With the breakfast and happy hour, and free parking, it a great value as well.
Manager Response: This review brings up our "car friendly" benefits.  A spacious parking lot with plenty of complimentary parking.  No struggle to park your larger vehicle or RV.  Located off the 91 freeway within a couple of exits to the 55 freeway towards Newport Beach/John Wayne Airport and the 57 freeway towards Disneyland/Angel Stadium/Honda Center.    I am glad you enjoyed your stay and thank you very much for your feed-back.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary: I had to attend a 4 day Training Seminar in Anaheim in February 2011.  I arrived on a Monday afternoon from a semi-long day in the airport and once immediately attended to at the front desk and was in my room in no time.  Very nice and clean room, and a very quiet area.  I then went down to the Hotel Bar, in which a cold beer was in very much need of.  I sat down at the Bar and was pleasantly greeted by Ralph who served me a very cold beer and we talked for awhile.  The Managers Reception every night was a real treat and the Managers did come around and talk to everyone and were very freindly.  I ate every night in my room and the Hotel Room Service was fabulous.  Food was great and the Carrot Cake was excellent.  Overall I had a wonderful stay and it was a pleasure coming down
Manager Response: Ralph will be very honored and happy, now that he is "famous".  He is definitely a great host during our nightly Manager's Reception.    I appreciate all the other compliments too.  It's always nice to hear when a guest likes our set-up and enjoys the many benefits we offer.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary: We visit Disney 4-5 times a year and try to do a Disney resort most of the time, this trip a little different. Found a great rate for Embassy in what seemed like a short trip to/from Disneyland. Staff was great, hotel was clean, amenities were great (indoor pool, gym, bar/restaurant, lounge area and great comp breakfast) and getting to and from the park were a breeze. Embassy is great for kids that need to stretch their legs or want a little area to themselves. It only took 15 minutes to get to/from the park and very easy to navigate, no need for the shuttle which they do provide but just as easy to drive. The breakfast was perfect for a little something on the way to the park and bar is nice for Mom and Dad to have a cocktail at the end of the day. The rooms are a little dated
Manager Response: Thank you very much for sharing your experience.  I can't tell you how grateful we are to hear from you.  Our hotel is certainly a great choice for families and you are hitting all of the many great benefits.  You are getting so much more for the price of a regular hotel room, not too mention the very pricey locations next to Disneyland.   I have many conversations with guest like you who come to Disney numerous times throughout the year.  You are probably an annual pass holder and I hope that we will be able to welcome you back on your next trip, now that you have tasted the "suite" life.   Looking forward to meeting you in person as your schedule allows.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary Heading: Great stay, will come here next time
Summary: We were scared by all the bad reviews, but this place was great.  It was clean and comfortable.  Plenty of room for 2 adults, 2 teenagers, a 10 year old and a baby in one room. The staff was great, the breakfast was wondeful.  The happy hour was loved, free drinks (the whole bar!) and snacks for 2 hours! Room service and food was good, pool was great.  The outside noise was not a problem considering it is in the Los Angeles area near a highway.  We didn't even notice any noise. We spent 5 nights here and went to disneyland.  Although it is 6 miles away, it is an easy commute and not a prolem at all. We come to disneyland every year, and we will be staying here again.  Don't be scared by the bad reviews, this is a great place to stay.
Manager Response: I appreciate the kind feed-back about your recent stay. I am glad that you found our offering to be of great value and I could not agree more. Our spacious suites, complimentary cooked-to-order breakfast, and Manager's Reception are second to none.   I also thank you for taking the time to share your positive experience with your fellow travelers. There is absolutely no reason for anybody to be "scared" about staying at our hotel, despite the opinion of some. We are certainly not perfect (nobody is), but if given the opportunity we do make things right for our guests.   We look forward to welcoming you back on your next trip to Disneyland.    Many thanks,    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary Heading: THE WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED AT!!!
Summary: This was by far the worst Hotel that my Mom and I have every stayed at!!! On Christmas night we arrived tired and late to our room only to find it had mold on one whole side of the bedroom and the special room service that I had pre-ordered wasn't in the room. I called the front desk and within an hour or so room service delivered a seriously in-adequate plate of food!!!   After a wonderful day at Disneyland we had to end our evening with switching rooms which was absolute a nightmare!!! I just can't state again how TERRIBLE this Hotel is!!! Not only will I never stay at this Embassy Suites I will never stay at another Embassy Suites and I have spread the word via e-mails and Facebook about how terrible this place is!!!  I can't even discuss how terrible the shuttle service is
Manager Response: It is correct that we were battling elevated moisture levels in our suites around Christmas when we had record rain storms in Southern California. All of these challenges have been rectified though. As I mentioned in a response to a previous review, our shuttle service is available during the most popular times and when it does not meet everybody's particular needs, we certainly do our best to provide alternatives.  Our breakfast opens at 7am on weekends, not at 6am as this reviewer indicates. We are flexible though to have our guests get some continental breakfast items prior to 7am while our team sets up for the actual opening. These continental items include pastries, fruit, cereal, etc.   We have been a very popular hotel for the past 2 weeks in December with record occupany levels. It is disappointing that we failed to impress this particular reviewer however.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary Heading: A below average embassy suites with no 24 hours housekeeping and unreliable shuttle to Disneyland!
Summary: I chose the hotel based on its proximity to the Disneyland but this Embassy Suites under-delivered!  Front desk staff are friendly and polite but the hardware needs major updates!  There is no 24 hours housekeeping and a call to assist with pulling out a sofa bed results in a security guard knocking the door and can't help much except bringing extra bedding supplies!  Really bizarre if you ask me!    Then the hourly shuttle to Disneyland is unreliable despite costing $3 per person!  They skipped off peak time slot even when reservation was made ahead!  Waiting in a parking lot for 1 hour was unacceptable and half-hearted apologetic staffs add further insult!  I paid 35,000points for this hotel and could have stayed in a nicer Hilton family property!  I highly discourage anyone
Manager Response: Appreciate the nice recognition of our front office team's service.  We do not have 24 hours housekeeping service as most hotels in our category do not offer this either (you would only find this in luxury hotels).  Therefore we have some other departments assisting between 11pm-6am which apparently need some more training.   Our shuttle service to Disneyland runs during the most requested time frames with the exception of state mandated driver break times and for a few hours mid afternoon.  In case the schedule does not fit the needs of a particular guest, we always try to offer solutions.  The fact that we missed somebody is obviously unacceptable and troubling.   The detailed description of these concern areas will enable us to further improve.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary: After reading the bad reviews, I had to say somethig. I was worried after reading the previous bad reviews. This Embassy is just like all others, great staff, good breakfast, nice rooms, and good atmosphere.  The nights that I stayed had 90% occupancy according to a staff member, and everything was great. Breakfast service was excellent (Staff so friendly). It did not seem that it was that full.  I would love to stay here again for my next trip to Anaheim.
Manager Response: It is great to have one of our fans voice their opinion. The nice compliments will certainly give our team a boost to provide all of our guests with an equally good experience.  They definitely like to hear when their efforts are appreciated.    Thank you,    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary Heading: I don't feel safe at this hotels location
Summary: I don't feel safe at this hotel. Parties until 1am and loud drunks roaming  The hallways until 2am.   I would recommend not bringing you're   family to this location.
Manager Response: This review refers to a Baptism Celebration held in our Ballroom. It is correct that it was a rather noisy event with a band until 1am. Based on several noise concerns from our guests, we have changed our event policy to only allow bands to play until 10pm going forward. This was the time that many guests found a reasonable time for a band to perform.  Besides the noise, we did not have any reported security or safety concerns as indicated by incident free security and Manager on Duty reports.  Our hotel is very popular with families and we take great pride and comfort in this fact. I just received written feed-back from another family whose kids had a wonderful time enjoying our breakfast and the lush atrium with our koi pond and turtles.   Coincidentally our Food & Beverage Director had a conversation with a guest this past weekend who had a reservation and read our more recent TripAdvisor reviews. He was contemplating to cancel the reservation, but decided to give it a try anyway. He said that his experience could not have been any better and he was happy that he saw for himself what our hotel had to offer.  We thank all of our reviewers for their feed-back, the good and the more critical. Either way, it gives us the opportunity to improve and provide a great experience to our guests.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary Heading: BED BUGS! NASTY FLOORS! CLOGGED PLUMBING!
Summary: Room 303 has stained, stinky carpets, BED BUGS on the pillows, dirty outside patio and messed up plumbing! PLACE SUCKS!
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about the disappointing experience. Your detailed comments allowed us to correct the deficiencies.   While there may have been insects present during this particular stay, we had our pest control company inspect the suite for bed bugs, and we received a report without findings. Many people believe that bed bugs are a common occurance in hotels whereas they are very rare. The media has done a "good" job in creating quite a bit of hype. We treat any report with concern though and have proper procedures in place to ensure that we are bed bug free.   Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary Heading: I beg you NOT to stay here
Summary: Horrible hotel, dirty carpet and furniture in rooms, inadequate front desk personell.  We stayed in July and complained to the management. We were comp'ed a night, so we accepted thinking management would at least put us in a better room.  NOT THE CASE.  Again, the room stunk, had stains on the furniture, carpet and drapes,...so badly we went to Walmart and bought blankets to lay on the bed. Dont lay on their comforters. WE put them outside our door, they were stained and smelled really bad.  but after all this...they charged my credit card the entire night stay plus $50 for deposit.  TOOK ME 6 DAYS TO HAVE THEM REMOVE IT.  Instead of remodeling your Atrium area,.. take the $$ and have all the rooms professionally cleaned with lots of chemicals, bleach and a steam cleaner. Only
Manager Response: It is nice to see the compliment about our team in the housekeeping, bar, and breakfast departments; thank you. The other concerns are very disappointing and I agree that we need to do better. It is unacceptable that a return visitor has been disenchanted again. Thank you for sharing.    Juergen Oswald General Manager

Summary: We've read the review about staying away from Recycling plant side.  We asked for the room far away from that side.  Contstruction noise - jack hammer, generator, etc - runs all morning and afternoon.  If you are going to be using the hotel for night snooze only, it'll work - as long you are away from the Recycling plant.    Atrium is nice for the kids.  Swimming pool has too much chroline.  Jacuzzi is warm and nice.  Fitness center is very limited.  The laundry's washer is okay, but the drier does not completely dry.  $1.25 per load.   This hotel is out in the boonies.  There is not much of anything in the neighborhood.  Carl's Jr. is across the freeway.  Bowling alley is few blocks away.  That's pretty much all you can do in this neighborhood.  The complimentary breakfast and

This is one of the worst hotels that I have ever stayed in. Screaming kids running around the hotel at all times of the day and night. Had hoped that since this was a good distance from Disneyland we wouldn't have that issue. Hard to sleep in the bedroom from the highway noise and hard to sleep on the pullout couch from the screaming kids and noise for breakfast prep. Pullout couch was cheap and very uncomfortable. Phone cord pulled out of the wall. Dirty, worn, and outdated furnishings. Lampshade was yellow, broken and askew. No toilet paper in the room. Had to go to front desk to ask for some (since I could not call). It seemed like everything was falling apart in the room. LONG, LONG lines for breakfast with a very poorly organized area for food distribution. Had to wait in

Summary Heading: Even Shrek would stay Far Far Away from this place!
Summary: I thought I only had the recycling plant to worry about so when we received a room facing the freeway we were home clear!   Well... the rooms are a little creepy to say the least.  You can't open your blinds to the courtyard or else all of the loiterers in the atrium will have their faces pressed against your window.  Oh, those were staff.   Ahem.  Anyways.   As a result, the only daylight comes from the one window in the bedroom.  Oh well... no big deal.  Pets are allowed in this hotel.  Fido barked incessantly each time someone was near the elevators and thankfully our room was away from him.  When morning arrived we had to line up to the trough with the rest of the cattle.  My son refused to eat the swill they were serving so I knew that hell must have frozen over.
For the price you pay for this hotel you would expect something better.  Breakfast was also horrid when we at there too.  Also, breakfast service was also at the same level.

This hotel is convenient to many main freeways so convenient to get to other areas.  We went to Newport and only took 25 minutes, Disney and Knotts close by.  Hotel was clean, bkfst was good (except seemed like a feeding frenzy - go before 8am).  Would stay here again, great value through Hotwire.  Only disappointment was an indoor swimming pool, we were looking forward to relaxing in the sun by the pool.

If you are looking for space, privacy, ambiance, great service and easyily accessible free parking, then you want to look in on this location of Embassy Suites (Anaheim, CA North).  I always stay at an Embassy Suites when I travel out of town and the Anaheim North has the most beautiful courtyard, with waterfalls, lots of greenery and koi fish ponds through the center.  The pool is indoors with an outdoor patio if you like to be in the sun . . and a great jacuzzi and exercise room.  The attendants are all very eager to make your stay THE BEST.  I have read a couple of reviews indicating the rooms were found dirty; I have stayed at this location MANY TIMES and I live in the same city.  I know that IF, somehow something was missed - all you would have to do is go to the desk and

We stayed here while on a road trip.  Normally we love Embassy Suites but this hotel is quite worn and really needs some renovation.  Rooms were not the cleanest, the beds are always comfy but this was not up to standard.  In door pool smelled of very strong chlorine almost sickening.

We are from New Zealand and stayed at this hotel for 10 nights in June.. The purpose of our trip was firstly to visit Disneyland and secondly to enjoy to sights of Southern California. We were an extended family of 8 ranging from 2 grandparents down to a 9 year old child. The hotel was awesome. The rooms were great and having a separate bedroom was fantastic as it allowed the children to go to sleep without the adults disturbing them. The beds were really comfortable and the rooms were clean. We could not fault them. The full cooked breakfast were great and the odd occasion we used the managers reception we had a great time. We used the shuttle many times to go to Disneyland and once we got our heads around the shuttle timetable we were away. The shuttle drivers were fantastic

I recommend this hotel to anyone who will visit Disneyland with either family and friends. I love, love, LOVE Embassy Suites! Best hotel chain I've experienced and is also part of the Hilton Family, which you can earn points. We stayed in this location for 2 nights and booked only one room for 6 of us in the room. The room included a microwave and a mini refridgerator which is convienent. The staff was completely wonderful and made us feel at home. We tried out the indoor pool, which was nice. The atrium of the hotel was beautiful! It took my breath away. Also, embassy suites always offers complimentary breakfast and free drinks at the bar from 5:30pm-7:30 pm. Always a AAA+++! Will definitely be back again!   By the way, just in case you'd like to know. Disneyland is 10 minutes

This hotel is not Embassy Suites quality. I booked two nights, but switched to one after seeing this place.  The rooms are old and worn and not clean. I was seriously considering sleeping on top of the blankets. The property is old and worn with spider webs and dead flys all over the outside of the small balcony.  The location is very poor. It is near nothing decent food wise or entertanment wise. The free drinks at night are a nice touch and the bar staff were very friendly and quick. The breakfast is also decent and the staff there were good too.  My Hilton Honors profile gives me free internet at Embassy, but I sill got charged and had to have it removed on the way out.

Summary Heading: Close to large Anaheim industrial park
Summary: This is a typical Embassy Suites.  The rooms are nice but unnecessarily large for a solo business traveller.  This may not matter to you but too much space is just space for lsoing things for me. The staff was polite, accomodating, and informative.  Make sure you bring a car, NOTHING is within walking distance but the nearby recycling station.  (Ask for a room as far from that as possible, the back up alarms started VERY early in the a.m.) Breakfast had a great selection and the managers happy hour was really nice with a good selection of appetizers and drinks.   Be aware that this hotel is a good 20 minutes from Disney depending on the time of day.

Summary Heading: Excellent rooms, wonderful staff, great complimentary treats!
Summary: Our stay at this hotel was great! We got an excellent deal through Priceline, and the hotel exceeded our expectations. We stayed there for a trip to Disneyland, and while the hotel is NOT very close (about 6 miles away) the shuttle service provided was easy and convenient - just be sure to solidify those reservations. The inside of the hotel was incredible, the koi pond with waterfall set a great atmosphere and we had a lot of fun watching the turtles.   The rooms were very clean, in great condition and not outdated or weathered. The bed was super comfortable and the tvs were really nice.The complimentary breakfast was not only of great quality, but there were so many options we left totally stuffed. The "happy hour" Managers Reception (free drinks for anyone over 21 with a room

Stayed here with my mom and siblings and her brother(my uncle) back in 2002. We drove from phoenix and my uncle was a Hilton member so i believe we got a bit of a discount.It was a one bedroom with two queen size beds and a living room.They had a frees shuttle to/from Disneyland (purpose of trip) and we really didnt spend much time in the hotel.Awesome breakfast buffet although it's what you'll expect, cereal, pancakes, sausages etc. They had two flat screen tv's which for 2002 i thought that was super awesome and good room service. I cant say much about the hotel as we only used it to rest our heads and we were out after breakfast but it was a splendid stay.
I had an awesome time in these vacations!.. i loved the hotel, the koi pond was really nice, the pool, the room, even the breakfast :).

We always stay here when we are in California. Usually have a great experience, not to much to complain about. The breakfast is great, chef Paul (I believe that was his name) was super nice. Great customer service all around in this hotel. Only downfall I suppose is it a ways from good restaurants.

Summary Heading: Stay away from this place, terrible location next to metal recycling plant
Summary: This was the worst embassey suites I have ever stayed at.  The room on the east side look out to a metal recycling plant that runs a 24 hr operation.  The noise from fork lifts beeping while backing all night long and the metal being p/up all night long were awful.  I will be writing to embassey suites to tell them to remove their name from this hotel as fast as they can.  If you cannot avoid but to stay here make sure you ask for a room on the south side of this complex.  The north side looks out to a busy freeway (which would have been much better than the metal recycler), the east side has the metal recycler.

Nice hotel I think around 10 miles from Disneyland...very well kept...breakfast was really nice...happy hour was great...lots of friendly people there...you can tell this hotel may be 20 years old but is well-maintained.  They do a nice job with it...the indoor pool area was nice.  The room was great!  Lots of room to spread out.  Two wide screen flat screen TVs.  I can't say anything else other than we'd like to come back.  We also met families that rode the shuttle to Disney and said good things about it...we were there when there are no crowds but I dont think it's more than 20 minutes from the parks.

Summary Heading: Hotel was very nice and the staff was terrific
Summary: The staff was very friendly.  The hotel is quiet and very relaxing

I recently stayed at the Embassy Suites with my family during our trip to Disneyland.  We all gasped when we walked in the door, as you are greeted by a beautiful indoor courtyard.  Our rooms were ready, even though we were checking in very early.  We spent the day at Disneyland and were sad to miss the special happy hour for hotel guests!  We were also bummed that we didn't bring bathing suits, as the hot tub would have been amazing after a long day of walking around.  I couldn't believe how enormous and nice the rooms were, especially at the low price! I almost feel like this hotel is too good to be true. I don't want management to catch on to how much they COULD charge!  We were able to take advantage of the free breakfast, which was amazing. I ordered an egg white omelette

This hotel completely sucks.  Stayed there for new year's eve disneyland trip.  There is a metal factory in back that operated 24/7, you hear the beeping of trucks backing up ALL NIGHT!  Hotel restaurant sucked.  The food was cold and took 45 minutes to arrive (with an empty restaurant, should have been my clue).  On the positive, the staff was pleasant and apologetic.  Thet also failed to control the entire high school class that was shouting from floor to floor into the wee hours of the morning.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel! far from Disney though..
Summary: This Hotel was awesome we stayed there 2 different times on a trip to Disneyland. It's a bit far from Disney but they do have a shuttle (be sure to get your tickets at the front desk) The drive was speedy (it scared my daughter she thought it was a disney ride) The front desk was great. The breakfast alone is worth staying here. For a family of 4 it usually cost over $40 for us to eat breakfast so it's worth it + it's made to order & they have a good selection of items. (get there early) The manager's reception is great they offer drinks for adults + sodas for the kids & some free snacks like pretzels & popcorn. Pizza slices etc. at a cheap price. The hotel was clean & the suites were a great size. I would definately stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great location, clean room, perfect stay
Summary: The Embassy Suites Anaheim has close access to major freeways, DisneyLand, and shopping/restaurant districts.  The hotel atrium is beautiful and the rooms are very clean and comfortable.  I love the breakfast choices and custom preparation.  I stayed here for business but, plan to take my family next time we go to DisneyLand.

Summary Heading: Close to Disney, and that's about it.
Summary: Pros: 1. Close/easy access to Disneyland (we drove instead of taking the shuttle that costs $3 per person).  2. Free breakfast & evening cocktail reception (the women who were busing tables were extremely friendly). Cons: 1. There are absolutely ZERO restaurants nearby.  Even the front desk couldn't tell us where any restaurants were.  Closest restaurants we could find were roughly 5-6 miles away.  2. This is the most out-of-date and dirty Embassy Suites I have EVER stayed at (and I've stayed at a lot).  Hair left over from the people before us on the toilet & shower (I nearly tossed my cookies).  There was also mold/rust on many of the bathroom fixtures.  3. Even though there is a free breakfast, it is mediocre at best and you can plan on spending 30 minutes in line if you want

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, transportation to park not good
Summary: We stayed here for three nights in October visiting Disney Land.  The hotel is nice and has a really nice pool and hot tub (overlooking a parking lot, but still nice).  The free breakfast in the morning is absolute chaos.  It can be difficult to get a table, people cut in lines and although it was free, by the last day, I was ready to head for a restaurant.  The elevator posts standard wait times and they are pretty accurate.  If you go early, you shouldn't have a problem.    The rooms were an okay size, but with older kids, I could see them being a little on the small side.  There is a bus with a small fee that goes and from Disney Land every 20 minutes.  Usually the bus was too small to fit everyone on it and rarely was it on time either way.  I think it's a better bet to

This is the second year our marching band has stayed at the Embassy Suites Anaheim North.  While the location is a bit farther from Disneyland, it is still very convenient.  Once again we had excellent service from everyone.  Rooms were clean, beds comfortable, and the lobby pleasant.  Pricing is excellent for the size rooms and amenities.  Our thrid floor room was on the freeway side, but we couldn't hear the traffic at all unless we were stading right next to the window with the curtains back...and even then it was only a faint sound.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, clean, friendly service, great price!
Summary: Stayed with my 2 teenage sons.  room was clean and plenty of room for all of us.  The staff was friendly, the breakfast was great and the managers reception was great too. We took the shuttle back and forth to Disneyland and had no issues at all.  Would definately stay there again and recommend it to friends and family!!    Just a side note- there are not a lot of inexpensive restaurants or fast food close, so you would have to drive to find them .

Summary Heading: Very Clean Hotel, Great Staff & Management, Great Value for a Family
Summary: The hotel worked great for a family of 6.  We registered early for the best rate.  The two bedroom suite and full breakfast make this a great value for our family.  The hotel was very clean and well maintaned.  The drive to Disneyland was no big deal. We found the management  to be of exceptional charector.  We had a problem with a lost item at the front desk.  The management handled the problem with great concern and in an exceptional manner.  I highly recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: Excellent Hotel, can't wait to go back!
Summary: I took my daughter and her family to orange for 4 days and the hotel was so incredible.  It began when we checked in the front desk staff is very friendly and very welcoming. The rooms are very spaciaous and comfortable with everything you need for a comfortable stay.  We arrived in the evening and took part in the manager's reception, really helped after a long day of traveling. Beds were so comfortable , I got one of the best night's sleep at a hotel in a really long time.  The breakfast the next morning was so surprising, we had no idea that it was such a full breakfast with made to order omeletes...everything was really fresh.  Great coffee too. The pool area was a lot of fun.  I really can't say enough about the staff though.  They really go that extra mile to make you feel
Good location for attending event at the Honda Center.  No restaurants within walking distance. Nice, clean hotel and great breakfast. Nice managers reception in the evening also. Great value.

Summary Heading: Don't stay here if you're going to Disneyland
Summary: We booked this room on a trip to Disneyland.  The hotel website said they are close to Disneyland. THEY ARE NOT!! We had to get on two major highways to get there and we got lost at night trying to find our way back.   Their happy hour was nice from 5:30 to 7:30. They had the normal Embassy Suites free alcoholic and non-alcoholic selection and complimentary snacks. Their breakfast was also really good. My husband and I are not coffee or juice drinkers in the morning, so it was nice that they offered complimentary soda.   The room was really nice and comfortable but there is a factory next door that woke us up at 6 a.m. That is not a nice wake up call when you are on vacation. There really isn't a room with a good view at this hotel. The indoor pool looked nice and so did the hot

Summary Heading: I stayed here for 6 years for good reason!
Summary: I stayed at this hotel for 6 years as a business traveler.  Saw much improvement in the facilities over that time.  Always had great service from front desk, housekeeping, and restaraunt/bar (check out Marla at the restaraunt!).  Management was very polite and treated me more like family than like a guest.  It was indeed my second home!!

A great hotel with very nice ameneties; location to freeways is very good and a most accomodating staff from check-in to retaurant personnel.  Free parking and great in-room furniture for doing your work conveniently....Thanks
Everything is perfect. I appreciate you for providing dinner for my group.  Thanks for your effort. All the credit goes to Masuimi. Thank You form the Golden Jubilee Group.      Zahir Ali

I recently had my family reunion at Disneyland and we decided to stay at the Embassy Suites Anaheim North because it was a great rate for what was included.  Initally, we wanted to stay in downtown disney; however, the best group rate we could find was $200 or more and being that my family was traveling all the way from the east coast, we thought that was too much.  We found the Embassy Suites Anaheim North, as although it was further than we originally wanted, once we saw the hotel we were very impressed. The hotel is very spacious with a beautiful atrium.  We loved the complimentary breakfast and the daily manager's reception from 5-7pm with an open bar was a MAJOR hit for my family.  The daily shuttle to downtown disney was convenient and and took only about 12 minutes...so

Summary Heading: The room, breakfast, staff and environment were all great.
Summary: Great place for the family to stay. The place was always kept clean. The staff was quite friendly and the cost was reasonable.

Summary Heading: Had a terrific stay at Embassy Suites Anaheim North
Summary: The entire staff at Embassy Suites Anaheim North is very friendly, helpful, and informative.  We arrived at mid-morning and they accommodated us with an early check-in without "reminding" us that check-in is at 3:00pm like some other hotels do.  When we asked the front desk staff to recommend nearby places to eat where the locals go and weren't "touristy," they steered us in the right direction and we always had a very enjoyable meal.  Yes, this hotel is not next to Disneyland.  Actually, it's about 7.7 miles away to Disneyland and 6.8 miles to Brea Mall.  It's also located between the freeway and an empty lot (perhaps dry stream bed).  However, our room was located on the empty lot side and we didn't hear any traffic noise from the freeway.  Our room was clean and spacious and

Summary Heading: Can't believe this was an Embassy Suites!!!
Summary: We have stayed at Embassy Suites hotels before and loved them.  We made our reservation here because we were going to Disneyland.  First off, it's too far away from Disney.  Find something closer! They have a shuttle, but it's $3 per person, and parking at Disney is $12, so if you have 3 or more people in your group, it's cheaper to take your own car. The hotel is located between a freeway and a transfer station. Noisy!  The rooms are dark and haven't been redecorated in 20 years probably. The water pressure in the shower was very poor, and the temperature varied hot to cold during your shower.  The pool is indoors - not what I expected in Southern California.  There are no restaurants or stores close by - you have to drive about 5 miles to find anything like that.  I am so

Typical Embassy Suites Stay. Never any major problems and staff was very accommodating. Breakfast was excellent although there were sometimes few tables available due to the crowds.     After reading on a few websites, i asked for the "quiet" side of the hotel. Not a problem. On the other side there is a recycling plant and the freeway which would have definitely increased the noise level.     We got a good rate (116 a night). This place is about 15 minutes from Disneyland (not a bad drive through Orange) and had easy freeway access.     Decor colors in rooms need to be updated and there was a washing machine broken on the 4th floor. Not a big deal.      Safe, comfortable stay overall.  Oh, there was a couple arguing in the parking lot the night we arrived. She was beating on

Summary Heading: If youlike A/C or a comfortable night's sleep stay away from this hotel
Summary: I was very happy with the lobby decor.  I was very happy with the breakfast selection, and even the morning crowd wasn't too bad while waiting for this free breakfast, can't complain at all about these tow things. BUT There is NO, air conditioning at night.  Most California hotels allow a 24 hour override so that the AC doesn't run constantly, but allows you to be at a good resting temperature in the evening.  This hotel does not have that feature.  We went with myself,   husband, two children(8 & 12) and a teen (17).  The temp in our room was 76 deg F all night.  I was sweltering.  I got up and got dressed at 4am to find someone who could enlighten me on the problem and I was told that there is a mandate in California which prevents any public building from operating their A/C

Took 8 yr old daughter and a friend on a getaway so they can hang out and play in the pool. The hotel was GREAT!! The indoor pool was the best!!!! the girls had the pool all to themselves and we did not have to worry about the weather spoiling the fun. The suite was really nice, flat screen tv's, comfy king size bed ,and nicely decorated too :) The Hotel staff were really nice....breakfast was better than expected.  So much to choose from and not like those continental breakfast at other hotels... this was a buffet style breakfast. Seeing the hotel by the side of the freeway you would think twice before staying but the set up inside is beautiful. Inside the hotel there is a restaurant, bar, waterfall, pond with fish, chairs and tables to lounge around.

Summary Heading: Above average experience for the Business Traveller
Summary: Above average experience for Embassy Suite:  Location -  just off 91 in between 57 & 55; northern side of Anaheim away from the Disney traffic.  Rooms - very good (not great) bed/pillows/sheet; good shower; oversized rooms ("executive"); flat screen TV; free wireless (HHonors).  Some noise facing the highway - request one away.  Great check-in; business center printer wasn't working - they immediately offered up to use they own computer & printer in their office at no cost.  Breakfast:  a bit dark; typical Emb Suites food  Overall - good for Anaheim/Fullerton business without the tourist crowd.

Value for money? This time not. I would not recommend to You, or anyone. The receptionist was picking up the phone repeatedly as we were booking in. Sure, we were not welcome.  He tried to get us accept a higher than the booked price. He promised to correct the spotted mistake right away, but as a I checked the next day, the extra 70$/night was still in their billing system. We were first given a smoking room, which was against the booking. We had to return to the reception and wait for another room to be fixed. We waited some 15-20 minutes,  which was a lot at late in the evening after some 22 hours of travelling. As we were sitting indoors, the maid dashed in bringing in towels and trying to fix partially uncleaned toilet. Next morning we realised that the toiletries were

We booked our stay through Travelocity where all the reviews were wonderful, then I checked this site and saw that these reviews were far less flattering, so I decided that I needed to write my review here.  My daughter wanted to bring along her best friend, go to Disneyland for her 16th birthday, stay at a hotel closeby, and then go to California Adventure the next day.  So I did my research as I usually do and booked this hotel.  We were very pleased.  The room was just wonderful.  The two rooms are perfect for families.  The bed was divine and the children seemed to be fine on the sofa bed.  All the personnel were very friendly and helpful.  Check in and out were both a breeze.  The grounds are enchanting.  My daughter loved the turtles in the koi pond.  But the best part for

We stayed at the ES last fall for our 10th Anniversary.  We took our girls to Disneyland.  We thought the hotel was great - clean, spacious, etc.  I always request high floor rooms and they put us on the top floor; the high ceilings really make a difference.  The hotel has shuttle service to the park and buffet breakfast.  I definitely suggest verifying the shuttle time with more than one employee as we did have a mishap.  My only real complaint is that there aren't a lot of restaurants in the area.  However, up the freeway a few miles are several great choices, but you definitely have to drive if you don't want to eat at the hotel.

This was our first time staying at an Embassy Suites Hotel.  We stayed for 4 nights and really enjoyed the large rooms and free full breakfast.  As we were only spending one day at Disneyland, the location of this hotel was fine.  There was not much in the immediate vacinity for restaurants though.    When we checked in, our two rooms were right outside the elevators and we requested to change rooms.   We were moved but couldn't keep side by side rooms which wasn't a problem.  Our room faced the freeway and was noisy when the sliding glass door was open but because it was a constant dull noise when the door was closed, it did not cause a problem at all for us.    Parking was free, internet was $10/day and shuttle to Disneyland was free but we didn't use it.  The breakfast was

I stayed at this hotel for one night on a business trip, and I'm thankful it was for only one night.  The hotel is next door to a scrap metal recycling facility that operates 24/7.  All night I could hear the beeping of forklifts and the smashing of metal.  I wasn't able to get any sleep.  There is one entire side guest rooms that faces the recycling facility.  I would not recommend anyone stay here that is interested in sleeping.

Summary Heading: Okay hotel - too far from Disneyland.
Summary: The previous reviews are absolutely correct - some good and some bad.  We did not spend too much time in the room itself but would not recommend this hotel to anyone.  Noise was never a factor for us; either we were really tired or we're just heavy sleepers.  The parking was free and convenient.  We never woke up early enough to enjoy the breakfast or at the hotel to enjoy the Manager's Reception.  The room was okay but with a musty smell.  The shower was clean but head too low.  The furniture appeared overused and needing replacing.  The shuttle service was okay but not consistent even with reservations.  Rey was the only friendly driver.  The distance was approximately 20-25 minutes away from DL.  Next time we will just stay on property.

The only reason I'm not scoring this hotel as terrible,  is the hotel itself is what you'd expect from a Embassy Suites, although our room could have used new furniture.  The cook at breakfast was a very friendly sweet woman,and the location is very easy to find, right off the 91 fwy.  Which brings us to the major problem with this hotel.  THE NOISE !!!!!!!!   If you want to sleep at all, don't stay here.  The freeway is just about 50 yards from one side of the hotel and a large recycling plant is on the other side.  At 11p.m. the noise level was still  so loud that we had to turn on the radio just to try to drown out the freeway.  Mind you we were on the 7th floor and had spend 10 hours at Disneyland,  we were exausted and still could not fall asleep with all the noise.  The

Summary Heading: Next to Junkyard and freeway , but otherwise OK
Summary: Typical Embassy Suites inside. Some rooms have been refurnished and some have not. Service was good, but location was terrible as was noise level. One side of the hotel faces the freeway and one end faces a 24 hour a day metal scrapyard. The other side faces a wash, but at least it is quiet until evening when the bar at the end of the parking lot kicks in.  ( also typical Embassy suites atrium noise). We booked on line ( embassy suites website) for a non-refundable rate of $107 per night for a double queen suite. We originally got rooms on the freeway side and had too change rooms due to the noise. We spoke to some people who had the misfortune of being on the second floor near the breakfast area and on the scrapyard end of the building and the elevator. They said it was

We recently stayed at the Embassy Suites Anaheim for a short three day Disneyland trip.  We were so thrilled with this hotel that we will be staying here every time we visit Disneyland.  The rooms are huge, clean and very comfortable.  The staff is very friendly and extremely accommodating.  The services are exceptional.  Yes the hotel is not right next to Disneyland, but the shuttle service is very efficient and comfortable.  It is a 10-13 minute ride each way.  The shuttle drops you off very close to the entrance.  I would highly recommend staying at this hotel.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, Not So Great Location
Summary: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for two nights on a short trip to Disneyland.  Our party consisted of my wife, our two-year-old son, and myself.  We booked the room on the Hilton website through our Hhonors account.  Location: The hotel is about 4-5 miles North of Disneyland around where the 91 and the 57 meet.  There is almost nothing in the area in terms of good shopping and dining.  A residential area on one side, and industrial locations on the other flank the property.  A crummy looking restaurant shares the E.S. parking lot and there are gas stations near by.  But the hotel is right off the freeway and super easy to find.  Outside Appearance/Lobby/Check in: The outside of the E.S is kept up nicely, and the lobby/atrium areas are quality…consistent with other Embassy

Summary Heading: A great place for a great event!
Summary: At the end of May we had a family celebration with our kids and grandkids at this hotel.  We chose an Embassy Suites  because nothing is more fun than being able to gather together for breakfast and even Happy Hour.  We had three rooms for the three families, with 11 people and the suite provides room for everyone.  The shuttles to Disneyland are huge, and accommodated all of us easily.  Drop off and pickup make it SO pleasant.  And they came as late as a half hour after the park closed at Midnight!  Free parking at the hotel was plentiful and appreciated.  It's away from the Disneyland strip, which was fine with us.    We had one dinner at the hotel and it was fine ... kids meals and pizza and other things.  The restaurant staff was very nice to us ... a big HEY to Sam!  The

Just got back from the Embassy Suites Anaheim North for a one night stay with the family (kids ages 2 & 4). We originally planned a stay in San Diego to go to the zoo, but with the thunderstorms here in California, we decided to cancel and stay closer to home.   I wanted my kids to go swimming and this Embassy Suites had an indoor pool so I booked it on the hotel's website using AAA. It cost $170 + tax for a large room with 2 double beds. We were pleasantly surprised at how large the rooms were. Free parking in a pretty nice sized lot.   We live literally 10 minutes down the road, but decided to make it a mini-vacation since it is a 3 day weekend. As we are Disneyland season pass holders, we thought MAYBE we could go to the Magic Kingdom, but the weather was too chilly. Instead,
