This was a fantastic place to stay with an excellent value and very friendly staff.  It had a little bit of everything.  The free full cooked to order breakfast  (eggs, omlettes, pancakes, french toast) was great and unheard of.  The bacon, sausage, and potatoes were in a warmer.    The parking was free with no surprise charges on the bill.  It is 5 miles away from Disneyland in which they offer a free shuttle to and from that the Embassy South does not offer and they drop you off almost at the front gates.  Check out time is noon not 11 like most places.  The room is clean and updated with granite countertops.  The fridge and microwave come in very handy.  It was quiet at night and with the curtains closed, room was pitch dark so easy to fall asleep.  However, if you sleep in

Summary Heading: Some good and bad -- not all bad.
Summary: They had great customer service.  We got there a little after 1:00pm, a little earlier than check in.  They did check us into an available room which was very nice.  Just so you know it IS near a scrap yard.  We didn’t hear it, of course we were gone all day at Disneyland, and we were so exhausted when we did get back to our room that we could have slept through anything.  They do have a free shuttle to Disneyland.  It's about a 15 minute drive to Disneyland.  There are no convenient stores, or restaurants near by or within walking distance, only one sports bar at the end of the parking lot.  So if you want to be closer to Disneyland or near stores I would not recommend this hotel.  Or you could purchase the ART (Anaheim Resort Transit)  tickets which will pick you up at the

Summary Heading: Reasonable stay at the Embassy Suites
Summary: My family and I just returned from an overnight stay at this hotel.  Given what was noted by others, I was somewhat concerned but figured that for a short stay, it would be no big deal...I was pleasantly surprised by what we found but must say that this hotel is not exactly the Garden of Eden...  The Good: The service was markedly better than I expected. Everyone was welcoming and kind. The front desk staff was very helpful with regard to directions and our needs. The room service staff was lovely and the folks providing the made to order breakfasts in the morning were really first rate. The staff really seemed to want to make sure we were comfortable. This was by far the best feature of the hotel.  The soundproofing on our window (which faced the freeway!!) was better than I

I booked this hotel before I read some of the reviews.  I was worried when I read about all the noise that comes from the freeway and the recycling plant behind the hotel.  As luck would have it, we got a room at the back of the hotel on the side of the freeway, right next to the laundry room.  Thanks to the reviews on tripadvisor, I knew this was a recipe for disaster.  We immediately asked to be moved to a different room away from the recycling plant and freeway.  We were moved to a room near the front of the hotel on the opposite side of the building and enjoyed 3 very restful and quiet nights of sleep.  The made to order breakfast was great! You could get anything you wanted.  My kids loved swimming in the indoor pool and I enjoyed the jaccuzi.  We went to Disneyland.  The

Unfortunately, we had a very bad experience at this hotel.  We checked in on Sat. evening 3/8/08.  We were woken up early Sun. morning to hammering and scraping above us.  Mon. morning at 5:00 am the fire alarm goes off in the hotel.  We evacuate the hotel using the stairs.  The fire dept. arrives and checks the building.  No fire (thank goodness).  When I asked the fireman if the fire alarms were off and if we could return to our rooms, he said, "what alarms."  He says to the front desk person, "you said there weren't any alarms."  Why would the front desk person tell the fire department that?  This really concerned me.   So we finally go back to our room when we were awoken again at 9:00 am by the hammering and scraping above us.  It turns out the room above us was under

We stayed for two nights at this hotel during our visit to Disneyland. We thought the hotel was very accomodating after a long day. The facility was appealing to the eye, more from the inside of the structure than the outside.  The rooms were spacious and comfortable. We particularly enjoyed that all rooms had one bedroom suites. This was perfect for our  family situation. And the breakfast was awesome. It wasn't just a continental breakfast, but rather a cooked to order breakfast with omeletes, french toast, fruit. etc.  This is included with the price of the room, only certain hours, I believe 7-10:30 weekends.   The indoor pool  and jacuzzi looked clean and inviting, but maybe next time!  It is a 15 minute drive to Disneyland from the hotel.  There is a free shuttle service

Our family loved this place from the moment we walked in! The staff was very friendly . The breakfast was wonderful and I have picky kids. They have something for everyone!  The  2 room suites are perfect for a family.. It's nice to have 2 tv's so parents can actually watch a little too! I can honestly say you will not be dissapointed if you stay here. And if you are your just to dang picky!!! We will definately stay here from now on!

We just got back from a 7 night stay here. We were travelling with 3 children, and the 2 room suite worked great for us. We faced the parking lot on the 5th floor, and got to see the fireworks at night. The cook to order breakfast was awesome! It sure saved us a lot of money. They have lot's to choose from. You can get fresh fruit, yogurt, cooked oatmeal, cereal, pancakes, scrambled eggs, waffles, omeletes, bacon, hashbrowns, sausages and more. It was great. They have it on from 6-9:30am.  We used the indoor swimming pool a few times. Each time we used it there was only one other person in there. It's not overly huge, but the kids just loved it.  They have laundry facilities on the 2nd, 4th and 6th floor. They sell soap and fabric softener for $.50.   There is a resaurant

We stayed here for a family vacation. They are doing some work but it didn't affect our stay any. There is a nice mangers reception at night where you can have free cocktails, sodas and snacks. It was very relaxing after a long day at Disneyland. We had a two room suite and 6 people so we used all available sleeping spots. The beds were comfortable but the sofa bed had a thin mattress so it wasn't the most comfortable thing. The rooms were clean and good size. Enough room for all 6 of us to mill around and not feel like we were on top of each other. There is an indoor pool and spa and my niece and nephew had a great time in there at night. The cook to order breakfast in the morning was great. The food was good and we were able to fill up before our long day at the parks. If you

I think that this hotels rating has been tarnished by reviewers who have it confused with Embassy suites South...there is no roaring lion at this one!  I didn't see any junk yard and we had no problems whatsoever with the sports bar on the other side of the parking lot.  It is there, but I almost had the feeling it was out of business.   It is a beautiful hotel that they are in the processes of redoing the rooms in.  They are done with the exception of the upper rooms.  The lobby area is breathtaking.  Breakfast was outstanding.  FREE shuttle to Disney...leaves on the hour to Disney and on the half hour back again.   Very handy.  The driver was so kind...even found us information on beaches in San Diego and left it in our room for us.

Summary Heading: Worn out with a working dump (scrap yard) next door
Summary: Lets just say this place needs a major facelift the carpet is nasty along with the bathroom. If you need to elbow your way thru people to get a free greasy omlette this may be the place for you. Buisness travelers beware this place wreaks from the dump next door and the steady stream of garbage trucks was enough to make me think I was In the low rent district let alone a Hilton property. If you stay here and they put you on the freeway side the noise from the road is very bad due to the worn out non soundproff windows. Do your self a favor and stay elsewhere.

Summary Heading: Worth Every Penny! Highlight of our trip!!!!!
Summary: We stayed one night at this hotel and wished we would have stayed for our entire vacation!  (We booked 3 nights at the Paradise Pier because it was our first trip to Disneyland & wanted the full "Disney" Experience)   We were disappointed in the PP's lack of "magic" (see my PP review!) and agreed we would have preferred staying at the Embassy Suites!  The cook-to-order-breakfast was awesome!  We figured a breakfast like that for our family of 5 would have cost $40-$50.  I loved the "managers reception"...Our girls had "Shirley Temples" my son a "Roy Rogers" and my husband and I enjoyed (free!!) cocktails while we awaited the shuttle to take us to downtown disney for the evening.  The driver was great...gave all the kids candy bars and showed them magic tricks while we waited for

The embassy suites was a great hotel to stay in. The hotel rooms were nice, clean, and big. It wasn't loud at all. The pool and spa were very nice after long hot days in Disneyland. The free breakfast was especially nice, as it saved on spending money at the parks. The only complaint I have, is that the parking lot is shared with a sports bar, and my car was broken into overnight. Apparently my car was not the first that had been broken into there. If you stay there, park as far away from the sports bar as you can. The hotel itself was nice though and the mamangement offered to let me stay in my room (as I was supposed to be checking out) until the police came to take a report and the car could get fixed.

Summary Heading: A great family hotel close to Disneyland
Summary: The Embassy Suites is a great family hotel for those visiting Disneyland.  The shuttle to Disneyland stops at the ES and runs every 20 minutes.  We never had any issue getting to or from Disneyland on this service and at approx $3pp/day is well worth the money - I am sure if you drve you'd have a longer walk to get inside the park.  The ES has a great breakfast buffet and evening drinks and the staff were always very friendly.  The ES has installed a robotic lion (ala Lion King) which roars (very loudly) every half hour.  We were on the 10th floor and could hear it faintly from our room so if you are in the eating area you know it is going to be loud - our 4 year old hated it and was terrified - so beware.  We ended up having to bring breakfast back up to the room each day as

I stayed here on a Wednesday and Thursday for a combination of work and vacation.  Overall, not bad for the money considering the spacious suites and complimentary breakfast.  The indoor pool and jacuzzi looked nice, but I didn't actually try either.  The work table in the suite was large and round, which provided lots of space to lay out my paperwork and food as necessary.  However, the television in the living room was in a low cabinet and didn't pull out or swivel, which made it difficult to watch TV comfortably while seated at the table.  There was also no coffee table.  The bar area was very convenient with the sink, coffee maker, microwave and fridge.  They even stocked paper towels under the sink!  The bedroom had lots of closet and drawer space to lay out all of my

Summary Heading: A Great Stop in Orange County!
Summary: We have now stayed at this hotel twice while visiting family.  We encountered no problems and have found the staff to be quite pleasant.  The rooms have a typical Embassy layout and everything was well maintained with an exceptional lobby area with fish ponds.  The room was very clean with new carpeting.  The hotel is very convenient to the 91 freeway.  Plenty of parking and a great complimentary breakfast.  The only complaint is that the hotel can be noisy as its proximity to Disneyland results in too many unsupervised children.  Wireless is costly at $10 per night.  The hotel shares the parking lot with a popular sports bar.

Good stay at the Embassy Suites. Our main purpose of our stay was to go Disney. It takes 30 minutes by foot if you want to walk, otherwise there are hotels shuttles for a reasonable price. But almost all the big hotels are located in the same area. The room was great, very big, comfortable, clean. With nice furniture, very clean and comfortable bathroom too. Two TVs, coffee maker, dinner table and sofa, just perfect for family. The buffet breakfast was very good with lots of choices and specially fruit. There are lots of outside parking spaces. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Wireless internet is not free but not expensive. However you can use two hotel PCs with printer for free, if you need.

This was our second stay at this location.  Staff were friendly and rooms and property were clean. Rooms are spacious with two rooms seperated by a door.  Both rooms have a tv.  Bathroom is accessible through bedroom side, which is a little inconvenient cuz the sleepers are in there, but it worked out fine.  there is also a second vanity area with a sink outside the bathroom, which is a plus for our family.  in the other room there is a wet bar, coffee maker, fridge and microwave which is yet another plus. A kitchen-like table with chairs is in this room as well as a sitting area with a chair and sofa, which has a pull out bed allowing for 2 more sleepers. The hotel is a little older but that had absolutely no impact on the stay.  The breakfast is a big plus for our family, and

Stayed on the way back from NZ, and thouroughly enjoyed. Hotel has superb amenities and kids and adults alike will enjoy (my 5 year old loved the pool and gym) The breakfast is superb as is the bar area. Only slight drawbacks are the distance to disneyland (although there is a free shuttle) just dont miss the one after the fireworks as it's a long cold wait. Also found some of the desk staff variable in helpfulness,(most are superb but one or two need some training) This doesn't really detract from my overall satisfaction and can certainly recommend to people with young families

Summary Heading: One night stay with some problems
Summary: We stayed here for one night before a conference.  The reason we stayed here was the price was right and near (driving distance) Disneyland.  Our stay was great except for a big problem we encountered with our door.  This is an older Embassy Suites which I like (the rooms looked like they had recently been remodeled).  I like the atrium Embassy Suites with the lush garden and Koi ponds.  The new Embassy Suites seem to be going away from that style.   The room was great, the breakfast was great, but....  We checked in early and asked for a quiet room, we got a room on the 7th floor (room 703).  We then drove over to Disneyland (the hotel has a shuttle but you need to make reservations)  and stayed until 11:30PM.  We came back to the hotel and went back to our room.  I put the

Summary Heading: Disneyland, Embassy Suites, and Orange County all surprisingly pleasant
Summary: Well, 25 yrs after I said I'd never come back, we took our widowed daughter and granddaughter to Disneyland and what a pleasant surprise!  The orange groves were replaced with parking lots and more amusement parks but Anaheim was clean, neat, upgraded, and pleasant.  We didnt go with the crowds but went in the fall during school to avoid such.  We stayed at the Embassy Suites with breakfast included for the group and was quiet and pleasant.  The shuttle to Disneyland was convenient and often and good for Grandma who gave out early a couple of the days and came back to rest.    We recommend the program Ride Max and this included the info on Fast Pass which made everything a lot easier and complete.    The only thing disappointing about the trip is the ill-mannered children in the

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel ... Very Accurate Reviews on Trip Advisor
Summary: This hotel is very kid friendly.  Lots of families stay here as it is close to many attractions.  The manager's reception is one of the better receptions for an Embassy Suites as they offered a veggie platter the night we stayed.  We only stayed here one night as it was a 15-20 minute drive to Disneyland, farther than we wanted to travel.  The bathroom in our suite was off the bedroom, as opposed to the hallway.  The bed was a little on the hard side.  The pullout sofa-sleeper was very uncomfortable, even for my 13 year old.  The free breakfast was very good, but poorly organized.  It took my husband and son 15 minutes to stand in line and get their omelette.  We would stay here again but really preferred the Embassy Suites South if it's an option.

Don't be fooled - this is NOT a business hotel.  I'm a happy mother of a son, but when I travel for business I don't want to deal with much of what I confronted.  For example, (1) small, screaming children fascinated by the sound of their shouts echoing through the atrium. (2) small, wriggling children running through the hallways unattended.  (3) Small children wandering around the breakfast area, handling with the food on display, leaving messes on all the tables, and generally making it a real teeth-gritter just get something to eat.  (4) my guest room tucked in a corner off the atrium where the ($9.95/day) wireless didn't go; I had to sit in the hallway (along the atrium) to check my email.  But, of course, for most of that time, six feet farther down the hall, a six-year

After numerous days of searching for the perfect hotel, with a smal child, I decided on this hotel.  I personally feel I could have not picked a better place to stay.   The rooms were large, with a separate bedroom and very clean.  Everything was top notch from the lobby, made to order breakfast, nightly receptiona and the shuttle service.  I am a very hard person to please when it comes to hotels and this was a very enjoyable stay.  I would recomend to anyone.  The only complaint we had was the pool was too cold to swim in, it was an indoor pool, but we tried!

Easy access to the parks.  Comes with a shuttle, but it was easier for us to drive.  The lobby is just what you expect.  The room was clean, the bed comfortable...the most important detail.  We spent a couple days at Disney then went to the beach.  It is close to everything including the airport.  The breakfast was something to look forward to.  We had dinner at the on site restraunt, as there is nothing within walking distance, it was good and the service was better.

This Embassy Suites is actually a little ways away from Disneyland; not as close as it sounds. The hotel is very nice.  The lobby is great and the rooms were standard Embassy Suites. The breakfast was the best we've had in an Embassy Suites.  Many selections of everything; nice setting, koi ponds. The room service was very good, somewhat pricey. The only problem we had was we left an item behind in the room and called the management right away after we left.  The room had not been cleaned yet. They said they would call us back, which they didn't.  After many, many phone calls up the ladder, they found the item (a week later).  If it had not been for this problem and the slightly farther distance from Disneyland I would give it an Excellent.

We stayed at the Embassy Suites North in Anaheim from Dec. 30 - Jan. 3/07.  It is a very nice hotel with an indoor atrium that has koi and turtles in it.  They have a complimentary reception every evening from 5:30-7:30 when any drinks are free (alcoholic too) and some snacks.  They also have a complimentary cooked to order breakfast that is great (just like a restaurant buffet).  They have an indoor pool and hot tub.  They have a shuttle to Disneyland that runs every hour (which is great because we found out parking at Disney was $11 per day - you can go in and out though).  The room was big enough (a separate bedroom with two double beds) - the sofabed in the living room was really uncomfortable though.  Internet access was not included but was reasonably priced at $10.00/24

This was one of the worst hotels I have stayed at for $139 + tax a night.  We stayed there 3 nights, and we basically had a problem every night.  They tried to give us a smoking room when a non-smoking room was guaranteed.  Then we had a room right next to the recycling plant.  We were awoken by the many semi -trucks and earth moving equipment.  They say that they are 6 miles from Disneyland.  It might be 6 miles as the crow flies - but it takes about 20 minutes to drive.  Don't always rely on their shuttle because people were complaining that they had made a reservation, but that the bus was full and the driver did not have their name - so we never attempted this because we didn't want to be stuck at Disneyland with only the option of a cab and a need for car seats.  The last

As a business traveler I have stayed at my share of Hilton Properties.  This does not live up to their standard.  The employees seemed disgruntled and the location was not ideal.  It is remote from Disney - which familes should know - but offers a shuttle.  It abutts a metal scrap facility so it is very noisy especiallly on the upper floors on the x20 side.  The plusses are the happy hour and full breakfast as well as a nice bar and pool area.  If you are a seasoned traveler you will be disappointed.  If you are heading to Disney with the family yo may not notice what I pointed out above.

Summary Heading: Best Disney Hotel for a Large Family
Summary: This hotel was a wonderful choice for a large family enjoying a Disneyland Vacation.  The rooms comfortably slept five and actually had adequate closet and drawer space.  The cooked to order breakfast was first rate! We ate a large, hot, yummy  breakfast each morning and then headed off on the FREE shuttle to Disney.  While this hotel is a couple of miles further from Disneyland, their shuttle service was free, dedicated to our hotel only, and very dependable.  The other good neighbor hotels use a shuttle system that charges three dollars per person per day.  For a family of five for a week, that runs to over $100.  We simply booked our rides each night for the next day.  One day we got tired and hot and wanted to come home early; I called the hotel, and they came to get us.

This hotel is as far away as you can get to anything in Anaheim.  It seemed that you were on a island, away from anything.  I would rate it lower than what is shown on this board.  We had one dinner there.  It was ok, a place trying to a 4 star with 2 star food.  The hotel needs to be updated.  The carpets need to be replaced in alot of the common areas.  The "balcony" doors are hard to open and the cleaned as well as updated.  I wouldn't stay at this location again.

Summary Heading: The Embassy Suites is always great
Summary: My husband and 2 small boys stayed there Feb 20-24th to do the Disney thing. While it is smaller than the Embassy South, it is still wonderful. Right off the freeway, plenty of parking. The inside of Embassy is a large atrium with trees and a fish pond which the kids loved. The room was very clean although the living room area was a bit smaller than other Embassy Suites I have been to. The main bedroom had 2 double beds, the South had 2 Queens. The sofa bed was awful and i pulled the mattress off and put it on the floor for the baby. I guess kids dont' care. We were right behind the recyceling center, but the boys thought it was wonderful, and would stand out on the balcony and just watch. Disneyland?? why when we can watch large trucks smash things?? The breakfast is much

I stayed at this hotel despite the marginal reviews.  We were pleasantly surprised.  Rooms were above average, very clean.  Very courteous and helpful staff.  Cook to order breakfast was excellent.  The only downside is there really is a recycling plant right next door and the trucks do wake you up early.  But it was still a very nice stay and would definitely be back!!!!!

my family and i stayed there for 3 days the day after new years. overally we had a good experience. they serve a free complementary breakfast every moring, and they served a lot more than your normal hotel breakfast. i do agree that the hotel was really all that close (about 10 minutes by their shuttle) but they had a free shuttle service going to disneyland every hour and a shuttle leaving disneyland every 1\2 of the hour so to me it was much better than driving or walking 4 blocks everytime. there was a weird smell outside fo the hotel but i never once smelled anything weird inside of the hotel so i dont think it was that big of a deal. the room itself was fine and i thought everything was nice and clean. our fridge didnt work the when we got there but they fixed it right

The main thing to consider when booking this hotel is can you sleep with noise all night? It is a nice enough hotel with large suites, good service, outstanding food (great free breakfast), and very clean. You are in fact surrounded by noise. My room faced the highway. All night long that is what you will here. Others in my group faced the metal recycling plant which is located about 50 yards from the hotel. The noise from this place is incredible and all night. If you are deaf this is the perfect hotel.

I recently went there for my cousin's wedding. The inside is nice. They have a jungle theme with koi fish and turtles.  Complimentary breakfast tastes like cafeteria food. Hey it's free and it fills you up for the morning! There is only one small pool and jacuzzi. Rooms are nice but the beds are very hard. I had a very hard time sleeping the first night I was there. Maids pretty much only speak Spanish.  Overall pretty good.

We booked 3 suites for 3 nights for ourselves and our adult children/grandchildren. Rooms were very clean, maid service was prompt, staff was very friendly & helpful. Pool area was clean, plenty of warm towels provided. Breakfast was excellent, plenty of food, nice omelets, plus more items than you could ever sample. Evening reception was great, shuttle service was on time and not over packed. We all had a GREAT time and will return to this location.

it is what it is, which is a fairly cheap and definitely not perfect hotel, but i thought we got a lot for our money. i second the fact that if you sleep in the living room, the noise is really loud (and the pullout sofa is hard) and there's annoying truck beeping in the back in the morning (i brought along a white noise machine anyway.) also, the bathroom was poorly situated, in the bedroom, which meant anyone in the living room had to wake up the bedroom people to come in. but you could fit a lot of people in the room, the breakfast is the best free b-fast i've ever had, we liked the reception at night, the pool looked cool and the management was very helpful and very nice.  the lobby was nice to look at. and the price was right.

We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, booked through Expedia.   The hotel is described as Embassy Suites Disneyland and I mistakenly booked this hotel instead of the Embassy Suites Anaheim South which is only a mile from Disney.   This hotel was 6 miles from Disney which is fine as there is a complimentary shuttle bus to and from the hotel.   Please be aware, however, there is nothing in the surrounding area at all and the hotel overlooks the freeway on one side, a scrap metal yard at the back and building work on the other side.   The hotel itself is very nice inside and the staff can't do enough for you.   If you're not interested in the scenery and are not spending too much time in your room then the hotel is fine.   The pool area is in a conservatory type setting with

Didn't have the noise problems others did and the breakfast was good. But our room really needed a good cleaning. There were stains all over the chairs. Not nearly as nice as other Embassy Suites I have stayed at.

Stayed at this hotel by default, hotwire messed up on our reservation. Nevertheless, we enjoyed our stay here. We did not have any problems regarding bed quality and the front staff were very professional. Our family enjoyed the full breakfast (yes, it is a  buffet but also included is a short order cook to make omelettes etc.) We did not have time to use the pool and did not use the shuttle bus (we had our own vehicles). We would definitely come back here.

We stayed here during our visit to Disneyland.  Though the hotel says they are close to Disneyland, really they are not.  However, the free, convenient shuttle makes up for it.  The ride is really only 10-15 minutes.  The staff at this hotel are very friendly and accomidating.  They were not very busy when we were there so the shuttle driver offered to drive us anywhere we wanted to go in Anaheim!  The rooms were great, and the breakfast buffet and managers cocktail reception make this an excellent value.  The pool was warm and the hot tub very hot.   We will return here again.  We had the most relaxing, stress-free vacation ever while staying at this wonderful hotel.

UGH! I would never stay at this hotel again! We were going to Disneyland and I don't think we could have found a hotel farther away even though they said they were just a few minutes away. The shuttle service was definitely lacking and was a pain during our entire stay. Ditto to what the previous person said about the recycling (?) center. It looked like a gigantic dump! Then on the "quiet" side there's a man-made river of sorts that didn't smell so good. Oh and right down the road a trash dump place that you could smell if the breeze blew in the hotel's direction. Disgusting. Why they built a hotel there with a freeway on one side, dump on the other, stinking river on another I'll never know. Also you can hear a lot of noise in the front room of the suite. While the atrium is

I had high hopes because most of the reviews were good and it was a suite with an indoor heated pool and jacuzzi. But what a waste of money:  1. The mattresses are Motel 6 quality; I don't think they were even old and worn, just so cheap that they were very uncomfortable. That and the parade of flat pillows and wafer thin sheets makes for no sleep.  2. Did they forget to tell you? there is a large recycling facility on the east side of the hotel right next door. FYI they begin their dumping and crushing operation at 5am so no need to set you alarm clock since you will be up. We even stayed in the south tower which is the quitest since the North tower overlooks highway 91.  3. They only wash your sheets every 3rd day unless you specifically ask or put the card on the bed.  4.

We stayed at Embassy Suites for 4 nights along with our 3 children in June 2003. With so many different hotels to choose from, we finally decided on Embassy Suites, because of it's reputation of having clean rooms, good breakfasts and service. We were so happy with our choice. The rooms were clean. There were plenty of items to choose from for breakfast. The location was great,7-10 minute ride to Disneyland-the shuttle buses came every 1/2 hr as scheduled. I would definitely stay there again.

We stayed here over president's day weekend which also happened to be valentine's day weekend. The front desk staff was very helpful and informative. The room was great, there was plenty of room for 3 adults and one child. With a very picky toddler is was nice to keep her favorite foods on hand in the fridge. The breakfast was good but we did have to wait in line. They have a free shuttle to Disneyland which my husband and I used one night when my mother-in-law took my daughter back to the hotel. It was nice to be able to go out to dinner and not worry about how to get back to the hotel. We will definitely stay here again!!!

We stayed here Jan 21-24, 2004. What an awesome hotel. We loved the huge rooms, food, and service. Our shuttle drivers to Disneyland were awesome! They were very accommodating. Everyone in the hotel offered outstanding service. The indoor pool and hot tub were just great! We really enjoyed the hot tub after walking around Disneyland all day. I will stay here again and recommend it to anyone who is going to Disneyland.

I stayed at this hotel in May 2003, and I had an awesome time there! I went with all my fellow graduating Seniors of Coalinga High School. We were in Anaheim for the Disneyland Grad Nite party, and we stayed at Embassy Suites. The girls took over the fifth floor, while the guys took the fourth. It was a great idea to stay there, because the teachers and chaperones could easily spot a student of the opposite sex walking on the wrong floor. I think the hotel was beautiful, both on the inside and the outside. I loved the waterfalls inside, it gave it a very peaceful feeling. Something else that was nice, was the fact that there were two phone lines in each suite, and we could use them to call anyone else at the hotel. This was perfect, considering quite a few of us had our

I stayed at this hotel 11/8/03-11/10/03. It was cold in Anaheim with a high of 68 and a low of 52. This meant the hotel rooms were in the low 60's.  This hotel has a unique heating and cooling system whereby the hotel rooms must either have access to cooling, heating, or nothing. After being cold our first night, we asked about the non-operational heater before our second night. We were told they did not have the heater system on and they brought a portable heater to our room. I placed the portable heater in the bedroom to keep my wife warm. However, as the portable heater was noisy, it kept me from sleeping well. So, I went into the living room. However, without a heater, it was very cold in the living room.  In the morning when we were checking out, we asked further about the
